MRIIRS Faridabad Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A solid college choice with updated labs, internship opportunities, and improved placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package is of 55 LPA, and the lowest is 3-4 LPA and 70-75%of students got placed. Well-known companies participated in the placement drive like TCS, HCL, Capgemini, Cognizant, which offer top roles like software engineer, Web developer, Data analyst and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department provides well-maintained infrastructure and facilities to support academic and practical learning. There is also a sports arena where there is a coach of boxing, shooting and many sports instruments. Wi-fi is also available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teacher in our department are generally qualified and supportive in their respective field. The faculty is more supportive, and each student has their mentor to whom they can discuss their problem and many more. The course curriculum is relevant and updated, which covers practical learning, technical subjects like programming language and many more.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Manav Rachna campus placement review

detailed_review.Placements: The Civil Engineering Department at SET, MRIIRS, along with the CRC, provides strong placement support, offering nearly 95 percent placement for eligible students, and through technical guidance and interview preparation, they help students become industry-ready.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department offers good infrastructure, including high-speed Wi-Fi, well-equipped civil engineering labs, and an updated library with relevant books and journals. The hostels provide clean rooms and essential amenities, and the mess offers decent-quality food with a variety of options.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified and help students understand both theory and practical knowledge, explaining concepts clearly and using practical examples, site visits, and lab sessions to improve understanding, and overall, the teaching quality is strong and helps students develop both technical and professional skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Balanced learning environment with strong labs and good placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate at my campus is about 100 percent. The average package in the civil department is 4 LPA to 6 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Mega, Ultratech, etc. Around 100 percent of students got internships from any course. The top roles offered in my course are Structural Design Engineer, Site Engineer, and Highway Designer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: MRIIRS has smart classrooms. The labs are quite well-equipped for civil engineering. Especially, we have labs like the survey lab, structure lab, concrete technology lab, soil mechanics lab, and fluid mechanics lab. There is a central library for both digital and physical resources.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in the civil engineering department are generally well qualified, with most holding M.Tech degrees and PhDs in structural engineering, geotechnical engineering, transportation engineering, and related fields. Many faculty members have industrial experience and have worked with government organisations or research projects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of all facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement cell is active and supportive. We get regular training sessions, aptitude practice, interview preparation, and soft-skill development. Many companies visit the campus, and students get good opportunities in both core and non-core sectors. Internships are also provided in the third, fifth, and final years, which really help in gaining experience.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: MRIIRS has very good infrastructure. The classrooms are clean and air-conditioned. Labs are well-equipped, and the library has a great study environment. Civil Engineering labs like Surveying, Concrete Technology, Environmental, Geotechnical, and Structures are modern and provide hands-on learning. The campus is green, well-maintained, and has strong Wi-Fi, sports facilities, and good canteens.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of the Civil Engineering department is excellent. Teachers are experienced, friendly, and always ready to help us. They explain concepts clearly and connect them with real-life engineering examples. The department also encourages us to work on projects, research, software skills, industrial visits, and technical activities.
detailed_review.Other: I am a Civil Engineering student at MRIIRS Faridabad, and my experience here is very positive.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfying because of the many facilities and the faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 60 to 70% of students got placed in my course, and the highest package till now is 12 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. There are many top recruiting companies for my course, and almost 90% of students got internships from our course in many companies. The top role offered in our course is in big research and future bio projects.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good infrastructure and facilities, as they provide us with free Wi-Fi, have AC in every classroom, and have 3 big libraries where any student can go and study. The labs are also very good, as they have the latest machines and a good environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is also very good, the course makes students industry-ready, and the semester exams are a little bit harder, but if a student studies well, it's not that much difficult.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a good college if you want to enjoy your college life.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements here are very good. The highest package this year was around 58 LPA, which was on campus only. This time, Google and Microsoft were also there. Almost 85% of students were placed on the campus. Wipro was the main highlight this time.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and facilities are top notch and also the Wi-Fi is very good and connectivity is very good, labs are fully air conditioned and well maintained, classrooms are SMART board equipped and library have more tha 2000 books which is very nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are decent here. If you have any doubts, they will for sure help you, but only when they are free. Teachers are well-educated and qualified. The course curriculum is very relevant, and it makes the student industry-ready. Exams are hard to pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with faculty members, facilities, infrastructure, and placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college offers good placement. It has well-managed interview grounds. Companies such as Microsoft, Adobe, HP, etc., are some of the recruitment companies that come for campus placement. At least, 2 rounds of interviews are conducted by placement companies in batches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides well-maintained and structured labs, classroom, library, and overall Wi-Fi is available on campus. Our college has eco-friendly environment. It is highly maintained and hygienic. Quality of food available in the hostel, mess, and canteen is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful, well-qualified, knowledgeable, and quite experienced in teaching. Faculty members are quite supportive. The course curriculum is highly relevant, and makes students industry-ready by providing internship opportunities before placement.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: You can take admission if you don't get admission in the top government colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: Manav Rachna College offers decent placement opportunities for students, especially in core engineering, IT, and management domains. Over the years, college has partnered with several reputed companies like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and HCL. The highest packages generally range between 8 LPA - 12 LPA for select candidates, while the average salary package is around 3.5 LPA - 4.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are well-maintained and rooms are of adequate size. Security is maintained 24X7. They also have a sports ground for football and cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-experienced and supportive. Most professors hold post-graduate or doctoral degrees, and have many industrial exposures. Question papers are a fair mixture of theoretical and application-based problems, although a stronger emphasis on learning still persists in some subjects.

reviews.course: BCA in Cyber Security in association with Microsoft
reviews.review_title: Life at Manav Rachna - Opportunities for career growth.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest packages are typically of 5 LPA - 8 LPA. All depends on the performance of students and individual department. As a whole, Manav Rachna is one of the best universities for very serious students about a career in the stream they opt for opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus is well-maintained with dedicated computer labs, a decent library, sources of medical aid, and well-maintained infrastructure. The infrastructure is good with well-equipped labs, smart classrooms, and ground. Manav Rachna has sports too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at Manav Rachna University are the best we have. They are playing a vital role in shaping us. Not just in our academic journey but also in our overall growth in life, they are very pathetic, engaging, and always evolving.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Design (B.Des.) association with Industry Knowledge Partner
reviews.review_title: It's worth being there. The knowledge of the faculty members is very good with industry guidance.

detailed_review.Placements: 50% of students got placements. I don't know about packages. The top requirement company is Kedman. 50% of students got internships for roles like junior animation, video creator, etc. It assists through portals and has a proper placement cell, which is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of course is very good. The latest configured PC labs with software are available. A support team is there. Graphic tables, projectors, and everything is there. It has laser cut machines, 3D printers, etc. Everything is there to use and can create things with.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are industry experts with a lot of knowledge we can gather from. They are very friendly and helpful. We can call them anytime for guidance beyond the study life advice. They also support us. They are there for everything we want at each step of our life.

reviews.course: B.A. (Hons.) in English
reviews.review_title: It is amazing. I suggest students take admission here.

detailed_review.Placements: So many students got placements. I suggest students take admission to this college. There are so many good opportunities that will help us build a career in a good field. Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies has placement opportunities with a good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms and hostels are amazing. I suggest students should visit once to get a chance to be a part of the Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies. This college has a lot of good facilities regarding the staff members, hostel, classrooms, canteens, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers, faculty members, and all staff members are good. At any time, we can visit them and clarify our doubts without any hesitation which is a plus point for students that they will not face any mistakes and can clear them on the way whatever the time it is.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in it, which took me forward to this course. I am currently pursuing a B.A. (Hons.) in English.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Great infrastructure and faculty, but placement support needs major improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: 50% of students who are going for jobs and all are placed, some went for masters. The companies who showed up have good packages, and companies like Panacea Biotech, Merck, Chimera Biotech, and Thisti. These are the companies which came for the placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good and the whole cleanliness of the college is maintained 24/7. Labs are equipped with high-tech faculty members. Hotels are also very good and the food provided in the mess is good. As for games a lot of area has been dedicated to it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Although the curriculum of our college needs a little bit of turning, overall because of the faculty of biotechnology and those amazing professors life at Manav Rachna is easy, exams and everything goes smoothly. Somewhat the curriculum makes the students industry-ready but you'll have to build yourself as well.
detailed_review.Other: The crowd of Manav Rachna is good, some students are there who are not very friendly behaving and all but all the colleges have one or two students like them, as for the security of the students it's fantastic. The teachers are very cooperative if you visit the teacher students are their priority, and event life at Manav Rachna is very happening. I participated in many competitions and won and I enjoyed all of them. Scholarship is based on the percentage of what you've scored in 12th or some other scheme as well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is not at all worth the money.

detailed_review.Placements: About 50% of students get placed. The highest salary can go up to 10 LPA, while the average placement is around 2.5 to 3.5 LPA. Not all companies focus on teaching; most are just small companies unrelated to education, and even TCS and Infosys do not visit here. No one gets internships; there were 2 students who secured off-campus internships at Adobe and Google in their 2nd year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is poor. In classrooms, you will find wooden benches and one class can have 60 to 65 students crammed into a very small space. The benches are not sufficient for everyone; if all students attend on the same day, half of them will not get a seat. The Wi-Fi is non-existent and never works. Labs are similarly just for namesake; in computer labs, many computers do not work, and in the chemistry lab, you will only be given a few experiments to perform, and typically just one reading, merely to show that you have done something. There is no good canteen, and the sports facilities are lacking.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, and all are assistant professors. They are somewhat knowledgeable but provide average teaching, so do not expect a lot; a few teachers are great. Don’t rely on the course curriculum, as it is cut short, and DSA is taught not practically but through rote learning. Nothing in the course will make you industry-ready. There are many exams; you will first take 2 sessionals within a one-month gap, a viva in between, and then a week of final viva and final exams. There is no time for any self-study. To pass, you need 40 percent in total.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because I thought it was close to my home and that I could study DSA on my own. Now that I know there is no free time, if there were fewer exams, we would have more time for important things. There are many small events, but no one is interested in them in the hot weather of Faridabad. Sometimes there are fests, but they occur on extremely hot days, and usually outside. There is nothing on campus, although there is a Suraj Kund Mela nearby around February. The nearest metro station is 20 minutes.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Physiotherapy (BPT)
reviews.review_title: Great faculty members with clinical experience and knowledge.

detailed_review.Placements: There is no guaranteed placement. But our teachers have contact so it helps in finding a hospital. We can also join ourselves in a clinic or hospital with interviews. We do internships provided by the college before convocation, and after that we get a degree and can join any hospital with clearing interview.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The whole university is covered with college Wi-Fi. Labs are well furnished. Our college has multiple libraries. Classrooms are fully AC with projector. The crowd is okay. We have materials to do our practical like all machines and B.Ed equipment. We have OPD also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers have high clinical knowledge about our course. They also practice so we stay updated with the latest techniques. They show us everything practically. Recently, our physiotherapy curriculum has been updated so new subjects will be introduced with new session.
detailed_review.Other: It is an amazing course as it has recently been updated and now we are primary health care professionals.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely dissatisfied with the college placement wing and the teachers.

detailed_review.Placements: Only 1-2 students were placed, and there were no top recruiters available. The placement companies were there only for Software Engineers and Developers, but not for Data Science, AI, Cloud, etc. Another thing is that there was no project-based learning in the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It was good, but it could be refreshing with some interior, to be specific. The library access was good, or you can say great, for the view and calmness required to fill your mind. The labs were also good for a go-type infrastructure. The sports gym was very good for athletics. It was almost good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were good, but not helpful. They were not attentive as they focused on the top students only. This course does not make the student industry-ready. You will have to struggle for 1-2 years if you are an average student to get started. Go to any other college, mate.
detailed_review.Other: The event management was so improper, and there was no respect for students.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics
reviews.review_title: Choosing Nutrition and Dietetics at MRIIRS.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 85-90% of students from the course are successfully placed every year. The highest package offered is approximately 6 LPA, while the lowest is range around 2.5 LPA. The average package lies between 3.5 and 4 LPA, depending on the student's specialization and the experience gained during internships and training. The top recruiters include Fortis Healthcare, Max Healthcare, VLCC, HealthifyMe, and Curve. Fit, Nestle, Away, Apollo Hospital, and various nutrition startups.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Manav Rachna University offers modern facilities, including Wi-Fi-enabled smart classrooms, well-equipped Nutrition and Food Labs, a comprehensive library, and access to digital learning resources. The campus supports hands-on learning through clinical training setups and industry-standard equipment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members at Manav Rachna's Nutrition and Dietetics department are highly qualified, with most holding PhDs and industry experience in clinical, sports, and therapeutic nutrition. They are supportive, approachable, and knowledgeable, often using interactive teaching methods, case studies, and real-world examples to enhance learning.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics
reviews.review_title: Great learning experience with supportive faculty, good infrastructure, and value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, around 70 to 80% of students were successfully placed, depending on their skills and performance. The highest package offered is around 6 LPA, the lowest is around 2.5 LPA, and the average range is between 3 to 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies included Fortis Healthcare, VLCC, Nestle, Healthify Me, Hexagon Nutrition, and HCL Healthcare. About 60 to 70% of students secured internships during the course. Popular internships provided are AIIMS Fortis, NGOs, research labs, and corporate wellness companies. The top roles offered included Clinical Dietitian, Nutrition Consultant, Research Assistant, Wellness Coach, and Public Health Nutritionist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for our course is excellent with smart classrooms, well equipped nutrition and biochemistry labs, a digital library, and high speed Wi-Fi across campus. The hostel facilities are good with clean rooms, 24/7 security, and laundry. The mess food is decent and hygienic, with a variety of options. Canteens offer snacks and meals at reasonable prices. Medical facilities are available on campus with a health center and regular check ups. Sports infrastructure is impressive. There is a gym, courts for basketball and badminton, and a large playground. Overall, the environment is student friendly and supports both academics and personal well being.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty in my course are highly qualified, supportive, and approachable. They use practical examples, case studies, and interactive sessions to enhance learning. The curriculum is well-structured and industry-relevant, covering both theory and practical to prepare us for real-world roles. Regular workshops and guest lectures add extra value. Semester exams are moderately difficult but manageable with consistent study. The pass percentage is fairly high, around 85 to 90%, as the focus is more on understanding than rote learning. Overall, the course helps build a strong academic foundation and essential professional skills.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the M.Sc. Nutrition & Dietetics batch of 2024 to 26. I chose this course out of passion for health, food Science, and helping others. The best part is the blend of theory and practical exposure through workshops, hospital visits, and research. I wish there were more tie ups with international universities and hands on projects. The campus crowd is diverse and friendly, with plenty of events, fests, and extracurricular activities. Connectivity to the campus is good, and the surroundings are peaceful. Scholarships are available for meritorious students, making it supportive for those with financial constraints. It is a fulfilling journey overall.

reviews.course: B.A. (Hons.) in Applied Psychology
reviews.review_title: Student life at Manav Rachna.

detailed_review.Placements: In B.A. In Applied Psychology, there are 30 students placed in each class. MNC and best hospital placements are there, with hospitals like Vimhans, IHBAS, etc. Internship opportunities are provided to all students with the best guidance. The experience is good and amazing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are well-equipped with Wi-Fi and the best mess food, with fully furnished hostel rooms and student security 24/7. Labs are well-equipped with all the latest tools. Classrooms are well-maintained with proper cleanliness and helpful workers. Security is nice. The best quality food and entertainment purpose are provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of my batch and course are very helpful and knowledgeable. They help us in every aspect, whether studies or future guidance. There are 2 sessional exams and 1 end-term exam with practical tests. The curriculum is not based only on bookish knowledge but practical knowledge too.
detailed_review.Other: Manav Rachna University has multiple events that are organized for students and a yearly fest with full enjoyment and interaction. Scholarships for every category. Travel is comfortable and affordable.

reviews.course: B.A. (Hons.) in Economics
reviews.review_title: One of the best private colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies exceeded my expectations. The placement process is seamless, and the staffs are supportive. The online resources are invaluable in preparing me for the test. I highly recommend this college for its academic excellence and student support. It also provides internships from top companies and gives a little experience to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of Manav Rachna is very good and spacious. It creates an amazing environment for the students. Everyone is very helpful, and it gives so many opportunities to students and teachers.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers of Manav Rachna are highly qualified. They are friendly to students. They help and give attention to each student in a class. Exams of a particular course are moderate and not so hard giving a better chance to students. It is a great college.
detailed_review.Other: Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies is an absolute top-notch private college. It gives opportunity to students in every field with helpful and friendly teachers and an amazing infrastructure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communications Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Internet of Things) with Intel Corporation
reviews.review_title: MRIIRS is a good option for students.

detailed_review.Placements: Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies has a mixed placement record, with some students reporting positive experiences and others expressing disappointment. The highest salary package offered ranges from 51 LPA to 119 LPA, depending on the course and year. Average salary packages range from 4 LPA to 8 LPA. Placement percentages vary across courses, with some reporting 80% to 100% placement rates. Top recruiters include IT and technology companies like TCS, HCL, Infosys, Wipro, Google, and Microsoft, finance and banking companies like HDFC and American Express, and other companies like Nokia, Qss, Amazon Web Services, and Plato.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There’s a review of the infrastructure for my course and hostel at Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies. The infrastructure for my course includes classrooms that are air-conditioned, spacious, and well-maintained. They are equipped with modern teaching aids like projectors, smart boards, and audio-visual equipment. Labs are well-equipped with the latest equipment and software relevant to my course. The lab assistants are helpful and supportive. The library is well-stocked, with a vast collection of books, journals, and online resources. The library is spacious and quiet, providing a conducive environment for studying.
detailed_review.Faculty: There’s a review of the faculty, curriculum, and exams for my course at Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies. The faculty members are experienced and highly qualified, with many holding Ph. D.s from top universities. Faculty members use a combination of traditional and modern teaching methods, including lectures, discussions, case studies, and project-based learning. Faculty members are approachable, supportive, and available to answer questions and provide guidance. The curriculum is well-structured, relevant, and aligned with industry needs.
detailed_review.Other: Our college organizes a big fest every year called Resurrection, with a star night included in the fest.

college_info.college_name: MRIIRS Faridabad Admission 2025: Admissions and Eligibility

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in MRIIRS Faridabad?
faqs.answer: MRIIRS admissions are based on both merit and entrance based criteria. Students can visit the official website of the university and find out more about the eligibility details for their chosen course. Students can choose to apply directly on the basis of their merit scoring in the previous qualifying exam. For the majority of the programs, students can apply on the basis of prescribed entrance tests such as JEE Mains, SAT, Pearson, MRNAT, CUET, XAT, CAT , among others.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies?
faqs.answer: MRIIRS Faridabad admissions begin with registration. Below are the step-wise admission process: Step One: Submission of Online Application Visit the official website which is manavrachna.edu.in/mriirs Step Two: Uploading Documents Aspirants need to upload a Class 12 mark sheet, a Valid Score of JEE Mains/ GATE, SAT/UNIGAUGE (if appeared), a Valid score of CLAT, Pre-final Year Mark sheets of higher education qualification (For PG Program). Step Three: Selection of Candidate and Offer of Admission Letter Merit Defining Document: Admission to various programs is based on merit as specified in Admission Brochure. Admissions to all programs are also made based on Manav Rachna National Aptitude Test (MRNAT) for which the scores shall automatically be picked up for merit. Step Four: Accepted of Admission and Payment of Fee All the selected candidates for admission at Manav Rachna International Institute of Research and Studies, who receive Admission Offer Letter from the University shall be required to send the Acceptance of Admission for the offered programme in the format which shall be sent by the University Authority along with the Admission Offer Letter. Thereafter, the candidate shall be required to deposit the first installment of fee for various programmes within one week of offer of admission by using any mode as mentioned below (after Step-five). Step Five: Physical Verification of Documents and Enrollment Process All the candidates, who have accepted the admission after receipt of Admission Offer Letter, shall be required to report at designated venue’s for “Physical Document Verification / Enrollment Process” as per the slots are given to them. Aspirants are required to bring Letter of ‘Offer of Admission’ and all the original fee receipts.

faqs.answer: MRNAT stands for Manav Rachna National Aptitude Test is conducted for admission to B.Tech, B.A. B.Sc. B.Com BBA BPT and BCA courses in the University at the undergraduate level. faqs.question: What is the eligibility and selection criteria for B.Tech at Manav Rachna International Institute of Research & Studies?
faqs.answer: Depending on the particular discipline of engineering, the Manav Rachna International Institute of Research & Studies' (MRIIRS) B.Tech eligibility and selection standards may change slightly. Candidates must have passed a recognised board's 10+2 exam, or an equivalent test, with Physics Mathematics, Chemistry and English  as the required subjects. The Joint Entrance Examination JEE Main or another state-level engineering entrance exam, such as the Haryana State Technical Education Society HSTES exam, must be taken by candidates. Candidates are chosen depending on their performance in the entrance exam and where they place on the relevant merit list. Candidates who have been shortlisted are called to take part in counselling, where they can select their chosen branch based on their rank and the number of seats available. ranking_section.description: As per the overall score, MRIIRS Faridabad has been placed at a good position by the NIRF under the 'Overall' category, reflecting its exceptional performance in areas like Teaching, Research, Graduation Outcomes, and creating an inclusive, quality learning environment. It is observable that in the 'Overall' category, the institute's ranks have shown a decreasing trend when evaluated against the ranking of the past year. In 2025, MRIIRS Faridabad fell 50 ranks to #151 rank in the 'Overall' categ As per the overall score, MRIIRS Faridabad has been placed at a good position by the NIRF under the 'Overall' category, reflecting its exceptional performance in areas like Teaching, Research, Graduation Outcomes, and creating an inclusive, quality learning environment. It is observable that in the 'Overall' category, the institute's ranks have shown a decreasing trend when evaluated against the ranking of the past year. In 2025, MRIIRS Faridabad fell 50 ranks to #151 rank in the 'Overall' category by the NIRF ranking. One can observe that within the category of 'Engineering' , the institute's ranking has steadiness when compared with the previous year's ranking. In 2025, MRIIRS Faridabad's rank is #101 , the same as last year's rank in the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF ranking. It has been observed that the institute has shown an increasing trend in the 'Dental' category as compared to the ranking of preceding years. In 2025, MRIIRS Faridabad climbed 5 ranks to #33 rank in the 'Dental' category by the NIRF ranking. Explore the most recent rankings from other ranking bodies and their respective categories below. According to the NIRF ranking 2025, MRIIRS Faridabad received #151-200 rank in the 'Overall' category. It holds a comparable status to the most prestigious universities such as Ashoka University Sonipat, and Avinashilingam for NIRF rankings under the 'Overall' category. sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on MRIIRS Faridabad Infrastructure in the below video:

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: Institute has well-stocked canteen and cafeteria, Hot Embers, Nescafe and Hunger Cure which provides daily necessities to students in hygienic environment and good ambience. These outlets can cater to all daily needs of students at the campus and the hostellers alike.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The hostels have well-furnished rooms with essential modern facilities like tv, telephone, wi-fi, newspapers and RO drinking water. The hostels have well managed and hygienic mess, where nutritional needs and taste of students are taken care of. There are many categories of rooms in hostels–air conditioned, non-air-conditioned, single seater,  two-seaters, three seater and five seater rooms with attached/ common bathrooms. An ergonomically and aesthetically designed hostel basically meant for international students is also available with all state-of-the-art facilities. Regular transport services are available between off-campus hostels and campus.

facilities.name: Shuttle Service
facilities.description: Institute has a fleet of luxury AC Buses providing transport facility to the students of Delhi-NCR covering various locations of Delhi, Noida and Gurgaon. It has also the fleet of Non-AC deluxe buses for the local students from Faridabad, Ballabgarh and Palwal. Buses are equipped with all safety devices i.e. GPS, to track the bus location, route, speed etc. and speed governor to restrict the speed of the buses as per the supreme court guidelines, fire extinguisher and first aid kit. Institute provides free transport facility for the students who avail the off-campus hostel facility of MRIIRS.

MRIIRS Merit cum Means Scholarship for Domicile Students of Haryana

Manav Rachna also offers scholarships based on merit cum means, to students admitted under reservation for Haryana state. This scheme is applicable to all UG and PG courses and to students whose parents have an annual income up to INR 2.80 lakh via all sources. Additionally, under this category, students are also given a fee waiver limited to the tuition fee as per the following scale. Candidates are required to pay other fees as applicable to the programme concerned.

In addition to all the above scholarships, the University offers Teaching Assistantships to MTech and MPT students, scholarships to the wards of MREI employees, scholarships to the alumni of MRIIRS (or other Manav Rachna), scholarships to girl candidates and scholarships for outstanding achievers in the sports category, academics and branch toppers. college_info.college_name: Maulana Azad National Urdu University: Courses, Admissions 2025, Fees, Placements

highlights.summary:
The Maulana Abdul Kalam Azad University was founded in 1998. It is a Central University named after Maulana Abul Kalam Azad. It is recognised by the UGC and accredited with an A grade by NAAC.
It has 7­ schools and 20 departments in total. The flagship courses offered at MANUU are MBA, BTech, and BSc. Also, it offers several academic programmes in the distance learning stream. Urdu University Hyderabad admission is based on merit and entrance. The institute accepts entrance exams such as CUET, NCET, MANUU ET, and others. Check out the table for more clarity:
MANUU Hyderabad Highlights 2025
Maulana Azad National Urdu University
Check out the below video for more information:

college_info_program.intro:
Maulana Azad National Urdu University comprises more than 15 departments, including Arabic, Economics, English, Management & Commerce, Mathematics, Islamic Studies, and others. The affiliated schools and departments of the university offer a wide range of courses at the UG, PG and diploma courses, across various streams. BTech, MBA, and BSc are among the most popular programmes offered at the university.
Maulana Azad University offers a full-time, four-year BTech programme at the UG level. The BTech programme is offered in Computer Science. The BSc programme offered at the university covers core courses in the areas of Botany, Physics, Zoology, Mathematics, and others. MANUU Hyderabad also offers several programmes in distance learning and online modes. Below mentioned are MANUU University Hyderabad's popular programmes:
For more details about courses Maulana Azad National Urdu University check out below video:

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Go for off-campus placements or go for higher education, not expect more from on-campus placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Generally, with the last trends, approximately 30% of students got placed. Top role offered in this course is data analytics. According to my information, the highest package is 12 LPA. The average salary ranges from 4 LPA - 4.5 LPA, and the lowest salary is 2.4 LPA. This depends from student to student and some students try to prepare for GATE exam and some of them go for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel infrastructure is good. Facilities are good like Wi-Fi and reading room in hostel and personal study table provided to students. If you are local then hostel chances are very low in the first year.

This course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-level at a basic level. Other things depend on students to get extra skills and get perfect for industry. Semester exams are not too easy nor too difficult and are at moderate level. 40% is a passing percentage.

reviews.course: Diploma in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Nice college for Muslim students.

detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is Wi-Fi, good labs, nice classrooms, and good laboratories. The hostel facility is awesome. Campus life is very disgusting. There is a very nice hostel infrastructure. The people of this university are awesome. Teachers and non-teaching staff are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable teachers. The quality of teaching is awesome. The course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are easy for those who study well. The classroom study is enough.
detailed_review.Other: There is a very nice course. There are many opportunities in India in electronics. There are many events, fests, campus crowds, and extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Maulana Azad National University is very good university.

detailed_review.Placements: In B.Tech computer science students are placed in top and startup companies through off-campus placement approximately 80% of students got placed. Here campus placements are very few. Mostly students prepared themselves for company interviews. Many companies are present in Hyderabad.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My university's infrastructure is very well. Here are more structures are newly built. Mess facility, hostel facility, and others are very good. Students do not have any problem with medical facilities, sports facilities, and other. College building structure is very attractive.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is very well here. Most teachers are experienced well-deserved, and well-educated. Semester exams are not very tough. 98% of student pass every year. After completing course students are ready for industry work.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: The good environment of my university. It feels like the university and infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students got placed. The highest salary package offered ranges between 12 LPA - 15 LPA. The lowest is 4 LPA - 5 LPA. The average package offered is 7 LPA - 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Amazon, Microsoft, and Deloitte. 60% of students secured internships at Microsoft, Infosys, etc. Top roles offered are software engineer, analyst, consultant, and developed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped labs, Wi-Fi-enabled classrooms, a vast library, and research space. The hostel offers clean rooms, good Wi-Fi, and basic amenities. The mess serves decent food. The canteen has multiple options. Medical facilities are available, along with sports grounds and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified & knowledgeable, with good teaching quality. The curriculum is relevant and industry-focused. Semester exams are moderate to tough, requiring consistent study. The pass percentage is around 90%, with most students clearing with effort.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: The college has absolutely perfect faculty to study.

detailed_review.Placements: If I talk about placements then I will say that the placement in this university is just okay. In the previous batch, all the students are placed but the package is low. The highest package that I heard was 32 LPA and the lowest package was 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not fabulous but it is well. The university area has a Wi-Fi connection which gives speeds up to 1 Gbps but has some restrictions like you can not use this network for some applications and websites. There are 100% hostels for girls and 4 hostels for boys which are not sufficient. Therefore some of the freshers have to stay outside the university which is very costly but these students get a hostel the next year. The food quality is also good. The college has 2 canteens and 1 help center with free medicine. The college has an indoor stadium and a playground is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty members are very helpful. They also prepare us for interviews. They share information about startup ideas and technology-related seminars going on. There is a little problem with the semester exam. The question paper will be in Urdu and English language. The question paper is average difficult.
detailed_review.Other: There is a very peaceful and friendly environment in the university. Since the university is surrounded by trees and hill areas. This university provides many scholarships but this university is banned for MOMA. If you want to participate in extra curriculum activities you have to do it by yourself they will not encourage you.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: The college has an islamic mahol with better studies.

The hostel is very good. The mess food is reasonable and well-hygiene.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science

faqs.question: How is Maulana Azad National Urdu University for B.Tech Computer Science?
faqs.answer: B.Tech. in Computer Science at MANUU is a 4 years course offered at the UG level. To get admitted to B.Tech. in Computer Science course at MANUU, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 45.0% in 12th. The total tuition fee for MANUU B.Tech. in Computer Science is INR 32400. Apart from the tuition fee, there is a one-time admission fee of - INR 200, and a hostel fee of amount INR 28400 that students are required to pay. The course offers admission to 60 students In Maulana Azad National Urdu University, the top courses are data structure, Python, networking, C, C+, Java, etc. About 70% of the students got internships in the previous year. One of the students got an internship in Google company in the previous year.

faqs.question: How is Maulana Azad National Urdu University for B.Tech?
faqs.answer: B.Tech. in Computer Science at MANUU is a 4 years course offered at the UG level. To get admitted to B.Tech. in Computer Science course at MANUU, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 45.0% in class 12th. The course offers admission to 60 students. For more accurate and the latest information please visit the official website of Maulana Azad National Urdu University or by contacting the admission office. It is imperative to follow all the guidelines to get the accurate information.

faqs.question: Does Maulana Azad National Urdu University refund fees?
faqs.answer: Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) does not refund fees for missed courses or years when re-admission is sought . Fees paid are non-refundable and non-transferable. The university also does not refund fees for incomplete, illegible forms, or forms received after the last date.

faqs.question: Will I get a fee refund if I cancel my admission from MANUU?
faqs.answer: Yes, MANUU does provide a refund in case of withdrawal of admission. However, the refund is subject to fulfillment of certain conditions. Listed below are the guidelines to be followed as per the fee refund policy of the university: Percentage of refund of aggregate fees Point of time when notice of withdrawal of admission is served to the University as per the UGC regulations 100% 15 days or more before the formally notified last date of admission. 90% Less than 15 days before the formally notified last date of admission. 80% 15 days or less after the formally notified last date of admission. 50% 30 days or less but more than 15 days after being formally notified the last date of admission 0% More than 30 days after formally notified the last date of admission

faqs.question: What is the application fee for the B.Tech programme at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: The application fee for the B.Tech programme at Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) in Hyderabad is INR 200 for the first semester and INR 200 for even semesters . The total tuition fee for the B.Tech in Computer Science programme at MANUU is INR 32,400, plus a hostel fee of INR 28,400 and a one-time admission fee of INR 200

faqs.question: What is the selection process for MBA and minimum MANUU Entrance exam percentile required at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: Selection Process: The admissions are done based on the merit in the Entrance test conducted by the University after fulfilling the eligibility criteria of having any university degree with 45% marks and studied Urdu as a subject or language at 10th standard/ 10+2/Degree or equivalent. Percentile vary year to year and depends upon  entrance.

faqs.question: How many students can do MBA at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: Maulana Azad National Urdu University has 120  seats for MBA  courses  offered in different specialisation and  you have to meet all eligibility criteria and clear there entrance exam conducted by the University. So  maximum of 120 students can do MBA course.It is one of the best  Central University established by an Act of Parliament in 1998. Best of luck!

faqs.question: How many students can do MCA at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: Master of Computer Applications (MCA) at MANUU is a 3 years course offered at the PG level. To get admitted to Master of Computer Applications (MCA) course at MANUU, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 50.0% in graduation. The total tuition fee for MANUU Master of Computer Applications (MCA) is INR 6200. Apart from the tuition fee, there is a one-time admission fee of - INR 200, and a hostel fee of amount INR 14200 that students are required to pay. The course offers admission to 30 students.

faqs.question: How do I take admission in B.Com at MANUU?
faqs.answer: The MANUU BCom course admission is subject to fulfilment of eligibility. In order to be eligible, students must have passed Class 12 and must have studied through Urdu medium or Urdu as a subject/language at Class 10 level or above or an equivalent Madrasa course approved by MANUU with Urdu as the medium of instruction. Further, they must fill out an online application form with all the appropriate details along with relevant documents and application fees to apply for the course. After submitting the application, students must pay the admission fee to finalise their spot.

faqs.question: What is the fee for PG courses at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: The fees for courses at Maulana Azad National Urdu University is very minimal as it is a Central University and PG Admissions are based on scores of the Entrance exam conducted by MANUU having fees 1.M.A (Urdu) 2,800/- 2. M.A (History) 3,300/- 3. M.A (English) 3,300/- 4. M.A (Islamic Studies) 3,300/- These are fees per annum so fees are very less so don't bother about it good luck.

faqs.question: Does Maulana Azad National Urdu University refund fees?
faqs.answer: Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) does not refund fees for missed courses or years when re-admission is sought . Fees paid are non-refundable and non-transferable. The university also does not refund fees for incomplete, illegible forms, or forms received after the last date.

faqs.question: What is the fees for B.Ed Computer Science course at Maulana Azad National Urdu University?
faqs.answer: This institute comprises of seven schools that are inclusive of 24 departments offering Masters programmes, research programmes at MPhil and PhD level. The fees for B.Ed Computer Science course at Maulana Azad National Urdu University is INR 16.2 K - 19.6 K and the eligibility criteria are 10+2 : 50 % and Exams Accepted are: TSEdCET,  MAH B.Ed CET For more accurate and the latest information please visit the official website of Maulana Azad National Urdu University or by contacting the admission office.

faqs.question: How is Maulana Azad National Urdu University for M.A. in terms of placements?
faqs.answer: The M.A. in Urdu program at Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) has a respectable placement history. In order to place students in reputable businesses like Airtel, Big Bazaar, Cap Gemini, Cognizant, DHFL, ICICI Bank, Infosys, Kotak Bank, Trade India, Wipro, and others, the university's Placement and Career Guidance Cell (PCGC) works hard. MANUU M.A. in Urdu students typically receive packages worth INR 3.80 LPA on average. All things considered, MANUU offers M.A. students the chance to obtain appropriate jobs and develop holistically through its placement programs.

The hostellers can apply for admission in the hostel every year.

college_info.college_name: NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management, is located in Sonepat, Haryana. Established in 2012, it is a public university approved by AICTE. NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management provides 7 UG and PG courses in 1 specialisation, namely Food Technology. Theses programmes are offered in both Full Time mode. B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech and MBA/PGDM are some of the courses offered at NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management. Some of the streams in which these courses are offered include Engineering and Business & Management Studies. The total fee at NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management ranges between INR 1,52,950 and 6,06,250. NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management has a student intake of 220 for all the courses. The average median package at NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management is INR 6,16,667. NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management offers all the infrastructural facilities to students.
