NIFTEM - National Institute of Food Technology Entrepreneurship and Management Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Best college of it's category.

detailed_review.Placements: In B.Tech Food Technology, around 70% of students were placed in my year, and 84% of students were placed from my previous batch. Major recruiters are Amul, Nestlé, and Mondelez International, providing packages of 6-8 LPA. Talking of internships, 90% of the students get internships. Companies usually recruit students for the positions of quality inspection, research and development, and new product development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is spread across 100 acres, covered with lush green trees. As for infrastructure, it has separate academic, administrative, and hostel buildings. There are well-equipped labs with all the machines and instruments, as well as classrooms. The rooms in the hostel are of triple occupancy and have a clean and hygienic mess.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very experienced in their fields, and many of them hold a doctorate degree. There are a total of 8 semesters throughout the B.Tech course, and 2 exams (Mid-term and End-term) are taken each semester. The minimum percentage to pass is 40%. Overall, the exams are average except for some subjects.
detailed_review.Other: There are approximately 700-800 students on the campus, and that's why the campus is not so crowded. Events and fests are organized every year, and small events are going on throughout the year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: NIFTEM - One of the best colleges for food technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 100% of students get placed. Internships are also offered. Top recruiters are Amul, Mother Diary, ITC, Haldiram, Nestle, etc. Our placement cell is also hardworking and it is working hard to bring many more recruiters for good placements for students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has very well infrastructure, and academic block is very good. Hostels are little low but all over campus is really good. Washrooms are clean. Classrooms are very well maintained seems like it is a private college cleanliness is also very good. Campus life is great.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful, qualified, and very well knowledgeable. One of the best faculty members for this course. The course is relevant as it is a growing sector of the country. It has much scope. Difficult level is tough in some subjects and average in some.
detailed_review.Other: Best college for food technology students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Unexpectedly content and placement rates are going up. Infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60%-70% of students got placed. The highest package offered is around 12 LPA for B.Tech courses. Top recruiting companies are ITC, Unilever, and Haldirams while Mondelez and Nestlé are the highest paying. Around 80%-90% of students got internships and we get roles as supply chain managers, FSOs, food analysts, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are equipped with Wi-Fi and all amenities like AC, good tables, projectors, boards, and library, which are top-notch. However, hostels do need some improvements but they are like any other government college hostel. Mess is fine. Sports facilities are good but need some improvements in terms of inventory but overall infrastructure is satisfactory.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are from IIT's and IIMs and are highly skilled and qualified. They are also eager to solve your queries and are always there for you. Course curriculum does focus very heavily on industry needs. In food tech engineering your starting salary is not even close to what engineering in other fields can make. However, here they try everything to make students industry-ready so they can latch on to any opportunity they get. Exams are hard but some subjects are more forgiving, and you can manage if you are sincere. However, assignments are just too much. Pass percent is 70%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I love my food and to know, create, and serve it in a more creative way was always passion for me, so I couldn't have been more fortunate to have enrolled in this course. In terms of academics staff and management do deserve some improvement they are core to deal with. Crowd and events are very fun and you can get ample opportunities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: College is the best for food technology.

detailed_review.Placements:
70% of students get placed. 
The highest package was around 12 lacs, and the lowest was 3 lacs. 
Too many companies like Nestle, Amul, and Dairies visit here. 
Management as well as industrial jobs are there for students. 
Industrial experience is provided on a wide basis by the college itself.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Infrastructure is good here. 
Facilities are provided in every possible way. 
Wi-Fi, library, and classroom are also good. 
Hostel quality is okay here.
Quality of food is also okay. 
Medical facilities are also available in good condition. 
Sports and game equipment are also there.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Yes, the teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is okay; you will find it easier as compared to other branches. 
Curriculum is good. Yes, it makes the students industry-ready. 
Exams are on the difficult side. 
Pass percentage is the same as national institutes like NITs.
detailed_review.Other:
I got this college from Jossa; this course only deals with food technology, so students interested in food technology can come here. 
No improvement is needed.
Events are organised on a regular basis; the campus crowd is also good, but silence is also there.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: NIFTEM and its life review.

detailed_review.Placements: We have an average placement with about an average of 6-7 LPA salary. Here, the highest offered package for B.Tech is around 12 LPA and the lowest is around 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Mondelez, Abinbev, ITC foods, ITC AD, Loykaa, Zomato, United Breweries, etc. The roles offered are research and development, quality, production, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure facilities are good and all the classrooms, labs and library are fully air-conditioned with full Wi-Fi access. Niftem has one of the finest labs with a lot of machines and instruments and practical classes are taken seriously here. The quality of the mess and canteen food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are very well educated, mostly from IITs and IIMs, and are highly qualified. Teachers are very helpful and cooperative, which creates a comfortable and educational learning environment for students. The course curriculum is very relevant to what students face in industries.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because food is something that will always be important to people and the food industry is one of the leading industries. Apart from study, campus life is also very good, with a variety of cultural differences in crowds and all-India connectivity of students. Niftem consists of a lot of extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Niftem: A food tech enthusiasm hub.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% students gets placements offered in B.Tech. The highest package offered was around 25 Lacs and the average package was around 7-8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Mondelz international, Abinbev, ITC and Bakers dozon. Around 85% students get internships in the top companies. Top roles offered are mostly for quality control and quality assurance, research analyst and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities of the college are top notch being the top college of food in India. The college has well maintained classrooms with unlimited internet service across the campus along with a library known as NKC (Niftem knowledge centre ) having world class facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are very qualified and knowledgeable. All of the faculty members have a very good teaching experience and all of them have done their graduation and post graduation from IITs and IIMs. The course is totally relevant to the food industry. It is basically a well designed course to make you a diamond for the food industry. The exams are really hard and you need to study extremely well to pass. The passing percentage is 50%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Best college for food technology - NIFTEM.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85-90% of students got placed in our college. The highest package from our college is around 25 Lacs by amul and the lowest package from our college are 3.5 Lacs per annum and the average package is about 5-6lakh. Top recruiting companies on our campus are Nestled, mondleys, ITC. About all students got internships from our college few of students got internships from out of campus. Top roles offered by companies are as product develops, research, and development areas.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities provided by college are top level. Which contains auditorium, seminar halls, hostels and accommodation facilities for parents also. Also there is a gym and various courts for playing various games including volleyball, tennis, badminton etc. Hostel is compulsory for all and mess is included in hostels. The quality of mess food is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: There mainly 5 branches for M.Teach and 1 branch for B.Teach which is FTM I, e food teach and management. Every branch has one hod and atleast 5-6 faculty members which are highly qualified. The quality of teaching is very good and easy with the practical knowledge including industry ready knowledge of machines and equipments. Every lab is air conditioned and with proper lab technician. Curriculum of college is all about food and its betterment. Clearing the semester is depends on point of views on every students no nonsense entertain here 75% attendance is compulsory for all subjects including labs and cheating in any way can case you debarred you from paper. Passing percentage of every subject is about 40%. .
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course because I wanted to know how the food industry and food processing works from engineering perspective. Every aspect of food is covered here in syllabus which is teached by experienced and qualified teachers. For fun activities we have various cultural programmes in our campus and also we celebrates every function such as pongal, ganpati, navratri and kite festival also in which whole college is being participate including pros and director also.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: This college provides good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of students are placed. The highest salary package offered ranges from 10 LPA - 12 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Nestle, Amul, and Mother Dairy. Almost 50% of students get internships and some are even placed in Mondelez. Managerial roles, sales, and research roles are also offered in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college has A-class facilities for our course. Wi-Fi is great, every student gets 15 GB of data per week. The whole academic block is centrally air-conditioned. NIFTEM is a zero-waste college, and a very clean and green one as well. It has NKC or Niftem Knowledge Centre dedicated wholly to the knowledge center or library which has a vast range of books. The quality of food is also good and it is better than the other college. The sports and games facility is also great.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the staffs are either professors or assistant professors. They are knowledgeable with a great command of the subject. NIFTEM provides an informative and knowledgeable course that graduates look back to even for higher degree persuasion. The exams are easy if students study and it is not a one-night study degree.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Our college is good. You'll experience a good college life here.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are quite fine. The average placement is about Rs. 5.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Baker's Dozen, ITC, Mondlez, Pepsico, Parle, and many more big and worthwhile ones. The highest salary package is 15 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the case of infrastructure, this college deserves appreciation. Everything, like the labs and classrooms, is very good. Fully air-conditioned classrooms and labs are there. The Wi-Fi network and its speed are quite fine. The sports and games are also very good. Mess food is quite good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, knowledgeable, and of a helpful nature. The course curriculum is quite relevant. We also have a pilot plant where you can do projects and gain knowledge of machines and industrial things.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is a very good college with good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: About 40-50% of students got their placements but the maximum salary package offered is 8 LPA and the minimum salary package offered is 5 LPA. If you have an average of 8 CGPA and have good knowledge of your course, you will get a good job for sure. You can have extra skills which can upgrade your CV.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good in the college. There are parks, sporting facilities, and a greener environment. The hostel also has good rooms that are good for living. Hostel mess is also decent and normal. It is a very proud thing that fit one branch. We have 100 acres of area.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of our college are good. All are professors and the syllabus of the college covers all concepts. The syllabus is vast and you have to study it properly. The course curriculum is nice but there are some loopholes as always. Semester exams are difficult but if you pay attention to the class and revise, it is easy for you.
detailed_review.Other: If you are interested in food technology then this college is the best in India.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is a good college. It provides great faculty members and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Keeping in mind the current covid situation the placements rates have been degraded but 2 years ago the rates are better and again they will grow. Many multinational companies come for placements, and several companies come for internships during 3rd year. Overall the placements rate is also good but it can be much better.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is green and very clean with a library of 4 floors consisting of all updated books. The Wi-Fi connectivity is also better than the rest colleges. NIFTEM is famous for its laboratories, and all machines are in proper working conditions with experienced faculty members and laboratory technicians. In sports facilities, the campus comprises 2 basketball courts, 2 outdoor and 2 indoor badminton courts, one 11X11 football stadium, 2 volleyball courts, one lawn tennis court, a 400-meter track, and 8 table tennis.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, experienced, and knowledgeable. They have published several books and research papers. The curriculum is also very relevant. It prepares students in the right direction for the industry. Exams are also conducted in a very systematic way. The exam cell is also good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is a great college for students who want their career in food technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest salary package offered is around 11 LPA, and the average salary package offered is 5-6 LPA. Nestle and Pepsi are the top recruiters. Some students got jobs in government like FSSAI by appearing in government exams. Some students become food inspectors. Also, one of our seniors pass-out in 2020 got a salary package of 27 LPA off-campus this year. Our college is at IIT and NIT level in food technology.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is great with 100 Mbps. There is a digital library for online classes, and there is a big library for offline. Food is the same for every college. Hostel and gym are stylish and new. There is a big cricket ground, and tennis, basketball and badminton court are available for all types of sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is strict from the second year. If you are interested in food technology, then only choose this course. Otherwise, I suggest not to opt for this, but if you are interested in food technology, this is the best college with fewer marks in JEE Main. Our college is of national importance now at the same level as NIT.
detailed_review.Other: Fests are great here. Sports activities and tournaments are organised every year by the sports club named Samarthya.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: This college is good for knowledge and the startup atmosphere around.

detailed_review.Placements: The top roles offered are food technologists and food techno-managers. The highest salary pacakge offered ranges from 10 LPA - 13 LPA, and the lowest salary pacakge offered ranges from 2 LPA - 3 LPA. The average salary pacakge offered is 6 LPA. Around 80% of students get placements and the top recruiting company is Nestle. Although ITC and a few other companies like Britannia also recruit a lot of students. The salary increases as students get to experience.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi is decent, around 10 Mbps, and if students connect a LAN cable provided by the hostel itself. Students can get around 90-95 Mbps. The laboratories and library are world-class. Almost all equipment and books are provided in this college, and no matter what the cost. The food is average and the sports facilities are excellent. The canteen is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are extremely qualified, did at least a Ph.D. in their subject. The teaching quality online is not good enough, but offline, it is good. The course curriculum is excellent and industry-related except for the first-year subjects. The semester exams are decent.
detailed_review.Other: There are many events and fests are held continuously throughout the year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is a decent college. I would recommend students to take admission in it.

detailed_review.Placements: Due to covid, placements are hampered heavily. But pre covid, around 90 to 95% of students are placed. The highest salary package offered is 15 LPA. Top recruiting companies are MARS international, Mondelez, ITC, GSK, Tetrapek, Baker's dozen, Snowman logistics, Coldex logistics, and many more. Top roles offered food technologist, food analyst, some managerial roles, food production manager, new product development executive, RnD executive, etc. Students may pursue a food inspector too as a career.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is one of the best in the nation. Hostels are well maintained, and food is good relative to other college's mess food. Wi-Fi, laboratories, classrooms, and library are world-class.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are highly qualified but not all worthy of teaching. 
For being industry-ready, students need to work independently. Students cannot depend on the curriculum for that, but it can give students a boost. Semester exams are not that hard to crack. Students can score well with basic efforts.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: This college is like other IITs and NITs. It will increase ranking of this college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is good. Almost 90% of students are placed. The average salary package offered is 6-7 LPA. the highest salary package offered is 1.2 LPA. This college has its placement team as faculty. So, that it is easy to place every student in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facility is very good. This college has excellent infrastructure, and it has an eco-friendly environment. Every hostel has its separate mess and gym. The food quality served in mess is very good. It has a cricket stadium for students, and everything is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly educated in this college. The teaching method is very good, but examination is a little bit difficult for students. Studying online is a little difficult for students in a covid pandemic situation. All faculty members are cooperative and helpful every time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is the pioneer college in food sector.

detailed_review.Placements: If students compare with other food technology colleges then NIFTEM gives far better exposure and better job offers. Although, the average salary package offered is 5 LPA with some exceptions above 10 LPA. But, if students compare with CS packages then they will receive less. Overall, the placement is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college Wi-fi is good though not as good as IIT. The classrooms and laboratories are states of the art. It has the strongest point when comes about infrastructures. Hostels for B.Tech is double sharing with no air-conditioner option available. The library is another feather in the hat for this college. Hostel charges are very less compare to IIT, and NIT but are very well maintained and clean.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are very good in their respective fields, and are very cooperative with the students. Although there are a few exceptions, which can't be helped. Overall, teachers are very good at NIFTEM.
detailed_review.Other: Fees are comparable to the higher side. However, as NIFTEM has become an INI so fees are now coming down. Still, it is far high, and more or less the same as an NIT. Hostel and mess charges are less. Campus life is excellent with many happenings.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: It is an excellent college in the field of food technology which is going to be world-renowned.

detailed_review.Placements: In our course, around 80-85% of the students got placed from the 2019 batch. The salary package offered lies between 4-10 LPA except for exceptional cases, and the average salary package offered is around 5.2 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Nestle, ITC Ltd, FSSAI, Mondelez, Mother Dairy, Britannia, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo, Haldiram's, etc. Companies like Mondelez, ITC and many others give internship opportunities to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi facilities are available 24 hours at our campus. Labs are well-equipped with modern equipment, and there are many research laboratories on our campus. Classrooms are fully air-conditioned with an interactive smartboard. The library is equipped with all resources like magazines, books related to our course, research paper, daily newspaper and many others. Rooms in our hostel are neat and clean with well-maintained furniture. About 2 students are allotted in each room. The quality of food in our mess is quite good. The canteen is also available with varieties of food items. Medical facilities are available for 24 hours. Sports competitions are organised every year, and there are different types of sports equipment in good condition. Everyone gets time to enjoy their sports of interest. A big stadium is also going to complete within few months.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors have deep knowledge of their subjects. They are ready to solve our doubts. All of them have completed their PhD degrees from reputed institutions, and some of them got their PhD degrees from IITs also. Our course curriculum is updated according to the needs of the industry. Many interviews, group discussions and projects are organised before placements so that students can develop their skills. Internship programs are also mandatory in the last year for students to get exposure to the industry. The difficulty level of semester exams is moderate. The pass percentage is around 40% or 4.0 grade for each subject.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Our college is the best, and I suggest to students that this college is decent to consider.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are average, and around 85% of the students got placed. The highest salary package offered varies from 8 LPA to 9 LPA, and the average salary package offered is in between 5 LPA to 6 LPA. Almost 100 recruiters visit our college for placements. Top recruiting companies are ITC, Mother Dairy, Mondelez, Amul, Dabur, Britannia, etc. Roles offered in domains including food and beverages, safety and quality, FMCG supply chain, retail, etc. All the students got internships in more than 30 different companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college stands out in terms of its infrastructure with an amazing 100-acre campus containing the top-notch technologically equipped library, auditorium, classrooms and labs. Other amenities include the cafeteria, tuck shop, medical facilities, laundry facility, gymnasium, guest house, etc. Hostels are good with double sharing rooms for boys and triple sharing rooms for girls. The mess serves average food. Our college also provides good sports facilities for almost all major sports, and many facilities are to be developed. Overall, the infrastructure is excellent.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are well-qualified and experts in their fields. Some teachers are very helpful towards the students. Teaching methods are not that interesting, and they are a bit boring. The course curriculum is well-modified for students to fit with industry demands.
detailed_review.Other: College life is quite happening with events, celebrations and competitions coming up regularly. Major fests are Edisia which is a cultural fest, E-Summit which is an entrepreneurship fest and Samarthya, which is a sports fest. The college has ample opportunities for students who want to participate in extracurricular activities or be a part of different clubs and societies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: There are really good infrastructure and facilities and lush green environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70% to 80% of the students get placed from our college, while others opt for higher studies. The highest salary package offered was 8 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered was 4 LPA. The average salary package offered was 5.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Mondelez, ITC, Cadbury, Nestle, Mother Dairy, etc. All students have to get internship experience compulsorily during their 7th semester, and interviews are conducted for the same.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are top-notch here. The entire campus is air-conditioned and has a Wi-Fi facility. Labs are modern and well-equipped. Classrooms are very spacious and equipped with rotating chairs which aren't found even in top colleges. The library building is a unique part and is sprawled over 5 floors, and it is quite spacious and provides a good ambience. The mess food is average and sometimes bad. The canteen is well-equipped will all the necessary food items. Medical staff members are friendly and easy to approach, and they give immediate medical attention. There are lots of basketball, tennis and badminton courts. Recently a race track is also being built, and there are a football field and a cricket ground. Every year a sports league called Niftem sports league is provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here were good with students, but they are not good teachers. Some teachers are helpful, and all teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. The teaching quality of some of the teachers is very good. This course is relevant to the curriculum, and the course gets updated every semester, which rarely happens in any other college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management
reviews.review_title: Good college but it has scope for improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 percent of the students are placed. The average package is around 4-4.5 Lacs and the highest is not more than 8 Lacs. Companies like Mother Dairy and Mondelez come for placements. The internship is held in the fourth year and students sit for interviews for the same. Roles are mixed, both managerial and technical.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is top-notch. Wi-Fi has a good speed. Library is well-equipped. Classrooms are airconditioned and spacious. Hostels are one, two and three seater. For boys, there are one seater and two seater. Mess food is below average. Medical facilities are reasonable. Scope for huge improvement in sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not very helpful and just teach from the PPTs. Their quality can be much better. The curriculum is relevant but it should be taught well also. We have to study ourselves and take help from seniors. Some faculty is good but most are not able to teach properly.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What is NIFTEM JEE Main cutoff?
faqs.answer: NIFTEM offers BTech and BTech Integrated courses based on JEE Main scores. Candidates having valid JEE Main ranks will be allowed to take part in JoSAA counselling rounds. Considering the NIFTEM JEE Main cutoff 2025 for the Round 4 seat allotment results, the B.Tech. in Food Technology and Management closing rank for the General AI category was 105051 . faqs.question: What is the cut off of NIFTEM?

highlights.summary: National Institute of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management - Thanjavur is an institute located in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu. National Institute of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management - Thanjavur courses are offered to students at the UG and PG levels. The institute is approved by AICTE and offers courses in Full Time mode. National Institute of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management - Thanjavur offers a total of 4 courses in stream such as Engineering. Some of the popular courses offered at the institute are B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech and the total seat intake for the available courses is 126. These courses are offered to students across several specialisation such as Food Technology. Further, the fee for all these courses is INR 3,04,000 and the average median salary is around INR 4,37,523. Apart from this, the National Institute of Food Technology, Entrepreneurship and Management - Thanjavur campus has a state-of-the-art infrastructure with all the advanced facilities.

college_info.college_name: NIT Agartala (NITA): Cutoff, Placement, Fees, Courses, Admission 2025, Ranking

highlights.summary:
The Government of India converted the Tripura Engineering College to NIT Agartala in 2006. Agartala NIT is approved by AICTE. NIT Agartala, also known as NITA, is located in Agartala, Tripura. The National Institute of Technology Agartala is a also the 20th NT in the country. NIRF 2025 has ranked the college in the 101-150 band under the Engineering category.
Establishment year/ Ownership type
- 101-150 by NIRF 2025 under the Engineering category
- 26 by India Today 2024 under the Engineering (Government category)

table.details:
- 101-150 by NIRF 2025 under the Engineering category

- 26 by India Today 2024 under the Engineering (Government category)

college_info_program.intro:
NIT Agartala offers a wide range of courses at the UG, PG, and doctoral levels through its various departments, including The Department of Civil Engineering, the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, and the Department of Bio Engineering, among others.
The NIT Agartala BTech programme offered by institute is highly popular due to its promising career prospects. NIT Agartala accepts JEE Main scores for admission to its BTech programme. Among the various specialisations offers BTech programme, Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) is the most preferred specialisation among the students.
The NITA curriculum ensures that the students are provided with the knowledge to understand the fundamentals of Computer Science Engineering and equips them with creative problem-solving abilities. Some of the popular courses offered by NIT Agartala and their respective eligibility and NIT Agartala MBA fees and NIT Agartala BTech fees are given below:
For more information about the National Institute of Technology, Agartala check out the below video:

NIT Agartala Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: First qualify, then dream about this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good enough if your skills are much better than those of others. If your CG is at least above 8.5, then you will definitely get a good package. So many companies come to our college, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, etc. The highest package of last year was 68 LPA. There are so many opportunities for internships if you have good skills compared to other students, and also have a decent CG, at least above 8.5. Microsoft also came last year and picked up two girls from an idea in Agartala.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a big library on the campus with enough books for every subject, and literature and novels are also available. Classrooms depend on the building in which your classes are going on, like science block classes are not good, but in the CSE and a new freshers building, which was started this year, for the first year, we are having very good classes. Here are a lot of clubs. In the hostel, there are two beds in a room as this is double accommodation, tubelights, fan, covered, food is average, quality is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are many faculty members for each subject, and they are friendly and understanding to students. Students have difficulties with the pronunciation of some faculty members, as the students are from all over India. Exams, class tests, quizzes, and viva are regularly taken to check the performance of each individual student. As in 1st year, all students have a common syllabus across all their respective branches, but I don't understand why a computer science student should learn about graphics.
detailed_review.Other: From my childhood, my dream has been to be a software engineer, and I chose B.Tech for my engineering.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Prasenjit Das college review.

detailed_review.Placements: My college was so nice. More than 90 percent of students were placed in top companies. The highest and the lowest packages were offered in this course. More than 68 percent of students got internships. Many top recruiting companies visited the course. The percentage of students got internships in the course was 90 percent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in this course were so good. Wi-Fi and classroom were available in my college. The quality of food in college canteen was so superb. Medical facility was not good. All sports and games were available for all students in my course.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in this course were so helpful and qualified. They were all too knowledgeable. This course curriculum was relevant, and students were industry-ready. Semester exam in this course was so easy to pass. Hence pass percentage was more than 90 percent in my course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Agartala is getting better, but due to its locality, its development will take time.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75-80% are placed generally every year. This year, placement is going on. Top recruiters are Microsoft, Cisco, ICICI Bank, Fractal, etc., and PayPal is yet to visit. From our Course 3 to 4, we are getting Internship opportunities like Cisco, Fractal, ICICI, etc. The Top role offered is for the SDE role, data analytics, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of NIT Agartala is good. Wi-Fi is available everywhere with a daily 2 GB Jionet. Classrooms are also cleaned with daily washing. Libraries are also big with the maximum number of books available. The quality of facilities in the hostel is not that good. The food quality is not good. Canteen's food is also not good. Medical facilities are average. Sports exposure is below average, with vast sporting games played here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Generally, here in NIT Agartala, every faculty is Ph.D. qualified. Their knowledge is very good. But the teaching quality is not that good. The course curriculum is relevant and is closely related to individual branches. The students are industry-ready. Exams are getting difficult with each passing semester. Pass percentage is 30-35%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my JEE rank. But after coming here, it was overall a good experience. The best thing about my course is that it explains many analogue, digital and electronic subjects, which is fun to learn. I wish that the practical lab of my course would improve much so that our practical knowledge also improves. Events, fest, campus crowd are average. Connectivity is also average, with not so many modes of travel available. The campus surroundings are very green. Scholarship is also provided. Extracurricular activities are also performed, like weight lifting, NCC, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology and Biochemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good faculty, placement is not that good, really, infrastructure and facilities are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: Actually, in the core company, no on-campus placement is available. Only in the IT sector placement is there if you know coding or have other skills, then only you will get a placement. In our branch, there is a maximum of 35 students every year and 12-14 people get placement. Mainly in ICICI Bank, as a data analyst, many students go. The highest package is 1,40,000, and the lowest is 4,00,000.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of my college is good, the classrooms are good, the labs are also very good, and there are many things in the labs. The Wi-Fi facility of my college is very fast, but the quality of the mess food is not good. The food is too oily. There is a hospital in our college, which is open 24 hours. The sports section is very good, every game is there as per your wish, and you can participate.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and cooperative. They are highly qualified, most of them have studied at IITs, and they are doing their research continuously. Their teaching quality is very good. The course curriculum is relevant if you are not interested in this subject, but after admission, you gain much interest in the subjects, and the labs are very interesting. If you work hard, you are industry-ready. The semester exam is not that difficult if you study well, you can pass the exam very easily. The pass percentage in my department is 99%.
detailed_review.Other: Actually, I chose this course because I could not get this course alone. But after getting admission, I gained so much interest. The best thing about this course is that you can study biotechnology and Biochemistry, which means you are also studying chemical engineering. I wish that labs should be better, events, campus crowd connectivity, campus surroundings, scholarship and Extracurricular activities of our college are awesome. Fests are very good.

reviews.course: B.S. + M.S. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: College is good. You should take admission in this college.

detailed_review.Placements: The BS+MS Chemistry at NIT Agartala is a five-year full-time integrated dual degree programme offered by the Department of Chemistry. Admission is through JEE Main via the JoSAA counselling, and eligibility requires having completed 10+2 with science subjects (PCM or PCMB) and usually around 75% marks in qualifying examinations (with relations for reserved categories).
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Agartala occupies around 365 acres of campus, set in a serene environment with well-planned academic blocks and greenery. The institute offers modern classrooms, seminar halls, and a lecture theatre equipped with projectors and other audiovisual aids. Labs are well-equipped across departments, including computer labs, electronics, mechanical, civil, etc., supporting hands-on learning. The central library has a large collection (several tens of thousands of books), many journals (200), plus digital resources, a reading room, OPAC, and scanning/copying facilities. For connectivity, the whole campus is Wi-Fi enabled.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching staff at NIT Agartala is well-qualified, with many faculty members holding PhDs from reputed institutions and having experience in both academia and research. Students often describe them as supportive and accessible, although there is feedback that teaching quality can vary across departments.
detailed_review.Other: The BS+MS Chemistry batch at NIT Agartala is fairly small and selective, with 13 seats available for the dual degree programme. Admission is via JEE Main, and candidates need about 75% marks in their 10+2 exams (in relevant Science subjects) to be eligible.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: About good placements (75%) with good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 75% of students are placed. Top companies are Google, Microsoft, Cisco, Service Now, Tata Steel, etc. Highest package is 60 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, average package is 8 LPA. 90% of students got internships at Cisco, TCS, ONGC, Indian Oil, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, Reliance, etc. Top roles are offered in computer science engineering, electronics and communication engineering, and electrical engineering and mechanical engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In hostel room, 2 students share a single room. In room, two beds, two tube lights, one ceiling fan, one table, one chair, and one almirah are available. Mess food is average. Three times a week give chicken, two times egg at night. Classrooms are cleaned. Library is quite big and books are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are most qualified. They have vast experience. Teaching quality depends on professor to professor. This course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are between moderate and hard. Mid-term is 20 marks and end-term is 50 marks. Pass percentage is 30%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for core companies like Tata Motors, ONGC, etc. We gain a vast knowledge from awesome faculty members. Events are conducted like Moksha, tech fest, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure, but the hostel and mess food are problematic.

detailed_review.Placements: EIE is a multidisciplinary engineering branch that merges principles of electronics with instrumentation to design, build, and maintain automated systems. The course provides a strong foundation in both hardware and software applications. Mathematics, Physics, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, and Signal Systems are the subjects mainly necessary.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities in the hostel are average, and the food is also not that good. Wi-Fi here is bad, too. Canteen, we have a Nescafe, but there are only a few items available. Classrooms are of average quality. Lawns are pretty good too, and medical facilities are active 24/7.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are well qualified. There are many teachers from IIT as well, because it not only teaches about IT but also studies us the core subjects, which is important. EIE has the main advantage of getting into core companies, so it is useful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, 75 to 80% students are placed almost every year. The average package is 8 LPA. Students get into both the core and its sectors. Core sector companies like BPCL, HPCL, Cairn Energy, and Vedanta, and IT and consulting firms like Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, and Wipro recruit our students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, as it is NIT. Hostels are well-maintained, and the mess food is good. First-year students stay in the RNT hostel. We also have a hospital also in our campus. We have a very large sports complex. There are lots of mess and canteens available all over the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of teachers are PHD holders. Teaching quality is good. Exams are average level. You need to study at least 2 hours daily apart from regular classes, and you will score good marks. For the first year, all branches are taught the same syllabus, like Physics, Chemistry, Maths, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Agartala College Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Generally, a lot of students get placed each year in reputable companies, and it really depends on the branches they pick. Speaking of my branch, nearly everyone managed to snag a job during campus placements. It was impressive. Most of the packages fall into what we call dream slots, and quite a few high achievers even make it to super dream slots, averaging around 10 LPA. Companies like TCS and Dell also have some great internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure was practical, with good facilities both for sports and academics. You could always use a LAN port for an unlimited public Ethernet connection. The campus was full of well organized events, and the different clubs add to the diversity and opportunities for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very well qualified and were of a lot of help. The teaching method was of very high quality. The training programme was very relevant, and it definitely prepares students for the industry. Semester exams were at a medium level of difficulty. The pass percentage was absolutely dependent on the average score of the class, which was 50%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology and Biochemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall great college and nice campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good, those who are not from IT branch can also be a part of the IT placements. If your coding skills are great, you can easily get an IT job here. Overall, 87% placement rate and also very good college overall. It has good and nice atmosphere also.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good and clean hostels are there. Our college has good atmosphere and very nice to spend time here. The courses are very great. There are 10 different branches that offer you to learn deep engineering. Very good and nice campus as well. I recommend taking admission to this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are great and nice. The exam pattern and scoring system are quite familiar to us. The grading system is based on CGPA and SGPA. Those who have above 7.5 CGPA can easily get a core/IT job here. The faculty members are also very nice and friendly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, a good college and decent.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, the percentage of students being placed is around 90% which is CSE. Our highest package offered is 52 LPA. Leading recruiters are Amazon, Oracle, Uber, and PayPal. In 3rd year, some of the premier companies came for interns. Most of the students get SDE intern roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: New RNT hostel is pretty good, but the older one, Aryabhatta, has some scope for improvement. Wi-Fi facility is decent, like you'll get 2Gb per day Jio net. Quality of facilities is pretty decent. Mess food in 1st year is not so good, and basic facilities are provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members and scholars are highly knowledgeable and helpful, but some lab assistants may be rude sometimes. But some faculty members are genuinely very helpful, and they give internships under their surveillance for 3rd and 4th year attentive students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Production Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good in culture, may be not suitable for placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario this year is not upto the mark, especially for branches like ours. I got placed in a decent company. But still, I would say placement is not good. Around 50% of students are placed in our branch which is very low, and most of companies are sales companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is great, there is no doubt about that. I don't think there is any better NIT in North East than that in terms of infrastructure, classrooms, and lab facilities. Hostel facility is also good but sometimes in mess the quality of food is not up to the mark.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our department, teachers are very helpful and knowledgeable, technically qualified. They help us not only in studies but also in other things like extracurricular activities, and how to compete on the internet with other students to check where we stand compared to others.
detailed_review.Other: To be honest, my first preference is other branches like computer science and circuital branches but due to less percentile in JEE I did not get these branches.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Loved the campus. Great college for students with around 98.1 percentile in JEE Main.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies like Google, IBM, and Deloitte come for recruitment. The average package for CSE students is around 14 to 16 LPA. NIT Agartala has its own dedicated building known as the Training and Placement Cell. Overall, this college is good for placement, and the overall average package lies around 10 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. NIT Agartala is known for its beautiful campus. You will get top-class sports facilities over here. Hostels are beautiful. The overall infrastructure of the campus is great. You have separate buildings for different branches. The mess is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: You will get top-class facilities at NIT Agartala. They are very friendly and interactive. The curriculum here is up to date, preparing students according to the needs of the industry. Semester exams are moderate. One can easily score 8 CGPA by merely paying attention in class and doing regular revision.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Big campus and good placements in the top 3 branches of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage placement is 80% in B.Teach, with the highest package being 52 LPA. The average package is also good. Companies like Microsoft and PhonePe hire with good packages, and core companies like BP also visit the college and offer good placements. For internship purposes, you need to apply.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: JioNet Wi-Fi and an AC library are available. Mess food has become better with time and with the help of the mess committee. A sports complex is available for all types of sports activities, and a shopping complex is also present within the campus itself. So, the campus area is pretty big.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are very good, but the professors are strict, and it is hard to get good marks in the higher semesters. So, try to get a good CGPA in the first 2 years, since, after that, the subjects will get tougher, and there will be a lot of pressure to get good placements.
detailed_review.Other: Festivals are rare. The previous year, the fest was canceled, but there are at least 2 fests yearly. Connectivity on the campus is okay; in some areas, you will get 5G, but in the hostel, if you are on the ground floor, then the network is poor.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the campus life but dissatisfied with the placement scenario.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2025, from my branch, Electronics and Communication Engineering, around 70% of students are placed, but most of them are placed in BDA (Sales) roles. The highest package is around 43 LPA from VISA, the average is around 6-7 LPA, and the lowest is around 2 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my course, Electronics and Communication Engineering, our department was quite great compared to other departments in terms of lab facilities, Wi-Fi, and classrooms. But in the hostel, sometimes the food quality was not that good. There are a few games and sports that the college organizes, but most of the sports are organized by the students themselves.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our Department of ECE, most of the teachers are very helpful, not only in college studies but also in extracurricular activities like coding contests, where they discuss strategies with us and guide us on how to apply. Regarding the course curriculum, it is relevant nowadays, especially with the semiconductor industry booming; this course has become essential. In our department, the exams were quite tough, and the passing percentage was around 40%.
detailed_review.Other: My first choice was the CSE branch, but I didn't get it, unfortunately. Then I decided to opt for the Electronics and Communication Engineering branch, as it was my second choice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Agartala College review.

detailed_review.Placements: Eventually, most of the students get placements every year in top companies, although results differ branch-wise. In my branch as well, nearly everyone gets placed via the campus drive. Most of the offers are dream category, with some achievers even landing above the super dream position, averaging about 10 LPA. TCS, Dell, among other companies also offer internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has decent infrastructure and has campus Wi-Fi everywhere. It compensates with well-equipped labs, comfortable classrooms, and a comprehensive library. The availability of textbooks and learning resources within the college reduces the need to buy external materials. Hostel accommodation is also provided, along with transportation facilities for students without personal vehicles. Mess service is hygienic, and food menu is acceptable. They need to add more food items liked by students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Although the faculty members are knowledgeable and experienced. They mostly focus on theoretical teaching without providing hands-on learning. Exams follow a semester-based pattern and are relatively easy to clear. Teachers offer strategies to help students score well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has a great college life, but something is missing.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90% of students got placed in the ECE branch. A few students get placed at Nvidia. In addition to ECE, other branches like CSE (Computer Science and Engineering), EE (Electrical Engineering), and ME (Mechanical Engineering) also achieved around an 80% placement rate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is beautiful and green. The need is to maintain the area. A huge part of the area under the college is covered with unwanted plants, and it just needs to be well-maintained. The another beautiful thing is that the internet speed here is not pleasing, and we have to face problems related to the internet. We are only provided 2 GB of data for Wi-Fi.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are regular classes, but sometimes due to bad weather, classes get cancelled as day scholars can't attend classes. When it comes to examination, we need to study regularly in classes, and that's more than enough. We need to be consistent in our studies. Like, giving 2-3 hours daily with classes is more than enough.
detailed_review.Other: There are not a lot of fests and events in this college. I don't know why, but I hope it improves in the upcoming years.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, the college is very good for its infrastructure and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is improving day by day, now more in branches like ME, PE, CE, CHE, etc. The college possesses a National rank (NIRF) of 81. 2025 few years back, the placements were not that good, but in recent years, it has improved with the highest package of 52 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: One of the best infrastructures in the northeast with lush green campus and a lot of diversity with large buildings with proper equipment for each branch, with one of the best sports facilities with a swimming pool and one of the largest sports complexes in India, and a gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is well-educated with a well-established examination system. Our exam schedule contains one midterm test and one end-semester test at the end of the semester. According to the stipulated syllabus, our academic curriculum also consists of many class tests and quizzes.
detailed_review.Other: The campus organizes one of the biggest fests called Moksha, with celebrities invited, along with various club activities.

reviews.course: B.S. + M.S. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the infrastructure, sports facilities, and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Out of 25 members in my batch, almost everyone got placed in campus placements, mainly during the final year. If you are passionate about teaching, then this course would be apt for you because many top teaching platforms like Byju’s, Physics Walah, and many more are recruiting students mainly from our department.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Agartala has one of the biggest sports complexes among all 31 NITs and also separate buildings for each department. Of course, the CSE building infrastructure is top notch. We also have a big round glass library where we have access to many books, and we have a digital library as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Curriculum is good and very updated. Mainly, those who want to do Masters and Ph.D. in this relevant area will benefit more. When it comes to faculty, we have top notch faculty who did their Ph.D. as well as double doctorates from Germany. We also have faculty who scored All India in both NET and GATE.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with campus things and hoping to get a good placement in 2028.

detailed_review.Placements: In the 2023 placement drive at NIT Agartala, the electronics and communication engineering (ECE) branch achieved a placement rate of 85.84%. The highest salary package offered in 2023 was INR 52 LPA, average package was INR 13.83 LPA, and the lowest package was INR 3.5 LPA. Google, TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Capgemini, L&T, and various PSUs are top recruiting companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and accommodation all together maintain a standard level, but in the first year we faced difficulties in building which is named new building but turned out to be an old building instead. Hope so in second year we will get a good classroom in our ECE department.
detailed_review.Faculty: Except some every professor is supporting and well qualified. The course curriculum is relevant and really makes sense for industrial training. Semester exams are overall easy. In case a student studies utilising his/her full potential. Otherwise, it may seem hard to some students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because after computer science, this was a great field to grab jobs and other opportunities in the future. Also, NIT Agartala has a vast campus with greenery. The events, fests, and extracurricular activities are next level.

college_info.college_name: NIT Agartala Course Admission 2025: Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility & Application

admission.title: NIT Agartala Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text:
NIT Agartala admission 2025 is based on national-level entrance exams. Candidates are selected through multiple national-level entrance tests for these courses. Admission is provided based on cumulative scores of a qualifying exam, personal interview and profile of the candidate. BTech is the flagship programme offered by the institute.

Admission to NIT Agartala is offers based on valid scores of accepted entrance exams. For courses such as BTech, the institute considers valid scores in JEE Main, and JoSAA counselling for final admission. NIT Agartala offers UG, PG, and PhD programmes across various branches of Engineering, Science and Management. NIT Agartala comprises 13 departments that offer more than 20 courses in different streams.

faqs.question: Is studying at NIT Agartala expensive?
faqs.answer: NIT Agartala offers undergraduate, postgraduate, PhD programmes across various branches of Engineering, Science and Management. NIT Agartala comprises 13 departments that offer more than 20 courses in different streams. The table below showcases the list of a few tuition fee offered at NIT Agartala: This information is sourced from official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: What was the BTech CSE cutoff for NIT Agartala?
faqs.answer: The opening cutoff rank for NIT Agartala Round 1 for the BTech CSE course was 291. The closing rank for the NIT Agartala BTech CSE course for Round 6 was 58163. Candidates seeking admission to the National Institute of Technology Agartala BTech course must visit the official website of the National Testing Agency (NTA) to apply online.

faqs.question: Is admission entrance-based for BSc in NIT Agartala?

sections.heading: Introduction
text: The National Institute of Technology  Agartala provides modern amenities with state-of-the-art infrastructure to its students. The facilities provided by the institute is mentioned below:
Hostel: NIT Agartala has both boy's and girl's hostels. There are a total of six boys hostel and two girls hostel.

Health Care: The institute has a well-equipped medical unit with two senior Medical Officers, Pharmacists, and other supporting staff available in the campus for rendering medical care to the students, staff and other persons within the campus.

Library: NIT Agartala has a stock room with more than 34,000 books & 200 Journals. The facilities include an 8 to 8 lending service, a well-facilitated reading room, a hi-speed copying facility along with Scanning facilities, etc.

Extracurricular Activities: The institute also conducts co-curricular activities such as games and sports, debates, cultural functions, essay competitions, drama competitions, rallies on various themes, NSS programmes, etc. being sponsored by the state Government and other statutory bodies and by the Institute authority.
For more information about NIT Agartala check out the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The central library of the Institute (NITA) has well-facilitated reading room, back volume section, indexing and reference section, OPAC facility and more than 84323 books & 200 journals. NITA subscribes to various e-resources from time to time.  The Library of the Institute is equipped with the latest RFID systems and dedicated digital section with online access to numerous international journals of repute and ebooks from different online portals and subjects to quench the needs of our students and researchers.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: National Institute of Technology, Agartala has made staying of girls students in the hostel mandatory from the year 2012-13. There are 3 other hostels which have a total seat capacity of 340 and construction of another 1500 capacity hostel is going on.

facilities.name: Shuttle Service
facilities.description: The Institute runs private bus services from Agartala to Institute campus and back during working hours and in cases of an emergency adequate number of buses, jeeps and private vehicles are available on NH-44 for traveling from Agartala. It is mandatory for all students to avail bus facility from Agartala to Institute Campus, however, on special grounds some relaxation may be given to students.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 370 published reviews , 337 reviews are verified.

likes.text: Top recruiting companies like Amazon, Samsung, Wipro, Infosys, Toddle, Jio Reliance, L&T, Nokia, Capgemini, Deloitte, ADP, Reliance Industries and Bharat Petroleum visit our campus for placements.
The mechanical and computer science students have very good opportunities to get placed from the college.

Hostel facilities are very good but mess food are not very well, but canteen food is good, madical facilities is good, sports facilities is excellent.

highlights.summary:
NIT Arunachal Pradesh is ranked 101-150 by NIRF 2025 under the Engineering category. The National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh was established in 2010 under the NIT Act by MHRD, and the Government of India. Earlier, the college was functioning under the mentorship of NIT Durgapur. The college is known as an Institute of National Importance by an Act of Parliament. NIT Arunachal Pradesh is approved by UGC and AICTE. Located in Arunachal Pradesh, the National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh is famous for its flagship BTech and MTech courses. NIT Arunachal Pradesh, through nine departments, offers UG, PG, and PhD courses to students. These courses are provided across Engineering, Basic and Applied Science, and various other streams.
National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh offers placement assistance to students. This reputed college offers medical facilities, a library, and various other facilities for students. NIT Arunachal Pradesh offers scholarships to students as financial assistance. They have signed MOUs with national and international organisations. NIT AP appoints well-trained and expert faculty members with years of experience in the related field. NIT Arunachal Pradesh admission is based on merit and entrance exams. The institute accepts national entrance exams such as JEE Main, GATE, DASA UG, and others. The major highlights of Arunachal Pradesh NIT are tabulated below:
NIT Arunachal Pradesh Highlights 2025

college_info_program.intro:
NIT Arunachal Pradesh popular programmes are BTech and MTech. BTech students are taught Engineering Chemistry, Communication Skills, and various other subjects. BTech students can become Mining Engineers, Ceramic Engineers, and Robotics Engineers, or can take up any job role matching their qualifications. BTech students with some level of training can also become AI Programmers. To become an AI Programmer, students must know Python, C++, Java, and others which students can learn at NIT Arunachal.
NIT Arunachal Pradesh's MTech programme is the other one for which the college has gained popularity over the years. MTech students are placed in top companies such as HCL Technologies, Publicis Sapient, Infosys, and others. Below mentioned are some of the courses offered by NIT Arunachal Pradesh and their respective eligibility and NIT Arunachal Pradesh fee structure:
