college_info.college_name: NIT Arunachal Pradesh Fees 2026
NIT Arunachal Pradesh Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Somewhat dissatisfied because of the language barrier and the Maths teacher.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every student gets placed in our course, i.e., CSE. The highest package is 60 LPA, the average is 24 LPA, and the lowest is 8 LPA. Top recruiters include Microsoft, Apple, and Amazon. Around 90% of students get placed in various companies like Amazon, and some even in institutions like NIT and IIT. Roles offered include account manager and director. My college is very good at placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Laboratories, playgrounds, classrooms with projectors, lab rooms, and Wi-Fi are available throughout the campus. The mess and canteen are rated 3 out of 5, medical facilities 4 out of 5, and sports and games 4 out of 5. On our campus, football is more popular, and cricket is played sometimes.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is good. It makes students industry-ready. It is difficult due to absolute grading. The pass percentage is 40%. Exams are conducted strictly. The academic calendar is somewhat disrupted due to college fights, and the academic schedule is not followed.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this because I got this course through the Main exam. It is the most chosen and suitable course nowadays. It is a top course. There is improvement in specializations. All events take place.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied because of the language barrier, and the infrastructure needs to be developed.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every student gets placed in our Mechanical branch. The highest package is 40 LPA, the average is 20 LPA, and the lowest is 15 LPA. The top recruiting companies for our course are L&T and Bridge & Roof. Around 90% of students get internships in the Steel Plant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure available in our department include Wi-Fi, labs, digital classrooms, a library, and a workshop. The hostel provides basic needs and maintains the mess well. Equal priority is given to sports and games on our campus to ensure overall growth.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They are qualified and highly knowledgeable. The quality of teaching is very good. It makes students industry-ready. It is difficult due to absolute grading and a pass percentage of 40%. The academic curriculum plays a crucial role in our course management.
detailed_review.Other: I get this course as per my ranking in JEE Main. My course gives students the freedom to learn freely. There is improvement in specializations in the course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is good having a reputation all across India, but it is in a remote area.

detailed_review.Placements: 50 precent of the students got placed in my branch. The highest package offered is 14 LPA in the electrical branch with the lowest package of  5 lakh by TCS. Top recruiting companies are Vedanta ,L&T ,Tata, Power Grid and many other companies. I have done my internships in Power Grid and BHEL.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are of good size. There are two types of classes, one normal having a capacity of 40 students and the other is a lecture hall which has a capacity of 150 students. Every class has a projector. Labs are equipped with latest equipments. The entire campus is wifi enabled. The hostel facilities are good with one room being shared between 3 students. The hostel food is really delicious.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty members are highly educated having done their PhD from top tier colleges like NIT and IIT. They are really helpful and their teaching style is good, I can understand the concepts properly. They make the students industry ready by giving us tips to crack the company interviews. Semester exams are difficult having 5 theory subjects and 4 practicals. The exams schedule is really hectic and 40% is the minimum passing percentage.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Fulfilled expectations: A critical evaluation of NIT Arunachal Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: As of now, around 40% of the students got placed in my batch. Among those, the highest package is 9 LPA, the lowest is 4.5 LPA and the average package is 6 LPA. The top recruiter is L&T. Placement drives are still going on, and we expect better ones in the second half. In our senior batch, almost each student got 2–3 jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of academic buildings is not bad. But you will be disappointed if you place high hopes on infrastructure. In hostels, we get almost all the facilities. The only things that concern us are power cuts and connectivity. Only BSNL works there so to use the internet, we need to depend solely on Wi-Fi.
detailed_review.Faculty: The syllabus is vast. Sometimes its difficult to complete in the given time. But by completing, we can gain an advantage in placements. Subjects are based on industrial requirements. There is a need for improvement in faculty. As for semester exams, due to descriptive questions, passing is okay but getting good marks is difficult. The passing percentage is quite good.
detailed_review.Other:
Electrical engineering is one of the toughest courses but it has very good opportunities. In government as well as the private sector. On my campus, there are around 900 students from all branches and years combined. There are two college fests, Addovedi the technical fest and Atulyam 
the cultural fest. As the campus has recently shifted, these fest don't meet most of the students expectations. The college provides information about various scholarships; all we need to do is be active. The major drawback of this college is connectivity. If you need to buy anything, most of the time you need to go to Itanagar. There are only two buses to Itanagar, and the timings are bad. There are no buses in college. So while going to classes, you will be walking down the hill. On Sunday, there is no transport. As of now, we can say that connectivity is the worst.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Infrastructure and faculty is not as par as other NIT's.

detailed_review.Placements: Generally in my course in my college only 1/3 get placed. The highest package goes around 16 LPA and the lowest package is around 6lpa. Top companies recruiting are BHEL, Deolite, etc. In my course harfly anyone gets internship in companies they generally do in IIT's.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very bad in our college. Wi-Fi is not available most of the times. There is even no library our campus. There is no proper sports field here, no coach, no training staff are present. Mess and canteen food is good but they ch high as students rely on them as hostel food is not so good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable and helpful, and wanting to help but lack of facilities provided by our coll prevent them from doing so. Yes this course curriculum relevant and does make students industry ready but as no internship are provided by college they suffer. Semester exams are generally easy people can pass if they have studied.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you work hard then there are 100% chances that you will get a good placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% students were placed in 2023 batch but if we talk about only non-local (outside this state) students then placement is around  100%. The highest package was 18lpa, average is 8.5lpa and the lowest was 6lpa. Power grind, TCS and PSU are the top recruiters. 70% students got internship from electrical engineering in various companies like power grind, and Siemens. Roles offered were like associate engineers and senior system engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are non-AC classrooms but there are fans in every classroom. Every lab has ACs. One of the finest thing about this college is its library. It is one of the biggest central library among all north eastern NITs. Hostel infrastructure is good, mess food is satisfactory and canteen food is also good but little bit expensive. Medical facilities are 24/7 available. Games like volleyball, cricket and football are organised in every two to three months.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified. They are skillful and knowledgeable in their respective course. The course is curriculum relevant and there are some extra activities like robotics, machines learning, coding competitions, etc. Students get a lot of benefits from this course and it makes students ready to take up industry challenges. Semester exams are neither easy nor tough. Pass percentage is about 85%.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in robotics and machines learning that's why I chose this course. There are two fests in our college, addovedi and cultural fest. Connectivity is somewhat complex but the college provides bus service if you want.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Arunachal Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Since the job season started in the middle of July, the number of students who have found jobs doesn't show the complete picture of how well placements are going at NIT Andhra Pradesh. Our college provides good placements. Currently, three companies have completed their placement drives, and nearly 50% of students have been placed. The highest salary package offered is 7.93 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 6 LPA and the average salary package offered is 6.9 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Genpact, Alstom, Teachnook, etc., visit our campus. Internships are not provided. They have taken FTE for now. However, there are more companies in line to hire interns in the future. Top roles offered are technical consultant and trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides all facilities. Wi-Fi is available throughout the campus. Labs, classrooms, and libraries are available. A large new library will be finished soon. The quality of the food is excellent. The canteen is good. Medical facilities are available. Sports and games are currently not very strong, but efforts are being made to improve them.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are helpful, knowledgeable, and well-qualified. They expect respect and hard work from us. They are supportive. The curriculum is similar to that of other NITs and is good. It covers important topics like DSA, ML, CAN, DBMS, and OOPs, which are essential from a company's perspective. It would be beneficial if they could incorporate some practical approaches into the curriculum to encourage software development among students at the college level. Exams become easier when you review your class notes and the previous year's questions. The pass percentage is 80%.
detailed_review.Other: In our college, we organise a technical fest like ADDOVEDI, which takes place once a year in September. We also have a cultural fest called ATULYAM, which is held once a year in May.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college location is really beautiful, but the campus is small, so I can't enjoy any campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is pretty good at NIT Andhra Pradesh. Every student who sits for placement gets placed. The minimum package is INR 4 LPA, and the maximum is INR 24 LPA. Every branch student gets placed. Some good PSUs, like CDOT, also visit, though big companies don't visit our campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is one girls' hostel, two boys' hostels, and one Ph.D. hostel. Infrastructure is average—not that good. We have buildings for every department. A few buildings are still under construction. The food provided is not that good. In short, it's a small campus, so you won't be able to enjoy any campus life. In time for girls hostels is early, though it exempts special occasions such as fests or any other events.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive. The college curriculum is the same as at other NITs. The exam pattern is one mid-semester and one end-of-semester. Besides this, there are a few assignments and quizzes before exams, too. Labs are also there for practice. Wi-Fi is available on college campuses. There is nothing like ragging in our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our campus life is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 85% of students got placed in this course. The highest salary package offered was 19 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 5.8 LPA. The average salary package offered was 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Samsung, OIL, L&T, Virtusa, Tech Mahindra, Bosch, Power Grind, Bharat Petroleum, HSBC, Deloitte, Adani, Nokia, HCL, TCS, Allstate, Jio, Tejas Network, JSW, Cognizant, Genpact, LG, OICL, KPMG, Geeks for Geeks, NTPC, QUESS, BHEL, HAL, BSNL, ESCORTS, UDEMY, etc. Many students got internships in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have adequate facilities in our department. We also have 3 different sources of internet. The food served in the hostel is good. Medical facilities are average. Sports are conducted. We do not have proper grounds for sports. Stadium is also not available for indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant to make students ready for the industry. Semester exams are tough. The pass percentage is 80%.
detailed_review.Other: There are 5 courses such as CSE, EE, ECE, civil engineering, and ME.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a decent college for those students who score average marks.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are decent. Almost 56-70% of students got placed in this course. The highest salary package offered was 19 LPA. The average salary package offered was 8.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is average but improving. LAN facility will be provided within a few months. There is a decent library in this college. Mess is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good. They are very approachable. They also ask you to meet them personally if you have any problems. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are not hard. If we study well, we can score good marks easily.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Arunachal Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70% of students got placed in this course. Almost 15 students got placed in this course out of 22 students. Few students opted for higher studies. All tech and non-tech companies visit our campus for recruitment. Top recruiting companies are Adani Group, Oil India, JSW, Tech Mahindra, Alstom, L&T, Nippon Steel, Hero, NTPC, IOCL, etc. The highest salary package offered was 24 LPA. The average salary package offered was 8.49 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 7.87 LPA. Many students got internships at companies like IOCL, NTPC, BHEL, DRDO, BSNL, TRTC, Indian Railway, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is well maintained. All facilities are available such as a CNC laboratory, SOM laboratory, simulation laboratory, fluid mechanics laboratory, hydrodynamics laboratory, centralized workshop, and many more. The food served in the mess is good. The hostel is well maintained. It also has an RO filter on each floor. High-speed BSNL Wi-Fi is available. LAN facility is also available. Sports are conducted in this college. There is a central library. Our college has one of the biggest libraries in the North East.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are highly qualified and supportive. All faculty members are doctorates. If you have any doubts, you can message them even at night and they will surely help you. The course curriculum is relevant to make students ready for the industry. Semester exams are moderately difficult. If we study well, we can easily score good marks. The pass percentage is good. Around 28% of students got backlogs in solid mechanics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Arunachal Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students got placed in our college. The highest salary package offered is 25 LPA. The average salary package offered ranges between 6 LPA - 7 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 5.7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Samsung, Alstom, Deloitte, Oracle, etc. Many students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides us with all facilities. The hostel facilities are average. Around 3 students can stay in each room. Wi-Fi is being provided in a hostel and the campus. The central library is still under construction. The infrastructure of the college is not much good. It's still under construction. The food served in the mess is good. Medical facilities are not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are cooperative and friendly. They take part with us in college events. The course curriculum is relevant. There are 3 internship programs. Semester exams are moderate. The pass percentage is 95%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Improving with limited amount of resources.

detailed_review.Placements: The main recruiting companies of our department are L&T, Kec international, etc. This college is improving day by day with limited amount of resources. According to our seniors a person who is willing to get placed will get placement from this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure related to studies is good but medical facilities and sports curriculum still need improvement. There is improvement of canteen facilites and mess food quality but it still require more requirement. The construction of central library is under going and it have one library that is functional.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers are friendly, supportive and therefore makes our college good. Here teacher are truly supportive and knowledge about there subject. The semester exam are not so difficult but marking scheme for evaluation is strict. Our civil core subject assistant professor is strict but have great knowledge about his subject.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Arunachal Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary package offered was 19 LPA. The average salary package offered was 6 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 3 LPA. Placements were good for CSE and ECE courses. The top roles offered were SDE, data analyst, developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure was not good because the college was under construction. There were 6 academic blocks. Wi-Fi was not good. The library was average. Mess was not good. There were 2 canteens along with a bakery. Playground was also under construction.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members were not good. Few of them were punctual and few teachers did not conduct classes. They try to complete the syllabus as per schedule. Semester exams were not difficult. The pass percentage was average.
detailed_review.Other: There were no clubs in this college. Two annual fests named Athulum and Adovedi were conducted in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Arunachal Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 65% of students got placed in this course. Around 70% of students got placed in PSUs. Government organisations, private companies, and petroleum companies visit our college to hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food quality is good. A canteen facility is available. Hostel facilities are better. Medical services are provided on campus. Sports and games are conducted very well. Laboratories and classrooms are decent. The food served in the mess is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students ready for the industry. Semester exams are moderate, and the pass percentage is 70%. The teaching quality is good. The level of the question paper is moderate.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is not a good college, and I would not recommend it.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good for CSE and ECE students, but not for CE students. The average salary package offered is 6 LPA. Deloitte and Alsotm are the mass recruiters in our college. Many companies offer different roles like SDE, data analyst, DM, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not working most of the time. The library doesn't have a good collection of books. The mess is not good, but we have 2 canteens and 1 bakery, which are good. Sports equipments very limited compared to the number of students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers want to teach, but most of them try to complete the syllabus without worrying about how clearly they are teaching. As it is a government college, students will be able to get funding if they are interested in making a good project.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements are improving greatly. Transport and mess food are bad. Faculty is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements have been good, Most students are getting placed, if you are from CSE or ECE branch then you will have lots of opportunities. Top companies for Mechanical were Bosch, L&T and JSW. In my year the highest package offered was 17LPA and the lowest was 5.5 LPA, average around 7.5LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi has been really bad and labs are getting improved they are bringing in new and advanced equipments, classrooms are okay, No proper medical facilities and the food available in mess is below average, Hostel quality is average. Canteen food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are some very experienced and good faculty members, Teaching quality is good. Semester exams are not that difficult pass percentage is more than 90%. Course should be updated its a bit outdated, Lab importance is very low at the moment which affects many students to improve their practical knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: In my branch (ME) projects are very good, you will get lots of experience working with project co-coordinators. Campus should improve regarding Events and fests and Transport should be greatly improved.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want placements, you can join here, but the infrastructure is not that good.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 80% of students got placed. The highest salary package offered is 27 LPA, the lowest is 6 LPA, and the average is 8 LPA. Companies that came here are WB, Kuliza, Thoughtspot, Reliance Jio, CGI, Alstom, Byju's, and many more. Most companies offered a software developer role.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available. The mess food is not that good. The canteen is fine. The hostel is good since we have recently shifted to the permanent campus, but the main problem is that you can only use a BSNL SIM. There is no playground to play outdoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. The quality of their teaching is quite good. Exams are not that tough if you prepare well. The pass percentage is 99%. Only a few students get backlogs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Few faculty members are good in civil engineering

detailed_review.Placements: 40 percent got placed in Companies like L&T, KEC international but I would say if anyone had interest in Civil engineering then choose otherwise don't choose because it's really hard to get placed in core. PSU in NIIT only prefer only local students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is decent but sometimes it's unavailable and network is not good because only BSNL network works whose network is very bad and sometimes even during placement test you have to suffer because Wi-Fi is unavailable but day by day it is improving.
detailed_review.Faculty: Few faculty members are good in civil engineering like for design we have amazing faculty but for other subjects like Structural engineering, we don't have any faculty for this. We have to depend on Online platforms Like Nptel as few Ph.D. faculty used to come.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my family background.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college provides good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 50% of our college students get placed. The lowest salary package offered is 4.75 LPA and the highest salary package offered is 20 LPA. PSU recruited 2 of our seniors from the mechanical branch with a salary package of 20 LPA. All professors are very polite and help many students to get internships. The top role offered in civil engineering is site engineer by L&T.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: More lab equipment is not available for core branches. Wi-Fi is not good. The food quality served in the mess is not good. Classrooms are good. The library is not much big but after a few months, a new central library will be opened. The canteen is good. Medical facilities are not good. The playground is not available in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Every professor is very helpful, qualified, and well-knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant to the industry and helps students with real-time challenges. Semester exams are not difficult. The pass percentage is based on relative marking.
detailed_review.Other: Extracurricular activities are not organised properly.

admission.title: NIT Arunachal Pradesh Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: Admission 2025 at NIT Arunachal Pradesh is conducted on the basis of entrance. Courses at the Institute are offers at the UG, PG, and Doctoral levels and the final admission is offered based on the national-level entrance exam scores and counselling qualification. The modes of National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh course admissions are online and offline. Candidates willing to get admission must first apply online for the relevant entrance exam. Students are accepted based on JEE Main scores and JoSAA counselling for admission to BTech. Further, MSc and MTech admission is conducted via CCMN and CCMT counselling, respectively. Interested students can read the following article to know detailed information about the NIT Arunachal Pradesh admission procedure .

faqs.question: How do I get a seat at NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: NIT Arunachal Pradesh offers a large diversity of courses to students in various fields. NIT Arunachal Pradesh admissions are held on the basis of entrance tests. Students seeking course admissions must clear their previous qualifying examination and appear for any of the prescribed entrance exams such as JEE Main, DASA UG, GATE, among others. Students can visit the official website to learn more regarding the course-wise eligibility and specialisation details.

faqs.question: How can I take admission at NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Check below the NIT Arunachal application process for BTech: 1: Students applying through JEE Main must first register for the entrance exam. 2: Then wait for the admit card and appear for the entrance exam. 3: Register for the JoSAA counselling. 4: Fill in the required preference. 5: Report at the selected college and pay the admission fee.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: NIT Arunachal Pradesh MSc cutoff 2025 is based on candidates' scores in the IIT JAM exams, followed by CCMN counselling. The institute released the cutoff for MSc in Data Science. For the General AI category candidates, the cutoff was closed at 1972 . For the OBC AI category candidates, the cutoff rank was closed at 3213 . For the SC and ST AI category candidates, the cutoff was closed at 2871 and 7025 , respectively. To check all the details for the cutoff at NIT Andhra Pradesh, click here .

faqs.question: Why BTech is the popular course at NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: NIT Arunachal Pradesh BTech students can become Ceramic Engineers, Mining Engineers, Robotics Engineers, or can take up any job role matching their qualifications. BTech students with some level of training can also become AI Programmers. To become an AI Programmer, students must know Java , Python, C+, and others which students can learn at NIT Arunachal. Check below for more facts around the NIT Arunachal Pradesh BTech course from the perspective of campus students:

faqs.question: How is NIT Arunachal Pradesh? What package can B.Tech students expect after completing the degree?
faqs.answer: According to the students reviews on Shiksha, NIT Arunachal Pradesh is quite good, however not on par with top NITs. As the institute is fairly new, it is understandable that it will take some time before it builds a similar reputation as other top NITs. It has a decent infrastructure and the library has a wide range of books spanning over various topics. The faculty are said to be knowledgeable, helpful and amazing at their work. Students pursuing the BTech course at the institute can expect an average package of INR 8.75 LPA .

faqs.question: How to prepare to get admission at NIT Arunachal Pradesh BTech course?
faqs.answer: JEE Main session - II exam has gone LIVE. A correct approach accompanied by a well-built preparation strategy is everything a student needs to ace JEE Main 2023. A last-minute preparation tips for the exam is mentioned below:

faqs.question: How can I apply for M.Tech at NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: To have M.Tech admission to the courses offered at NIT Arunachal Pradesh, candidates need to visit the official website of respective conducting bodies of national-level entrance exams and fill the application form in online mode.

faqs.question: Should I take admission to M.Tech at NIT Arunachal Pradesh or make a drop?
faqs.answer: NIT Arunachal Pradesh is an integral part of the NITs. Although the institute is not on the same level as the top NITs, it still has amazing faculty and curriculum. Students can opt for the M.Tech programme offered at the institute if they want the NIT tag and experience. However, there certainly are other institutes, albiet not NITs which have a better environment and curriculum. You can consider the institute if you don't get in any other NITs. But those who wish to pursue the programme can look forward to decent packages, amazing faculty and an overall satisfying experience.

faqs.question: What M.Tech specialisations does NIT Arunachal Pradesh offer?
faqs.answer: At NIT Arunachal Pradesh, students are offered the M.Tech programme across multiple specialisations. The eligibility and selection criteria is same across all of the specialisations. faqs.question: How can I take admission at NIT Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Check below the NIT Arunachal application process for BTech: 1: Students applying through JEE Main must first register for the entrance exam. 2: Then wait for the admit card and appear for the entrance exam. 3: Register for the JoSAA counselling. 4: Fill in the required preference. 5: Report at the selected college and pay the admission fee. faqs.question: What is the cutoff for NIT Arunachal Pradesh?

faqs.question: How is NIT Arunachal Pradesh? What package can B.Tech students expect after completing the degree?
faqs.answer: According to the students reviews on Shiksha, NIT Arunachal Pradesh is quite good, however not on par with top NITs. As the institute is fairly new, it is understandable that it will take some time before it builds a similar reputation as other top NITs. It has a decent infrastructure and the library has a wide range of books spanning over various topics. The faculty are said to be knowledgeable, helpful and amazing at their work. Students pursuing the BTech course at the institute can expect an average package of INR 8.75 LPA . Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Should I take admission to M.Tech at NIT Arunachal Pradesh or make a drop?
faqs.answer: NIT Arunachal Pradesh is an integral part of the NITs. Although the institute is not on the same level as the top NITs, it still has amazing faculty and curriculum. Students can opt for the M.Tech programme offered at the institute if they want the NIT tag and experience. However, there certainly are other institutes, albiet not NITs which have a better environment and curriculum. You can consider the institute if you don't get in any other NITs. data.title: NIT Arunachal Pradesh Placement Report 2025
summary: The NIT Arunachal Pradesh placements are ongoing for seson 2025. So far, the highest and average package stood at INR 59 LPA and INR 7.2 LPA , respectively. A total of 273 offers were made and 167 students were placed in 2025.

Earlier, as per the latest report, the participating recruiters placed 73% of the batch 2024 of BTech , MTech , and MSc . The highest package offered during the NIT Arunachal Pradesh placements was between INR 24 LPA – INR 32 LPA . The average package stood between INR 9.16 LPA – INR 13.5 LPA . Moreover, the median and lowest packages offered were INR 11.3 LPA and INR 6.5 LPA , respectively. A total of 84 students got placed out of the total 144 students . The major recruiters that participated during the NIT Arunachal Pradesh placements include Microsoft, Morgan Stanley, Amazon, Bosch, ISRO, HP, Indian Oil, etc.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: NIT Arunachal Pradesh offers several facilities and various amenities to students such as a library, hostels, classrooms, a cafeteria, a computer centre, and others. The National Institute of Technology Arunachal Pradesh is equipped with a LAN facility, the internet, and others.

(As per Shiksha verified Review, " There are non-AC classrooms but there are fans in every classroom. Every lab has ACs. One of the finest things about this college is its library. It has one of the biggest central libraries among all northeastern NITs. The hostel infrastructure is good, the mess food is satisfactory and canteen food is also good but a little bit expensive. Medical facilities are 24/7 available. Games like volleyball, cricket, and football are organised every two to three months. ")

NIT Goa Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT GOA's genuine review.

detailed_review.Placements:
Placement scenes in NIT Goa are average. The highest package in NIT Goa is 44 LPA, while the average package is around 8 LPA, and the lowest package is 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are ORACLE, TCS, and NSE.
100% of students who appear for placements get placed, while some opt for off-campus placement too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
As our college is newly built in January 2024, so infrastructure is top-notch. We have more than enough Wi-Fi routers right in front of our room and in every building. We have all types of labs for all branches of students, and we have a proper library having all books that are required.
The best part is single rooms in hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Yes, all of the teachers are too polite and helpful and cooperative in studies and extracurricular activities too.
The semester exams are not that hard. If we study what all the teachers teach, then we can easily score, and they also ask us to refer to some books for our betterment.
The pass percentage is 50% relatively, or 5 CGPA in every subject and lab.
detailed_review.Other:
I choose ECE electronics and communication as it's an exploring field, a hill branch, as a senior told me before coming here, and having mostly the highest package on the campus
There are a lot of events and fests. We have also collaborated with TEDx and SPIE, and there are a lot of scholarships.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: National Institute of Technology, Goa is one of the emerging NIT.

detailed_review.Placements: Normally 80 to 90 percent of circuital branch students are placed. The lowest package is around 6 LPA, with the average being 11 LPA. The highest package was 23 LPA this year and 44 LPA the previous year. Companies like Samsung, Infosys, Accenture, and various PSUs come. The roles offered for my course are mostly software developers, as many students prepare for that. Other than that, roles like VLSI engineers are also offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: After switching to the new permanent campus, the infrastructure is top-notch. We have a huge library, department blocks, teaching block, ground, etc. The mess is within hostels. The only drawback is the boys hostel is around a km away from the teaching block, although it's within campus. Therefore, having a bicycle is recommended.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are all from different IITs and abroad universities, but the course till my year was outdated; with the implementation of the New Education Policy, it changed, and now the course and curriculum are comparatively better. The exams are really difficult, but relatively grading helps score a good CGPA. The continuous evaluation means you'll be having some sort of minor or assignment always.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because it is considered one of the evergreen courses. The choice was correct, as you get the opportunity to sit in almost the same companies as CSE plus companies specific to ECE. So go for it, but keep in mind that the academics for ECE and software skills for CSE have to be balanced, which makes you exhausted.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: NITG is definitely one of the developing NITs, as it now has its own new campus.

detailed_review.Placements: NIT Goa has good placements, and in the branch Civil, it also has good placements. Students got average packages of 13 LPA. Government companies & MNCs do come here for placement. It has good placement of cells, which is very good. All you need is skills. If you have good skills, you will get placed .
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Infrastructure is so good as we shifted to our new campus. So everything on the new campus is new & good. 
Canteen, medical facility, etc.—everything is good. Faculty members will help you in everything. Also, you will get single rooms from the first year in this NIT, which is a very good thing.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are supportive & good. All are polite & of a helpful nature. Every course has highly qualified teachers. Exams are definitely tough, as it is engineering but a hardworking person can definitely do it. But definitely figure out which branch you like most .
detailed_review.Other: Everything here is so good. We have our techno-cultural festival, Saavyas, of NITG, and then we also have the Prasang event of the Inter Branch. If you are really interested in construction planning & all, you can choose civil engineering, but if you don't have any interest, then don't choose it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good experience, good faculty for core branches and good placement records.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of students were placed in good companies like Amazon, NSE, Oracle, Samsung, Intel, etc. with an average package of 15–16 LPA. The highest package offered was 44 LPA by Amazon. Meanwhile, the lowest package offered to 6 LPAs by L&T was the management post. Currently, the institute has tie-ups with NIO and Persistent Technologies, which offer internship programs to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel's condition is decent. Wi-Fi, due to being BSNL, fluctuates a lot but is decent whenever required. But if the network goes down, it takes a lot of time to bring it up. This makes it difficult for the students to sometimes complete their assignments.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are very helpful, at least in the core branches. There is not much knowledge about non-core branches. The curriculum is well defined and is suited for competitive exams. Pass percentage every year is 90%+. So overall, all semesters are difficult; even just 3rd year maybe a bit challenging due to tight schedule of curriculum
.
detailed_review.Other: I had gotten a respectable 98.75 percentile in JEE during the COVID-19 pandemic. Also, I am a native of Goa. So, due to pandemic factors, I decided to take admission at NIT Goa. I was getting CSE in NIT Goa so I decided it was better to take the best possible branch if I was going to stay in Goa itself. I would like a dedicated high-end lab in our college, at least for the core branches, where they could explore high-end technologies. The environment is very good. The climate is very good. The campus is very close to a major city. The institute provides internships at the National Institute of Oceanography as summer interns to academically excellent students. The curriculum is a bit strict so it's sometimes difficult to do part-time freelancing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Goa, the new campus phase begins.

detailed_review.Placements: As far as the CSE branch is concerned, the placements for them have been average or below average. Compared to last year, when all the CSE students were placed by now, and some had multiple offers this year, the count is low. For the ECE branch, the situation seems better placement wise but the EEE branch has been hit really hard. Hardly any students have been placed, and a lot of oversight takes place as companies naturally tend to ignore students from the EEE branch and focus on the CSE branch even when there are students with a lot of experience in web development and machine learning.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As the current campus is our transmit campus, we have limited infrastructure and hostel facilities. I would have been happy to write this review after about one month, as we are shifting to our permanent campus on January 7, 2024. The infrastructure there and the hostel facilities are more than enough to raise our ranking.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty, as in every college, is strict and firm as far as the syllabus is concerned. Give them a chance and they will show you their soft sides, which you would not have expected. When it comes to exams, each faculty member has their own method; some have a strict teaching style and an innovative questioning style, while others follow the standard NPETL style of teaching but provide tough questions with an easy correction level. Attendance is very strictly maintained and I might say that is the only thing making us pay attention these days in class.
detailed_review.Other: Crowding and campus life are two separate things. The crowd, as in the students, hails from various parts of India and we managed to have a last in our transmit campus. Being a small campus, fests and events were always limited in number but after COVID, we never made a comeback in the events department. Though we have many lines for our new campus, I hope to see y'all there. When it comes to the branch I have opted for and the value for money, I was more interested in IT subjects. Believe me when I say that and not just because everyone these days likes IT branches. But even the EEE branch has been quite interesting to me. Students who have an actual liking for the subject might definitely like the branch and the course overall.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied with the infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: It's not so much a college problem as the hiring freeze that's going on nowadays. The placement rate in computer science and engineering is good regardless. Most of the students get placed. Many students have completed their internships at big companies like Reliance and universities like IIT Madras.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The temporary campus was not that good but now we are shifting to the new campus. By the looks of it, it is going to be much better. The meal is not that good but the food doesn't taste so bad.
Things are going to improve as we shift to the new campus starting this semester.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are quite knowledgeable and the teaching quality is good. However, the course curriculum tends to get a little old. The semester exams are not that difficult and the pass percentage is very high. Not many people get a failing grade. Courses are easy to pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Poor temporary campus, but good placements in past 3 years and the opening of new campus .

detailed_review.Placements:
100% placement of eligible students (CGPA 7.5+) the highest package offered in ECE branch was 22lpa and average package was 12.84 Lacs with minimum package of 6.5 LPA .
There are total 38 students in my branch and around 26 got to sit for placements 2023 and all 26 of them got placed .
Samsung, Intel and Deloitte are some MNC and more than 160 companies visited campus this year for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The permanent campus has all the facilities in terms of academics and sports will be opened soon, hostel is okay as of now.
The Wi-Fi facility is okay not very fast not very slow. 
The hostel rooms are very compact with 4 people in one room. 
The mess is very nice the only good thing in the campus of now 
2 volleyball courts one football ground, medical room and majority popular sports like cricket football kabaddi volleyball and badminton are available .
A badminton court is also there in the main building campus .
detailed_review.Faculty:
Majority of the faculty is good and are PhDs from iisc Bangalore, IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay. The semester exams are not very easy to pass but the passing percentage is above 90.
The students are getting industry ready in terms of language and behaviour but the technical skills are acquired by the student on his own mostly.
Very few people get internships by college e.g. 3-4 people out of 38 in the branch.
detailed_review.Other: Campus crowd is less as of now, saavyaas a fest conducted by students of NIT Goa every year in the month of February which is our the biggest techno cultural fest .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great Place to Study and Enjoy.

detailed_review.Placements: I am part of the 2019–2023 batch of the Electrical and Electronics Engineering B.Tech. course. Most of the students who sat for placement were placed. Top recruiting companies include Samsung, Oracle, Nokia, BillDesk, JSW, Adani, Jio, and BPCL. Most of the students were placed in IT-related roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Goa is currently operating from a temporary campus in Farmagudi as of 2023, but it is shifting to its permanent campus in 2024. So facilities were limited there. Limited means all these above-mentioned things are there, but on a limited scale. The hostels are good and provide cheap and healthy food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, the teachers there are very helpful and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is top-notch. Course relevancy is an issue at all government colleges. But as far as I have heard, it is going to be improved. Semester exams are not that tough if you study. There is no fixed percentage of passing; it is based on the marks obtained by everyone.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college provides good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of students got placed in our college. The rest students are going for higher studies. The highest salary package offered is 21 LPA. The average salary package offered is 10 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Samsung, Nokia, Tutlemint, BPCL, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is good. Our college provides us with all facilities. Labs are well-equipped with air-conditioners. The library has many books. It has a good sitting arrangement. Our college is Wi-Fi enabled. The girls' hostel is good. They provide single rooms for girls. The boys' hostel is average. Around 3 boys can stay in each room.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are helpful, friendly, and well-qualified. The course curriculum is good. After 2nd year, they let you choose your electives through which you can pursue knowledge of your interest. Semester exams are the perfect combination of questions to test knowledge. It makes students ready for real-life problems.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I got EEE through JoSAA counseling. I liked this course and learned about electrical and its real-life applications and problems. Students together celebrate every festival. Our college surroundings are good. Our college crowd is helpful and friendly. Our college has good surroundings.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has excellent placements and encouraging teachers.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, almost 84.6% of students are placed. The highest salary package offered is 20 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 5.2 LPA and the average salary package offered is 9.7 LPA. The top recruiting companies like Samsung, Capgemini, Jio, etc., visit our campus. Top roles offered are SDE, research engineer, deputy manager, and analyst. Almost all students get internships at Siemens and the National Institute of Oceanography.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college facilities and infrastructure are limited. Our classrooms are air-conditioned and equipped with projectors. Wi-Fi is available. The library is equipped with reference books related to undergraduate courses, newspapers, inspiring magazines, and books for other entrance exam preparations. Laboratories are good. Hostel rooms are limited. The quality of food available in the mess and canteen is average. Medical facilities are available. There is a huge playground for sports and other cultural events. Our college has a badminton and volleyball court.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are well-qualified and helpful. They are Ph.D. holders. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum primarily helps in providing theoretical knowledge, but the course laboratories impart practical knowledge, which is required for the industry. Semester exams are average. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it provides solutions to many real-life problems. The course gives you an analysis of how modern equipment and machines have evolved and how to improve their efficiency. Our college organises various cultural activities, events, and festivals. Our college organizes the biggest event every year, like Saavyas.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Goa - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement cell is working hard for better recruitment. More than 125 companies visit our campus to hire students. Almost 100% of students got placed in our course. The average salary package offered was 10 LPA. The highest salary package offered was 44 LPA. Placement coordinators help us during placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college is working on the temporary campus located at Phona But all facilities are available. Laboratory is well-equipped. There are 5 departments like computer science, electrical, electronics, mechanical, and civil. There are 3 departments for masters like CSE, PEPS, and VLSI.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is very good. We have a credit-based system for exams. Mid-semester and end-semester exams are conducted very well. Around 75% of attendance is required in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I'm satisfied with placements but infrastructure is not good.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of mechanical students get placed in our college. The highest salary package offered in 2021 was 9 LPA and the average salary package was 7 LPA. The roles offered are SDE, Data analyst, etc. Companies like Ashok Leyland and BPCL offer placements in our college with a salary package of 20 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our campus is very small as it is on a temporary campus. Classrooms have air-conditioners. Wi-Fi is available on campus. Hostel is not good and the food quality is very poor. New campus will have all the facilities. Students are not sent to Inter NIT sports because it is held far from our campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers in our college are helpful and well-qualified. Most of them have done Ph.D.  from IITs. The course curriculum of mechanical engineering includes DSA in 4th year. Exams are very difficult but are easy to pass because of relative marking. It is difficult to score a good CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I like mechanical engineering. Students of our course get both government and IT jobs. Events and fests are organised in our college but not like IITs or private colleges. Campus crowd is less because there are 180 students in B.Tech courses of all departments together. Faculty and student ratio is not good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything seemed good after 2 years of online classes.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year the packages offered to students were really good and overall the average package also increased. In CSE, ECE, and EEE 100% of students were placed, while it was not the case with Mechanical and Civil. Because the 2022 batch was the first batch of both branches in NIT Goa.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms and labs are okay. Single rooms are allotted to girls not the case in the boys' hostel. There is no Wi-Fi in the girls' hostel, also you cannot expect good food from the mess. Other facilities like medical facilities, sports and games are at an average level.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors here are really helpful if you ask them for help. They are well qualified in their respective fields and their teaching quality is also good. The course curriculum is relevant, however, for us, it was online for 2 years so it didn't make us industry ready in any form. Talking about semester exams they are not too difficult to pass. One can easily manage to pass if he/she focuses during the class.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It provides good placements and campus life is great.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good. Around 100% of EEE students are placed. The IT placements in the previous season are record breaking. Students can visit the official site of NIT Goa to take a look at the placements records. This year NIT Goa's first CVE and MCE placements are also there, and the students get placed in both IT and core.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The laboratories are well-equipped with the instruments students need. The only drawback is the quantity of them. Students have very good air-conditioned classrooms and a hostel with shared rooms of 3 students. This college and hostel are well-equipped with a Wi-Fi facility and guards.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and have a lot of knowledge. But some teachers are not good at teaching. They know but fail to deliver the information sometimes. The semester exams are difficult if students do not study regularly and study just before the exams. There are some subjects like power electronics, and LIC which cannot be covered a day before the exam. Although it is easy to pass but difficult to score.
detailed_review.Other: The campus life is excellent. Though the campus is small, it is worth it to live here. Faculty members are supportive and students have a lot of events that held in this college regularly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the best place for a nature lover and currently small campus but the big one will come soon.

detailed_review.Placements: In CSE, ECE, and EEE branches, almost everyone was placed. Since it was the first time for the mechanical and civil branches in placements, their record was not good. The highest salary package was 44 LPA bagged by Rohit Kartik in Amazon. The lowest salary package offered is around 3 LPA - 4 LPA. The top recruiting company is Samsung which did mass hiring with more than 15 students getting salary packages of 16 LPA - 20 LPA. Only 2 students got internships at Samsung. Few others have applied for off-campus internships. The top roles are T&P head, T&P coordinator, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college, all facilities needed for the CSE branch are available. Wi-Fi is enabled in both the college and hostel. The classrooms have air-conditioners. Library is quite good. The hostel has 3 bedrooms, we have indoor games facilities like chess, TT, and carrom. There is a big ground near hostel called infinity ground. Mess food is average and the canteen food is good. Medical facilities are average. There are events organised on regular basis like Zumba, marathon, martial arts, Yoga, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: The best part of college is the teaching part. The teachers are well qualified and the classroom interaction is great. Since there are just 30-35 members in a class, the teacher can follow individual interactions and track the progress of each student. They are very friendly. The course curriculum is followed very strictly. But, to be industry-ready, extra skills like DSA has to be done by the student on their own. Exams are easy for students who follow the class regularly but most of us do last night's preparation.
detailed_review.Other: Since there are fewer students, we all know each other. Senior junior interaction is great. I chose this course since everything revolves around technology today. This industry is only growing. The knowledge of this field can open up many opportunities in the future. There is an annual event called Savyaas and inter-branch event Natarang conducted on campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has good placements but not that good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: There is 100% placement in the mechanical department. The highest salary package is 15 LPA, the lowest is 6 LPA, and the average is 8 LPA. The top recruiters are L & T, Bridgestone, and Capgemini. About 90% of students got internships at Renault and Nissan. The top roles offered in our course are data analysts, software engineers, and design engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Currently, NIT Goa doesn't have its own permanent campus. The temporary campus has an academic block where classrooms are equipped with air conditioners and projectors. Wi-Fi is available on campus. There are multiple labs and a library. Food quality is fine. There's a sports room on the campus. Medical facilities are available with an ambulance.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are all well qualified. Most of them have Ph.D.s in their respective subjects. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready. Exams are a bit tough, but the grading is based on a percentile system. The topper gets 100% and the others are graded on that basis.
detailed_review.Other: I love mechanical things, and that's the reason I chose this branch. There are a lot of fests and events at the college. The campus has good connectivity with the airport and railway station, nearly 40 minutes away. The campus crowd is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Goa - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of students are placed. The highest salary package offered is 24 LPA, and the lowest salary pacakge offered is 7 LPA. The average salary pacakge offered is 15 LPA. Samsung and Shadings are the top recruiting companies. Students get internships in many companies, and the highest salary package offered is 24 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college has huge and lush green. Students will be shifting to our permanent campus shortly. The hostels are good and the library has almost all the books needed by the students. The food served in the mess is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and elaborative. The course curriculum is industry-ready. The passing percentage is 90%. The faculty member is top class and very helpful. The campus is small but self-sufficient with a hostel, library, and mess all nearby. There is institutional transport for traveling also.
detailed_review.Other: The NIT tag is a brand in itself. Students are currently on GEC campus, will be shifting in next academic year to our main campus. Many events are there, and the annual event Savyas is very famous in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It provides almost 100% placements in the CSE course with the highest salary package of 20 LPA.

detailed_review.Placements: For the academic year 2020-21, about 22 students from the CSE department were eligible for placement out of 28, and others do higher education. All 22 eligible students got placed. The highest salary package offered in our course is 20 LPA. The average salary package offered in all branches is 7.61 LPA, which is very good in 2019 -20. From the previous 2 years, the CSE department had 100% placements. The lowest package salary package offered in all branches is 3.5 LPA. The average salary package offered in our course is 12 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered in our course is 5 LPA. Students got a salary package of 20 LPA this year from Goldman Sachs. Some companies like Samsung, Siemens, JSW, Reliance, Nokia, and Infosys visit our college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our own campus will be ready until June of 2022. Faculty members are trying to make the campus good. The government has allocated 300 acres of land for the new campus. We are currently on the temporary campus. There is Wi-Fi even on the temporary campus. The quality of food served is average. We have fields to play most of the sports. But there is no swimming pool or gym on the temporary campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are very helpful and supportive. If we can ask them a doubt many times, still we will not get angry. Most of the teachers used to support us in this pandemic by understanding network problems. They cover the full portion. Exams are a little hard as the end semester is of 100 marks and the mid exams is of 50 marks. Teachers motivate us to try new projects so that we can get ready for industries. Mostly, all students pass if they can study like 1 hour daily apart from listening class.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because I wanted to join the CSE course. The college is in Goa, so it is a lot of fun. A branch is of 40 students only, so teachers pay more attention. We have a robotic club, and you can get a scholarship also. If your income is above 1 lac and lower than 5 lacs, then you just have to pay Rs. 22,000 for 1 semester. If your family income is less than 1 lacs, then you are fee will be less than Rs. 5,000 per semester. Our college organises a lot of fests. I wish it was offline, and the new campus was built fastly. If you want to know more about the robotic club or anything, then go to the NIT Goa website.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Totally satisfied with the faculty of NIT, Goa and the placements of 2018 batch.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of the students were placed, and the rest opted for higher studies. The highest package offered was 11.5 LPA, the average package offered was 7 LPA, and the lowest package offered was 4.5 LPA. Microsoft and Barclays were the top recruiting companies of computer science and engineering branch. We got internships on our own, but 1-2 companies came for internships. Smartprix and L&T came in the 3rd year for internships. Technical manager, software developer, software testing manager and R&D in Microsoft were the top roles offered for computer science branch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
NIT, Goa has enough classrooms for its students. Every classroom has A/Cs according to the size of the classroom. Every branch in B.Tech and M.Tech has labs. The library has all the books a student can require. The number of books never fall short. Wi-Fi is available on the whole campus. Food quality is not up to the mark. 
Non-veg food is provided for 2 days in a week. 2 people have to stay in 1 small room, and 4-6 people in a hall. Medical facilities are quite good. A doctor and a nurse are available in the college hours. NIT, Goa, participates in all the sports in All India Inter-NIT Competitions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors were the best anyone could ask for. All are PhD holders from IITs and NITs and are highly qualified and knowledgeable. Maximum are associate professors. Their teaching quality is great. Some go beyond their limits to teach us. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes the students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose computer science because before taking admission, I looked at the curriculum, and it was interesting and future based. The best thing was cloud computing using Hadoop. I honestly want no improvement as the course is already providing its best for the students. NIT, Goa organises 2 annual fests known as Technical fest and Savyas fest. Campus crowd is not much high, and it is the best thing as every student and teacher knows each other, and it helps in better communication. SC and ST students get yearly scholarships of about 1.5 Lacs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The lecturers in our college are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 80 percent of students were placed in our college. The highest package was 18 Lakh per annum and the lowest package was 5 Lakh per annum. Wipro, Capgemini are the top recruiting companies. Nearly 30 percent of students got an internship from our course in Wipro, Capgemini, SAP.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities provided by our college are not bad. They provide Wi-Fi with slow speed. Labs are congested with limited experimental modules. Classrooms are fine. Library is also congested. The food in hostel is not tasty and low quality. Our college provides medical facilities. For the next academic year, our permanent campus will be ready.
detailed_review.Faculty: The lecturers in our college were helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is above average. The course curriculum is very much relevant. I think this course curriculum does not make the students industry-ready. Only the students who have in-depth knowledge of the subjects become industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in being an electrical engineer. From childhood, I used to play with electric toys. The best thing about this course is the experiments.

college_info.college_name: NIT Goa Admission 2025: Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility & Application

admission.title: NIT Goa Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: NIT Goa admission 2025 is strictly entrance-based. The college offers various programmes that include BTech, MTech, and PhD. The selection criteria is engtrance based with the college accepting scores of national-level entrance exams namely JEE Main, JEE Advanced, GATE, etc. Final allocation of seats to the BTech Programme is done through Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) counselling.

faqs.question: How to get admission to the NIT Goa BTech course?
faqs.answer: NIT Goa offers a four-year full-time BTech course at the undergraduate level. NIT Goa BTech admission is completely entrance-based and depends on candidates' performance in the JEE Main entrance exam, followed by the Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) counselling. The JoSAA counselling begins in September. There will be 6 rounds of seat allotment.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria to get admission to B.Tech at NIT Goa?
faqs.answer: NIT Goa follows the eligibility for admission follows the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Education (MoE), Government of India. For BTech courses, at the time of admission, the candidates should have passed/ appeared and awaiting results of the final examination of the Class 12 or its equivalent with Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry as main subjects of study. Additionally, the candidates must have secured at least an aggregate of 75%. The selection process for BTech at NIT Goa completely depends on the JEE Mains scores achieved by the candidates'.

faqs.question: What will happen if someone misses the internal exam at NIT Goa?
faqs.answer: Nothing happens, if you have some medical reasons then you can submit the Medical report. But then you have to score well in the semester examination so that you will get good marks and won't fail. If someone fails in end semester exams then they will have to reappear, next year. So try to give internal exams, and do not miss them as it helps to score and have a good aggregate of marks which will ultimately increase your CGPA. These internal exams, therefore, play an important role in securing admission.

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility requirement for NIT Goa BTech admission?
faqs.answer: For the National Institute of Technology Goa BTech admission, candidates are required to pass Class 12 with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects and Chemistry/Biology/Biotechnology as an optional subject with a minimum aggregate of 75%. Apart from the minimum eligibility criteria, NIT Goa also considers the JEE Main score to admit students to its BTech course.

faqs.question: What are the specializations offered under the NIT Goa BTech course?
faqs.answer: The National Institute of Technology Goa offers BTech covering five specialisations. Details regarding the same are given below: NIT Goa BTech Specialisations Computer Science Electrical & Electronics Civil Electronics & Communication Mechanical -

faqs.question: How much is the NIT Goa BTech fee?
faqs.answer: The National Institute of Technology Goa BTech fee is INR 5 lakh. The fee mentioned here is the total tuition fee taken from an unofficial source. Apart from the tuition fee, a one-time payment of INR 9,000 will also be charged. The one-time fee includes the security deposit (refundable), institute development dees, alumni fees and convocation fees. For more detailed NIT Goa BTech fee structure, click here.

admission_eligibility.title: NIT Goa Eligibility & Selection 2025
admission_eligibility.intro_text: NIT Goa offers a BTech in five specialisations, an MTech in three specialisations and a PhD in five areas of research. Candidates who plan to get admission in any of these courses must appear for the respective entrance exams and qualify for their cutoff. Given below are the courses offered at NIT Goa along with their selection, eligibility criteria and total fees:

faqs.question: What will happen if someone misses the internal exam at NIT Goa?
faqs.answer: Nothing happens, if you have some medical reasons then you can submit the Medical report. But then you have to score well in the semester examination so that you will get good marks and won't fail. If someone fails in end semester exams then they will have to reappear, next year. So try to give internal exams, and do not miss them as it helps to score and have a good aggregate of marks which will ultimately increase your CGPA. These internal exams, therefore, play an important role in securing admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility requirement for NIT Goa BTech admission?
faqs.answer: For the National Institute of Technology Goa BTech admission, candidates are required to pass Class 12 with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects and Chemistry/Biology/Biotechnology as an optional subject with a minimum aggregate of 75%. Apart from the minimum eligibility criteria, NIT Goa also considers the JEE Main score to admit students to its BTech course. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

sections.heading: Introduction
text: National Institute of Technology Goa has a state-of-the-art infrastructure. NIT Goa campus has a library, hostel, sports complex, labs and various other facilities to students.
Watch the video below:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The Library of the Institute has a collection of more than 6500 books. The Library subscribes the databases of e-journals which are available at the campus on the intranet. The Library gives access to Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ), an online directory that indexes and provides access to high quality, open access, peer-reviewed journals. IEEE Explore Digital Library provides web access to more than 3-million full-text e-documents from some of the world's most highly cited publications in electrical engineering, computer science, and electronics.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The Institute is providing hostel facilities to outstation students with shared accommodation in the campus and maybe in a rented building which is very near to the campus. So far the existing hostels are provided with the basic amenities like mess and Wi-Fi internet connectivity. NIT Goa is having highly qualified faculty from IITs, NITs and reputed universities.

highlights.summary:
NIT Mizoram was established in 2010 and recognised as an Institute of National Importance by the Ministry of Education, Government of India. The institute offers UG, PG, and PhD courses through nine departments such as Chemistry, Civil Engineering, Physics, Humanities & Social Science, Computer Science & Engineering, and others. The flagship course offered at NIT Mizoram is BTech. NIT Mizoram has been ranked in the 100-150 band, under the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF 2025.
The National Institute of Technology Mizoram offers scholarships to meritorious students under various schemes. NIT Mizoram admission is entrance-based and accepts national entrance exams such as JEE Main, GATE, and others. During NIT Mizoram placements 2024, the highest package is INR 14.50 LPA. The institute has well-equipped infrastructure which includes classrooms, a library, a sports complex, healthcare, a hostel, and others. Candidates can check the highlights of NIT Mizoram in the following table:
