NIT Mizoram Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: How life goes in NIT Mizoram.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, more than 90 percent of students were placed. Right now, the highest package is 21 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA, and the average package is 9 LPA. Our top recruiting companies are Juspay, Vedanta, Adani Wilmar, etc. Many of our students get internships in companies and colleges like BIS, NTPC, NITs, and IITs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: To be honest, our college doesn't have a campus, but we have proper labs, classrooms, Wi-Fi, and a library. Hostel facilities are good, with good maintenance. Geysers, fans, and beds are provided by the college. The food quality is good, but the taste is average. There is a medical help center that every student can access. Our college also encourages students to participate in sports events like Inter NITs and conducts a sports fest every year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified and teach very good. They are knowledgeable and always ready to clarify our doubts. The course curriculum is relevant to our department, blending Mathematics, Physics, and Material Science very well. Exams in our department are not so difficult, and almost every student is able to pass, except for very few students. Around 90 percent of students pass exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: It has a good academic environment and a growing infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently pursuing B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing. Students get placed in my course. The highest package is 46 LPA, and the lowest package is 9.7 LPA. The average package is 15.3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are separate hostels for both boys and girls with good security and 24x7 Wi-Fi. It has clean and spacious rooms either single or shared with necessary furniture. The water environment is peaceful, making it ideal for students. The mess is also good. It has high-speed Wi-Fi connectivity across the campus.
detailed_review.Other: The campus has a diverse student community from different states of India. It has supportive faculty members and seniors who help juniors in academics and projects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: Overall, National Institute of Technology is a good college for B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: At NIT Mizoram, around 90 to 95% of students got placements according to previous records. Life at NIT Mizoram is challenging and rewarding. Students are expected to work hard and maintain a good academic record. However, there are also many opportunities for students to get involved in extracurricular activities and have fun.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Extracurricular activities at NIT Mizoram have a vibrant student life. There are many clubs and organizations that students can join. These clubs organize a variety of events, including cultural events, technical events, and sports events. Students can also participate in various competitions and workshops.
detailed_review.Faculty: The cost of living in Aizawl is relatively low. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding academic experience, NIT Mizoram is a great option. You will have the opportunity to learn from the best faculty, get involved in extracurricular activities, and live in a beautiful city.
detailed_review.Other: NIT Mizoram offers a variety of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in engineering, science, and humanities. The institute has a strong faculty and a well-equipped infrastructure. Students have access to a variety of resources, including a library, computer labs, and research facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, it's a good college to consider if you are not getting other good colleges. Just go for it.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in civil engineering are quite average. One can crack the placement if one maintains the college CGPA thereby increasing his chances of placement by almost 80 to 100%. About 50-60% of total students got placed in our college in this particular branch. Internship opportunities are good. I would say, almost everyone got it. One of our seniors in the civil branch grabbed a PPO offer of nearly 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Vedanta, Ashok Leyland, Mahindra, KEC, Alstom, and Tech Mahindra.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Mizoram doesn't have it's permanent campus for now. We do feel its consequences. Different blocks are a bit far away so you have to travel quite changing blocks. This is the major lag of this college. Talking about classrooms, the size is small and not well-equipped even just feels like average sitting there. Labs are good and well-equipped. Professors guide us nicely there. Hostels are average. You will get basic facilities of course. But didn't expect much. The mess is average. We can survive with it. But this is how things are practically.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are highly qualified and well-experienced. They help students very energetically and responsibly. The courses are kept updated always depending on the market trends and requirements. College exams are neither too easy nor that difficult to ace one can crack them if he/she studies sincerely. There are few students who get a back. So you have to be kind and sincere.
detailed_review.Other: You get a scholarship based on caste named OBC NCL. We get less than 1 lacs. There is no tuition fee for SC and ST. For, Gen Ews, it is less than 1 lacs. A good amount of fests are held every year like technical fest, hackathon, cultural fest, freshers party, NCC, debate, painting competition, presentation, idea pitching, etc. In every batch, almost there are 30 to 35 students which are quite less because classrooms are not that big again.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: BASED ON NIT MIZORAM Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Overall placement is good in the civil branch. Very beneficial degree if you get it from NIT. But if in the future you want a government job, then it is surely good for you. The highest package this year is 27 lac and the average package is 10 lac. Best of luck if you join NIT Mizoram.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Lab, the classroom is okay. Ultimately, if you want to study, then no matter how the classroom is. And the hostel is good for girls and there are no sports activities for girls. But on sports day, you enjoy a little more. But if you want campus life, then it is not perfect for you.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is easy to score marks in the examination because the faculty wants you to pass at any cost. There is a little much pressure on you. But if you study a little more, of course, you will pass. Overall, the faculty is more educated. Lab faculty belong to Ph.D. scholars and others are professors.
detailed_review.Other: NSP scholarship is available, with no extracurricular activities, and for the fest, it is only for freshers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want NIT tag then come otherwise not.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement in Mechanical Engineering is good on average. If you are in NIT Mizoram, then go for Mechanical Engineering because you get on-campus placement in Mechanical Engineering. I think it is good for placement and overall best. Go for Mechanical in NIT Mizoram. Best of luck.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It's not that good in infrastructure because NIT Mizoram has no permanent campus and no own building. There isn't even a temporary campus here. But if you want the NIT tag, then it's good. The hostel is not that good in terms of facilities, but for living purposes, you can adjust.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty are very educated, and you know also that if you are admitted to NIT, then don't worry about faculty qualifications. Everything is good here, but in exams, all faculty are very strict about the examination. There are no cheating techniques; you need to study if you want a good CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: No fest and event.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: One semester experience in NIT Mizoram

detailed_review.Placements: The placement at NIT Mizoram is decent. Last year, almost 83% of students in my branch (S3 batch) were placed by several companies. According to me, it's a decent and good placement rate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel infrastructure in NIT Mizoram is decent—not too bad, not too good. It is okay, but the Wi-Fi is slow, and the labs are good. However, the classrooms need work. The hostel facility is not good because sometimes we face a shortage of water.
detailed_review.Faculty: When I talk about faculty, they are good, but in our branch, they are too strict. They give us too many assignments and check them strictly, which is why I am saying they are strict. However, some faculty members help us learn construction topics easily. The curriculum of the college is decent, and the quality of education is good.
detailed_review.Other: In our branch, the summer papers are purely in South Indian languages. They do not understand Hindi properly, so we communicate with each other in English. When we talk about events, the first organizing is good, and the facilities are good. Personally, I like the food served at events; the quality and hygiene are good. Connectivity and scholarships, according to me, are too strict, and they ask us to serve a type of question for signatures on the scholarship application.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good teaching staff members and providing knowledge is the ultimate goal here.

detailed_review.Placements: In the CSE branch, around 93% of students get placed in the 2023-2024 academic year. The highest salary package offered for CSE is 13 LPA, but in the 2024-2025 academic year, it is increased to above 35 LPA. The average salary package offered for CSE students in the 2023-2024 academic year is around 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Adobe, Deloitte, Tech Mahindra, etc., visit the college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The quality of food served is good. Bathrooms are not cleaned regularly. The ratio of bathrooms to students is 1:10 so they should clean bathrooms twice a week.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality at NIT Mizoram is very well. Teachers solve the doubts of students regularly. Due to the number of students, teachers can easily understand the level of students. The course curriculum is designed very well. The end semester exam is easy but due to less time, many students got average marks. For every subject out of 100 marks, students should get above 34 marks to pass. For the CSE course, there are good teachers for teaching languages.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the CSE branch in my B.Tech because nowadays software knowledge is involved in every field. I am interested in learning about how computers work and how software runs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of National Institute of Technology,  mizoram.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good here. Since it is a temporary campus, mostly online interviews happen, so there is a chance you can get placed easily. The number of students here is less, which is also a good reason that you get placed as compared to other colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Since it is a hill area, network issues are there. But they provide Wi-Fi here, and sometimes Wi-Fi works slowly. Hostels are on the average side. Food is also not convincing, and since it is in the North, students can't even like food outside. Students don't get a homely feel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good here. Exams happen every three months per semester, so they are completed fast. Working days are also fewer. Exam levels are good. They provide PDFs. Faculty members are also from professional backgrounds, such as Dr., etc. Curriculum is also good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My review on NIT Mizoram.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are pretty good, and if we study well and get a good CGPA, we'll get placed easily. Even if we get an average CGPA, there are high chance that we'll get placed. There are fewer students here than at other colleges, which is one reason why it's easier to get placed. And, of course, the NIT tag is beneficial.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Since it is a hill area, the network is not that good. They provide Wi-Fi, but sometimes the network is slow. The infrastructure is average since it is a hill area and a temporary campus. The food here in the North is not acceptable. Every day there are potatoes in the mess, and the food is not that good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at this college is good. Exams are held every three months, which means that the syllabus is completed quickly. As a result, the number of working days is also less. We will need to study from PDFs, which is common in any B.Tech college. The semester exams are of a good level, which means they are somewhat tough. However, this is the case at every college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Bad college, but good nature.

detailed_review.Placements: 100 percent placement rate is present in our campus because there are fewer members, and they all are placed. 29 Lacs is the highest, and 8 is the lowest. Google is mostly visited by companies. 70 percent of interns are from our college. In our college, the highest package has increased now, and the skills we get here are very well enough for the interview, placements, and communication skills are also taught here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Very bad quality of food is available here in the mess. Wi-Fi is too slow in Aizawl; the network connection is very bad at times. The climate is also challenging here in Aizawl. Classrooms have no fans and are very uneasy to sit in. The library is quite large; we can get any type of book there, but we have to reenter it monthly. If extended, we have to pay money for compensation. Labs are quite good and decent and can be very useful to us. All the equipment is present in the labs; we can do any work without any delay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, teachers are very helpful. It is difficult to pass the semester exams. Teachers explain topics very clearly in a good manner. Semester and mid exams are very strict, with very strict invigilation. If any person is found to have cheated, they are terminated from all the exams. Here, there is a curriculum, and we celebrate in our hall with a very good atmosphere.
detailed_review.Other: Very bad infrastructure is there in the college, and it can get a small crowd in the college. There is no permanent campus for us, and on one side, there is a campus and on the other side, there is a hostel. The mess we eat in is in 2 places: in the hostel and in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The main drawback is there is no campus and ground for students.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, 100% of students got placed. The highest salary package offered is 15 LPA, the average is 9 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 4 LPA. I have no idea about the recruiting companies but they are not top companies. I’m not aware of internships but all students are getting internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the National Institute of Technology is good. Library and labs are good. Hostel is average. Sports and games are quite tough.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, educated, and brilliant there's no doubt about it. Their way of teaching is mind-blowing. They are also helpful. Exams are really tough and up to the mark. We have completed mid-semester exams but not final semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: Mechanical Engineering is best here. There aren't many events held in our college, but if the event is held it is enjoyable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is the true review by the student of NIT Mizoram.

detailed_review.Placements: We have decent placements, like other NITs. Many companies come to our campus, like Juspay and Adobe. About 70 percent of students got placed with decent placements this year. So far, one of our seniors from the ECE department got the highest package, 21 LPA, from Juspay.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have good hostels. As we don't have our permanent campus yet, we have decent facilities in the hostels, like geysers and water purifiers. We also book futsal courts for playing games. We have the same courses for all branches in the first year, as we have the option of changing branches.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good and friendly with us. Whenever we need them, they are present to help us in every way. We have exams of a good level. Compared to toughness, there is relative grading in our college. Our exams are related to the courses or chapters taught in class.
detailed_review.Other: As we don't have our permanent campus, fests don't occur regularly. We have to book an auditorium to organize fests. All our students are busy with coding and other activities. We have to take flights to reach our college, as Mizoram doesn't have a railway station.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good college having decent increasing placements and facilities are the best here.

detailed_review.Placements: This college has decent placements, and one of our seniors received a PPO of 44 LPA from Microsoft this year. The placement scenario is as follows: 81% of CSE students were placed with an average package of 10 LPA, 85% of ECE students were placed with an average of 8.78 LPA, and 100% of Electrical students were placed with an average package of 8.56 LPA. Similarly, Mechanical and Civil branches had about 95-100% placements with an average package of 4 to 6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As expected, the mess food is not great, but we do get non-vegetarian food three days a week. Mess hygiene is good. Hostels have decent Wi-Fi, geysers, and other basic amenities. The library is good but lacks sufficient space for reading. Since the college does not have a permanent campus, all the buildings are rented.
detailed_review.Faculty: NIT Mizoram has some of the best faculty members. They are very supportive and always give their best for the students. All professors and Ph.D. scholars are well-qualified and possess good knowledge in their respective fields. The course curriculum is the same as other NITs and is highly aligned with modern industry requirements.
detailed_review.Other: Due to the lack of a permanent campus, only a few events and fests are conducted here. I chose the ECE branch because seniors mentioned that the ECE faculty here are the best.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average college life and placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of students from the Mechanical Engineering department were placed, with an average package of 7 LPA. Top recruiters like Adobe, Deloitte, Vedanta, Tech Mahindra, and IBM visit the campus. The highest package is 14.50 LPA, and the average package is 7 LPA. Students also pursue internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are digitalized, and Wi-Fi speed is average. Hostel food is not good. The sports facility is lacking as the college doesn't have its own campus, so good sports infrastructure cannot be expected. Books can be accessed from the library or online.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, and students can clear their doubts in class. Semester exams are not very difficult, and students can pass easily if they don't have any backlogs. A minimum of 75% attendance is mandatory. Teachers are capable of making students industry-ready if they engage well with them.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of National Institute of Technology, Mizoram.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 100% of students from the civil engineering branch were placed last year. Core branches also achieved nearly 100% placement. Prominent recruiters include Ashok Leyland, Vedanta, and others. The average package was 9.8 LPA last year, with the highest package this year reaching 44 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no permanent campus for NIT Mizoram, which limits facilities for outdoor games. The mess food is acceptable, but Wi-Fi connectivity is poor. The library is well-stocked.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teacher are good and knowledgeable in their respective fields. They are very helpful in nature. The course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry ready. Semester exams are challenging, with a pass CGPA requirement of 4.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: There is nothing good in this college. There are no exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year placements were very good with median package of 9.8 Lacs and it's getting better year by year. Almost 100% placements take place last year in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, civil engineering, and placement cell is very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no permanent campus. They have rented all the buildings. Hostels are 7 to 13 km away and they provide bus services to academic blocks. Canteen facility is provided. Medical facilities is also very good. They will help you in need. Ambulance service is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable. They have achieved very much in their field. They are very helpful in all cases. The curriculum makes us industry ready. Semester examination are quite tough but we can easily score by a little bit of study. Minimum CGPA is 4 to pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Mizoram: Worth it! Faculty Placement Infrastructure

detailed_review.Placements: College gave 100 percent placement in my course, electrical engineering. The highest package offered this year is 44 lakhs by Microsoft. The lowest package is 3 lakhs, and the average is around 10 lakhs. 80 percent of students got summer internships in companies like Microsoft, IIT Bhilai , Adobe , TCS, etc . Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Ashok Leyland, Adobe, etc .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Colleges don't have permanent campuses, but they provide facilities like Wi-Fi , labs, good classrooms, and libraries. The facilities are quite good with nice food , good sports facilities, and games . Different academic blocks are placed quite far apart with no connectivity.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable , with great teaching quality. Yes, the course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready as the syllabus is very course-centric. Mid-sems were very hard with relative grading. Branch change is also offered.
detailed_review.Other: Major drawbacks are the lack of a permanent campus, less campus life, and connectivity issues . Events and fests are nice with good management.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of National Institute of Technology, Mizoram

detailed_review.Placements: In the last two years, mechanical, electrical, and civil engineering (core branches) have had 100 % placement with an average salary of 8.4 LPA in 2022 and 9.8 LPA in 2023. Placements are increasing year by year. The faculties are good, but NIT Mizoram does not have a private campus; it is running on rented buildings.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Faculties are good, helping nature and have a good understanding of students’ lives. Teaching style is also different from other casual colleges. Medical facilities are also available in the college. Nit has its own ambulance service. The college does not have its own campus . Wi-Fi is not that good because of the altitude area. The library is better than I thought.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are quite tough, and if you self-study 3-4 hrs, it will be easy for you, but mathematics engineering requires more than 3-4 hrs, as you know. Exam invigilators are strict as in an NIT. Yes, the course curriculum is relevant and makes students fit for industry. The teachers are highly qualified. The director of NIT Mizoram was used to being the HOD in IIT Madras.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college runs on temporary campus but still has good placement and teaching facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in my first year but recently one of our seniors from the CSE department got a PPO of 44 LPA from Microsoft. This motivated us to study more and get a package like that . Average package last year was 10 lpa . Companies like TCS , Alstrom, Mahindra , Adobe , Capgemini, etc. came last year .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are good with smartboards; wifi is also present on the floors . A library is present from which we can issue books and study free of charge ( also, resources are there in our library) . The first-year hostel is average, with rooms well and good and 4-5 wifi are there on each floor . The seniors hostel is very nice .
detailed_review.Faculty:
The teaching quality here is top notch, with highly qualified professors who have their strong expertise in their subject and teach us by taking practical examples; they also motivate us so that we can get good placement.
The course curriculum is relevant and in the course additional subjects like communicative English , data analysis and visualisation are also there . 
We had our mid - semester exams recently and it is not possible for a person to study one night before and pass as the level of questions was good.
detailed_review.Other: Last month we had Technox 2024, which was the technical fest. It had multiple events like eSports, posters, debates, etc.

college_info.college_name: NIT Mizoram NIT Mizoram Admission 2025: Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility & Application

faqs.question: Can I join NIT Mizoram directly?
faqs.answer: The NIT Mizoram University does not take any direct admissions. In order to take admission for any engineering course in NIT Mizoram one has to undergo JEE Mains examination, and has to score a valid ranking according to the cutoff released. This is followed by JoSAA counseling and CSAB counseling. Eligibility criteria includes 75% aggregate in 12th class and JEE Mains score.

faqs.question: What are the minimum marks required to get a seat at NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: To get into NIT Mizoram, candidate must have attain the rank as per the cutoff list released. As per the round 4 of the cutoff list,   the cutoff ranks among the General AI category candidates varied between 548694 and 1314967 . Therefore, to get admission to NIT Mizoram, candidate must have a rank of atleast 57538. For further information on NIT Mizoram cutoff 2025, candidates can check this page .

faqs.question: How can I get into NIT Mizoram for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer: NIT Mizoram admissions is entrance-based. For admission to its BTech programme National Institute of Technology Mizoram accepts the JEE Main scores followed by the Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) counselling. For admission at MTech programmes, NIT Mizoram accepts the GATE scores, respectively. After qualifying for the respective entrance exams, interested candidates must apply for the relevant counselling sessions such as JoSAA, CCMT, and others to gain admission.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: NIT Mizoram JEE Main cutoff 2025 has been released for round 1. The cutoff was released for candidates belonging to the All India quota. Among the General AI category candidates, the closing ranks in round 1 varied between 20801 and 51888 . Among the OBC AI category candidates, the cutoff ranks varied between 10144 and 16248 . Apart from General and OBC category, the cutoff was released for SC, ST, and other categories. Candidates can check all the information for NIT Mizoram JEE Main cutoff here . In the table given below, students can find the branch-wise NIT Mizoram 2025 cutoff, for the General AI category candidates:

faqs.question: What is the BTech cutoff for SC and ST categories at NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: NIT Mizoram BTech cutoff 2023 for Computer Science Engineering was 4524 for SC and 1507 for ST category. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE Main, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

faqs.question: How can I apply for admission to NIT Mizoram for BTech?
faqs.answer: Students seeking admission to NIT Mizoram for BTech are selected via JoSSA Counselling on the basis of their JEE Main scores/rank. After the same, they are required to report at NIT Mizoram campus on the announced date with all the required documents. To start the process, students must begin with the JEE Main application process. The process of application for JEE Main 2023 is inclusive of three major steps, i.e registration, form filling & document upload followed by payment of application fees . All these steps of the application are as follows: Step 1: Open the official website (jeemain.nta.nic.in) and click on the ‘ Registration for JEE (Main) 2023’ link. Step 2: Fill out the registration form with the required information followed by clicking on the submit button. Step 3: Fill out the detailed application form and upload scanned images and documents. Step 4: Pay the application fees. The application form is automatically submitted after the successful payment of application fees. Read more details about JEE Main application form and fee 2023 here.

faqs.question: How can I take admission to the M.Tech programme of NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: Candidates can take admission to M.Tech at NIT Mizoram through a common counselling named CCMT after qualifying for the GATE exam. In case the seats remain vacant even after the CCMT Counselling is over, non-GATE candidates are then offered admission on the basis of the institute-level admission process. For details on the same, students are advised to connect with the admission office of NIT Mizoram.

faqs.question: What are the specialisations offered under M.Tech at NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: MTech at NIT Mizoram is offered across four specialisations. These include the following:

faqs.question: What is the process to fill out the M.Tech application form at NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: One can take admission to M.Tech programme at NIT Mizoram through common counselling for M.Tech (CCMT) after qualifying GATE. If seats remain vacant after GATE qualified candidates, admission can be given to non-GATE candidates through Institute admission procedure.

data.title: NIT Mizoram Placement Report 2024
summary: The placement process at NIT Mizoram includes a comprehensive pre-placement training and skill development program for the students. The final placements at NIT Mizoram are a result of very systematic interaction with the industry and continuous career counselling of the students.

During NIT Mizoram placements 2024, the highest and average packages offered stood at INR 14.5 LPA and INR 7.02 LPA, respectively. A total of 75 students registered for the NIT Mizoram placements 2024, of which 75 students were placed in reputed companies. Additionally, 100% of the CE, ME and EEE branch students were placed in 2024, whereas 63% of the CSE and 80% of the ECE branch students were placed in top companies . The top recruiters of NIT Mizoram in 2024 included Deloitte, Tech Mahindra, L&T, Adobe, KEC, Ashoka Leyland, Alston, Vedanta , etc.

faqs.question: What is the fee for NIT Mizoram?
faqs.answer: The fees for studying B.Tech in NIT MIZORAM is Rs. 95,750 per semester including the tuition fees. Category Benefits for students. Scheduled Caste/ Scheduled Tribe/ Physically Handicapped gets 100% tuition fee waiver. Economically backward students (whose family income is less than Rs.1 Lacs per annum) gets full remission of the Fee. Other economically backward students (whose family income is between Rs.1 Lacs to Rs.5 Lacs per annum) 2/3rd of the fee.

text: For more information about NIT Mizoram - National Institute of Technology check out the below video:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The central library holds more than 7000 educational books which are as per the course requirement of the various semesters of different departments. The central library has also subscribed e-journals like: Springer link (1400+e-journals), IEEE-IEL online e-journals, ASME e-journals, ASCE e-journals, INDISTAT e-journals and the central library is automated with an integrated library management software package ‘LIBMAN’. The library collection has been created and available through Online Public Access Catalogue (OPAC) to the users through the IP based online access to these resources.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The Institute has a total number of 4 hostel, 3 for boys and 1 for girls. The hostel provides many facilities like: purified drinking water, generator is installed for power backup, sanitation and cleaning service, TV, sports and gym rooms. Mess is operated in each hostel which provides breakfast, lunch, evening tea and dinner.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. highlights.summary:
NIT Nagaland was founded in 2010 in Dimapur Nagaland and approved by AICTE. The institution offers BTech, MTech, MSc and PhD programmes. JEE Mains and GATE score cards are accepted for National Institute of Technology Nagaland course admissions. NIT nagaland was ranked between 101 to 150 by NIRF 2024 for Engineering.
Top companies such as Infosys, IBM and Tech Mahindra took part during the NIT Nagaland placements and 61.54% of students have been placed. It also offers scholarships to students through various government schemes. The key highlights of NIT Dimapur are tabulated below:
Establishment year | Ownership type

NIT Nagaland provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programmes to students. The courses provided by the Institute include BTech, MTech, MSc, PhD, etc. Moreover, BTech is the flagship course at NIT Nagaland. The institute offers the BTech programme in 6 specialisations for a duration of 4 years. Some of the NIT Nagaland BTech specialisations are listed below:
National Institute of Technology Nagaland is also known for its MTech programme offered in four specialisations, namely Computer Science and Engineering, Power Systems Engineering, Communication Engineering and VLSI Systems. NIT Nagaland Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college with good faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college 75 percent of students get placed every year. Top roles offered are System Engineer Data Analytics, Electrical Engineer, etc. 70 to 80 percent of students get internships from our course. These internships are really helpful for future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has best infrastructure facilities. They contain Wi-Fi beautiful library and clean classrooms. The food in our hostel is really hygienic and healthy. Games period is also allotted in the timetable schedule. Food quality is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful highly qualified and very knowledgeable with their teaching quality. The curriculum is also very relevant and it makes the students industry ready. The semester exams are a bit difficult but we can manage to pass.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Physics
reviews.review_title: Pros and cons of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Various scopes of opportunities are available for the course, while most of them are core recruiters. Most of the electronics-oriented core companies like Cisco Systems, LG Electronics Ltd, and Hero Electric are among the active recruiters from the college, with packages going up to 6.7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has secured good rankings and recognition from various top organisations. To relax and chill, various activities are performed in the college, some of which include dedicated rooms, fitness centres, and badminton courts. Hostel zones were peaceful but highly restrictive.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors have good experience with Certificates of Excellence in the profession of teaching, while assistant professors have a little bit of experience but provide good guidance to the students till the completion of the course. Also, they are learning technical skills from the professors, just like the students.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Physics
reviews.review_title: Pros and cons of my campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Various scopes of opportunities are available for the course, while most of them were core recruiters. Most of the electronics-oriented core companies like Cisco Systems, LG Electronics Ltd, and Hero Electric are among the active recruiters from the college, with packages lasting up to 6.7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: To relax and chill, various activities are performed in the college, some of them include introducing dedicated rooms, fitness centers, and badminton courts. Hostel zones were peaceful but highly restrictive.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors had secured good experience with Certificates of Excellence in the profession of teaching, while assistant professors had a little bit of experience but provided good guidance to the students till the completion of the course. Also, they are learning technical skills from the professors like the students.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Physics
reviews.review_title: Master of Science in Physics at Nagaland.

detailed_review.Placements: Well, considering records of placements, it graphically changed over the years. But the training for placements was consistently given by the top trainers, which helped to enhance our knowledge with incredible efficiency. Most students got placed in core companies, with the highest pay being 15.4 LPA last year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus area was hygienic, with all facilities looked at by students to pursue their courses. Student safety was a priority for the management over other activities. Transportation on the college campus was very good. All the necessary safety measures were initiated in the college
detailed_review.Faculty: Academic excellence was superb, but teachers focused more on their teaching. A few students were disappointed with their teaching. Most teachers preferred to take classes using the SMART board and avoided using blackboards. Some of them simply read the textbooks and moved on.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with my college.

detailed_review.Placements: 50 to 60% of students are placed this year. The highest salary is approximately 14 LPA, the average package is between 5-6 LPA, and the lowest package is 4.22 LPA. The top recruiting companies are L and T Engineering and Construction, IBM, Infosys, and Tech Mahindra. The majority of students take internships at Power Grid in Dimapur and Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited. 40% of students go for internships. Roles offered for Mechanical Engineering is in manufacturing, design, research, and technology management.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a separate lab workshop for mechanical engineering students. Wi-Fi connections are good on campus. Labs are well-functioning. We have 6 bamboo classrooms and many buildings. Classrooms are quite good for studying. We have a library where we can take books for studies. Most of the time, books are available for us. We have a good supply of electricity, but sometimes you can face electricity problems. The mess and canteen are average. We have a sports ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Most of them are good at teaching and provide quality education. As we know, our syllabus is not advanced according to industry standards, they will provide what they have, but you also need to put in efforts from your side. The difficulty level of exams is moderate. If you study, you will pass easily. If you start preparing one week before the exam, you will easily get good marks. 60% of the people pass easily. Most of faculty members are supportive and help with each work. The nature of our teachers is quite good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in machines since childhood. This course makes it easier for me to understand about design of machines and many more. The best thing about my course is that I recently won a Robo GP competition where we made a car and competed with other participants. At least one event or fest is done in a month. The campus crowd is not so much. Connectivity is too good for us. Many extracurricular activities are done like fests and healthy competitions between branches, like sports, dance, and others.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college, Great crowd and awesome college life.

detailed_review.Placements: The EIE branch has the highest placement percentage. You can expect a median of nearly 8 LPA and an average of 8-9 LPA as well. In my branch, mostly placements vary between 90-100%, except for 2024. You can get placed in both IT and non-IT companies. You have to work on your skills to grab good internship offers. Overall, it's 8.4/10.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi facility is fast enough and is available in all of campus. You get like  upwards of 200-300mbps on laptops. On phones, it can vary between 35-120mbps. Classrooms are good enough to accommodate all of the students. Don’t expect modern classrooms. Classrooms are good but aren’t super modern or anything, though they get most of the work done. We have one cricket football ground, a badminton court, a cricket practice net, a volleyball court, and a basketball court. We are provided with table tennis. Hostels are really great as well with spacious rooms. The library is good as well and contains many books on different topics.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of professors and teachers have done their Ph.D. from prestigious institutes. They are all very knowledgeable and explain concepts and topics really well. Teaching quality is excellent. The course curriculum is similar to most other NITs, i.e., the same syllabus for all branches in the first semester. Though, unlike many other NITs, in the second semester, every branch gets a unique exclusive subject and practical subject. The curriculum is good and relevant. Exams aren’t that tough. Questions test all of the stuff you learn in the lectures, though. You can easily score high in exams with a small amount of study.
detailed_review.Other: I chose EIE because it has a high placement ratio and you learn both hardware and software well. The events and fests in the college are very great. The main annual fest is called Ekarikthin + Teach-Avinya. It's the biggest technical and cultural fest of college, and it's really awesome. You can win a lot of prize money in the technical/cultural events in the fest aswell. Extracurricular activities are good as well. Many are good at dancing, singing and at sports etc. Crowd is good too. Connectivity is really good as you can easily reach the college by train.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and facilities with a chill semester, enough time to pursue your interest.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. It depends upon your skills. Most known companies like TCS, Wipro, Deloitte, Vedanta, etc., visit our college for placements. Most of the hardworking students get placed. The average package may be around 7 LPA to 8 LPA. The highest package may be around 12 LPA to 15 LPA (on-campus).
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good as compared to other North East College. Hostel is newly built. All hostels and campus are equipped with Wi-Fi. In the first year, your hostel will be just outside the campus. All the hostel rooms are double and triple-sharing and have enough space for 3 and 4 members. Lab facility of the college is very good. It has all the necessary equipment with good infrastructure. New departmental buildings are also under construction.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is very good. All the teachers here are qualified and have good knowledge of their subjects. Semesters are very easy as compared to any other college. It is very easy to get pass and get good grades. In one semester, you have 1 mid-semester, 2 quizzes, 1 end-semester, and lab exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is better than I expected.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are not good because students don't work hard. Previous placements are not good due to covid period. Talented students don't go for placements. They score 80% good in GATE and go for M.Teach in IIT. Local students prepare for state government exams.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The course is designed to be easier, making it accessible for students who may struggle academically, so everyone has a good chance of passing. This provides an advantage for scoring well and achieving a good CGPA. Hostels are in excellent condition with good infrastructure. Currently, first-year students are in a rented hostel off-campus due to availability issues, but a new hostel building is in progress. The hostels for second-, third, and fourth-year students are very nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are very friendly and polite. They are making it easy to achieve a CGPA of above 8.5 with just 2-3 days of studying before the exam. Exams are conducted every semester, with one mid-semester exam and one end-semester exam. Currently, I am in my first year, pursuing a degree in electronics and communication engineering.

reviews.course: Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College campus is huge and placements are also good.

detailed_review.Placements: We have a very good placement record right now compared to other institutes. The training for placements for students starts from the second year itself. Last year, the highest package is 25 LPA, and the average package is 12 LPA. There are many companies recruiting from our college, such as IBM, Cisco, Infosys, HCL, etc. Mostly all the students got placements from the campus placement drive.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is good, and we have a library, student section, help desk, and many classrooms available in the main building. Also, we have an auditorium, an AC convention hall, 2 to 3 lecture halls, etc. The college provides transportation facilities also for the students. All events and fests are conducted on the college campus, and mostly all the festivals are celebrated here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college faculty is very friendly and helpful. Some of them have even graduated from prestigious colleges. They always guided us through our doubts. They all are very supportive and teach us diligently so that every student can pass in semester exams. Recently, we have achieved a 70% passing percentage in the institute.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Physics
reviews.review_title: Quite an awesome academic boosting experience.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement opportunities are available for students taking up engineering courses, the placement percentage might be 30-40% per batch although no placement opportunities are available for the Physics and Chemistry department as they get an opportunity to get appointed only in IT companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is standard as any other standard institute of national importance although some of the departments are still underdeveloped. Hostels are provided for all and the mess is managed by a private management affiliated with the Institute. Food is also provided well, i.e., 4 meals a day for both veg and non-veg. The hostel facilities include fans, no AC, geysers, public bathrooms, and multiple toilets.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-qualified as they all come from a research-oriented institute of national importance. There is quite a diversity in faculty members from across the country and they teach according to national standards. The curriculum is well updated and the students are well prepared both theoretically and practically with the top-notch laboratories and equipment in the state of Nagaland. The difficulty of the semester depends on the particular teacher as they are also the ones setting the question paper for end-semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose to study my master's in Physics at the Institute. It was quite a journey, the atmosphere is always encouraging to pick up books and study, and we were constantly surrounded by research scholars who were our seniors. Apart from the academic hustle, the campus also organizes social gatherings for occasions and festivals, which include all the major religious and non-religious festivals of our country. I thought more attention was needed towards the non-engineering departments like Physics and Chemistry in terms of funding and placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Nagaland offers proper facilities and faculty to the students in our course.

detailed_review.Placements: For the electrical engineering branch, 40-50% of the students get placements at this college. Average package offered at our college was between 3-6 LPA. Many companies such as Wipro, PWc, Infosys, Adani, Reliance, Tata Technologies etc. Visit the campus for placements. Students also get internship opportunities at this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Nagaland is having a well maintained and developed infrastructure for our course. College has a big campus with all kinds of necessary facilities. Wi-Fi, labs, library, canteen, hostel, sports and other modern facilities are available for the students. Hostel are available there for the students. Food in the hostel mess is good. Facilities are also of good quality at the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers of the college are helpful, qualified and knowledgeable. The quality of teaching is really good and understandable. Teachers solve all our doubts and give us proper guidance. Course curriculum followed at this college is relevant and makes the students industry ready. Exams of our college are not that hard to pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Disappointed due to the faculty, but the hostel and overall environment are good.

detailed_review.Placements: NIT Nagaland had a steady improvement in its placement statistics over the years. The placement rate typically ranged between 70% to 90%, with variations across different departments. The highest package offered was 15 to 18LPA, and the average package offered was 4 to 6LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms and labs were quite good, and the library, though not bigger, was also fine, with some books related to their departments and space for studying. Coming to the hostel, it was a very good, comfortable, and secure accommodation, ideal for studying as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty was not that impressive, it was not completely bad, but okay. Professors conduct classes, and Ph.D. scholars also teach some classes, but the teaching level was good. Exams were conducted very strictly, failing in regular semesters can lead to supplementary, arrear, and summer term exams to clear subjects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Nagaland - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: This is the top national college in India. Above 80% students were studied in our college. The highest package in our course is above 25 LPA. The lowest package is below 10 LPA. The average package is 15 LPA. In India, the top international companies are recruited by our course. The top roles are team manager, HR.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are excellent and overall college is above 100 acres. Very good in nature and full-speed internet. And classrooms. The quality of hostel and food is excellent and very hygiene. The medical services are also available 24/7. The sports facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The top verified teachers are teaching our course. They are very friendly, very supportive. The students are ready for projects and industry visits. And the semester exams are very hard and very strict. And full of knowledge by the teachers.
detailed_review.Other: Our course was the best course among all courses. It is helpful for core and software also. And no need to improve anything; it is already well-improved and well-designed. The events and fests are monthly once and full of entertainment and good connectivity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Nagaland - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements:
Here is 100 percent placement for the students who are appearing for campus interviews without arrears.
Till today, the average package for our passing-out batch (2024) is INR 8 LPA.
The highest package is INR 15 to 20 LPA since there are many companies coming to campus between February and April.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Wi-Fi connection is good.
Now the library is small and is in the administrative block.
The two-story library is under construction (from Corona time).
Our classrooms are also under construction, just beside the library.
Now we are having classes in bamboo classrooms, which are temporary. Medical facilities are available.
24/7 hot water is available in hostels.
The daily hostel cleaning is done.
sports are conducted every semester
football ground was recently constructed.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are very helpful here.
We can ask any question related to the subject without hesitation, and they will answer us.
Semesters are very easy.
We can pass easily since it is a grading system and the strength is also very low.
The pass percentage for the semester exam is 40%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not so good placement for civil, but worth it for a good college experience and healthy environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is not that good. For civil, it's very low—around INR 5 lpa, which is very low. In other branches, it's almost the same as in other NITs. It's improving every year, so I'm just hoping civil gets higher too. Many companies, such as Johnson, Infosys, etc., visit.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostels are very good. The mess is good. It's improving every year based on our ratings. Libraries and classrooms could get better. There's room for more improvement. We have bamboo classrooms for now for the civil departments. More department construction is underway.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were good. I especially like the math teacher, though he takes too many extra classes. The exam questions are fine enough, like any other NIT. Just pray you don't get backlogged because they make it so difficult to pass. You might end up with backlogs until the sixth semester if you fail in the first semester.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is wonderful. It is very beautiful, with mountains and hills. Friendly environment, and lots of events are organized. We have lots of competitions and events, including cosplays (for anime fans, you'd love it).

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college placements are excellent and CSE is excellent.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, almost 10% of students are placed in our course. The highest salary package offered is 19 LPA in the IT sector. On the core side, there is very little hope. The highest salary package offered is 6.5 LPA and the lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies like L&T, Pie Infocomm, JSW, etc., visit our campus. Almost 10% of students get internships at IBM and Pie Infocomm. Top roles offered are software developer and site manager.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college Wi-Fi is slow and labs are excellent. Our classrooms are better and the library is somewhat small. Hostels and the food served are not good. The canteen is not good and there are no proper grounds. The medical team is excellent, but the facilities are inadequate.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are excellent and some are better. Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Semester exams are difficult but starting with the 5th semester, the syllabus is good for civil engineers.
detailed_review.Other: Our teachers are more experienced. Our lab is very large and expensive. It is good to be a good civil engineer but there are no proper placements. The lectures are not good. We need to change. Everything is excellent, but everything will happen with a low budget.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I would recommend students to join this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 89% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary package offered was 20 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 4 LPA. The average salary package offered ranges from 6 LPA - 8 LPA. If students are good then they can be placed in top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food quality is good. Hostel rooms are better.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. They are well-qualified, and the teaching quality is better. They also provide notes to us. Semester exams are moderate. If we prepare well then we can score good marks.
detailed_review.Other: It is a very good college. Events are conducted every year. Studies and extra curricular activities are equally balanced.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Science beauty of this campus eases the problems and defects.

detailed_review.Placements: 2018-2022 batch placed students percentage is 82.6. the highest package is 18 LPA. The average package is 7.63 LPA. The average package of my department (ECE) is around 8 LPA Top recruiting companies include L&T Construction, Infosys, TCS, Cognizant, etc. Most companies that recruit students are from IT backgrounds but students also get placed in core companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are equipped with a Wi-Fi connection. Labs do have the proper equipment for the number of students now. Classrooms are not digital, which most people expect from an NIT. The library is open for almost 12 hrs a day. It has books related to technology and academic purpose but not biographies or novels. Hostels are much better than other colleges but not all. Freshers hostels for B.Tech is very good. Food quality is the worst thing in my college. We get to eat 4 days of bread as breakfast. Lunch is the most miserable meal of the day. But the good news is we have a canteen. The food in the canteen is not like super tasty, but okay we can it's good. When it comes to medical facilities doctor visits to campus once a week. The rest of the week nurses are available. One ambulance is also available for students in case of emergency. Students have the proper equipment to play sports. Mostly we play Football, Basketball, volleyball, cricket, kabaddi, Badminton, Table tennis, and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are very approachable and ready to help. Ph.D. scholars also have deep knowledge of the subject and are friendly too. One of the best things about my college is academics are not that difficult, so students get ample time to focus on developing other skills.
detailed_review.Other: College life is a completely new experience here. You get to live your student life in a peaceful hilly area. Locals are also very friendly. Many cultural fests take place every semester. The one fest every student of NIT Nagaland waits for is Ekarikthin which is the biggest annual techno-cultural fest. Sports meet also takes place. When it comes to connectivity Airport is 15km and the Railway station is 18km from the campus. Roads were really bad when I joined my B. Tech here but now they are good. Students do get various scholarships and can approach seniors for any help. Seniors are very friendly here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has a well-designed administrative block and various other rooms and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has an excellent placement record in the past few years in CS and IT branch. Students are eligible for placement from the 3rd year. Many companies like Wipro, TCS, HCL, Flipkart, and cognizant visited our college in the past few years, placements are awesome here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college's infrastructure is quite good enough. Classrooms are spacious and ventilated properly. Various advanced technology is present in our classrooms like smart boards. The quality of teaching is excellent, members are skilled in different domains.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college has a well-designed administrative block and various other rooms and facilities for the students such as girls' common room and boys' common room, waiting room, co-operative store, etc. Wi-Fi facility is available throughout the college campus. The library consists of many technical books and online websites to download.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of National Institute of Technology, Nagaland.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, the placement percentage is 60% due to the ratio of locals and non-locals 50:50. The highest salary package offered is around 15 LPA, the lowest salary package is around 3.5 LPA, and the average salary package offered is 8 LPA. Deloitte, Capgemini, cognizant, and L&T are top recruiting companies in our college. Around 50% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Admin building infrastructure is good. The hostel infrastructure of 1st,  2nd, and 3rd-year students is good. But the 4th year hostel is very old, it needs to be renovated. We have a Wi-Fi facility, speed is average, and we have bamboo classrooms. We have very low sports facilities and the mess food is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are well qualified and knowledgeable. The quality of teaching is good and somewhat helpful. Each course has qualified faculty members but some teachers don't even take the class the whole semester. They help in exams at the end by giving some important topics. Semester exams paper difficulty is average and the pass percentage is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because I want to go to the communication and IT side. I wish to add equipment in the lab and good books are available in the library for the preparation of exams. Campus crowd is low compared to other NITs, events and fests occur regularly like Euphonics, Ekarikthin, farewell, freshers, and annual sports meet.

college_info.college_name: NIT Nagaland Admission 2025: Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility & Application

admission.title: NIT Nagaland Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text:
NIT Nagaland admission 2025 is entrance-based. The institute offers various programmes at UG, PG, and doctoral levels . The institute accepts various national-level entrance exams for admission to its courses. Also known as National Institute of Technology Nagaland and NIT Dimapur, NIT Nagaland provides over 20 courses via seven departments, out of which the flagship course BTech is offered across six specialisations.

Interested students can read the following article to know in-depth about NIT Nagaland's admission process, cutoff, courses, fee structure, and more.

faqs.question: What are the minimum marks required to get a seat at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: To get into NIT Nagaland, candidate must attain the rank as per the cutoff list released. As per the round 4 of the cutoff list,   the cutoff ranks among the General AI category candidates varied between 36109 and 57538 . Therefore, to get admission to NIT Nagaland, candidate must have a rank of atleast 57538. For further information on NIT Nagaland cutoff 2025, candidates can check this page .

faqs.question: What is the admission process in NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland admission starts with the registration process for JEE Main January session. Admission to NIT Nagaland is subject to various national-level entrance exams such as JEE Main and GATE. The flagship programme of NIT Nagaland is BTech which is offered across six specialisations. Admission to BTech is based on JEE Main scores followed by JoSSA Counselling. For MTech and MSc, admission is subject to GATE and IIT JAM exams, respectively. MTech and MSc also have counsellig based admission. CCMT and CCMT are the counselling platform through which the qualified MSc and MTech are admitted.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for NIT Nagaland admission?
faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland offers BTech, M.Tech MSc and PhD programme. Candidates who have twelve years of school education with 75% aggregate and a valid JEE Main scores are eligible for the BTech course. For the MTech, candidates who have a Bachelor's Degree in any stream and a valid scorein the GATE score. Also candidates with a bachelor's degree in Science and IIT Jam score are eligible for the MSc programe. And finally for the PhD candidates must have master's degree  in Engineering or Technology, a valid GATE/JRF/ UGC NET/ CSIR NET score.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BTech at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have twelve years of school education with 75% aggregate. Additionally, candidates must have valid JEE Main scores for admission. Therfore thy must apply for JEE Main exam and stay updated related to the exam for admission. Candidates must have a good JEE Main score i.e. 250 or above. For NITs and IITs a in the 85th to 95th percentile is ideal for admission . Applicants must also rank among the top 15,000 to 20,000 students in the country to get admission to the premier NITs and IITs.

faqs.question: How is NIT Nagaland? What package can B.Tech students expect after completing the degree?
faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland offers its flagship BTech course is offered across multiple specialisations. According to one of Shiksha reviews, the institute has amazing faculty, facilities, and infrastructure. In recent years, the placement rate has been close to 100%. The highest package offered for BTech 2024 is INR 13.95 LPA. Students can expect a decent package once they've completed their BTech degree from the institute. For further details related to NIT Nagaland BTech placements and campus life, students can go through the NIT Nagaland reviews , where students have shared their experiences.

faqs.question: Am I eligible for BTech admission at NIT Nagaland with 60% in Class 12?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for BTech, students must have completed their Class 12 with 75% aggregate (for the General category). For more details on the subject, students can reach out to the admission office. Additionally, admission to NIT Nagaland for its four-year BTech course is subject to a valid score in JEE Main followed by JoSAA Counselling. For seats that remain vacant after JoSAA counselling, admission is offered via CSAB Counselling.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for M.Tech at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have completed a bachelor’s degree in any discipline. Also, have a valid GATE Score and a decent work experience is eligible for M.Tech at NIT Nagaland. The GATE Cutoff for each NIT will vary and each NIT will release its GATE cutoff based on the following factors. Candidates will be able to see the cutoff for all NITs on the official website of CCMT (Centralised Counselling for MTech).

faqs.question: What M.Tech specialisations are offered at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland offers MTech as a postgraduate programme for a two-year duration in a regular and part time mode. The MTech programme is offered under multiple specialisations : Communication Engineering. Communication Engineering Syllabus. VLSI Systems Curriculum. Admission to these specialisations is offered based on the GATE score and CCMN/CCMT counselling.

faqs.question: What are the career prospects after doing M.Tech from NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: After doing M.Tech from NIT Nagaland, students can pursue a variety of roles in various fields. The institute offers the programmes across multiple specialisations, such as Computer Science and Engineering, VLSI Systems, etc. The top recruiters for the institute are Cognizant, Infosys, Deloitte, TCS, and more. Graduates of NIT Nagaland M.Tech VLSI course often have high placements, with students getting placed in semiconductor corporations, research labs, and design centers.

faqs.question: What is the M.Tech fee at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: MTech fees at NIT Nagaland is around INR 5 lakh . The fee structure is cumulative of multiple components, such as tuition fee, hostel fee, medical insurance, mess and other security deposits, etc. Out of all these fee components, there are a few components that are charged one-time by NIT Nagaland.

faqs.question: How can I apply for MSc at NIT Nagaland?
faqs.answer: To apply for the MSc at NIT Nagaland, candidates first must qualify for the eligibility criteria: B.Sc. (Hons. in Physics) with 60% aggregate for general and OBC candidates and 55% or 6.0 CGPA in 10 scale grading for SC and ST . Candidates qualifying the eligibility are now eligible to appear for the Institutional Entrance Examination conducted in the NIT Nagaland campus. The seats offered via the entrance exam are seats which are left after the CCMN counselling. Candidates can apply vis the CCMN cunselling by visiting the counsellin's official website.

faqs.question: What is the NIT Nagaland cutoff 2025 for MSc?
faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland offers admission to the MSc courses based on the IIT JAM entrance exam, followed by the CCMN counselling process. For 2025 admission, the Round 1 closing ranks varied between 1835 and 1858 for the students belonging to the General AI quota. Specialisation with the lowest cutoff rank of 1835 was M.Sc. in Physics . For other specialisations along with their GATE CCMN first-round closing ranks, check out the table provided below:

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for MSc in physics at NIT Meghalaya?
faqs.answer: Admission to MSc at NIT Meghalaya is based on the CCMN counselling process. CCMN released cutoff for admission to the institute. Find below the CCMN cutoff for M.Sc in Physics for 2023:

faqs.answer: NIT Nagaland offers PhD acoross multiple specialisations with different eligibility. The PhD is also offered in integrated which is only applicable for all the engineering departments in full-time mode. The PhD specialisation offered are:

sections.heading: Introduction
text: The National Institute of Technology Nagaland provides various facilities to the students. Some of the facilities provided by the institute include:
Other facilities include Medical, post office, ATM and bank, Data Center, etc.
Check out more on NIT Nagaland Infrastructure in the below video:
list: Central Library:The Central Library of NIT Nagaland has a collection of over 9,500 books in streams such as Engineering, Basic Sciences, Management, Humanities, and others. The library also has more than 1,400+ e-books on Electrical, Electronics, Communication, Civil, Mechanical, and Computer Science along with non-book materials such as NPTEL videos, CDs/CD-ROMs, etc.

Hostel:NIT Nagaland houses six. At present, there are four 64-seated boys’ hostels, one 56-seated girls’ hostel, and a 32-seated PG boys hostel on the NIT Nagaland campus. NIT Nagaland also provides good quality mess facilities (Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian) for all students and a few faculties and staff.

Sports:The Institute is equipped with sports facilities and several indoor and outdoor games. Indoor games include Badminton, table tennis, Carrom and Chess, and outdoor games include Cricket and Football. New football and cricket stadium are under construction and expected to be ready soon.

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The central library has a collection of more than 7,200 books in the area of engineering, technology, basic sciences, management, economics, social sciences and humanities including text books, reference books etc. The central library also having 1400+ of e-books on electrical, electronics, communication, civil, mechanical and computer science and other non-book materials such as NPTEL videos, CDs/CD-ROMs, etc. The central library are fully computerized using integrated library management software with OPAC and RFID technology.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The Institute has a total number of 6 hostel,  4 for boys and 1 for girls. Altogether there are about 172 well furnished rooms across 6 hostels. NIT Nagaland also provides very wholesome messing facility (Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian) for all students and few faculties and staff.

facilities.name: Sports Complex
facilities.description: The Institute provides sports equipment to the students for practice sessions and during tournaments. Inter-Branch tournaments are conducted in various games annually i.e. chess, football, badminton, table tennis, volleyball, kabbadi, etc.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 41 published reviews , 39 reviews are verified.

highlights.summary:
Institute of Technology, Nirma University (ITNU), located at Ahmedabad, is the first self-financed engineering college in Gujarat. The institute is accredited with Grade ‘A’ by National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). The institute offers multidisciplinary undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programmes in Engineering and Technology. Some of the key specialisations include Computer Science & Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Instrumentation & Control Engineering, Civil Engineering and Mechanical Engineering.
