Institute of Technology Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Students life at Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly 95 percent of students are placed in campus placements. Some students choose to pursue a master’s degree for further studies. The highest package is 80 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, and the average package offered is 8 LPA. Companies that frequently hire students on campus include Infosys, TCS, JPMC, Oracle, and Deloitte.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is surrounded by greenery. The architecture of the buildings is modern, with Wi-Fi, AC classrooms, and projectors. The classroom design is awesome. The library is modern and has six floors. The hostel facility is good. Multiple sports grounds, meetup places, and two or three canteens are available for students to relax and socialize.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty have a PhD degree. Faculty help students in both the theory and practical sections, as well as in solving live problems. The course curriculum is updated as per industry requirements, and the college also organizes industry visits every year. The semester exams are moderate to hard, and almost 95 percent of students pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it focuses on cybersecurity. They use logic and mathematics. I want to increase the practical and assignment portions instead of theory. There are also many clubs, scholarships, and extracurricular activities available at the university.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Nirma University is a good private college.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately, we have 80 students in one class, and two such classes. Placements are getting better year by year. The highest package in the ECE stream is approximately 53 LPA. The top recruiters are Google, NVIDIA, Amazon, Adani, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All rooms are air-conditioned, and Wi-Fi facility is available for free. There is proper parking space, and the campus is surrounded by greenery. The canteen is affordable, hygienic, and offers the best food. There are four canteens K canteen, Pharma canteen, Law canteen, and MBA canteen and all of them are excellent. Labs are also well-equipped and among the best. The college has the best infrastructure and a peaceful environment without any stress.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are three exams one is a unit test, one is a mid-semester exam, and one is an end-semester exam. All exams are quite easy, so there is no need to worry. The first year is easy, but the succeeding years become more difficult. Overall, the university has good faculty members not the best, but definitely not the worst.
detailed_review.Other: The culture and fests are also good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Excellence of faculty members and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Total of 400 students are placed in computer science field every year. The highest package till year is CTC 52 LPA. The average salary is 10 LPA - 12 LPA. SDE and many more have been offered in the last 2-3 years when I was on campus. One internship in DE Shaw is also placed with pre-placement talks and PPO.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available on campus. Classrooms are basic and computer labs are still under resource as some of them are still holder model and electricity issues sometimes occur. There is food issue in the canteen. Sometimes, when food is served, insects are there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are the best. Many of them are Ph.D. holders and masters. Still, some of them are going on for research topics as well. Knowledgeable of course, I got full support through them. Students have to practice and make them ready for the role they are interested in. Passing is required above 5.0 CGPA/SGPA.
detailed_review.Other: Course I chose because of the 12, I completed with computer science as electives. The course is very diverse and no flexibility is given. Students have to complete and pass all the courses irrespective of their choice of field. There some space should be given like following their dream and choosing their path following the perfect role they wanted. Events, fests, extra-curriculars, and scholarships are available. No one can beat the events and fests life 4 years the students will experience.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: An honest opinion on Nirma University.

detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are multiple canteen on campus which provides a wide range of options. There is a gym, a playground for multiple sports and games. The campus is open from 10:30 AM to 11:00 PM for all. Those who live in hostels can stay inside. Overall, the facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio is good, there are many faculty members, and the number of students per class is limited. The curriculum design is good and in-depth. The exam system is a continuous evaluation, the result is not just based on the final semester exam. Some of the faculty members are good. The ability they have to make you understand the topic is great. Well, the curriculum covers all the topics in that domain with a good amount of practical. Industry experts are invited to give real-life scenarios about the real industry. The exams are not too difficult to pass, but to score one needs to work a little hard.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placement, strong academics, and impressive campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: From Nirma University, Institute of Technology, CSE branch, Batch 2024 around 90% of students got placed. The highest package was 50 LPA, the lowest was 4 LPA, and the average was 8 LPA. Top recruiters are Amazon, Microsoft, Infosys, and TCS. 85% of students got internships in top MNCs. Roles offered are SDE, analyst, and ML engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Nirma University CSE department offers smart classrooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, advanced labs (AI/ML, data science), and a rich central library. Hostels are clean with good Wi-Fi, 24/7 security, and laundry. Mess food is decent, canteen offers variety. Medical center is available on campus. Sports complex has facilities for cricket, football, badminton, gym, etc. Overall infrastructure is modern and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, well-qualified (mostly PhDs), and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is good with a practical focus. The CSE curriculum is regularly updated and industry-relevant with courses like AI, ML, and data science. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty, students who attend regularly and study properly can pass. Pass percentage is around 90%-95%.
detailed_review.Other: I'm from the 2024 CSE batch of Nirma University. I chose CSE due to my interest in coding and tech. The best things are an updated curriculum, coding culture, and good placements. Improvements needed like more industry projects and startup support. Fests like NU-Tech and Encore are vibrant. Campus crowd is diverse and friendly with the well-connected location. There are green surroundings. Scholarships are available based on merit. Many clubs and extracurriculars for overall development.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good classrooms and infrastructure. Faculty members and courses are fantastic.

detailed_review.Placements: Here, 80% of students get placed in different types of companies, and some students pursue a master's degree, so not all students sit in placement interviews. Some students take off-campus placement, or they continue their father's business. Here in my branch, top companies like Alstom, Micron, Inductotherm,  etc., visit the college to hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are awesome, and the infrastructure is so good. Here we have a 4-floor central library with almost every book that we need. However, here technology students don't get hostels, but they can find PG near the college. Medical facilities are good, and we have a sports and games ground too. We will also get a new sports complex in 2-3 years.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members and course curriculum are good because they are set according to the needs of future jobs. The course curriculum is enough for students to enter industries. For our interest, they have major and minor elective courses, so we can also study our favourite branch subjects and sit in our favourite companies' interviews.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have an interest in power electronics and electric vehicles.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Institute of Technology, Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements of the college are pretty fine enough compared to other colleges. However, the placements vary from different branches and courses the highest for CSE and the lowest is for civil engineering. 7 LPA is the average of combined branches with the highest average of 10 LPA or CSE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hindi college campus is well-equipped with the latest classrooms equipped with smart boards. The laboratories are recruited with the latest instruments. The college campus is about 105 acres big with very good sports facilities. There are three canteens in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The university is NAAC and NBA accredited. University has professors with high educational levels and their content delivery is also very good. The course curriculum is very relevant and is applied on the basis of today's industrial knowledge. University follows the method of continuous evaluation for examination purposes.
detailed_review.Other: University is very popular among the Gujarat people and also the university of a variety of courses which provides durability and greater wide range of selection. The events and fests on the campus are also very good. The disciplinary action taken by the authority is a must for student discipline.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied and happy with campus life and various events that build my career at par it's limit.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package in the technology department is from our department, somewhere around 83 LPA. The median package is between 8 LPA to 11 LPA. Many companies come to train and fascinate students to become part of their organization. The university also has a policy of social services to make students aware of social issues.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is for PG students for boys and girls, and a hostel is also available for B.Tech students. The campus functions with Wi-Fi, labs, air-conditioned classrooms, and three libraries, and it is open to every student. Even students from other institutes can become part of events organized by various clubs at Nirma University.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty and alumni are just too much cooperative and liberal, helping and guiding students in every situation. Semester exams are also logic-based, not just lies from books.. The overall course design aims to make students outstanding in their respective fields as well as in their interest fields.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the ECE department, first year, 24-28 batch. I experience the first semester, and it is just fabulous.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college but have a hectic curriculum.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70% of students got placed till now. Placements are still going on. The average package is between 6 to 7 LPA. The highest package is 16 LPA. Torrent Power and Adani are among the top recruiting companies. The top role offered is a graduate engineer trainee for electrical engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is so good. Classes are well-maintained. There are ACs in some classes and some don't. Labs are managed with advanced technology equipment and software used for simulation purposes. Hostels are only available for girls till the end of the third year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and well-qualified. They help in every possible way they can. The teaching quality is good but sometimes, it is average. The course curriculum is relevant. The curriculum is hard as there are 3 components of evaluation like CE, LPW, and SEE. It is mandatory for you to score in every component to get good marks. The passing percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: At my JEE rank, I got this course. The best thing about this course is the electrical field is evolving and students with an interest in the electrical field will love it. Talking about fests and events, they are amazing. In February and March, you will get fests or events almost every weekend.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The attendance policy is a headache, but there are good placements and a very good campus.

detailed_review.Placements: The college claims 95% placements of students, but faculty members claim that 100% placement is there. The highest package of my college is 35 Lacs in my branch and the average package is 8 Lacs in my branch. Top recruiting companies in my branch are Google and off-campus placements are there for internships. The top roles offered in my course are chip engineering, VLSI designing, and PCB making.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is a well-organized campus with Wi-Fi-enabled labs and classrooms, a 5-floor library which was recently built, and the facility is very well. AC classrooms are there, and 80-seat classrooms are there. The quality of food and mats in the canteen, medical facilities, and sports and games are very good. A sports complex is built and the food quality is good. Hostel is hard to get, but only for outside Ahmedabad, not for locals.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Their teaching skills are very good. They ensure that every student understands the concept, and the course curriculum is very relevant. It makes the student industry-ready and also makes the student ready for any challenge in life. The semester exams are very tough, and the pass percentage is 40%, and it is very tough to score very good marks in the exam. The marking scheme is very complex.
detailed_review.Other: I did choose this course because I want to become a chip designing engineer, and I want to learn robotics. I wish that the attendance policy of the college could be improved. There are many technical clubs and cultural clubs on the campus. Many cultural activities and extracurricular activities take place. Many trips to villages took place for social internships.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Only professionalism even in college life.

detailed_review.Placements: Over 80% of students are placed in Electrical Engineering. The average package is 6-7 LPA, and the maximum is 12-13 LPA. Roles include maintenance of electrical appliances used in industries, designing for companies like lift manufacturing companies, TCS, etc. In short, there is no issue with placement, just need to maintain CGPA throughout the degree.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: High-speed Wi-Fi is available all over the campus. Canteen food is clean, healthy, and tastes so good (3 canteens are available on the campus offering a variety of cuisines and flexible times for students. Even vending machines are available at different places for snacks). Classrooms are spacious and very well-ventilated, with both traditional chalkboards and projectors, which are beneficial for students. Labs are equipped with all necessary equipment. Nirma also motivates sports and health by conducting a 3-credit course (YOGA).
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified and skilled in terms of teaching. Despite professors being very strict, they are very helpful in nature, and the student-to-teacher ratio is great. Basically, you just need to maintain discipline. Yes, the course curriculum is perfectly set for the basic knowledge of the industry.
detailed_review.Other: There are fewer cultural events for engineering students, whereas there are a lot of cultural events for management students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Nirma University is good and it has A+ grade also.

detailed_review.Placements: There are almost 75  students in one division. There are two divisions for civil department. The highest salary package offered is 15 LPA. The average salary package offered is 10 LPA and the lowest salary package offered is 6 LPA. Almost 70% of students get placements. Companies come in 3rd or 4th year to select students. Nirma has high-level companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a big campus for Nirma University and hostel too. There are multiple blocks on campus and every block has a different department. As we know, there is an auditorium also in different blocks and hostels also have all facilities and mess too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very cooperative and most of them are graduates from IIT. Everyone has great experience and knowledge. The whole curriculum is given in mail at start of the year. There are three exams in one semester and it is not too difficult if we study daily.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Strong Placement, Excellent Infrastructure, and Vibrant Campus Life at Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements: Nirma University has strong placements. Around 85-90% of students are placed. The average package is 8-10 LPA. The lowest package is around 4-5 LPA. Top recruiters include Amazon, TCS, Microsoft, Wipro. Many students secure their internship in leading companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university provides excellent infrastructure, including modern classrooms, labs, and large libraries. Hostel offers both AC and non-AC rooms with necessary amenities. Food quality in the mess is decent. Sports facilities are good. Overall, it's a well-maintained campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified, with many professors holding advanced degrees and industry experience. The curriculum is well designed and industry-oriented. Semester exams are tough, with high pass percentage. Regular assessments help in reinforcing concepts throughout the semester.
detailed_review.Other: The fees for the course were around 9.18L for four years, which is on the higher side but justified by the quality of education, infrastructure, and placement opportunities. The campus is vibrant with a diverse student body from across India. Events and sports activities make campus life enjoyable. The peaceful environment for studying and personal growth with easy city connectivity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college comes with great faculties and infrastructure with the best placement for my branch.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 90 percent of students were placed in my course. The highest package was 52 LPA, and the average package was 8.51 LPA last year. There were companies like IBM and Google in my course. Several other companies like Tata and Zomato also came for students. Most of the students got internships in my course, with some of them getting internships in companies like Google and Zomato.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college comes with the best facilities. It has many departments and a huge campus. All classes have Wi-Fi, and you can also use Wi-Fi in labs. The quality of labs is very good. It also provides hostels for students with great quality, and there are 3 canteens which serve great food. It also has the best medical and sports facilities and sports clubs.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculties are highly educated and kind. They are helpful to us; yes, they are well knowledgeable, and the quality of teaching is best. Teaching is relevant to the course curriculum. The semester exams are not very difficult, but they ask tricky questions. The pass percentage is above 90 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIRMA UNIVERSITY .

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, up to 85% of students were placed in B.Tech in chemical. In the current year (2024), around 93% of students were placed in our branch with an average package of 7 LPA and the highest package of 13 LPA. There are a total of up to 80 companies that provide recruitment with high salaries and other great facilities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Have very good facilities like modern classrooms with air conditioning, projectors, lights, and new-style benches and chairs. The hostel fee is around 80000 per year and have the best food quality and other facilities. There are also many sports activities here that will help you to participate at the national level easily.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have a 3-component exam in which 0.3, 0.4, and 0.3 marks will be calculated to make the CGPA. First are 3 class tests, in which the best of 2 will be considered. Then a sessional exam (mid-semester) will be conducted with 60 marks. At last, but not least, the semester end exam will be conducted.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech in chemical because there are very few colleges that have a chemical branch for engineering, and Nirma has one and is very reputed as well as highly valued.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Comprehensive review of Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package for the computer science branch is 6-7 LPA, and the overall placement is good. Approximately 90% of students are placed every year, with the highest package this year being 52 LPA at Google. Top recruiters include Deutsche Bank, DE Shaw, Oracle, and Samsung. For placement-related queries, students can contact the placement cell, known as the III Cell.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facilities at this college are available to female candidates and those in the residential program (MBA). The hostel has a gym, attached wash areas, air-conditioned rooms with attached balconies, a mess, and laundry facilities. The college has a library, computer labs with Wi-Fi, and well-organized classrooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are well qualified, with all of them holding Ph.D. degrees. They have a great depth of knowledge, both conceptual and theoretical. The curriculum is updated regularly, so you are learning the most relevant and up-to-date courses that are in demand in the industry.
detailed_review.Other: Along with the core courses in the computer science branch, we are offered some specialization courses as minors in our syllabus. The focus should be more on gaining practical knowledge than theoretical. Campus life is very happening, along with various facilities for multiple events and equal importance is given to extracurricular activities as well. There are various scholarships opportunities available, such as MYSY, Reliance, SDEF, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of mechanical engineering at Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements:
In mechanical engineering last year, 110 students applied for placement, in which there was 92% placement ratio. The average salary offered was 7.5 LPA and the highest package offered in mechanical was 14 LPA. The lowest package offered was 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies for mechanical are:
Bosch, Tata Motors, Adani, Reliance, Torrent, Power, Tata Power, Mahindra, Amazon, Google, TCS, etc. The roles offered in our college are in IT companies; mostly the roles are managerial roles to lead the team. In power sector and energy sector, mainly the roles of engineer is to design and improve the performance and efficiency of machines. In the manufacturing industry, it is to see and lead the workers and to apply cost-cutting operations. The internships are offered after 6 semesters at the college. Currently, I am studying in the 5th semester, so I have not much idea about it. But companies like ISRO, Adani, BIS, etc. give the projects and internship very much to NIRMA UNIVERSITY. Currently I am also working on project funded by BIS (bureau of Indian standards) in which I have to analyze the design and strength of materials used in transmission lies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of Nirma: sports ground (badminton, cricket, table tennis, volleyball, racing track, tennis), 4 hostels (h1, h2, h3, h4), auditoriums, 3 canteens, medical block, bus facility, computer labs, sitting areas, vending machines, etc. For my department: Wi-Fi, Cad software labs, CAM machines like CNC and VMC, vmc conventional machines in workshop, all core thermodynamics subjects labs, auditorium, non-AC classrooms, mechanical library, centre for robotics lab. In the hostel, the basic facilities were given, like bed, AC, tables and washrooms, induction, fridge, etc. The quality of food in mess and canteen is average only. Once my friend got food poisoning also eating food of mess, so hygiene wise it is poor.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are not at all friendly and they also do not have much knowledge, They only know how to shoot and sell at the students and not know how to teach the subject. Also, the head and teachers will not understand the problems of the students and the new rules made in college are always in the benefit of faculty only. The course curriculum is relevant as we are learning all the core subjects of mechanical. Also, there is a facility to opt for minors, so you can also learn CS law and management subjects even if you are doing mechanical. Yes, there is always a barrier between theoretical engineering and practical engineering, but it is reduced somehow by students of GTU colleges. The end-of-semester exams are moderate, out of which 70% paper is always easy and rest 30% is always difficult, thus you can easily score at least 50-60 marks and get passed. The pass ratio is 85%, so 10–15 students fail the end-of-semester exams and have to give a supplementary exam.
detailed_review.Other: The best things about mechanical is that it is easy and once you know the concepts, you can clear it. Also, manufacturing is more practical and needed in every sector. The main thing all engineers love of mechanical is designing the component and Thermodynamics. Now a days you can analyse where your component will be failing and the critical points using FEA and computational fluid dynamics. Things I wish to get improved are that instead of learning all department subjects in the first year, rather software like SolidWorks, CATIA, and Ansys should be taught in the first year more deeply. Events in Nirma are held most from Jan to April. Main events are vaudeville, ashwamedha, praveg, Kalp, etc. Campus is big and lush green campus. The public coming to Nirma is decent and coming from well-settled families. There are two main scholarships, MYSY and NIRMA SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME; more details you will get on website about it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I was not so worried about the placement rate because they placed all the students.

detailed_review.Placements: At Nirma University, 100 percent of students are placed in different companies. In mechanical engineering, the highest package is up to 15 lacs, and the lowest package is about 6 Lacs. TATA, RELIANCE, ADANI, MARUTI, and L&T are among the companies recruiting at Nirma University. Roles offered are maintenance engineer, supervisors, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Nirma University campus is beautiful. So many trees are on campus. The campus is so large. Nirma provides us with facilities like advanced labs with the latest technology, and an air-conditioned classroom with a projector and step-wise seating arrangement. Nirma provides wi-fi facilities, but only for laptops and not for mobile devices.
detailed_review.Faculty: In Nirma University, professors are mostly IITIANS. They are most helpful. The course curriculum is relevant to the actual industries. At Nirma University, they provide industry visits each semester. Therefore, we are seeing how we learned and how this is implemented in real industry.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the mechanical because this branch is the only green branch in all branches. The best thing about my course is that we learn about manufacturing processes, which help you when you open your own company.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life of Nirma University!

detailed_review.Placements: In my branch, there was around a 98% placement ratio. The highest package was 15 lakhs per annum, the average package was 9 lakhs per annum, and the minimum package was 5 lakhs per annum. All students are placed with very named companies with assurance by the university. There are also other clubs for extra activities for students, and I joined Team Stallion as my branch; you can check it on IG also.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college, the infrastructure is very beautiful and simple, so even though some blocks are 30 years old, they all look awesome. There are hostels for MBA students and girls, but sometimes they are full, and MBA students have no chance for it.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is decent, but the teachers have the mindset that if students want to learn, they have to come to them and ask. No student will be industry-ready at the university level, and the difficulty of papers is mid-range. If you focus in class, you must pass the exam; the passing marks are 35% of the total marks.
detailed_review.Other: I come from a manufacturing background of brass items, so my background and interest are the same, which is why I chose mechanical engineering. I am in the TFWS category; in this category, you only have to pay the exam fee of your college, in my case, that is only 3500 per semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: 4 years of my journey at Nirma University.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are good but a little less compared to the previous year because the situation in the market currently is not good. There are companies like Oracle, Detautche bank, etc. coming for hiring. 90% students got placed. The highest  offered is 55 lace which is off-campus and the lowest may be 3-4 lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the college is quite good having a lush green campus with many trees. Wi-Fi is enabled in the campus. There is a canteen name Mohani, the food prices are affordable and the quality of food is very good. The second canteen is the law canteen where the price is a little higher but they provide many types of restaurant-like items. The Library is very good and is enabled with Wi-Fi, all books are available there.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my CSE branch, the faculty is good and well qualified with all the assistant professors having Ph.D. degrees. The quality of the course is good but not enough to crack placements, you need to prepare yourself to get placed. There is a good community of coding culture. The course does not make the students industry ready but those who are intelligent, prepare themselves. The semester exams are moderate.

college_info.college_name: Institute of Technology Course Admissions 2026: Fees, Eligibility, Dates & Selection Process

admission.title: Institute of Technology, Nirma University Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: Institute of Technology, Nirma University admission is mainly entrance-based. The institute offers BTech, MTech, MCA, and PhD programmes across multiple faculties. The seat allocation fpr BTech at the institute is done through ACPC, All India quota via JEE Main, and management quota. Students at Institute of Technology, Nirma University , must apply separately to ACPC for state quota seats and follow institute norms for other categories. Scholarships and reservations are provided as per university regulations. Interested students can read the following article to know all about the courses and admission criteria of the INTU .

faqs.question: How many marks are required in JEE Main to get admission in Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: For obtaining entry to Institute of Technology, Nirma University from JEE Main, candidates needs a very good score. It changes yearly with respect to courses and categories. For highly competitive courses like CSE, below 25,000 rank would be the desirable one. Though official cutoffs are issued in the course of counselling.

faqs.question: Can I get admission at Institute of Technology, Nirma University without an Entrance Exam?
faqs.answer: Admission to institute of technology, Nirma university is entrance based into all major courses in the university. GUJCET/JEE Main is required to get BTech and GATE is needed to get MTech. One cannot directly be admitted without the qualifying exams.

faqs.question: Can I take admission to Institute of Technology, Nirma University with 70% in Class 12?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply to Institute of Technology, Nirma University with 70% in Class 12 because the cutoff is 60%. But that also depends on your entrance exam marks. You must appear for JEE Main or GUJCET to be eligible. Merit is both academically and entrance performance-based.

faqs.question: How to get admission in Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: To obtain admission in Institute of Technology, Nirma University, candidates have to appear in entrance examinations like JEE Main, GATE, or GUJCET depending on the course. Candidates should apply under ACPC or the All India quota, as per eligibility. Counselling and seat allocation are done subsequent to the entrance results. Seat finalization by document verification and payment of fees is done.

faqs.question: What is the GUJCET cutoff for B.Tech course at Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Institute of Technology accepts GUJCET entrance exam scores for admission to the BE/ BTech courses. The GUJCET 2024 cutoff has been released up to Round 3, wherein B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering was the most competitive course with a closing rank for 302 for the students belonging to the General Home State quota. During the 2023 cutoff, the GUJCET Round 3 closing rank was 228 . Candidates can refer to the table below to check out the Institute of Technology GUJCET Round 3 cutoff trends for the past three years for BTech in CSE for General category in HS quota.

faqs.question: What is the JEE Advanced cut off for B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering at IIT Dhanbad (ISM) - Indian Institute of Technology (ISM)?
faqs.answer: During the IIT Dhanbad JEE Advanced cutoff 2024 , BTech in Computer Science and Engineering had the highest cutoff. The Last Round closing ranks ranged between 3846 and 16011 for students from the General AI quota. In the first round, the IIT Dhanbad CSE 2024 cutoff was 3594 . Due to the cutoff, IIT Dhanbad- (ISM Dhanbad) BTech course was the most competitive to get admission to.

faqs.question: How many seats are available for the BTech programme at Shri GS Institute of Technology & Science Indore?
faqs.answer: Shri GS Institute of Technology & Science Indore college also offers B.Tech degrees to students. The following seats are available for the B.E./B.Tech. program: Engineering in Biomedicine: 60 seats, with 3 NRI seats.90 seats in civil engineering, including 5 NRI seats.120 places in computer Science and engineering, including 6 NRI seats.90 places in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, including 5 NRI seats.

faqs.question: What is the GUJCET cutoff score for admission to BTech programme at ITNU?
faqs.answer: The Institute of Technology gives admission to the BTech courses through scores of GUJCET entrance exams. The GUJCET 2024 cutoff has also been announced up to Round 3, in which BTech in CSE was the most sought-after course and had a closing rank of 302 for students under the General Home State quota. Candidates can refer to the following table for more information:

faqs.question: How can I get admission in M.Tech at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: For getting admission in M.Tech in Institute of Technology, Nirma University, the candidates should either qualify GATE or sit for the written test conducted by the university. Preference is given to the GATE-qualified candidates in the merit-based selection. Candidates should also possess a BTech degree in the concerned field from a recognised university. The selection is competitive and on academic and test merit.

faqs.question: Is GATE compulsory for M.Tech admission at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: No, GATE is not mandatory for admission to M.Tech in Institute of Technology, Nirma University. If a student has not cleared GATE, he or she can take a written entrance test conducted by the university. Still, preference will be given to GATE-qualified candidates in the merit list. Admission is offered on the basis of performance in the test and eligibility.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for M.Tech at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: For M.Tech at Institute of Technology, Nirma University, a candidate should have passed BTech in the same stream. The degree must be from a recognised university or institution. Admission is by GATE or a written examination for non-GATE candidates. Relevant subject knowledge from the undergraduate level is necessary for each specialisation.

faqs.question: What is the course fee for a two-year M.Tech at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: Nirma University's total fee for the MTech courses is INR 2.8 lakh . Moreover, the one-time payment is INR 11,000 and can be part of the overall fee structure, which includes tuition fees, hostel fees, and other expenses. Candidates can look at the following Nirma University M.Tech fee structure: NOTE: The mentioned fee is taken from the official website/sanctioning body. It is still subject to change and, hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in MCA at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: To get admitted in MCA at Institute of Technology, Nirma University, the candidates should appear for GUJCET and go through the ACPC counselling process. The admission is through the merit list drawn up by ACPC on the basis of scores in GUJCET. The candidates should also meet the minimum eligibility of a bachelor's degree with 50% aggregate. The final admission is granted after document verification and payment of fees.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for MCA at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: Applicants for MCA in Institute of Technology, Nirma University should have a bachelor's degree in any discipline. General category applicants need at least 50% aggregate marks. Admission also depends on GUJCET performance and ACPC counselling participation. One should have a degree from a recognised university.

faqs.question: Is GUJCET mandatory for MCA admission at Institute of Technology, Nirma University?
faqs.answer: Yes, GUJCET is required for MCA admission in the Institute of Technology, Nirma University. Admission is provided on merit through ACPC counselling, which takes into account GUJCET marks. The candidates need to qualify for the exam first and then apply for counselling. Without appearing in GUJCET, one cannot be eligible for the MCA seat allotment.

The college offers admission to the offered programmes based on the entrance exam scores of the candidates. The minimum eligibility to apply for UG courses is Class 12, whereas graduation is required for PG programmes. facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Institute of Technology, Nirma University has a fully automated library catering to the information needs of more than 4,000 users. Stocked with over 55,000 books, 4409 bound volumes, 243 current subscriptions to journals, magazines and newspapers, 2020 standards and 700 e-journals from ASCE, IEEE/IET, ACM, etc. the library has   adopted open source software ‘KOHA’ for integrated library management. The library is also an institution member of The British Library – Ahmedabad, Institute of Engineers – Kolkata, Indian Society for Earthquake Technology (ISET), Developing Library Network (DELNET), Indian Geo-technical Society, The Computer Society of India (CSI).

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Institute of Technology, Nirma University provides hostel facilities only for post graduate students. All the hostels have basic amenities like water purifiers, common room, recreation room, mess, TV, laundry services, security and surveillance system etc.

college_info.college_name: NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology: Courses, Fees, Admission 2026, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology is a private university located in Bengaluru. The university was established in 2001 by the NITTE Education Trust. The university has been approved by the AICTE with an Platinum Grade accreditation. While the NAAC also accredits the university with an 'A+' grade. The NMIT is affiliated with the Visvesvaraya Technological University.
NITTE Meenakshi Bangalore offers a plethora of NBA-accredited tier-1 UG courses and has been ranked among the top Engineering institutes in Bangalore. To promote multi-disciplinary research, NMIT has started 11 state-of-the-art Centres of Excellence on subjects such as Space Research, Robotics Research, etc. The students of the batch 2025 secured the highest package package of INR 58.93 LPA. More than 300 companies participated during NMIT Bangalore placements 2025 and presented over 1200 jobs to the students.
The top recruiters of NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology Bengaluru Karnataka in 2025 include Nvidia, PwC, Intel, INfosys, Wipro, Hitachi, etc. Following are some key highlights of NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology:

college_info_program.intro:
NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology offers UG and PG courses are affiliated with VTU. The popular programmes are BTech and MBA. Some of the BTech specialisations include Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Computer Science & Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and others. Accepted exams include the KCET and Comed-K examination. For the Management category, the admissions will be based on the merit and NMIT online entrance examination.
MBA programme is offered through the Department of Management Studies at the institute. The Management Department is an approved research centre for the University of Mysore and Visvesvaraya Technological University. The institute offers these courses for the duration of 2 years to 4 years with tuition fees varying from INR 6 Lakh to INR 14 Lakh.

NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Structural Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good for the masters.

detailed_review.Placements: Students are eligible for placements from the 3rd semester. Companies such as Atkins, Brigade, and Shoba visited the college. The highest package offered is 7 LPA. About 70 percent of students got placed. I plan to do a Ph.D. after this. The college provides internship opportunities. Stipends vary, with some being unpaid. Projects include various attributes, helping students gain hands-on experience and industry exposure from time to time as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NMIT provides on-campus hostels for both boys and girls with 1689 capacity. Twin-sharing rooms are available for 1st year students. Second year onwards, boys may opt for twin-sharing or four-sharing rooms. Wi-Fi all over the campus with CCTV security. Computer labs are spacious and have a good number of PCs. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated, and also air-conditioned. The library is good, and open till 12:00 AM.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio in my college is decent, ensuring that students get enough attention. Most of the professors are approachable and willing to help if you put in the effort to interact with them. There are two semesters in the first year. In the second year, there are presentations, journal club, research work, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a very expensive college, but in Bangalore, it is common.

detailed_review.Placements: Coming to the campus placements, the placements have been going on for almost 4 months, and the majority of my friends have been placed. To be honest, they have multiple offers. Each person has gotten a minimum offer of 4 LPA, and the big companies are ready to come, so coming to the placements, they are really good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: On campus, international students live in the hostel. All the students are helpful and belong to other parts of the world and the country. Mostly, 5:2 boys to girls live in the hostel campus, and there is equal respect for all. We celebrate all important functions on the hostel campus together. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated. The hostel is good, and their mess is super. I'm sure you won't get better food at home than in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: To be honest, the course I am pursuing is nothing new, and when it comes to relevance, the teaching staff is doing everything they can to give us more internships or call industry persons to do some seminars, so we are up to date on the industry trends and not just studying what's in the book. For the most part, the faculty is really chill and relaxed. They are extremely cooperative. The non-teaching staff are also very chill.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Structural Engineering
reviews.review_title: Please do some serious study and aim for IIT.

detailed_review.Placements: Students are eligible for placements from the 3rd sem. Companies such as Atkins Brigade and Shoba visited the college. The highest package offered was 7LPA. 70 Percent of students got placed. I plan to do a Ph.D. after this. There were internships provided by TCS Wipro and many companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library was vast with lots of books available. The classroom had projectors. We had a huge ground for sports. Clubs such as theatre club fashion club etc. Hostels were good they were mostly two seated. Mess food was average. Wi-Fi was all over the campus. There were cricket grounds volleyball court and many other grounds present.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members were good and they taught very nicely. They start from basics and teach you in detail. They were highly experienced and very friendly and they always try their best to solve our problems. They conduct regular tests and exams. There were two semesters in a year and each semester had two sessions which were conducted by the college. The course curriculum was well structure and relevant covering the key concepts with practical applications. It prepares students for real world challenges but could include more hands on training.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I’m fortunate to be part of this institution.

detailed_review.Placements: About 40% of students are placed as of now. 15 LPA is the highest and 6 LPA is the lowest. Some Japanese companies, Oracle, Rabbit AI, Capgemini, and Accenture are the top recruiters. About internships, I don't have any idea. Roles offered are AI analyst, assistant engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms come with LED screens, a projector, and Wi-Fi. Hostels are provided with all the amenities, but students have to compromise with food. I’m a day scholar but have friends in the hostel who give mixed reviews about the hostel facilities. They have 24/7 medical support.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching is top, with well-qualified lecturers, many lecturers are Ph.D. holders. The course curriculum is updated as per the 2020 syllabus. Many subjects are related to current technological developments. Exams are pretty complex and easy by the way. The pass percentage is high.
detailed_review.Other: I got this course based on my DCET rank. Not everything is perfect in the course or college, but the college vibe is different, green everywhere, stress-free. Often, there are cultural activities going on, and yearly a grand college festival is arranged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: We have good faculty and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 90% of students are placed in our course. The highest package is 8 LPA. The lowest is 4 LPA. The average package is around 6 LPA. The top recruiting companies include Microsoft and TCS. Around 80% of students receive internship opportunities. The top roles offered are HR and Manager positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department facilities are good, and the overall infrastructure is also good. We have Wi-Fi in every classroom within the department. The library facilities are also good. The hostel is good with decent food. Rooms and washrooms are also good. There is also a ground in front of the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are friendly, good at teaching, and well-qualified with subject knowledge. The curriculum is relevant and helps make students industry-ready. Exams can be difficult, but they are manageable. Sometimes the exams are easy as well, and a question bank is provided. The teachers are very helpful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Aeronautical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and teachers.

detailed_review.Placements: Japanese placements pay 22 LPA available for all the branches in BE and B.Tech. The placement coordinators are really good, and they help with everything you want. All Japanese companies atleast 13 of them will come for the recruitment of the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good library. It has collection of online and offline books. We have good facilities. Good interaction is there with students. We have good football court for playing games. There is a basketball court as well for sports. It has good facilities in general. The clubs are good as well in all departments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Everything is relevant to the course. Teachers are highly knowledgeable. The exams are easy and whatever is taught will come in the exams. The students are industry-ready for placements, higher education, and training for the same will be provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: A wonderful experience in this green campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80 to 85% of students are placed in my course. The highest package is 46 LPA, and the lowest is about 6 LPA. Companies like L&T, Infosys, and Intel come to our college for recruitment. Top roles offered are scrum master, project lead, testing engineer, and program developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the rooms are well-maintained and very hygienic. The food is good but it provides the same food every week. There is a medical center. There are various labs with high technology. There are places where students get a chance to focus on physical development. There is a gym and sports activities too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified. They help us and guide us clearly. Unless we go, nobody will approach. So if we approach them, they will always be there for us. Our curriculum is more course outcome-oriented. Exams are easy if you study well. Our college is strict in discipline.
detailed_review.Other: My course offers me all the things. We have great clubs available to join. Our college fest Anaadhyantha is the biggest 2 day fest. We enjoy a lot, and there are a lot of opportunities for us to develop both personally and professionally. There is a special team that looks after student's mental well-being.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Aeronautical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is quite good until it became a university and stopped taking admissions from COMEDK and KCET.

detailed_review.Placements: I have seen people getting placed at good offers, and a few at more than 30 LPA, which can be considered good. However, not all departments have this situation, and people should also have the necessary skills for it. After all, it is ultimately about the skills you have.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have big rooms in the hostels and smart classrooms in the college, with good sanitation that gets cleaned daily. There is a big football ground, and Wi-Fi is available 24/7 in the hostels. The mess food is not quite to my liking, even though they have improved it.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my department, the faculty is quite good, very helpful, and kind. Even though they are strict, they are ultimately still kind and helpful. They are very well-qualified and knowledgeable. The first four semesters are easy, and among them, the even semesters are even easier.
detailed_review.Other: It is my interest in aerospace and aeronautical that drew me to this course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good learning environment with supportive faculty and strong placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, around 75–80 percent of eligible students get placed. The packages ranges from 3.5-18 LPA, and the average is about 6–7 LPA. Top recruiters include Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, PwC, Deloitte, Bosch, and L&T Technology Services. Nearly 60 percent of students also secure internships with companies like Bosch, Infosys, PwC, Deloitte, and several Bengaluru-based startups. The roles offered are diverse. It ranges from software development, data analysis, and system engineering to consulting. A smaller group also receive opportunities in cybersecurity and embedded systems. It aligns more closely with the core electronics background of the course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department offers a supportive academic environment with well equipped classrooms. Along with projectors and campus-wide Wi-Fi. It makes learning more interactive. Labs, especially in electronics, VLSI, and computing, are regularly updated. This gives us practical exposure beyond theory. The central library is a major advantage. It has a wide collection of books, journals, and digital resources. Along with quiet study space for focused learning.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty at our course are very supportive, approachable, and knowledgeable in their subjects. Most of them have strong academic backgrounds. Some bring in industry exposure. It helps bridge the gap between theory and practice. The teaching quality is good overall. Teachers encouraging questions and discussions rather than just focusing on lectures. The curriculum is designed to cover both core electronics and emerging fields like programming, data structures, and communication systems. While it provides a solid foundation, students often supplement it with online courses or internships to become more industry-ready, especially for software roles.
detailed_review.Other: I am a part of the Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE) batch. I am graduating in 2026. I chose this because it combines hardware and software knowledge. It gives me to select multiple career paths. One of the best thing about the course is the mix of theory and practical exposure through labs, projects, and internships. It really helps in building problem-solving skills and adaptability. Campus life is vibrant and diverse. We have technical and cultural fests, clubs, and student communities. It encourages participation beyond academics. The campus crowd is friendly and collaborative. It makes group activities enjoyable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: A short note on NMIT College.

detailed_review.Placements: The salary packages vary with the highest being 7 LPA, the lowest at 4 LPA and an average package between 5 to 6.5 LPA. Top recruiters included Qcrete Readymix, Agrima Roofing and Tata Steel. Approximately 30 to 50 percent of students secured internships with notable companies like Coca Cola and Puravankara. The most common roles offered were in project management, design, and testing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi in NMIT is very poor, and the mobile network is hectic. I hate this thing about our college, the Wi-Fi network is not good, and mobile network is the worst. We can't send any message, or sometimes we don't get OTPs, etc. The labs here are good, and the systems are new, and they run smoothly.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers at NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology (NMIT) are highly qualified and knowledgeable, with many holding PhDs, and they provide significant support to students. The institution is autonomous, which allows it to regularly update its curriculum to stay relevant to the demands of the IT industry. The programme is structured to make students ready for employment, including topics like Big Data and IoT, and requires mandatory internships. While the final exams are challenging, a high percentage of students successfully pass their courses.
detailed_review.Other: The Civil Engineering branch at NMIT, Bangalore, which began in the academic year 2009-10, offers a four-year B.Tech programme known for its qualified faculty and well-equipped labs featuring industry-standard software like AutoCAD and STAAD Pro. The college is recognised for its peaceful, green campus and a lively student crowd, with an active calendar of events including the annual techno-cultural fest Anaadyanta.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good placements, helpful faculty members, and decent infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: In our course, around 80-85% of students got placed during the last placement season. The highest package offered is around 24 LPA, the average is 6 LPA to 7 LPA, and the lowest is about 3.5 LPA. Top recruiters included Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Accenture, Deloitte, Capgemini, and a few product-based companies like Microsoft and Bosch. Nearly 70% of students also secured internships in reputed companies such as IBM, Cognizant, and Tech Mahindra. Top roles offered included software engineer, data analyst, associate consultant, and developer positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides good infrastructure for both academics and hostel. Classrooms are spacious and equipped with smart boards, while the labs are well-maintained with high-speed internet and updated software for practical learning. Library has a wide collection of books and digital resources. Wi-Fi is available across the campus and hostel. The food in the mess and canteen is average but hygienic, with multiple options available. Medical facilities are provided on campus along with emergency support. There are also good sports facilities for both indoor and outdoor games, encouraging students to participate in extracurricular activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our department are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable in their respective subjects. Most of them focus on both theoretical and practical aspects, which makes the classes engaging. The curriculum is relevant and regularly updated to include the latest industry trends, especially in emerging technologies. This helps students gain skills that are useful in placements and internships. Semester exams are moderately difficult, but with proper preparation, students can perform well. The pass percentage is generally good, and continuous internal assessment also helps students improve their scores.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: An average College with a good placement ratio.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of the students are placed in my course. The highest package is 28 LPA,  and the average package is around 4 to 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Adobe and TCS. Around 80% of students got internship. Roles provided in the companies are full stack developers, web developers, app developers, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Faculty members are all good. They are good, knowledgeable, and all classrooms have access to Wi-Fi.  Love for different types of things. Library is overall good facilities. We got a ground to play on, and the canteen and the Mess are also nice. The food served is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching qualities are nice. Curriculum is good, and it makes the student ready for the industry. Semester exams are medium level difficult. Learn to read this college. The course of everything is good.
detailed_review.Other: I was interested in it, I am in Computer Science and Engineering. The best thing is that I got to learn many different things. I think more practicality than theory or improving my course, there is one event known as anadyanta that happens each year around April. That is the only event happening there.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has supportive faculty, a strong curriculum, and good placements. It is a great choice for E&C.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 86-90% of eligible ECE students got placed in recent years. The highest package offered ranges between 28-35 LPA. The average package ranges from 6-13 LPA. Core and hardware companies like Qualcomm (Japan), Intel, Bosch India, Texas Instruments, Nvidia, Mercedes, Sony, Nokia, and L&T Technology Services visit the college for placements. Students also get placed in IT and software companies like IBM, Infosys, Wipro, TCS, Accenture, Microsoft, Oracle, and PhonePe.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are four boys' hostels and two girls' hostels. Rooms are furnished with a bed, study table, chair, wardrobe, shared common rooms, TV, reading or music rooms, solar water heaters, LAN+Wi-Fi, 24x7 power backup via generators, water coolers, and full security with CCTV. Mess offers both North and South Indian meals, with options to order extra items beyond the standard menu.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are diverse in academic and industrial experience. They are well-qualified. Many of them are PhD holders with strong industry or research backgrounds. Faculty members are generally friendly, approachable, and student-oriented. They often use practical examples and real-life scenarios in teaching.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NMIT Bengaluru provides good placements for students.

detailed_review.Placements: Varied placements statistics for the 2025 batch. With approximately 75 to 80% of students securing placements, depending on the branch. The highest package for Computer Science is around 20 LPA. The minimum is 4-5 LPA. Top companies are Nutaix, London Stock Exchange, Infosys, etc. Some reviews mention that the highest package offered was 30 LPA, with an average package of around 7.6 LPA. However, there is also mention of placements being more favorable for students in IT and related branches, while those in core branches like mechanical or electrical might find it more challenging to secure a job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. The college has classrooms, labs, and libraries with high-speed internet facilities provided. You can make self-preparation on your own.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are experienced. They are well supported for students and placement in ECE, most of all, by experienced faculty. The faculty at Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology (NMIT), particularly in departments like Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE), is generally considered qualified, experienced, and approachable.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Good placements and lectures.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 85% of students got placed. The highest salary package offered was 10 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies were Wipro, TCS, and Amazon. Top roles offered were product manager and marketing manager. Around 60% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College provided good hotel facilities like mineral water, water coolers, and washing machines. The bedrooms were good with attached bathrooms. The food quality was good. College infrastructure was good. The classrooms were in good condition. Labs were well qualified. Wi-Fi connection was available. Many books were available in the library. The medical facilities were good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were good at our college. Teachers were well-qualified and knowledgeable. They had a lot of experience. They were very friendly and helpful. Their teaching quality was good. The course curriculum was superb. Semester exams were easy to pass, and the pass percentage was 70%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely one of the best colleges in Bangalore. The faculty members are well.

detailed_review.Placements: This college is very good in terms of placements. But the management is not up to the mark. About 80-90% of the students will get the campus selection. The highest package is more than 40 LPA which is a very good package. Top recruiting companies like Google, Capgemini, Wipro, Infosys, etc., come for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has covered a good amount of area which is around 23 acres. College will provide free Wi-Fi, labs, and library for every student. Taking about the quality of the facilities in the hostel is very nice. The mess food has very much homely feel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members here are very much experienced. They have experience of our age. They are really helpful and they have a brilliant and huge amount of knowledge. They are building us for the next industry, and the course curriculum is very much relevant to the current world. Semester exams are not difficult and not too easy, they are moderate we can score easily.
detailed_review.Other: I chose computer science engineering because of my strong interest in technology, software development, and how digital systems influence the world. NMIT is one of the reputed colleges offering good placement opportunities, a solid curriculum, and a peaceful learning environment in Bangalore.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college's structure and infrastructure attract you more, and the faculty members are friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology (NMIT) has a strong placement record, with around 94% of students placed in 2024. The highest package offered is 47 LPA, and the average is 6.06 LPA, with top branches like CSE and ISE averaging 7-8 LPA. Top recruiters include Amazon, Microsoft, Deloitte, and Infosys. About 30% of students secured internships, often with stipend of up to 1 lakh per month, at companies like Dell, TCS, and Wipro. Key roles offered are software developer, data scientist, and AI/ML engineer. NMIT is well-regarded for its training support, especially in teach-related branches, and is a solid choice for engineering aspirants in Bangalore.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology (NMIT) offers excellent infrastructure, including smart classrooms, high-speed Wi-Fi campus, and advanced labs for AI, ML, and core engineering fields. The central library is well-equipped with books, journals, and digital resources. Hostels are clean, secure, and provide Wi-Fi, laundry, and recreational areas. The mess serves hygienic South Indian meals, while the canteen offers varied snacks and North Indian options. On-campus medical facilities and emergency care are available. NMIT also has strong sports infrastructure for cricket, football, basketball, and indoor games. Overall, the campus ensures a balanced academic and residential experience for its students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at NMIT are well-qualified, supportive, and experienced in their respective fields. Most professors hold postgraduate or doctoral degrees and are approachable for academic guidance. The teaching quality is good, with practical learning, projects, and industry-relevant topics included. The curriculum is regularly updated to include emerging technologies like AI, ML, and Data Science, making students industry-ready. Semester exams are moderate difficult, focusing on both concepts and application. With proper preparation, they are manageable. The overall pass percentage is high, around 85-90%, as continuous assessment and lab work help students stay engaged and perform well academically throughout the semester.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course at NMIT for its strong academic foundation, industry-relevant curriculum, and excellent placement opportunities. The best aspects include hands-on labs, exposure to technologies like AI, ML, and IoT, and supportive faculty. The course prepares students well for industry roles. However, more internship opportunities and diverse electives would enhance the learning experience. The campus hosts vibrant fests like Anaadyanta, offers active clubs, and encourages extracurricular activities. The student crowd is friendly and diverse. NMIT is well-connected to the city with a peaceful environment. Scholarships are available for meritorious students, making it a well-rounded experience both academically and socially.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and active campus life with decent placements and supportive faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: I was part of the 2023 ECE batch at NMIT Bengaluru, with around 78% of students placed. The average package is 6.5 LPA. Top recruiters included Bosch, TCS, and Capgemini. About 65% of students got internships in companies like L&T and HCL in core and software roles.

detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at NMIT are helpful and well-qualified. The teaching quality is good. The curriculum is relevant and industry-focused. Semester exams are moderately tough, with a pass percentage of around 85% to 90% for most of them.
detailed_review.Other: I was part of the 2023 ECE batch at NMIT Bengaluru and chose the course due to my interest in electronics. Labs and project work are the best parts, but the syllabus needs more industry updates. The campus is lively with fests, good crowds, decent connectivity, and active clubs and sports.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, quality of education is good in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: About 75% of students got placed in our course. The highest package is 28 LPA. Average package is 13 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA to 5 LPA. Top recruitment companies are Intel and Qualcomm. Around 60 to 75% of our students got internships at Qualcomm and Bosch India. Top roles include network engineer and VLSI design designer.

Hostel food is average, not that great. The food in canteen is a bit expensive. Medical facilities are good with proper treatment. You have well-supportive coaches and trainers for sports and games.

Pass percentage is about 30 to 35%.
