college_info.college_name: NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology Admission 2026: Application, Eligibility, Fee and Seats

admission.title: NMIT Bangalore Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text:
NMIT Bangalore admission 2026 is entrance-based. The institute conducts NUCAT or Nitte University Common Admission Test for admission to UG and PG courses. NMIT Bangalore offers courses at UG, PG and doctoral levels in Engineering, Management and Computer Applications streams. The deemed-to-be university offers courses such as BTech, BSc (Hons), MTech, MBA and MCA programmes. Besides, the institute offers PhD in various departments from Visveswaraya Technological University, Belgaum & University of Mysore . NMIT is a part of NITTE university, Mangalore . Interested candidates can apply online for the preferred course.

Below is the overview of NMIT Bangalore admission process :

For BTech

For MBA/ MTech

Candidates have to reach out to NMIT Bangalore admission office for admission through Management Quota.

faqs.question: Are admissions open at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology admissions are currently open for 2026 session. Interested candidates can apply online for the preferred course. Aspirants have to submit their application form and appear for the required entrance test. Admission to NMIT Bangalore UG and PG courses is based on NUCAT score. Aspirants must pass NUCAT with a good score for admission.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology offers a wide range of programmes at the undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral levels. Admission in the undergraduate and postgraduate level programmes are entirely on the basis of performance of the candidates in the entrance examination. Candidates need to appear for NUCAT for admission. Nitte University Common Admission Test (NUCAT) is a multiple-choice test conducted for 120 minutes. Once selected, candidates are allotted seat in the deemed-to-be university.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Yes, NITTE Meenakshi conducts NUCAT for admission to UG and PG courses. Nitte University Common Admission Test (NUCAT) is conducted in online mode for 120 minutes. Candidates seeking admission in BTech, MTech, MBA, MCA or BSc (Hons) courses at NMIT Bangalore must have a valid score in NUCAT. Aspirants need to participate in counselling and seat allotment with their rank for final admission.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to MBA at NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology - NMIT?
faqs.answer: Greetings, No, you are not eligible for direct admission to NITTE Meenakshi Institute of Technology's MBA programme (NMIT). For its MBA program, NMIT has a rigorous entrance-based admissions procedure. This is an overview: admission Exams: To be eligible to apply, you must take one of the following national admission exams and receive a valid score: XAT (Xavier Aptitude Test), MAT (Management Aptitude Test), and CAT (Common Admission Test) Procedure for Selection: Your performance in the group discussion (GD) and personal interview (PI) phases, prior academic standing, work experience (if any), and admission exam score are all taken into consideration when shortlisting candidates. Regards

faqs.question: What is the BTech eligibility at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have passed Class 12 with English as one of the languages and obtained 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology are eligible to apply for the NMIT Bangalore BTech programme.

faqs.question: What is the BTech fee at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for NMIT Bangalore BTech programme ranges between INR 6 lakh and INR 14 lakh . The total fee is a cumulative of components such as exam fee, caution deposit, etc. Besides, aspirants also need to pay an exam fee of INR 1,000. Aspirants need to pay the course fee at the time of admission to confirm their seats in the institute.

faqs.question: Which are the BTech specialisations offered at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore offers four-year full-time BTech programme at the UG level. The course is spread across eight semesters and is available in 11 specialisations. Below are some of the BTech specialisations offered at NMIT:

faqs.question: Am I eligible for a job in the public sector after completing a BTech from NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Yes, BTech graduates who have completed their degrees from NMIT Bangalore are eligible to work for the public sector of India. This happens because the government sector employs engineers in various capacities. However, getting a government job can be tough, because these jobs provide many benefits, such as tax deductions, good pay, job stability, incentives, and more. Students who have completed a BTech degree from DCRUST are eligible to apply for a job in the public sector of India. Indian Railways, ONGC, BHEL, ISRO are some of the leading government organisations that actively recruit BTech graduates. Generally, BTech graduates are offered entry-level positions, such as Research Assistant, Jr. Developer, Software Engineer, Quality Analyst, and such. At these jobs, students can expect to get a salary ranging from INR 6 LPA to INR 8 LPA.

faqs.question: Is MBA expensive at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee of MBA is INR 7 lakh. The total fee includes caution deposit, tuition fee, exam fee, etc. Candidates are required to pay the course fee after completion of all the selection rounds to confirm their seats. In case, a candidate is unable to pay the fee within the specified time, his or her admission will stand cancelled. Aspirants will also need to pay a registration fee to apply for admission.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to MBA at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology admission 2026 for the MBA programme is entirely entrance based. Candidates cannot get direct admission in the MBA. To take admission in the MBA programme, candidates must have to appear for NUCAT conducted by NITTE Meenakshi University. Besides, aspirants must also fulfil the eligibility requirements for admission.

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for MBA course at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: There are a total of 120 seats available in NMIT Bangalore MBA programme. Candidates are offered seats in MBA programme based on NUCAT score. NUCAT is an online test of two hours. The test comprises multiple-choice questions of a total of 120 marks. Once selected based on NUCAT rank, MBA aspirants need to pay the course fee to confirm their seat.

faqs.question: what is the eligibility criteria to take admission in MBA at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Banagalore offers three porgrammes at PG level. The admission to 50% of MBA / MCA / M.Tech seats is through a valid score in PGCET and the remaining 50% admissions are done through Management quota. AICTE has approved an additional 15% seats for foreign nationals/PIO/NRI/students whose parents work in Gulf countries over and above the sanctioned intake. Candidates who have passed graduation with 50% and for candidates from Karnataka belonging to SC/ST and category-1 with 45% are eligible to apply for the programme. Candidates who wants to apply must have a valid score in PGCET / KMAT / CMAT .

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for M.Tech at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore M.Tech admission is entrance based. Candidates who have a BTech or BE qualification with minimum 50% aggregate (candidates from Karnataka belonging to SC/ ST and Category-1 must obtain at least 45% aggregate) in the qualifying examination can apply for admission in the M.Tech programme. Further, candidates must appear for Karnataka PGCET or GATE (for admission through the management quota).

faqs.question: Which are the MTech specialisations offered at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore offers a two-year full-time MTech programme. Passed BE/B.Tech in relevant subjects with a minimum of 50% aggregate are eligible to apply for MTech. The course is available in four specialisations, namely:

faqs.question: What is the MTech fee at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology charges tuition fees, hostel fees and one-time registration fees from candidates who want to take admission in the M.Tech programme. The total tuition fee for NMIT Bangalore MTech ranges between INR 1.4 lakh and INR 6 lakh . Besides, aspirants also need to pay an application fee in the start to register for MTech. Aspirants must pay the course fee to confirm their seat in the institute.

faqs.question: What is the seat reservation policy for M.Tech programme at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT has the seats reserved in its M.Tech programme for candidates who take admission to the programme through different entrance exams and quotas. Additionally, AICTE has also approved 15% extra seats for foreign nationals/ PIO/ NRI students whose parents work in the Gulf countries. Given below is the NMIT Bangalore M.Tech seat reservation for 2024: Examination/ Quota Percentage of Seats Reserved Karnataka PGCET 80% Management Quota 20% Note: This information is sourced from the official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

This is an overview: admission Exams: To be eligible to apply, you must take one of the following national admission exams and receive a valid score: XAT (Xavier Aptitude Test), MAT (Management Aptitude Test), and CAT (Common Admission Test) Procedure for Selection: Your performance in the group discussion (GD) and personal interview (PI) phases, prior academic standing, work experience (if any), and admission exam score are all taken into consideration when shortlisting candidates. Regards Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the BTech eligibility at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have passed Class 12 with English as one of the languages and obtained 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology are eligible to apply for the NMIT Bangalore BTech programme. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the BTech fee at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for NMIT Bangalore BTech programme ranges between INR 6 lakh and INR 14 lakh . The total fee is a cumulative of components such as exam fee, caution deposit, etc. Besides, aspirants also need to pay an exam fee of INR 1,000. Aspirants need to pay the course fee at the time of admission to confirm their seats in the institute. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which are the BTech specialisations offered at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore offers four-year full-time BTech programme at the UG level. The course is spread across eight semesters and is available in 11 specialisations. Below are some of the BTech specialisations offered at NMIT: Computer Science & Engineering Information Science & Engineering Electronics & Communication Engineering Mechanical Engineering Civil Engineering Aeronautical Engineering, etc. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Am I eligible for a job in the public sector after completing a BTech from NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Yes, BTech graduates who have completed their degrees from NMIT Bangalore are eligible to work for the public sector of India. This happens because the government sector employs engineers in various capacities. However, getting a government job can be tough, because these jobs provide many benefits, such as tax deductions, good pay, job stability, incentives, and more. Students who have completed a BTech degree from DCRUST are eligible to apply for a job in the public sector of India. Indian Railways, ONGC, BHEL, ISRO are some of the leading government organisations that actively recruit BTech graduates. Generally, BTech graduates are offered entry-level positions, such as Research Assistant, Jr. Developer, Software Engineer, Quality Analyst, and such. At these jobs, students can expect to get a salary ranging from INR 6 LPA to INR 8 LPA. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is MBA expensive at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee of MBA is INR 7 lakh. The total fee includes caution deposit, tuition fee, exam fee, etc. Candidates are required to pay the course fee after completion of all the selection rounds to confirm their seats. In case, a candidate is unable to pay the fee within the specified time, his or her admission will stand cancelled. Aspirants will also need to pay a registration fee to apply for admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to MBA at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology admission 2026 for the MBA programme is entirely entrance based. Candidates cannot get direct admission in the MBA. To take admission in the MBA programme, candidates must have to appear for NUCAT conducted by NITTE Meenakshi University. Besides, aspirants must also fulfil the eligibility requirements for admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for MBA course at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: There are a total of 120 seats available in NMIT Bangalore MBA programme. Candidates are offered seats in MBA programme based on NUCAT score. NUCAT is an online test of two hours. The test comprises multiple-choice questions of a total of 120 marks. Once selected based on NUCAT rank, MBA aspirants need to pay the course fee to confirm their seat. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: what is the eligibility criteria to take admission in MBA at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Banagalore offers three porgrammes at PG level. The admission to 50% of MBA / MCA / M.Tech seats is through a valid score in PGCET and the remaining 50% admissions are done through Management quota. AICTE has approved an additional 15% seats for foreign nationals/PIO/NRI/students whose parents work in Gulf countries over and above the sanctioned intake. Candidates who have passed graduation with 50% and for candidates from Karnataka belonging to SC/ST and category-1 with 45% are eligible to apply for the programme. Candidates who wants to apply must have a valid score in PGCET / KMAT / CMAT . Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for M.Tech at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore M.Tech admission is entrance based. Candidates who have a BTech or BE qualification with minimum 50% aggregate (candidates from Karnataka belonging to SC/ ST and Category-1 must obtain at least 45% aggregate) in the qualifying examination can apply for admission in the M.Tech programme. Further, candidates must appear for Karnataka PGCET or GATE (for admission through the management quota).

faqs.question: Which are the MTech specialisations offered at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT Bangalore offers a two-year full-time MTech programme. Passed BE/B.Tech in relevant subjects with a minimum of 50% aggregate are eligible to apply for MTech. The course is available in four specialisations, namely: Defence Technology Electric Vehicle Technology Robotics & Artificial Intelligence Structural Engineering

faqs.question: What is the MTech fee at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology charges tuition fees, hostel fees and one-time registration fees from candidates who want to take admission in the M.Tech programme. The total tuition fee for NMIT Bangalore MTech ranges between INR 1.4 lakh and INR 6 lakh . Besides, aspirants also need to pay an application fee in the start to register for MTech. Aspirants must pay the course fee to confirm their seat in the institute.

faqs.question: What is the seat reservation policy for M.Tech programme at NMIT Bangalore?
faqs.answer: NMIT has the seats reserved in its M.Tech programme for candidates who take admission to the programme through different entrance exams and quotas. Additionally, AICTE has also approved 15% extra seats for foreign nationals/ PIO/ NRI students whose parents work in the Gulf countries. placement_faqs.question: How are B.Tech placements at NMIT, Bangalore?
placement_faqs.answer: Nitte Meenakshi Institute of Technology (NMIT) in Bangalore achieved a notable placement rate of 94.3% in 2023, reflecting its commitment to providing career opportunities for its students. The average package offered during placements in 2023 was INR 7.6 LPA, demonstrating the competitiveness and quality of opportunities available to NMIT graduates. The placement scenario at NMIT is dynamic, with an average and median package of INR 6.6 LPA and INR 6 LPA, respectively, showcasing a robust offering of positions for students across various disciplines. Notably, the International Package witnessed an impressive 11% increase compared to the previous placement year, indicating the global recognition of NMIT graduates. For the B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering programme, top recruiters such as TCS, Infosys, and Wipro contribute to the diverse placement landscape. Similarly, the B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering programme attracts leading companies like TCS, Accenture, Wipro, and Amazon, further underscoring the versatility of opportunities for students in different specialisations. To enhance students' employability, NMIT provides a proactive placement training program. This proactive approach is embedded in each department, fostering a supportive environment for students seeking career opportunities after graduation. The consistent efforts to bring diverse and reputable recruiters to campus contribute to NMIT's impressive placement records, solidifying its position as a sought-after institution for quality education and promising career prospects.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on NMIT Infrastructure in the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The library and information center has a comprehensive collection of books, periodicals, audio/video cd-rooms, e-resources in engineering, basic sciences, management and general subjects to cater the needs of faculty members, research scholars, staff, and students. Every Department has its own Departmental Library. It also housed a digital library which has 40 computers with internet facility. The Library has a collection of 48,600 books in various disciplines, 130 print journals, and several online subscribed journals.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: NMIT provides in-campus hostels for both boys and girls. Twin sharing rooms are available for 1st-year students. Second year onwards boys may opt for twin sharing or four sharing rooms. The hostel has amenities such as TV rooms, reading room, 24 hours medical emergency service van, co-operative stationary stores and many more.

college_info.college_name: NIET Gr Noida: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Cutoff, Placements, Ranking

highlights.summary:
NIET Gr Noida, is managed by the CESWS and is UGC recognised. It was established in 2001 and is NAAC and NBA accredited with an 'A' Grade. The institute is a private college and has been ranked 40th by the NIRF 2024 under the Pharmacy category. The college provides AICTE-approved courses to students in affiliation with Dr. A.P.J. AKTU.
It is one of the renowned colleges in UP to offer quality education to students in the fields of Engineering, Computer Application, etc.
Further, the NIET Gr Noida courses are offered to students at UG and PG levels, such as BTech, BCA, BPharm, BBA, MPharm, MBA, MTech, etc. These courses are offered to students across several specialisations, including Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Biotechnology Engineering, Innovation, Development & Venture Design, and many more. GNIT Gr Noida admissions are both merit and entrance-based. Apart from this, the college has a huge campus of 23 acres in a lush green area with all the modern facilities. The major highlights of NIET College are tabulated below:

NIET Gr Noida Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: I really do not recommend this college. You can see other better alternatives.

detailed_review.Placements: So, talking about the percentage of students placed in my course, I will give an example: 3 out of 10 students are placed from my branch, and the rest are from other branches. The highest package is around 10–11 LPA, and the average is 3–4 LPA. Top recruitment is from Deloitte and Accenture. 40 percent of the students are placed, and the rest of them are still seeking internships. As of now, I really don’t know about the roles offered in my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Talking about the infrastructure, it is good, and the Wi-Fi facility in the library is also impressive. Classrooms are well furnished. The sports and games department and medical facilities are 8 out of 10. Food available in the mess is healthy to eat, and they make the food accordingly.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful, well qualified, and knowledgeable. They are very helpful at every step, and the teaching quality is pretty decent. The course is relevant in context to the curriculum, but it doesn’t make students quite ready for anything. I feel like I have to forcibly learn the things. Semester exams are easy, but the checking is difficult.
detailed_review.Other: In my case, I just went with the crowd and eventually ended up here in this course. It provides practical knowledge and creativity. Talking about events and fests, there are no fests organized, and even a freshers’ party is not happening for freshers.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: In this college, the placement is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Right now, 50 percent of students are placed. Packages offered are 7 LPA (the highest),4 LPA to 5 LPA average, and 2 LPA the lowest. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Capgemini, and Accenture. Most of the students got internships from MCA in Cloud Analogy and Capgemini. Roles offered in MCA are business analyst, DevOps engineer, software engineer, and full-stack developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In this course, classrooms given to students are very well-maintained, and AC facilities are also provided in every classroom and lab. In each lab, proper internet is available, and PCs are provided to each student for their work. In the hostel, all facilities are provided. Mess food is good, and a canteen is provided on campus. There is a proper area of sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: In this college, teachers are very helpful, qualified, and some teachers have published their research papers and have gained their Ph.D. degree. Teaching quality is good. The curriculum is based on industry demand. It makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are difficult as we have three sessional and final exams, and the criteria for the 75 percent are strict.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to gain expertise in any one programming language.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: This is the best university in Noida for students.

detailed_review.Placements: NIET is situated in Noida, Uttar Pradesh, and this university offers the best placement opportunities for students. The highest package at this university is 50 LPA, and the lowest package is 8 LPA. At least 60 percent is required for internships. Many well-known tech companies like HCL, Microsoft, TCS, and Infosys visit this university for placements. Students get good opportunities here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of this course is good. It supports students for future purposes. There are many facilities, including 24/7 Wi-Fi. Classrooms are fully air-conditioned. The university has multiple libraries where students can study together. Many hostels are available. The food in both the canteen and hostel is good. The university also provides medical facilities. Sports events are organized every week.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty at this university are kind, supportive, highly knowledgeable, and well-qualified. The teaching quality is very good. The course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready within one semester. Many exams are organized, helping students perform well in their sessional examinations.
detailed_review.Other: The university organizes many fests and events. It also provides scholarship facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Good faculty and good placement ratio but average infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 60-70 percent students were placed from my course, and one of the highest packages is 51 LPA, with one student getting placed in Microsoft. Companies like Accenture, Microsoft, Amazon, TCS, and Wipro come for recruiting in our college for the B.Tech course. Around 30-40 percent students got internships from our course in companies like Wipro, TCS, etc., and roles offered in our course include developer and cloud developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides a good environment for students to stay focused towards their goal, and the faculty members are good and very helpful. The infrastructure is quite good; the labs are really good, fully AC, and all PCs are working properly. Classrooms are also fine, but I think they should install AC in every classroom because in summer time it is really hot. Overall, it is good; hostels and canteen are good, everything is available, and the medical room is quite fine.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty here is quite good and really helpful, they are actually qualified and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is also good, they actually try to clear each and every doubt of every student. The course curriculum is also relevant and to the point. The semester exams are quite difficult, but I think it is mandatory to maintain some uniqueness, and that’s why it is fine.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Workshops are key for learning coding.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed is around 50 to 60%. Companies such as Capgemini, TCS, and Accenture visit for placements. Exams are held on campus with proper facilities to accommodate 800 students in two shifts. The highest package is bagged by a girl named Manisha Kaushik, who got a job with over 50 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is poor. The cafeteria is very small and not very clean. The campus has a small sports ground, one basketball court, and five blocks named A to E. There are two campuses. The old one and the new one, with the new campus for first-year students and the old campus for other years. There is a hostel on campus with Wi-Fi and hot water facilities in winter. A mess is also available inside.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified. Every one of them has a Ph.D. or at least a Master’s degree. The course is relevant and updated according to current industry standards. They teach what is necessary. The semester exam is held every three months with three sessionals in between, each of 30 marks, which are used for internal assessment.
detailed_review.Other: This course is very good compared to other institutions. The course designed at NIET is relevant. It is an autonomous college affiliated with AKTU. The course prepares students for the industry, and real-time skills are taught here. Events are mostly held from the second year, usually on Fridays.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharm.)
reviews.review_title: NIET is a quite good college.

detailed_review.Placements: Overall good placement. There is a high number of students placed from my batch. The average package is about 5 LPA to 11 LPA. The placement department really tries to get good companies to recruit students. The top companies, such as Sun Pharma, Abbott, and CorroHealth, recruited the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: They do provide Wi-Fi facilities, but that is not very good. They have an average classroom, but it gets hard during the summer since no air-conditioners are available. Otherwise, the overall average infrastructure. The quality of the food is also very average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are quite knowledgeable, and they make the students industry-ready. There is feedback conducted between the semesters of the teachers, where students can share their opinions about the teachers who teach them. The semester exams are also pretty tough, but students generally pass them.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: This is best in Greater Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: NIET is situated in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh. It offers the best placement opportunities for the students. The highest package of this college is 70 LPA, and the lowest package of this college is 6LPA. There are many well known companies like HCL, TCS that visit this college every year for placement purposes. At least 60% is required for placement purposes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this course is good for the students, it provides many facilities for the students, like 24 hour Wi-Fi facilities. This college has a big library where students learn borrow books and novels. This college classrooms are fully air conditioned. This college has a big hostel where different students live together. The college food is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of this college is highly qualified and highly knowledgeable. They teach students in a very good manner. Their teaching quality is also very good. The course curriculum provided by this college is relevant for the students in one semester. This makes the students industry ready There are many exams organised in this college, so the students perform well in their sessional examinations.
detailed_review.Other: This college conducts many events, like a fresher party and a fest every year for the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is best in Greater Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: NIET Engineering College is situated in Greater Noida. This college offers many opportunities, but the placement opportunities are best for the students. There are many well known companies like HCL, Microsoft that visit this college every year for placement purposes. The highest package of this college is 60LPA, and the lowest package is 7LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this course is good for the students. There are many facilities provided by this college, such as all time Wi-Fi facilities for the students and faculty. This college classrooms are fully air conditioned. This college has a big library where students learn borrow books and novels. This college has a big hostel where students live.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of this college is kind and supportive of the students. They are highly knowledgeable and highly qualified. Their teaching quality is also very good. The course curriculum provided by this college is relevant for the students. This makes the students industry ready. There are many exams organised in this college for the students, so they perform well.
detailed_review.Other: This college provides many events and fest every year for the students and also provides scholarship facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Although this college is very good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement of this college is very good. Almost all the students get placed in it. Its placement is much better than other colleges. Average package is around 6 LPA - 7 LPA, and the highest package is 58 LPA. Students are placed in very good companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of this college is very good, and many facilities are also available in it. Its infrastructure is much better than other colleges. Hostel is also very good. All variety of foods are available here, and very hygienic foods are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of this college is very good, and they guide all the students very well. Everyone also has good knowledge. Regular exams are held at this college so that students can score well and all results are good. The faculty of this college is also well-educated.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's good and bad at the same time.

detailed_review.Placements: 75% and above are placed, and 2 LPA is the average package offered by the college. Top recruiting companies like TCS, Infosys, etc., recruit. Not all students are qualified because of their mistakes, like less presence in college, making wrong character in front of teachers, otherwise, percentage also matters. College provides placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Nice, but not the type that we expect. Infrastructure is nice. If someone wants to take admission, first clear the fees and clear all doubts about the course and placement aggregate also, that's all.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are conducted semester-wise, and they are medium-level hard. Teachers are knowledgeable, but sometimes they talk arrogantly to other teachers, and they also teach sometimes as if we are their little pets. Some teachers are like parents, they teach nicely with proper examples. Faculty sometimes disappoints, but otherwise okay.
detailed_review.Other: To get a good placement, and my course is full of knowledge, that's why I chose it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: It's one of the best colleges in Greater Noida for B.Tech and B.Pharma.

detailed_review.Placements: Strong placement outcome with figures like 75%-80% placement percentage rates and average placement like 4-5 LPA, and the highest placement was about 45 LPA on campus. The top recruiters often include Amazon, TCS, Infosys, Capgemini, Deloitte, Wipro, etc. Around 80% of students get internships. Most of the faculty are Ph.D. scholars in their respective fields with a teaching experience of 10 years or above.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are labs for almost all the related subjects that you are going to study. They mostly focus on studies. The classrooms are mostly old-style, and there is no Wi-Fi available in the classrooms for students. And also, most of the time, your personal network is not working on the college campus. The college campus area was about 14 acres of land.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are well qualified, and most of them have completed or are pursuing Ph. D.s in their respective fields with vast experience in teaching. The course curriculum was relevant to the upcoming technologies, which helped to get industry-ready. This college was an autonomous college, so the exam papers are not that hard. They are much easier than the other AKTU college exam papers, and most of them can pass the semester exams with no back. The passing percentage was about 100% in semester exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Business System
reviews.review_title: NIET college is good in greater noida for the B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: Many companies come to the college for campus placement, and 70% students are placed. The highest package is 52 LPA offered by Amazon. Top recruiting companies are Cognizant, Capgemini, TCS, etc. Internship, many companies come and give offers to students, and many students get internship as well as a PPO.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is good. Labs, the Classroom, and the library are also good, but only a timing problem. There are four types of food provided in the hostel 8 to 9 breakfast, 12 to 1 pm lunch, 5 to 6 evening snacks, and dinner at 8 to 9 pm. Food quality and quantity are good, but the taste of the food is not good. Medical facilities are available, and sports like cricket, basketball, and football tournaments happen.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers and the curriculum are good, and all teachers are fully qualified. Semester exam appears on the college campus, and the exam level is a little difficult, and 30% percent is the passing mark. To become industry ready, they teach us DSA, programming languages like C, C++, Java, and Python, and other knowledge subjects like DBMS, cloud, and Operating Systems.
detailed_review.Other: My course is CSBS, and in this course you learned about computer Science subject and business subject as well as cultural events that happen every month and scholarship provided only for state students.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA) (Twinning)
reviews.review_title: College is good if anyone has sufficient money, otherwise, select other colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students got placed, and the highest package offered is 8LPA and the lowest offered is 3 LPA. Top recruiters include IndusInd Bank and other MNCs, maximum students got placed in the marketing field. If I talk about internships, then 90% of students got internships, and in 90% only 10% of students got paid internships, so paid internships are very difficult in this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good and all the facilities available like library, classrooms, lab, Wi-Fi, etc. Hostel quality is average, and the medical facility is only for first treatment, but PG is available in the surrounding college, which is the best, so you can take it on a lower budget.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are Ph.D. qualified, and they are very helpful. Teaching quality is upper medium because they have experience but don't know the front-seating students' understanding capability. The course curriculum is relevant to industry requirements. Exams are not complicated if you study, 90% is the passing percentage.
detailed_review.Other: MBA is a management course and the highest in demand in the market, so I selected this course. Suggestions for college are to improve the teaching style. Events are not conducted, campus crowd is very high, campus surroundings have a lot of colleges available, no extracurricular activities are organized.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is the best in Greater Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: This university is situated in Greater Noida, which is a very highly demanded city. This university offers good placement opportunities for the students. The highest package of this university is 70 LPA, and the lowest package is 10 LPA. There are many well-known companies like TCS, Google, and Microsoft that visit this university for placements. At least students acquire 60% to get an internship in this university. You must visit this.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of this university is fantastic, and this university provides a clean environment. There are lots of facilities this university provides, like Wi-Fi for the students and faculty. The university classrooms are very big and fully air-conditioned, and there is a library which is also very big where students can read books and novels together. This university hostel is good for students and provides the best quality food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of this college are helpful and highly Ph.D. qualified. The faculty make hard concepts very easy and at your fingertips. The course curriculum is relevant for the students. In one semester, this course makes the students industry-ready. There are many exams and practicals organized every semester so the students can perform well in their sessional examinations. The faculty is very supportive.
detailed_review.Other: There are many fests and events organized in this university for the students. This university also offers scholarships to many students so they can easily pursue their studies. This university conducts many extracurricular activities like a sports fest every year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: This college is very good for studies.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements of our college are good because our seniors are satisfied with the placement cycle. Our college has a tie-up with many companies, which makes the placement easier. The placement cell is very supportive. For my branch, many companies visit the college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our hostel is also very good. The mess is very clean, hygienic, and tasty. Our dean also does lunch from the same mess. Rooms are very good and spacious. They are well-ventilated. It has clean bathrooms and clean drinking water.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college are very good. They treat us just like our own child. They are very strict and give regular homework every day. Since our college is autonomous, the copy checking is also done in our college. They change the syllabus according to the industrial requirements.
detailed_review.Other: I want to say that this college is very good, but the fee is slightly high.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good placements and faculty make for a solid engineering experience.

detailed_review.Placements: My perspective as a student who recently graduated, I can say that the placement scenario at NIET is quite strong, especially if you are in a core branch like CSE or IT. The college really emphasizes placements, and the numbers they share are pretty impressive. We saw a lot of big names during placement season. The top recruiting companies included tech giants and major consulting firms like Microsoft, Amazon, Palo Alto Networks, Accenture, TCS, Infosys, and Deloitte.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The NIET Greater Noida campus has a good mix of facilities. The labs are well equipped with modern technology, and the library is a great resource, offering a peaceful and conducive environment for studying. While some of the older parts of the campus show their age, the college has been making a concerted effort to upgrade and maintain them. The sports facilities and canteens are good, and the campus provides all the basic amenities a student needs. Overall, the infrastructure is practical and supports both academic and extracurricular activities without being overly extravagant. Its a functional setup designed for learning.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at NIET Greater Noida is generally well-regarded. Many teachers are experienced, with some holding advanced degrees from top institutions. They are often supportive and approachable, providing both theoretical and practical knowledge. As an autonomous institution, NIET has the flexibility to design its own curriculum. This allows them to regularly update courses to align with current industry trends, including subjects like AI, machine learning, and data Science. The curriculum emphasizes hands on training and projects, aiming to ensure students are well prepared for their careers. This approach helps bridge the gap between academic learning and industry requirements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Comprehensive Review of NIET Academics, Placements & Campus Life.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement of NIET is quite good, and it is improving year by year. The placement cell is very supportive and focuses on our skill development and interviews. Many national and multinational companies visit our college every year. Overall, the placement is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: If you look at the NIET infrastructure, then we can say the infrastructure is also quite good, having a proper classroom with digital labs. Now, if we talk about hostel facilities, the Rooms are well maintained and have a good environment. The foods are hygienic and properly take care of your health.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members of NIET are very supportive and have a great knowledge in this field. They give you a proper road map to build your career. The curriculum is industry Oriented and updated to meet the latest requirements. The exams are conducted fairly. Exams are moderately challenging, which helps student to improve their skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Knowledgeable teachers are limited. No proper festivals and events are conducted.

detailed_review.Placements: I am studying B.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering. 100% of students are placed. The highest package is 52.2 LPA, the lowest is 3.5 LPA, and the average is 6 LPA. Top companies are Capgemini, Cognizant, TCS, Wipro, Accenture, Amazon, Microsoft, IBM, Juspay, Josh, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not so good here. We do have classes, but it feels like school. The canteen is not good, just a place with tin and all, and also not much edible food available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Very few teachers are knowledgeable, and the rest are just for names. They feel like just fitting formality here. HOD of ECE is very unwilling to help with the ground problems of students, but he has good contacts in companies. Curriculum is relevant. It is autonomous, so it has its own benefits. Faculty members are rude here.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it lets me go into both software and hardware fields, and that's admirable. Teachers should be less rude towards students, and they do not listen to our problems. Rest events and fests are horrible here, speakers with bad sound, no proper management, and limited extracurricular activities. No fests are conducted, only some little ones like Sanskriti, but it's not enjoyable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is worth taking admission here.

detailed_review.Placements: My course is ECE, which is very crucial in today's time for jobs and placements. ECE comes under semiconductor and also subjects like analog and digital circuits and control systems. ECE is tough but the branch is very good and very beneficial for the future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of my institute is not so good but facilities in lab are good. Wi-Fi is also good in my institute. There are no ACs in classrooms but present in labs. Water coolers are not present. There is regular cleaning. The labs are maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are the best part of my college. They are very helpful and supportive. Teachers are skilled and expert in their field. They are interactive and also explain in a very practical way. Teachers are so experienced, and faculty members are Ph.D. holders. All teachers are so good and give motivation all the time.
detailed_review.Other: There is only Diwali fest in my college, or no other fest.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great infrastructure and placements, but faculty and management need improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-90% of students get placed, mostly in core roles like AI engineer, software developer, and other tech positions. It has a strong placement record with good industry tie-ups, though faculty quality and academic support could be improved. Overall, it is good for placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College offers overall good infrastructure with more than 40 well-equipped labs, a centralized air-conditioned library, and reliable Wi-Fi access across the campus. It creates a comfortable and resourceful learning environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum at NIET is highly industry-oriented, designed to keep students aligned with current technologies and job market requirements. Exams are conducted with full seriousness and proper evaluation, ensuring that students genuinely learn and apply concepts rather than just focusing on written learning.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am very much into the part of physics and keen to gain knowledge about semi-conductors.

faqs.question: Are admissions to various courses open at NIET Noida?
faqs.answer: Yes, National Institute of Engineering and Technology Greater Noida admission is open.  The institute offers various courses such as BTech, MTech, MBA etc. at the UG and PG level. Apart from the UG and PG courses the institutions also offer Diploma courses. Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology is affiliated with AKTU.NIET College, Greater Noida offers more than 15 courses in various streams such as Engineering, Management etc.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to the Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET)?
faqs.answer: Yes, direct admission is possible at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology. Eligibility for admission to the various courses, intake, reservations, and admission process/procedures to the courses offered by AKTU is as per decided by the CAB/AKTU.  A total of 15% of the approved intake of a course is filled under this category as per the Govt. of UP and AKTU guidelines. Further, students must meet the eligibility criteria set by the institute.

faqs.question: Does NIET Noida accept CUET scores?
faqs.answer: Yes, the NIET Noida accept CUET scores for admission to its undergraduate and postgraduate courses. The university offers four undergraduate courses through CUET, which are:

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for DPharm at NIET Noida?
faqs.answer: For admission to NIET Noida DPharm course, aspirants must have passed Class 12 or equivalent exam from a recognised board. Additionally, they should have studied Chemistry, Physics, and Mathematics/Biology as compulsory subjects in Class 12. Only the aspirants, who meet the mentioned criteria can apply for admission. Candidates must have the pass certificate with them (original/copy) at the time of form filling and admission confirmation. The documents is required by the institute for verification purposes.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BTech course at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology?
faqs.answer: In order to apply to the BTech course at NIET College, candidates need to meet the last educational qualification. Students should complete Class 12 with 45%-40% aggregate. Aspirants who do not complete Class 12 are not eligible for BTech course admission in this college. Apart from this, the selection criteria for the BTech course is JEE Main followed by UPTAC counselling.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in BTech in NIET Noida?
faqs.answer: The candidate needs to appear for the JEE Exam and appear in online counselling of UPCAT. Candidate needs to opt NIET as the preferred choice in any of the branches offered by the institute. The college may conduct admission tests/on a merit basis/other criteria defined by the college admission policy.

faqs.question: What is the M.Tech selection criteria at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology?
faqs.answer: For admission to BTech at NIET College Greater Noida, students need to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place. The next step of the selection criteria is UPTAC counselling. Candidates must pass BTech with 45% aggregate. However, for MTech CSE course admission, aspirants need to complete BTech degree in Computer Science and Engineering/Computer Science/ Information Technology and related branches.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for admission in NIET MBA?
faqs.answer: NIET Noida MBA course admission is carried out through UPTAC counselling. Candidates can be shortlisted based on CUET-PG scores and seat allotment is done through counselling. Apart from this, the institute also offer direct admission. For admission under this category, aspirant should fulfil the prescribed eligibility criteria mentioned below: Eligibility Criteria : Candidate should have passed a three-year degree course in any discipline from a recognised university The eligible candidates can further visit the NIET official website to apply. After the counselling, if seats are left vacant, then those are filled based on merit list released by the institute.

faqs.question: What is the fees for Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET) MBA?
faqs.answer: NIET MBA fee is cumulative of multiple components, such as tuition fee, hostel charges, security deposit (Refundable), and more. The fee varies for each of the MBA programmes. data.title: Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology Placement Report 2024
summary: The NIET Greater Noida placements 2024, highest and average packages offered stands at INR 51 LPA and INR 6 LPA , respectively. The season 2024 witnessed over 4000 offers made by Fortune 500 companies . More than 2700 offers were recorded during NIET placements. Further, over 2000 recruiters took part in the placement drive and the notable recruiters include- JP Morgan, Microsoft, Paloalto etc made into the list at Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology placements 2024.

Earlier, the highest package offered during NIET placements 2023 stood at INR 58 LPA . Further, over 300 recruiters participated in the placements process and offered over 2700 placements to the students of the batch 2023. The top recruiters of Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology in 2023 included TCS, Cognizant, HCL, Wipro, Accenture, IBM, Amazon, Infosys, Deloitte , etc.

faqs.question: How many job offers were provided during the recent NIET placement?
faqs.answer: As per the latest placement details available on the official website, the participating recruiters offered over 2,700 job offers to the students of the batch 2023 during NIET Noida placements 2023. The same is tabulated below: Particulars Placement Statistics (2023) Total offers 2,700+

faqs.question: What is the highest package offered during the recent NIET Noida placements?

text: Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET Noida) is spread across 13.90 acre of land. NIET Noida has a wi-fi-enabled campus, separate boys' and girls' hostels, lecture theatres, a library with more than 3,200 international and national journals, innovation labs, a campus bank, an ATM, campus shops, a gym, and others. Check out more on the Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology (NIET) Infrastructure in the below video:

data.description: Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology has trained and experienced faculty members. Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology employs professionals in the post of Assistant Professors, Dy. Head and Assistant Professor, Professor and HOD, Professor and Dean, and others. The Noida Institute of Engineering and Technology also invites guest faculty for lectures and workshops. The NIET Noida faculty and non-faculty members keep themselves updated with the latest information from time to time and the faculty also act as mentor to students.

college_info.college_name: IIITDM Jabalpur (IIITDMJ): Cutoff, Placement, Fees, Ranking, Admission 2025, Courses

highlights.summary:
The Ministry of Human Resource & Development, Government of India, founded the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design & Management (IIITDM), Jabalpur, as a public institution in 2005. Under the IIIT Act, IIITDM Jabalpur was designated an Institute of National Importance. The NIRF Ranking 2025 places the institute in the Engineering sector between 101 and 150. IIITM Jabalpur is also known as Pandit Dwarka Prasad Mishra Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design & Manufacturing (PDPM IIITDM). The institute provides engineering, science, and design programs at the undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral levels. IIIT Jabalpur's main curriculum, BTech, is available in five different programs.
The 260-acre IIITDM Jabalpur campus is located close to Dumna Nature Reserve Park and Jabalpur Airport. IIIT Jabalpur course admission is based on entrance exams. Based on legitimate JEE Main scores, the institute uses JoSAA/CSAB counseling to induct candidates for the premier BTech program. The most expensive packages were INR 110 LPA for domestic travel and INR 122 LPA for overseas travel. Furthermore, three foreign offers were accepted. Here are a some of IIITDM Jabalpur's main highlights:
Dumna Airport Road, Jabalpur ( Madhya Pradesh)
BTech, MTech, BDes, MDes, PhD and Mechatronics
