PSG Itech Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: There is a peaceful environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies like Schneider Electric, Bajaj Auto, Ashok Leyland, Tata Motors, Google, and Microsoft visit our college. Our college provides good placements, with an average of 9 LPA and a maximum of 42 LPA. The minimum CGPA to appear for placements is 7.5.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Both the department library and the common library are available with digital access. Wi-Fi access is given only to PCs and not to mobile phones. The quality of the food is appreciable. There is a medical center near the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching is awesome and at the application level. The course curriculum is relevant, and we also take industrial and local visits during even semesters, which gives good industry exposure.
detailed_review.Other: Cultural activities are quite low compared to other engineering colleges.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best infrastructure in CBE.

detailed_review.Placements: Through our college pursuing B.E. ECE, students have a chance of being placed for the package of range from 4.5 LPA to 24 LPA in core IT, etc. Top core companies like Qualcomm, Samsung, and many more are visiting yearly. And few are also placed in IT companies. In ECE, approximately 20% of students now go to internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college to be honest has the best infrastructure. Many laboratories and classrooms are of top quality. We have access to digital and normal libraries and also each department has its own library. You will surely love the hostel. Hostels are being built now there are more than 5 blocks for both genders separately.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members have a deep knowledge and experience and students who want to learn can learn way faster. The institution has made the B.Com course autonomous this year, so the questions will be of a higher standard. You need to have a deep knowledge of a subject to get clear, so tests are conducted for your core knowledge.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely happy with the college, self-improvement, and confidence.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of the students are placed in my course. The highest package is 40 LPA, and the lowest is 10 LPA. Wipro, all the students get internships in many good industries and factories. The top role offered is a job at BMW for the one studying in my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the amenities are available in my college. My college is a perfect place to focus on careers, and facilities in my hostel are convenient for students. Most types of sports are available on the hostel premises, and the food is amazing.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are very friendly and helpful. My college has all the lab facilities that help students prepare for future challenges in the industry and factories. It makes students industry-ready with lots of practical knowledge. The semester exams are quite difficult.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: A college with good infrastructure and helpful and friendly faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: I am happy with the recent placements. Almost 80% of students got placed. The highest salary package offered is 32 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Qualcomm, Schinder, Oracle, and Caterpillar. Around 20% of students got internships at Caterpillar. Some of our seniors joined as interns in top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is good. Our college provides facilities such as Wi-Fi, classrooms, and a well-organized library. According to the hostel, food available in the mess and canteen is comparatively good. According to the sports and games, it is not much focused. Students achieve national-level competitions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are supportive and helpful. Their teaching quality is mesmerizing. Semester exams are easy to write. The pass percentage of our batch is 100%. The course curriculum is good. The faculty covers the course plan. It makes students ready for industry work and placements.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of PSG institute of technology and applied research.

detailed_review.Placements: As companies from various locations keep on visiting our campus for hiring us throughout the year. Depends on our interests and our skills, we got placed in various companies. We have plenty of internship opportunities too. The highest salary package that students got placed in will be 17.5 Lacs per annum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Roughly 2 to 3 events occur in a year. All these events were conducted to showcase the curricular and extracurricular skills of each and every student. Also, events like hackathons and festivals were conducted at inter-college levels. Also, we have good medical facilities within the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers deliver good quality contents in an understandable way. Also, we often went for industrial visits for a better understanding of the practical class. Also, our institute is well known for their academic standards. And our institute has the maximum number of research patents till now.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want to enjoy your college life, then this is not the right place.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year in the mechanical department, around 75% of the students were placed only in core companies. The remaining were some of the students who opted for higher studies or business, and some had backlogs. Since I am a mechanical engineer, the package we get is around 12–15 LPA maximum. The top core companies like Caterpillar, McDermott, Ashok Leyland, etc. visited the college for the placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. We have good labs and classrooms. We do have a library that is open all of the time. The hostel is not that good. It has all the facilities one needs, but we cannot be that comfortable. The food is good, but being in a hostel at one point in time, you get bored of eating the same.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very good, and they are qualified well. The teaching quality is good except for a few. Since the college is not autonomous, we do still follow the Anna University syllabus, and the exams are conducted by them. The papers are easy, but the evaluation is really bad. It is very expected for someone to get an arrear here. You could have done the exam splendidly and gotten an A.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I don't want to end up in IT. I needed it to be practical, and that's why I like this course. It would be better if the college became autonomous since there wouldn't be any problem regarding the evaluation. If you are a person who is very much into enjoying and want to have fun in college, then this is not the right place. If you come here, you have to only learn. Since it is a college that started just 8 years ago. There are only a limited amount of courses, and the campus is small. But recently the intake was pretty much high, and it is crowded a bit. There are extracurricular activities that you could do here. But the thing is, you have to learn how to manage the academics and extracurricular activities, and then you are good to go. There aren't many events here, so if you want to enjoy college life, then this is not the right place for you.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really satisfied with the management and faculty of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college focuses on providing best placements and internship opportunities to its students. In computer science engineering, 40–45% of the students are getting successfully placed at this college. 4–8 LPA was the average package offered at our college. Many technical companies visits college for placements for the roles of software engineer, web developers, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: PSG Institute has a good infrastructure for the computer science engineering course. Students were offered all types of facilities. The campus was big and had ample space. Multiple sports facilities were available for the students. A canteen facility was available, which offers good food at an affordable price. A hostel facility was available for the students of the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at the college were highly experienced in the teaching field. All the teachers at our college were highly qualified and knowledgeable. They were providing the best-quality education to the students. They were making us understand all the concepts in an easy way. The course curriculum of the college was relevant and it makes the students industry-ready. Semester exams at the college were not hard to pass.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college for a bright future.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students were placed in my course. The highest package offered in my course is 13 LPA, the lowest package is 4 LPA and the average package is 6-7 LPA. The top recruiting companies for my course are Sobha construction, L&T Construction and Cameron Manufacturing India pvt. Ltd. 95% students got internships at L&T, Tata, and KNRCL construction companies. The top roles offered in my course are structural engineer, geotechnical engineer and road and railway department.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is plentiful in my college and Wi-Fi connections are available for students 24/7. Labs are completely optimizable and well maintained. They have all kinds of testing equipment needed. Classrooms are well ventilated and cleaned on a daily basis. The library is available with an adequate number of books. Hostel facilities quality is comparable to that of other colleges. Rooms are cleaned and mopped on a weekly basis every year, and the food available is also hygienic. They have an ambulance before the hostel 24/7 for any emergency. Sports are not so dominant but still, interested students are free to use sports things.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers have completed Ph.D.s or did MEs, and they are talented teachers. The students are often taken on industry visits. Since semester exams are conducted by Anna University, exams are a bit difficult, but college gives us enough training, and the pass percentage is 96%.
detailed_review.Other: My college population is smaller and mainly concentrates on studies. So, if anyone is willing to enjoy their college life, it is not recommended that they join this college. But, still, this college has a good lawn and canteen to hang out with friends. But the faculty members are literally everywhere. But if you want a good future, this college is the best.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: There are a reasonable number of placements at this college, as far as I know. For mechanical engineering, 12 LPA was the highest package offered and the lowest was around 3.5 to 4 LPA. Major recruiting companies are Caterpillar, JSW, L&T, etc. Many of our seniors have also gone for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I will give 10/10 for the infrastructure of our college. All classrooms are well-equipped with all necessary facilities; Wi-Fi is also available everywhere; and the library is also very good. The hostel is also good as far as infrastructure is concerned. But I heard some complaints about the mess foods.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are all well-qualified and helpful. As it is a non-autonomous college as of now, it follows the Anna University curriculum. I'm not sure if this makes the students industry-ready. The curriculum even consists of subjects like the heritage of Tamil and technology for the 1st and 2nd semesters, which I personally feel is a huge time waste and overload for all the students. The university exams are moderately difficult.
detailed_review.Other: This college is much more of a study-oriented college. So don't expect much fun and enjoyment here.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has a good infrastructure, but the academic pressure increases our tension.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90% of seniors have been placed, but the issue is with the salary package, which is average or less. Qualcomm, Texas, and Google are top recruiting companies. Most students obtained internships, while others are awaiting the completion of their final year project.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. Machines in labs are not accurate and do not have good precision. Wi-Fi is not available on campus, but it is available in the hostel with certain procedures. The canteen food is good but not worth the amount it costs. Only a few items are provided in the canteen. Sports grounds are available but not well maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are guiding well, but there are some teachers who are struggling to teach. The difficulty level of exams changes at both extremes.
detailed_review.Other: I am a guy with an interest in electrical engineering, which made me choose this course. They need to provide good lab facilities and teach concepts in labs. Events are conducted very occasionally, but they are like festivals.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the care taken by them towards students.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% of students of our college got placed. The highest salary package offered by companies was 13 LPA and the lowest salary package was 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies were Amazon, Flipkart, Microsoft, TCS, Infosys, Wipro, etc. Around 65% of students got internships. About 30% of students got internships at Infosys, 10% at Flipkart, and 25% at TCS. The top role offered was data scientist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is known for its libraries which consisted of approximately 25,000 books to study and gain knowledge. High-speed Wi-Fi was provided to browse for studies and work easily. Classrooms were high-tech with projectors. We had a separate hostel for boys' and girls' safety. Each room was allotted for 4 students. The food served was top-notch. Medical facilities were provided. Students played games and reached more heights.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college were highly developed with skills and taught students from the basics. The course curriculum was not relevant to the industry but some projects and internships would teach us more than the curriculum. Exams were easy if students understood the topics.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as I wanted to become a data scientist. They had to encourage students. All other extracurricular activities performed by students made our college days beautiful.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good and excellent in education.

detailed_review.Placements: It is a good college with great infrastructure, faculty members, facilities and placements. Placements: Almost every student gets placed in a good company from our college. Our college claims that there are 100% placement results every year. Top recruiting companies for our course are Qualcomm, Caterpillar, Oracle, Cisco, SAP Labs, etc. Many of the students get an internship in top companies like Qualcomm, Caterpillar, etc. Top roles offered here are hardware engineer, software engineer and systems engineer. In 2019, we got the highest salary package of 38 LPA in Microsoft.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is a great learning experience. It has all facilities on campus. Academics is also very good. The faculty members are so coo-operative and supportive. They work hard for us and always welcome everyone to ask anything, discuss any problems one has. Our college has a rich library and a good big lab. The campus is really amazing. There are a lot of events and fests and workshops conducted throughout the session which is really interesting and specially career counselling sessions.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The course curriculum is relevant, and our college has the industry at the back to gain industry knowledge and classes over it.
Faculty members are really good, qualified and more knowledgeable and teaching quality was excellent and good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is for gaining knowledge.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 100% of placements are there. The top recruiting companies are for both the IT sector and core companies. There are many internships offered by this college. There are many opportunities to take part in club activities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a high-tech infrastructure in this college with more laboratories and clubs. There is a good atmosphere in this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are more experienced teachers in this college, and the pass percentage is 100%. There is an industry visit from the college. The syllabus is based on Anna University.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the best college in Coimbatore in terms of placements and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70% of the students got placed in our course, and few of them opt for higher studies. The highest salary package offered was 12 LPA, the lowest salary package offered was 3.26 LPA, and the average salary package offered was 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Caterpillar, L&T, Samsung, IBM and TechnipFMC.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms and laboratories are excellent, and hostel rooms are very clean and good. There are a lot of books in our library, and a new auditorium and library would be constructed in our college. In the hostel, Wi-Fi is available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are knowledgeable because most of the teachers are PhD holders. They teach very well about content, concepts and semester examinations point of view. They teach a lot of things apart from studies like how to adapt the work culture, and our pass percentage is 80%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a good college with great infrastructure, faculty members, facilities and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every student gets placed in a good company from our college. Our college claims that there are 100% placement results every year. Top recruiting companies for our course are Qualcomm, Caterpillar, Oracle, Cisco, SAP Labs, etc. Many of the students get an internship in top companies like Qualcomm, Caterpillar, etc. Top roles offered here are hardware engineer, software engineer and systems engineer. In 2019, we got the highest salary package of 38 LPA in Microsoft. The average salary package offered is 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is extraordinary here, and there are great labs and good facilities. There is a high-speed internet facility in our labs where we can access and use the internet for productive purpose. Classrooms are good with good ventilation. The library is somewhat fine, but a huge library is under construction. Hostel facilities are good, and the rooms are good enough. The food served here is comparatively better than the food served in other colleges. There are good medical facilities, a good ground, an indoor court for badminton, table tennis and chess. There is also a gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are very knowledgeable and highly qualified. Their teaching is extraordinary, and we can approach them personally for any help either be in personal life or academics. They will do help with pleasure, and they not only behave as teachers but also behave as friends. The course curriculum is provided by Anna University. So, if students need to be ready for the industry, they must try on their own with the help of facilities provided by the college. However, faculty members help students to become industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I loved electronics right from my childhood and was mesmerised by the communication technologies like 5G, etc., so I chose electronics and communication engineering. Everything is already good here, so there is no need to improve anything. Our college organises fests like intra-college fest named Advaya, national level technical symposium named Yuktaha, sports day named Sudeva and annual day named Dhaksha. Our college also celebrates events like Pongal, Onam, Golu, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a number one college in Anna University.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies like L&T, Wipro, HCL, TCS, etc., visit our college and hire students by conducting interviews. Companies conduct three rounds in interviews, i.e., the first round is the aptitude, while the second round is a group discussion, and the third round is HR. If students qualify in all the three rounds, they get placed. Students are provided with 3 to 6 months duration training in the companies, and then only their jobs become permanent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a separate block for all departments, and labs are highly secured. Our college provides all kits to students. The food served in the hostel mess is good and healthy, and they provide only first-class quality food. There is a small hospital in our college, and our college gives importance to sports also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are helpful to students, and they teach nicely. They provide soft copy and hard copy of the books to students, and they clear the doubts at any time.  They are well trained and educate the students.
detailed_review.Other: All religions functions are celebrated here.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good Engineering Experience!

detailed_review.Placements:
1. Nearly 85% of students got placed in various firms. 
2. The highest salary offered was nearly 3 Lacs. The lowest offered was 27,000. 
3. TCS, CTS are the companies that recruits many students from the course. 
4. Team head roles were offered.
5. The highest package offered in the course was 35 Lacs per annum and the lowest package offered was 3 Lacs per annum (approximately). 
6. Nearly around 30% of the students got internship in various firms.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
1. The infrastructure of the whole college itself is a beauty. Specifically for the course, there are nearly 6 laboratory such as Mobile and IoT lab, Cisco lab, SAP lab, Cloud lab etc. The classrooms are spacious, neat and provided with smart learning. 
2. The most important thing to say is the hostel food. Really, the hostel food is good compared to other colleges in Coimbatore. Hostel is also provided with gym facilities and sports such as badminton, table tennis etc. Good medical care is given.
detailed_review.Faculty:
1. Well knowledge teachers are the main reason for the highest pass percentage in the college. Teachers are very helpful, and also well qualified. Teaching is really good and one can learn a lot other things from teachers. 
2. Of-course the course is relevant. This course teaches the student to get ready for their career and they use the knowledge gained from the course subjects that they have learnt. Passing out from the college, the students can make them ready for the industry.
detailed_review.Other:
1. I personally chose the course for the better placements in this course. 
2. Nothing of that sort. But I would like to suggest to add some more practical way of learning. 
3. Nearly 10-12 major events will be conducted every year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good college with decent placements and new facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are among the best in Coimbatore. The college provides good placements as well as coaching. The college focuses more on placements and makes sure that the students are industry ready. The efforts taken by the management in inviting companies are appreciable.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has very well-equipped laboratories in every department. Being a new college, labs are loaded with the latest equipment. The classrooms are huge and spacious with projectors and audio systems. The cafeteria needs improvement though. The hostel is huge and spacious as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is based on Anna University curriculum since the college is affiliated to Anna University, Chennai. It's not an autonomous institution, which means the semester-end papers are not evaluated by faculty members of this college. The faculty are well-qualified and knowledgeable.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the best college to join in. You gain good technical knowledge and earn a job in your domain.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are really good with almost all top companies for every domain visiting for drives. All the seniors got placed. The highest package offered was 38 LPA by Microsoft. Around 100 companies hire students. The placement cell provides information about the off-campus placements too. They guide students well with pre-placement coaching thus making students ready to face interviews.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Being a new college, it has an amazing infrastructure. Quality of classrooms and labs are very good. Only one drawback here is that sometimes, there occurs a network problem. Seminar halls and indoor stadium are very good. Hostel food is nice, and the rooms are kept very neat. Price of food in the canteen is reasonable.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty here are very friendly and provide us with vital information beyond the curriculum. They also encourage students to take up online courses. Rewards are given to students who take up online courses. We have clubs here, and the best ones are iTech dialogue, iTech talks and astronomy club. There is a 10-day orientation programme for new students which moulds them into the right human being.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: PSGiTech-chase your dreams in the average curriculum, with above average placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements went quite well last year for our senior batch. Around 90% of the students were placed. The highest salary of 40 LPA was offered by Microsoft. Core, IT and business analytics companies visited the campus with various packages with a minimum package of 3.8 LPA. Skill-based professional roles were offered to the students. Almost 10% of the students got internships, and the highest stipend ranged from Rs. 25,000-40,000 per month. The placement cell is proactive in communication and informs about the results of rounds without any delay. They provide proper intimation for registering for the events.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, a library, medical facilities, and sports and games are available. Sports grounds are well-equipped, and students have the opportunity to excel in and win awards and participate in tournaments with support practices in the ground with many facilities. The labs and canteens are always clean. The quality of food available in the canteen is good, and it is still improving. Infrastructure related issues were insignificant.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful, knowledgeable and qualified. The teaching quality is excellent with improvements, and updations are given through mid-semester and end semester feedback from students. Teaching methods vary and include projectors, chalk-blackboard, written assignments, presentations, and seminars. The faculty to student ratio is 1:45. Industry exposure was given through industrial visits and labs. The course curriculum is set by Anna University. Updations were missing in the old regulations.
detailed_review.Other: The events are mostly college events like Symposium, annual day and sports day with a campus crowd of around 1000 people. Connectivity is gathered through organising various events by different departments and batches. The campus surroundings are quite clean and neat with a peaceful environment. The government provides scholarships yearly, in thousands, depending upon the annual income of parents. First graduate scholarships are also provided for eligible students. Extracurricular activities involve participation in various clubs, etc.

faqs.question: How can I get into PSG Institute of Technology and Applied Research for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer:
PSG Institute of Technology and Applied Research has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.Arch Candidate who have passed 10+3 Diploma Examination with Mathematics as compulsory subject with at least 50% marks in aggregate from a recognised Institute/ University can also apply.
Candidates appearing for 10+3 Diploma with Mathematics in the current year may also provisionally appear for NATA-2023. B.E. / B.Tech Candidate must have passed VIII, IX, X, XI & XII Std. from schools situated in Tamil Nadu.
Tamil Nadu native candidate who have passed any of the VIII, IX, X, XI & XII Std. or their equivalent exam from schools situated outside Tamil Nadu can also apply. They should produce Original Nativity Certificate.
Children of Central Government Employees, irrespective of their nativity, provided their parents or guardians (only if both parents are not alive) have been serving in Tamil Nadu continuously for the past five years can be eligible to apply.
Sons & daughters of All India service Tamil Nadu cadre officers are eligible to apply. A Self declaration from the parent in this regard is to be produced.
Children of employees in the Public Sector or Government recognised institutions had been working in their organisations for the past five years are also eligible, irrespective of their domicile.
Other State candidates who have studied VIII, IX, X, XI and XII Std. in Tamil Nadu are eligible to apply. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

highlights.summary:
Punjab Engineering College is a Deemed-to-be-University which was established in 1921. It is affiliated with Punjab University. It has a vast campus spanning 146 acres and the university is a Grant-in-Aid program administered by the Indian government's Union Territory of Chandigarh. Punjab Engineering College offers undergraduate and postgradute programmes across Engineering and Technology streams. Punjab Engineering College also offers Doctoral programme in streams, namely Engineering, Science, Management, Humanities, and Social Sciences. Admission to UG and PG programmes are made through national-level examinations namely JEE (Mains) and GATE respectively. There are 9 academic departments and 2 centers of excellence.
The faculty of academic departments and centers are involved in cutting-edge research and development works. Punjab Engineering College collaborates very closely with research organisations, industries, alumni, and other academic institutions both in India and abroad, and has signed MoUs to pursue joint research in various areas. The students graduating from this institute are placed in highly reputed companies. Some of the past recruiters of PEC Chandigarh Placements are Accenture, Deloitte, Dabur, BHEL, ABB, ACC, and others. Punjab Engineering College also provides scholarships to deserving students through central and state undergraduate scholarship schemes. The major highlights of Punjab Engineering College are mentioned in the table below:
Merit scholarship, Merit-cum-means based scholarship
Check out more on Punjab Engineering College Highlights in the below videos:

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Production and Industrial Engineering
reviews.review_title: Punjab Engineering College Chandigarh review.

detailed_review.Placements: In Industrial and Production Engineering, there are a total of 30 students, out of which 21 are placed last year. The average package is around 13 LPA, the highest is 20.85 LPA, and the lowest is 3.3 LPA. Maximum students are placed in consultancy firms, while some students from production and other branches prepare for the CAT exam. About 30 percent of the students get internships from my course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of PEC Chandigarh is decent. First-year classrooms have AC, and the Computer Science department and ECE department also have AC. Wi-Fi is good. The infrastructure of labs is decent; some lab machines are old, while some have new machines. The library is good, and all types of books are available. Hostels are average but quite costly compared to other NITs. The mess is decent, and there is no hostel canteen. For medical facilities, there is a dispensary in PEC market where you can get medicines. Sports facilities are good, and all types of grounds are available, such as cricket, athletics, volleyball, squash court, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: In the first year, I don’t have much idea about professors of my core subjects, but first-year teachers are good and qualified. The curriculum is good, and all important subjects and practical's are included. It makes us industry-ready. Semester exams are moderate. Around 30 marks are required to avoid a back in each subject.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Punjab Engineering College, Chandigarh.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70 percent of students got placed on campus, and multiple PPOs are offered. The off-campus data is not shared with the students. Overall, it has decent placements. The highest package is 20.90 LPA. The lowest package is 3.60 LPA. The average package is 11 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are just good enough for surviving. However, rooms are pretty small for two students, and only one table is provided in a room of two. The tennis table is broken and the snooker room is non-functional. The mess food is good for mess standards, but definitely not of top quality.
detailed_review.Faculty: Mostly, teachers are not interested in teaching properly, but if we go up to them and ask doubts, they will help us. They won't be very helpful otherwise. It's very hard to understand what they are teaching in classes (the same is in most colleges), so ChatGPT will help us a lot.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has strong academics, supportive faculty, good placements and comfortable campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently pursuing B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering, and my batch will graduate in the year 2029. The overall focus of our course was on practical learning and coding skills. Based on the previous passing out batch, almost 85 percent of students got placed in the same course. According to the placement data, the highest package offered in the last batch was around 61.03 LPA. The lowest package was close to 10 LPA, and the average package ranges from 16-17 LPA. Some top companies that visited the campus for the last batches included Google, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Oracle, Amazon, and Microsoft.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for our course is good and designed to support practical learning. We have well-equipped computer labs, high-speed internet, and updated software tools that help us in coding and project work. Hostel facilities are decent and well-managed. Rooms are clean and have basic furniture like beds, study tables, and cupboards. The canteen and mess food is simple and hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our course are very supportive and focused on practical learning. Most teachers have a good academic background and industry experience, which helps in understanding real examples during classes. The course curriculum is designed to build strong fundamentals in computer science. Semester exams are moderately difficult. Questions in exams mostly come from the syllabus taught in class, along with practical applications.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: PEC Chandigarh College review.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70 percent of students get placed in electrical engineering, with the highest, the lowest and average packages being 52, 6.5, and 14 LPA. 160 multinational and top-tier companies, including Uber, Microsoft, JP Morgan & Chase, Goldman Sachs, Texas Instruments, Arcesium, Cisco, American Express, ZS Associate, Maruti Suzuki, Airbus, Infosys, Micron Semiconductor, and many others. Additionally, the office has been instrumental in introducing 30+ new recruiters for PEC students, such as Blinkit, Tick2Trade, Chegg, Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC), RP Sanjeev Goenka Group, FNZ Group, Table Money, Perfetti Van Melle, Vectorial AI, UBS Group, and Usha International, further diversifying the placement landscape.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of PEC Chandigarh is decent. First-year classrooms have AC, and the Computer Science department and the ECE department have AC. Wi-Fi is good. The infrastructure of labs is decent, some lab machines are old, and some have new machines. The library is good, and all types of books are available. The hostel is average but quite costly compared to other NITs. The mess is decent, and there is no hostel canteen or medical facilities. There is a dispensary in the PEC market where you can get medicine. Sports facilities are good, all types of ground are here, like cricket, athletics, volleyball, squash court, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: In the first year, I don't have an idea about professors of my core subjects, but first-year teachers are good and qualified. The curriculum is good, all important subjects and practicals are included. It makes us industry-ready. Semester exams are moderate. Around 30 marks are required to avoid a backlog in each subject.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Amazing college with top-tier placements, good academic environment, and a nice atmosphere.

detailed_review.Placements: I study Electrical Engineering. The placement is still going on, and it is amazing. Top companies like Oracle, Apple, American Express, and Nvidia have also visited the campus. Some of our 3rd-year seniors have even bagged internships in companies like Texas Instruments and Flipkart. Some have also bagged PPOs in top startups like PhonePe. Companies like JPMorgan and Microsoft also visit the campus in their placement grounds every year. The placements in electrical are really good, with previous years seeing 52 LPA, the highest package in electrical, with a median of around 12 LPA and an average of around 13 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure can surely be better. However, it is still manageable, with labs being allotted for every course. We have regular lab classes, promoting hands-on learning. The food quality is okay, and the hostel is also okay. Sports facilities are really good, with football, cricket, volleyball, basketball, lawn tennis, and badminton courts. It also has a great gym. I would say that PEC Chandigarh has a really good atmosphere.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are all Ph.D. scholars. They have great experience. They are extremely knowledgeable. The teaching quality was pretty good for the most part, with some classes being pretty boring, just like any other engineering college. The course curriculum is relevant enough, and it is evident if we look at the placements. It surely makes the students industry-ready. The semester exams are pretty conceptual. They are not tough, but they can only be solved by people who have really understood the concepts.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I liked Physics and math. The electrical Engineering has a lot of that. This course is evergreen, yet quite challenging. It is never going to die. I would like the course to be a little more up-to-date. The events and fests are really good. Top singers like Sunidhi Chauhan and Asees Kaur have performed at PEC Chandigarh in the past.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a beautiful college, and I am having a nice time here.

detailed_review.Placements: Electrical engineering at PEC is a well-established branch. The highest package here is 52 LPA, and the average is 12 LPA. Top recruiters include Siemens, L&T, GE, Texas Instruments, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is appreciable, classes are well built, spacious, and labs are nice. The department has its own building. We also have conference rooms and tutorial rooms. Hostels are good, rooms are good, but small for 2 people. Mess is average. There is a PEC market that has a dispensary. We have two 2 Nescafe outlets also. A lot of sports facilities are provided. We have a gym, a badminton court, volleyball, basketball, a tennis court, football, cricket, and an athletic ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors here are well-qualified and nice. Syllabus is completed on time. Exam-relevant questions and problems are also given. Assignments are also given. Exams are not very difficult, but not easy either. If you follow what the teacher says, then you excel. The course focuses on modern technologies like power systems and control systems, in collaboration with Power Grid.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is excellent. A lot of friends and memories here. A lot of clubs, as per your interests. Beautiful, clean and peaceful environment. We have a PEC market where you can enjoy with your friends. We have the Annual Athletic Meet and PECFEST, which is 3 days.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: PEC is one of the top colleges in India. We have to get a great percentile in JEE Main.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80 percent of students got placed. The highest package offered is 54 LPA, and the lowest package is 7 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are JP Morgan, etc. 30 percent of students got internships. We can easily get placed. If we do not even work hard, it's easy to get placements here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is a bit old because the college itself is old. The food is above average. The PEC market is the best. Sports and facilities here are very good. I would rate the college 4 out of 5 stars. It is one of the top colleges in the whole country.
detailed_review.Faculty: It does not affect whether semester exams are difficult or not, as there is a relative grading system. If exams are difficult, it is difficult for all students, and if exams are easy, then it is easy for all students. The course curriculum is relevant.
detailed_review.Other: The campus crowd is the best. I got the best seniors. Pecfest is also the best. Nothing should be compared to Pecfest.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is very good, but it is a bit expensive.

detailed_review.Placements: 45 percent of the students got placed from our course of civil engineering, the highest package is 20.9 LPA, and the lowest is 3.90 LPA. L&T, Brain, BCG, and Google are some of the companies that recruit students from college, most roles are software developer and consultant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is mediocre, not very good, but it's okay for the placements. Wi-Fi is good, labs are old but are good enough, library is top-notch, classrooms for 1st year are amazing, but for the following three years, classrooms are okayish, hostels are quite old for 1st year, but are like a hotel for 4th year.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are quite qualified, but most of the students study by themselves from books, so it's hard to understand the lessons from the teachers. The course curriculum is quite relevant and good for industry exposure. The semester exams are easy, not very hard.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to build things that civil engineering allows me to do, so the course is still a little bit old-fashioned, even after much improvement, a little correction is needed. Events and fests are very good, a huge amount is funded for the fests and events. We enjoy the college campus in the middle of Chandigarh, and the campus surroundings are very good. Extracurricular activities are also encouraged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements and amazing campus life but the infrastructure needs improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: It belongs to the 2025 passing out batch of B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering. The placement statistics have been quite encouraging this year despite the market shutdown. Approximately 85 percent of students are placed. The highest package offered is 61 LPA while the lowest is 6 LPA. The average package is 16 LPA for circuit branches. Top recruiters include Apple, JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, and Arcesium. Regarding internships, around 70 percent secured them with as high as 1.5 LPM. Top roles offered are SDE Data Analyst and Cyber Security Analyst. The placement cell is extremely active and brings excellent opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our classrooms are spacious and equipped with projectors, though some older blocks still lack ACs.The library is definitely the highlight, it's fully air-conditioned and has a massive collection of books and this is the go-to spot during exams. The campus-wide Wi-Fi is decent. Labs are well-equipped for the core. Hostel life here is an experience in itself. First year get shiwalik, which is old, and the rooms are compact. The washrooms are average and need frequent maintenance. The mess food is edible but monotonous.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at PEC is a mixed bag, some senior professors are absolute gems with deep knowledge in the core and CSE departments but a few others just stick to slides. You can't rely entirely on classroom teaching, most of us end up studying from YouTube or reference books. The curriculum has been updated recently to include some modern electives, but for placement you need to put extra effort outside the syllabus to be truly industry-ready. As for exams PEC follows a relative grading system which is a blessing and a curse.
detailed_review.Other: I chose PEC primarily for its legacy (more than 100 years old)and its prime location in Chandigarh. The best thing about the course is the flexible academic culture, unlike strict private colleges we get enough time to work on personal skills, coding, or startups. The alumni network is massive and very helpful. The infrastructure needs a serious upgrade, some hostel buildings, Shivalik, are very old, and hygiene can be an issue. I also wish the curriculum were updated faster to include modern tech stacks. Pecfest is the heart of our college life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is fine, but very overhyped.

detailed_review.Placements: PEC provides decent on-campus placement for top branches. CSE, ECE, and EE branches have above-average placement percentages and average packages. Most placements are for SDE, analytics, IT, etc. Roles. Our ECE branch has very few students placed in core electronics, and core placements are on a decline. Further, Other branches like Mechanical, Civil, Aerospace, Production, etc. It has a very low placement rate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is bad. The boys' hostel has very small rooms. Hostel food and cleanliness are average. In college, there are multiple dysfunctional labs. The robotics lab has machines which are out of order due to a lack of maintenance. The gym has old-school equipment, including very few weight plates, unlabelled dumbbells, non-adjustable pulleys, and dysfunctional machines.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my first year, I have seen a variety of teachers. Most of them are well qualified. A very few of them teach exceptionally well. Most of them are just like any other teacher, teaching for the sake of course completion. Seniors seem dissatisfied with the faculty.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is fine. College's location is good and has connectivity with multiple tourist destinations. Further fests/athletic meet/Gurmat Samagan, etc. Keep students engaged and entertained.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is very good.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in the Computer Science branch currently in 1st year, and this year we have got 90 percent placements in the Computer Science branch. The highest package is around 53 LPA, the average package is around 16 LPA-17 LPA, and the lowest is between 5 LPA and 6 LPA. One of the top recruiting companies is JPMorgan. Top roles like SDE are offered by the companies this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has a poor infrastructure. The internet in the classrooms is very slow. Jammers are installed in the classes. The library is well-maintained and large enough to study there with facilities like AC, tube-light everywhere, proper charging ports, and proper Wi-Fi connections all over. The college has all the types of labs required for the course. The college has many grounds and is active in sports. To cover medical facilities, they have a dispensary where very basic medicines are available. The food quality of the mess is average, and the canteen is good enough.
detailed_review.Other: Scholarships are available for those whose parents' income is less than 8 Lacs. Computer Science is the best course in college with the highest placements among all other branches. Fest this year was very average as the main event was cancelled by management. Hostel life and campus are very enjoyable. Clubs are very active, so there are no extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college is good for placements if you are in a good branch like CSE, AI or this.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in the Computer Science branch currently in 1st year, and this year we have got 90 percent placements in the Computer Science branch. The highest package is around 53 LPA this year, the average package is around 16 LPA-17 LPA, and the lowest is between 5 LPA and 6 LPA. One of the top recruiting companies is JP Morgan. Top roles like SDE are offered by the companies this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has a poor infrastructure. The internet in the classrooms is very slow. Jammers are installed in the classes. The library is well-maintained and large enough to study there with facilities like AC, tube lights everywhere, proper charging ports, and proper Wi-Fi connections all over. The college has all the types of labs required for the course. The college has many grounds and is active in sports. To cover medical facilities, they have a dispensary where very basic medicines are available. The food quality of the mess is average, and canteen is good enough.
detailed_review.Faculty: Scholarships are available for those with parents' income less than 8 lakhs. Computer Science is the best course in college with the highest placements among all other branches. Fest this year was very average as the main event was cancelled by management. Hostel life and campus are very enjoyable. Clubs are very active, so there is no end to extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best placements from the old legendary college.

detailed_review.Placements: From our prestigious institute, most of the students have been placed so far. This year, the placements have taken a great turn with on-campus placements of about 55-60 percent, and the lowest package from our college is about 5.4LPA, and the highest is 60 LPA from CSE, ECE, and Electrical. Whereas Internships have decreased by about 4-5 percent. About 15 percent of students have got internships in companies like JP Morgan, McKinsey, and BMW from my course. Top recruiting Companies from our college are Cent, Airbus, McKinsey, JP Morgan, Apple, Zomato, Meesho, Phones Pe, Amazon, etc. Top roles offered are as follows management, SD profile, Data Analyst, Marketing, Sales, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: PEC is more than 100 years old and has an average infrastructure i.e., very old. Development is currently taking place in our college, and new buildings and a hostel are being built. The quality of food in the hostel is above average, cleanliness is good in the mess and washrooms, and the sports and games department also offers many opportunities and equipment to pursue your hobbies.
detailed_review.Faculty: The mechanical department faculty is good, and really experienced and knowledgeable. And if we talk about its exams and curriculum, it's proper on an application basis, and exams also check the level of the student so that he or she can be a part of the mechanical course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: PEC Chandigarh, not IIT Chandigarh. Overall college is nice, senior–junior culture is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Most seniors of 3rd year I MET are interned. For CSE, average package is good, like above 15 LPA, percentage is also good, above 90 percent, although placements were still going on. The highest package is 62 LPA, from both CSE and ECE branch. Internship stats for CSE is good, the highest is around 1.5 LPA for a month, and the percentage is like 70–80 percent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Buildings are okay, Wi-Fi is unusable in hostels, resources in library are great, labs are average too. Mess is okay according to price and PEC market is one of the highlight points of college, it’s very good. Medical facility is available at PEC market only. Around this time, so many events are there that one doesn't get bored in their college life.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are average. 1-yearite I cannot comment about course relevance. Exam difficulty is mid, but quizzes are congested with assignments and viva, that creates the problem. Maybe, that's a first-year problem, as Saturdays are also working in first year. Grading is affected by attendance too, so one needs to get bored in classes.
detailed_review.Other: Management staff could be of less attitude. Gym is good, sufficient equipments. Fest is okay. Management is like much lazy.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: It may not be someone's dream college, but it has the best crowd.

detailed_review.Placements: In the civil engineering branch, placements are very average with a package ranging from 8-10 LPA. The college is known for its internships and is highly focused on giving internships in the 3rd year. The internship pattern can be given in the 4th year, but that's fine too, because the 9th semester internship and 10th semester placements are fine.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has highly equipped labs, as some civil engineering labs have 10 lakh worth of machines. Wi-Fi is super good. The library is one of the best I have seen. For the hostel, I would rate it 2 out of 5 for 1st year. The condition gets better till the 4th year. We have 3-4 grounds and a gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: In the first year, we get to have relatively CG-like percentile stuff, which makes it hard but super important to get a good CGPA in the first year. The course curriculum is well-designed, circulated, and easily available. Teachers are very well-qualified and very friendly to talk with.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: I really like the vibe of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a 1st year student currently. In the year 2025, the maximum package went above 70+ LPA. In the year 2024, the maximum package is approximately 85 LPA by a student of Data Science stream. The best placements are bagged by CSE students. Most students are able to get interns in the 6th semester in major companies such as JP Morgan, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi isn't very good in some parts of the college, probably due to the walls of Holder building. Other than that, library and labs are in great condition. The lecture halls have good study benches, except those in L-26, L-27, L-28, L-29. The sports are maintained very well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exams are pretty tough, but students still have ample time to prepare for exams while taking part in other activities. All courses are taught thoroughly with multiple books to prepare and refer from. I do feel like some subjects should not be part of the curriculum.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: PEC is a great college if you want any college with very good placement and excellent college life.

detailed_review.Placements: In ECE branch of PEC Chandigarh around 85 percent students got placed. The highest package is 52 LPA and the lowest is around 6–7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are American Express, Mediatek, and all software development companies allow ECE students in placement, and many students got placed in software roles. Around 45–50 percent got internship from PEC. Top roles are VLSI design, consultancy, SDE, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of PEC Chandigarh is decent. First-year classrooms have AC and for Computer Science department and ECE department have AC. Wi-Fi is good. Infrastructure of labs is decent, some lab machines are old, some have new machines. Library is good, all types of books are available. Hostel is average but quite costly compared to other NITs. Mess is decent and there is no hostel canteen. Medical facilities: there is a dispensary in PEC market where you can get medicine. Sports facilities are good, all types of grounds are here like cricket, athletics, volleyball, squash court, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: First year I don't have idea about professors of my core subjects, but first-year teachers are good and qualified. Curriculum is good, all important subjects and practical are included. It makes us industry ready. Semester exams are moderate. Around 30 marks is required to avoid back in each subject.
detailed_review.Other: I have interest in ECE and PEC have great college life so I choose PEC ECE.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average could have been better.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70–80 percent students get placed. The highest package is strong, average is decent, and the lowest is basic. Top recruiters include major IT and core companies. About half the batch gets internships in similar firms, mostly for teach and analyst roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is decent, labs are well-equipped, classrooms are clean and modern, and the library has enough resources for most courses. Hostel facilities are okay, food is average but manageable, medical support is basic, and sports facilities are good for regular play.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are supportive and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is solid. The curriculum is mostly relevant with decent industry focus. Semester exams are moderate tough but fair, and most students clear them with consistent study. At the end, you have to rely on yourself only.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for the technical depth and career scope. The best parts are the hands-on labs and strong peer group. Curriculum pace and industry exposure could improve. Fests are lively, crowd is friendly, campus is well-connected, and extracurricular are active.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Aerospace Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college but expensive as a government college.

detailed_review.Placements: Percentage placement is 40 percent approximately. The highest package is 20 LPA. The lowest package is 10 LPA. Top recruitment company are JP Morgan. Top roles offered in Aerospace at PEC are site engineering and government jobs, and ISRO-like more companies are also available here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Fully AC classrooms, with fans and proper air conditioning, and two-tier library with 1 tier with AC and other with non-AC. All books are freely available there. Wi-Fi facility not good everywhere. Hostel and mess facilities are not that good, it's quite expensive. Games and sports clubs are there. Free dispensaries are there for medical.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified with B.Teach, M.Teach, PhDs in their respective subject. Some are good at teaching, but some are not good at clearing concepts. Exams are quite easy and good for curriculum with good industry ready. Semester exams are quite good here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Honest review about placements and college life in PEC Chandigarh.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in Computer Science branch, currently in 1st year, and currently we have achieved 90 percent placements in our branch. The highest package this year is around 53 LPA, average is around 16 LPA, and the lowest is between 5 to 6 LPA. One of the top recruiting companies this time is JP Morgan. Top roles such as SDE are offered by the companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has poor infrastructure, especially Shivalik hostel. Wi-Fi in the classrooms is very slow and jammers are installed in the classrooms. Library is well maintained and large enough for the students to study there with proper facilities like AC, charging ports, and good internet connectivity. College has all types of labs required for the course. College has many grounds for different sports, a swimming pool, and a gymnasium. For medical facilities, we have a dispensary inside the campus. Food quality of mess is average and of canteen is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and qualified enough, but they don't teach so deeply in the first year as the subjects in first year are not related to core. So, even students don't care much about those subjects. The course is relevant and makes the students industry ready. Semester exams are doable as far as difficult is concerned. There is relative grading, which makes scoring a CG like 9 competitive.
detailed_review.Other: Scholarships are only available for those who belong to a family whose annual income is very less. Computer Science is the best course in this college than any other branch as far as placements are concerned. This year's fest is very average as the main event got cancelled due to some issues with the management. Overall, hostel life and campus are very enjoyable. Clubs are active, so there is no dearth of extra-curricular activities in campus.

college_info.college_name: Punjab Engineering College Chandigarh Admission 2025: Application, Process, Fees & Dates

faqs.question: Can I get PEC Chandigarh with 85 percentile?
faqs.answer: Yes, students stand a good chance of getting admission at Punjab Engineering College Chandigarh (PEC) provided they have a percentile of 85 and above. The applicants with a competitive performance and the percentile of 80 to 85 are good candidates to be received in the high-ranking programmes of PEC. Nevertheless, the outcome of admission can be influenced by several other factors such as the number of applications offered, the specific course that is pursued and the criteria used by the university to determine admission.

faqs.question: Can we get direct admission in PEC Chandigarh?
faqs.answer: For PEC Chandigarh BTech admission is based on a candidate's GATE Main rank and for MTech, the University accepts admission through GATE scores. Moreover, PhD admission is conducted on the basis of a written test and Personal Interview (PI).

faqs.question: How to get admission at PEC Chandigarh?
faqs.answer: For admission to PEC Chandigarh candidates need to clear the national-level entrance exams Also, candidates need to clear the eligibility criteria. Eligible candidates can apply by visiting the official website. Candidates can check more details below: PEC Chandigarh BTech admission is based on a candidate's JEE Main or DASA rank For MTech, the University accepts admission through GATE or CCMT scores PEC Chandigarh BTech admission is based on UCEED, NID DAT, JEE Main, and NATA. PhD admission is conducted on the basis of a written test and Personal Interview (PI)

faqs.question: What are the available BTech programmes specialisations at Punjab Engineering College Chandigarh?
faqs.answer: Punjab Engineering College Chandigarh offers B.Tech programs in Aerospace Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials & Metallurgical Engineering, and Production & Industrial Engineering.

faqs.question: How many marks are necessary for B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering at PEC University of Technology?
faqs.answer: It varies year to year but if get around 99 percentile and above one can easily get CSE in PEC. But one could not able to get CSE at then new branch is also added in PEC data Science, it is also at par with CSE. One can go for it also .

faqs.question: How can I get admission in PEC Chandigarh M.Tech programme?
faqs.answer: In order to be eligible to enroll in the M.Tech course at Punjab Engineering College (PEC), one must obtain the established cutoff marks in the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) test. After this, the candidates need to go through the admission exercise enabled by the Centralized Counselling of M.Tech. (CCMT). CCMT allocates seats according to the GATE scores of the candidates and other requirements, making the admission process at the various institutions fair and uniform.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for M.Tech course admission at PEC Chandigarh?

faqs.question: How many marks are required to get into PEC Chandigarh for MTech?

sections.heading: Introduction
text: PEC Chandigarh provides various facilities to its students. The facilities of the university include a library, computer centre, medical facilities, workshops. Punjab Engineering College also has a hostel facility both for boys and girls. Additionally, the institute has an auditorium, open-air theatre, library, computer centre, reading rooms, workshops, and well-equipped laboratories, spacious playgrounds, tennis courts, squash courts, swimming pool, gymnasium, student club, and technical society area.
Check out more on Punjab Engineering College Infrastructure in the below video:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
Punjab Engineering College has a central library with the collection of of 1,15,452 volumes and an active collection of 30,267 books under Book Bank Scheme to support SC/ST as well as General categories students. The library uses a commercial Library Management Software (LibSys) and also provides intranet access to all its students through Online Public Access Catalogue (OPAC). Central Library is also having Multimedia Resource Centre (MMRC) to make use of most popular mode of education i.e. Electronic Media with the help of ICT Technology and it has a collection of 1064 CDs, 143 floppies, 25 DVDs and 581 video cassettes on various disciplines of engineering and technology.

Library has also procured and installed NPTEL video and web courses on LAN of the institute for the benefit of the students. Students can access Internet and other subscribed e-resources at Multimedia Resource Centre (MMRC). Students can access over 2300 e-journals form publishers like ASCE Journals, ASME Journals, IEL Online etc.

Library is has Wi-Fi connectivity, book bank, reading hall, multimedia resources etc. and reading halls are open to students on all working days from 9:00 am till 8:00 pm.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Punjab Engineering College has 6 hostels in total - 4 for boys and 2 for girls. All the hostels have Wi-Fi connectivity and other required amenities like water purifiers, recreation rooms, indoor sports, mess, common rooms, TV, laundry facility etc.

college_info.college_name: RVCE Bangalore: Info, Admissions 2025 Placements, Ranking, Courses, Fees, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Located 13 km from the heart of Bangalore on Mysore Road RV College of Engineering Bangalore is a self-financing engineering college. It is managed by the Rashtreeya Sikshana Samithi Trust and affiliated with the Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU). It is accredited by the NBA and approved by AICTE and the Karnataka Government. RVCE has ranked under the 101-150 band in the Engineering category of NIRF Rankings 2025. Further, RVCE is also accredited by NAAC with an 'A+' grade.
Established in 1963, RVCE or RVCOE Bangalore is a private college. RVCE has 15 departments that collectively offer more than 35 courses at UG, PG, and doctoral levels. All these courses are AICTE-approved and are offered across two fields, including Engineering & Technology and Science. Popular courses at RVCE Bangalore include BE/ BTech, MTech, and MCA. RVCE Bangalore admissions are based on merit in COMEDK UGET, JEE Mains, and others for admission to all undergraduate and postgraduate courses. The COMEDK UGET last closing rank during the RVCE Bangalore Cut off 2023, ranged between 310 and 18500 for the BTech programmes. The highest package offered during RV College of Engineering placements 2024 stood at INR 92 LPA and INR 35 LPA, respectively.
The campus is spread across an area of 16.85 acres in Mysore Road, Bangalore. It has all the basic facilities like cafeteria, gym, dispensary, transportation, smart classrooms, auditorium, conference hall, separate hostels for boys & girls, and more. RVCE offers scholarships to students on a merit-cum-means basis and the scholarships are funded by both government and external organisations. Students can avail themselves of one among government scholarships, corporate scholarships, NGO Scholarships, and Alumni Scholarships.
The major highlights of RV College of Engineering Bangalore are presented in the table below:
Visvesvaraya Technological University
101-150 under the 'Engineering' category
Merit scholarship, Merit-cum-means based scholarship
