RV College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A good college with an excellent crowd and nice placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are excellent, one of the best in private colleges of Bengaluru. ISE programme has 19 LPA average in the ongoing year. It is 16.37 LPA in 2023-24. CSE placements are even better with 19 LPA average in the current year, 17 LPA in the previous one.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi quality is average at best (20 mbps at most). Many times the Wi-Fi doesn't even work. Hostels are okay, although the food could improve. Library is nice. Canteens are adequate. Sports could use a lot of work as the current ground is just a parking lot.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good enough; most of them teach the curriculum well. Curriculum is good but it needs some updating. First-year syllabus could definitely improve as many irrelevant subjects are taught. Semester exams are not that hard. Pass percentage is more than 90 percent in most programs.
detailed_review.Other: Sports facilities, events, and fests need improvement.

reviews.course: B.E. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Life in the RVCE College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: In my branch, 20 to 30% students get placed successfully. The highest package in my biotechnology is about 16LPA, the lowest package is 3 to 6 LPA, and the average is  7 to 8 LPA. Many top recruiting companies visited my college, such as Johnson and Johnson, Bharat Tech, and many more. Almost in every sem, students get internship opportunities easily from my branch. Top roles offered are designing or researching bio related things, and also some opt out for higher studies. This is possible because my college is number one in the COMEDK colleges list.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college has multiple lecture halls as well as rooms for tutorial work, and also a seminar hall. There are many labs that come under my course total, which are around six, and the Wi-Fi speed is around 600mbps bandwidth, and is also available in almost every unit of the college. Library is also there with a vast variety of books and articles. My college has accommodation for both boys and girls on campus, in which rooms can be double, triple, or even more sharing options are available. There is a common mess for all branch students, which is quite good in taste.
detailed_review.Faculty: Medical facilities is there in my college with a ambulance available for 24hrs and all types of sports activities also happens there such as indoor outdoor as well as gym is also installed their. The teachers in my college are very helpful in nature and have higher knowledge in their respective fields with higher degrees. The course is more than sufficient for the students who want to contribute to biotech, and the exams are above average, but you need to study at least 10 days before the exam, as it is RVCE, and 80 to 90% get passed.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because my college is one of the top 1 colleges of COMEDK, which will provide a better infrastructure and resources. The best things about my course are that I can learn all the main points of engineering with the help of my faculty members. Events in my college are many, such as 8th Mile, technical events, cultural events, CARV, QuizCorp, and many more. Campus crowd is good, and the connection is also good with big colleges. Scholarship is there for needy students, and the campus is very well maintained and good enough for each and every student.

reviews.course: B.E. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: A life in my RVCE College.

detailed_review.Placements: In my biotechnology branch, around 25% of students get placed. The highest salary is 16 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA - 6 LPA, and the average is around 7 LPA - 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Merck and Bangalore Bioinnovation Center. Many students in my course get internships in their respective branches every semester. Top roles offered are core R&D, and many students opt for higher studies in the field.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has multiple lecture halls, tutorial rooms, and a well-equipped seminar hall. The department has many labs, such as animal cell culture lab, plant biotechnology lab, genetic engineering and molecular biology lab, and many more. Department has its own library stocked with reference books, textbooks, and journals. Wi-Fi is enabled with a bandwidth of around 600 Mbps. RVCE has hostels for both girls and boys with double, triple, and many more sharing equipped with table, chair, and cupboard. Canteen is also there in my college. Health center and ambulance are also available for 24 hours.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in my course are very helpful and well educated with a higher knowledge of the course, and their quality is exceptionally very well. The course is relevant to the branch. I have opted for it as it gives a vast idea about my field and also makes me ready for that field in the future. Semester exams are of average level, and around 90% of students easily passed.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was highly interested in the field of this, and I wanted to explore biotech things such as plants, animals, and many more. The best thing about the course is that we can gain high information regarding all of this with the help of the 4 years course provided in our college. All is best in my RVCE nothing needs to be improved. Events and fests in my college are 8th Mile, CARV, Quizcorp, and many more. Campus crowd is very good with maximum number of innovative students, connectivity with IITs and even with the big market.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: My review of this college

detailed_review.Placements: Placements and job opportunities are out of this world. That can be one of the biggest driving forces for a student to join this college. RVCE is a brand, and every year, more than 100 companies visit the campus to hire resources. Internships and jobs are available, and the reason these students got placed was that they actually had some relevant skills and showed up in interviews conducted during campus drives. Good companies like L&T, Tech Mahindra, Geodesic, TCS, Infosys, Amazon, HDFC, ICICI, etc., were the top recruiters. The minimum package is from 3.5 LPA, and the maximum is 7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel life is awesome. A very large area is occupied by the hostel in the college, with rooms having the required furniture, Wi-Fi, canteen, and mess (not compulsory). Students can move anywhere on campus 24×7. All festivals are celebrated in the hostels. Full freedom is given to students for good activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are highly qualified and expect a lot of high-level thinking from the students. Every student is required to complete one project per semester, which is a non-academic project. These projects need to be done following software development life cycle techniques. Every semester, in every course, there are at least two labs a week, and they are conducted strictly according to the timetable. Exams called Internals are conducted in the second, third, and fourth months of every semester, and the semester end exams are conducted at the end.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall RVCE is good in terms of placement and studies.

detailed_review.Placements: As of my branch, EEE 85% of my seniors are nearly placed with the highest package being 31 LPA the lowest being 6 LPA and the average being around 12 to 12.5 LPA. As for other electronic branches, nearly 80% of students are placed with the highest being 41.1 LPA. The lowest is 5 LPA and the average is 14 LPA. As for computer branches, nearly 70% of students are placed (the percentage being low is due to high intake) the average package is 15 LPA the highest is around 90 LPA and the lowest is 6 - 4 LPA as an entire college has the highest package of 90 LPA. The average package is 13 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Since the colleges are under construction nearly 30% of the colleges are inaccessible due to construction. The playground has become the parking area due to which sports can't be played where the lab and classrooms are well maintained and have a digital board due to now is your cooler you might feel hot in summertime. The quality of food in the mess and canteen is good as compared to the other colleges so in the food area you won't have many complaints.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are Ph.D. holders and others are pursuing to get their Ph.D. They are well qualified due to so many Ph.D. holders. Many companies come to collaborate with professionals and other teachers and give them projects then the professors and other teachers choose the students to work with them on the project so the opportunities here are good. The curriculum is the same as that of the other colleges so it's not that different. Semester exams are not that difficult but still, you have to study well to score well.
detailed_review.Other: One of the most shocks that I got after joining the college was that it's getting under-constructed and that here there is an EL thing which is experiential learning where you have to meet teams with your friends or other branch members. They have to work on a model or prototype that solves any world problem they take it very seriously. You will be awarded marks for this and this is as important as your internal marks so if you plan on coming to RV remember to make a team in the starting stages only.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: RVCE is the top college in Bangalore.

detailed_review.Placements: The batch size of the college is around 1,600. The highest package for 2024 placements is 92 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. The average package is 10 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, Flipkart, Meesho, Zomato, Blinkit, and various startups visit the college for placements. The top role offered is SDE, and almost 56% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are really big and spacious. The whole campus has central Wi-Fi for students, and all the labs are well-equipped for even performing research. The library is newly inaugurated, wonderful, and the perfect place to study. The hostel facilities are good. The food served in the mess is moderate. Sports facilities are moderate as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and well-qualified for their roles. The course curriculum is industry-related. Semester exams are not very difficult, and the pass percentage is good since a lot of people pass because of experiential learning.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have a keen interest in it. The best thing about this course is that the faculty members are very good and helpful. Fest is organised every two years. There are various scholarships for KCET students.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Structural Engineering
reviews.review_title: Masters in structural engineering at R. V. College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students got placed in roles like designing. They also got a chance to work as an intern on foreign projects. After the end of the internships, they got a permanent job role with salary hikes. Some of the top recruiters were L&T and Tata Group.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Most informative resources that were available in the library like updated newspapers, journals periodicals, and reference books used for courses were collected and stocked in the library once a month. Biometric systems were used in the libraries instead of manual systems.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of our syllabus was oriented to diagrammatic papers. Our teachers were known for their excellence in designing. They illustrated and made us reconstruct the design perfectly by guiding us step by step. Our teachers motivate our skills than insisting on high grades.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of RV College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Top companies come to RVCE for placements. Most of them get placed with good packages. The highest salary package offered this year is around 65 LPA. All students in RVCE are mostly skilled and highly intelligent unless they are from management, so they mostly get placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It was established in the 90's, so the infrastructure is not that great. We have all facilities. The college is constructed newly. Recently, a new library was built, which is posh and has technologies like sound-proof and is a place where everyone would love.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are qualified. The paper is quite tough and requires deep knowledge to be answered. It involves experiential learning where we get to learn a lot of new things. We have to coordinate with our team members to complete it within the deadline.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements and infrastructure of RVCE.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package for 2024 placements was 92 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA, and the average was 10 LPA. The top recruiting companies were Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, Flipkart, Meesho, Zomato, Blinkit, and various startups. The top roles offered were SDE, and almost 56% got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are really big and spacious. The whole campus has centralized Wi-Fi for students, and all the labs are well-equipped for even performing research. As the library is newly inaugurated, it is wonderful and just the perfect place to study. The hostel facilities are good. The food served in the mess is moderate, and the sports facilities are moderate as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are really helpful and well-qualified for their roles. The course is designed such that it is industry-related. The semester exams are not very difficult, and the passing percentage is good since a lot of people pass because of experiential learning.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I had a keen interest in it. The best thing about this course is that the faculty is very good and helpful. The fest happens every two years, and there are various scholarships available for KCET students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Come only if you want placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of students in the CS branch get placed by the end of their third year. The highest package offered was 56 LPA in 2025 and 92 LPA in 2024. The average package for the CS branch is around 17.5 LPA. Companies like Amazon, Zomato, PhonePe, Qualcomm, and Microsoft have visited the college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is quite good and newly built. Classrooms are currently under construction and will be completed in one year.  Students are currently attending classes in another branch's building. While the writer lives in a PG, they note that the hostel food is not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful in the first year, but their engagement decreases in the second year. The first-year curriculum is tough. The pass percentage is good, but semester exams are quite difficult.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Cyber Security)
reviews.review_title: It is best to enjoy a course with better placement and experience.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students get good offers. The average package is about 20 LPA, the least is 6 LPA, and the highest is 96 LPA. In my course, 67 LPA is the highest, same as the average and least. Top recruiting companies are Google, Samsung, Intel, HP, TCS, Tech Mahindra, and Infosys. Roles include Software Developer, Full Stack Developer, and Data Scientist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my department, we have a vast library with supportive internet and a computer lab. We also have different classes for lab and theory sessions, which are well-equipped. The hostel is okay when compared to other hostels, but the food is good. Medical facilities are available 24/7. Each block has a gym, game courts, and fields for practicing.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-experienced. It is good for understanding the concepts. The course curriculum is different when compared to others, and they focus a lot on practical sessions. The semester exams are quite difficult, but the passing percentage is 40% in CIE and SEE.
detailed_review.Other: It’s better to choose normal colleges for learning the concepts. Improve the faculty involvement in the sessions and projects. The RV campus conducts two major fests, Kannada Habba and 8th Mile Fest. The campus is a bit busy because it is a small campus with all departments. Scholarships are purely based on merit only.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience of RV college of engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: 100% placement in our course for those who are eligible for the placement. The eligibility criteria for the placement is that the student must not have any active backlogs. The highest placement is 92 LPA, and the average is 20 LPA. Top recruiting companies are HP, Microsoft, Eightfold AI, Oracle, and PhonePe. 50% got internships, and the same companies coming for placement will provide the internship. The top role is software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in the college is good. We have separate buildings for the separate branches, and the infrastructure of the hostel is also good. We have Wi-Fi availability everywhere on the campus, and labs are also good. The library is newly constructed for both RVCE and RVU with good infrastructure. The food quality in the hostel is good, but the worst case is they provide the same food every day; there is no change to the food menu for your money.
detailed_review.Faculty: The qualification of the teachers is almost everyone is Ph.D. completed, and they are very helpful for our studies and projects. The syllabus is a very updated version; it is so much relevant to the present industry. The first year is difficult only to adjust to the college and subjects. From the 3rd sem, it is difficult, and the 3rd sem is the toughest one of all, and the start of the real engineering feel.
detailed_review.Other: The crowd on the campus is high as RVU and RVCE are present on the same campus. Events and fests are conducted every year, and we have good sports facilities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want to develop and learn, then this is the perfect place for you.

detailed_review.Placements:
In my course (CSE), nearly 80% of the students got placed in 2024.
The highest package offered is 64 LPA (2 members got this), and the lowest package is 5 LPA, with the average package around 20 LPA for CSE.
Top recruiters are Microsoft, Cisco, Apple, Confluent, Flipkart, PhonePe, Goldman Sachs, etc.
Nearly most of the people who got placed secured internships in top companies, including all the above-mentioned companies.
Top roles offered are software engineer, data analyst, software developer, engineering analyst, and software engineer intern.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The hostel we got is brand new, and they will provide 24/7 Wi-Fi and hot water. They inaugurated a new library by the Brigade Foundation in December 2024.
In the hostel, you will get different types of food, North Indian, South Indian, and the taste is decent enough. There is no non-veg, but you can have non-veg and junk food in the canteen called Mingos. For sports and games, they are building a gymnasium, which we can use by July 2025. Until then, we can play in the outdoor grounds provided by the college.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The teachers here are really helpful. They will guide you in projects and subjects. If you have a good idea or are interested in learning, teaching quality is also good here. They will take extra classes if the majority of the class does not understand anything.
Yes, it will give you vast knowledge about every industry because they make you learn everything in the first year.
Semester exams are not too tough if you study from the start, otherwise, they will be tough.
detailed_review.Other:
I chose this course because of placements here, and the best thing is you can learn a lot. Your peers are much more talented than you, so you can learn a lot from them.
I don't have any personal suggestions to improve the course curriculum. Even though the curriculum is old-fashioned, I think this is the best way of teaching because we learn a lot of things.
We have many clubs here, so the connectivity is good, and every day some event or another happens here.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied because of infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students were placed in our course. I'm from civil engineering, and we don't know about the package for civil. We don't know about top recruiting companies. We are 1st-semester students and don't have an idea about internships in which companies. Sorry for this.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are good, and the infrastructure is average as we thought before. Classrooms, labs, and the library are good. Wi-Fi is slow. In the hostel, facilities are good, and food is also good, but in the morning, it's very bad. We don't know why it is like this. We play all sports and games on the same ground, including cricket, kabaddi, football, volleyball, kho-kho, hockey, throwball, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good, as we thought. They explain concepts easily and understandably. Semester exams are a little difficult because the semester-end exams contain five chapters, which makes it hard to study seven subjects. But our college faculty members are ready to explain our doubts.
detailed_review.Other: Because I am interested in construction, and nowadays, software is common.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: RVCE, Go change the World.

detailed_review.Placements: It is one of the topmost colleges in Karnataka. It has very good infrastructure and good placements. This year, the highest package is 92 LPA. It has very good teaching faculty and well-experienced professors and labs. By the completion of the 4-year course, we would definitely get a job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am in the Millennial Hostel of RV College of Engineering. They provide very good food, and it has very good infrastructure. They maintain very good health. But one drawback is that they do not provide non-veg food. We have it from outside, but the food is fine, and I liked it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, teaching is very good, with qualified and knowledgeable staff. It has very good teaching staff, highly experienced professors, and very good labs. They conduct three tests and take an average of them, and finally, they will conduct a semester-end examination for 100 marks.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Honest Review of RV College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 30-40% of students were placed in my college in my course. 16 LPA is the highest, 4 LPA is the lowest, and 7 LPA is the average package offered in my course. Satva, Shobha, L&T, JSW, etc., are the top recruiting companies. Around 60-70% of students get internships in the above-mentioned companies. A structural designer is the top role offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department's infrastructure is good. The college has a private Wi-Fi facility; they provide a username and password for Wi-Fi for security purposes. The Civil department has four CAED labs with sufficient systems, one SOM lab, one Geo Technology lab, one Highway lab, one Concrete Technology lab, and some separate rooms for survey equipment. The quality of food is average; morning snacks are good, but lunch and dinner are average. Three canteens are there in the college, and the college also has medical facilities. The college supports sports and games but does not have a proper ground. All vehicles are parked on the ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are M.Tech graduates and have sufficient knowledge. All are supportive. Yes, this course makes the students industry-ready. Semester exams are very hard and strict. If they catch you cheating, they call a parent-teacher meeting and fail the student in that subject.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is evergreen and offers a lot of opportunities in government jobs. It is better to focus on field learning rather than sitting in a room and assuming. There is one big event every year and many minor events in a year. For example, 8th Mile and E-Summit are the fests. The college has a lot of crowds, as RVCE, RVU, and RVCEM are present on the same campus.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: RV College of Engineering is one of the top colleges in Bangalore and is known for its placements.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently studying at RV College of Engineering, Mechanical Department. This year, 25% of students got placed with the highest salary package of 31 LPA. The average salary package offered is 10.75 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Bosch and Mercedes. About 30% of students got internships in companies like Mercedes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is under construction. Campus is decent with a big canteen. Classrooms have Wi-Fi. We also have labs and a library, which is recently made. In the mess, food is good. But rooms and washrooms are not clean. Washrooms are common. We have a ground which is common for all sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are Ph.D holders from reputed colleges like IITs and IISC. Our college focuses on a relevant curriculum and keeps upgrading the syllabus according to advancements. Semester-end exams are moderate in difficulty but hectic. Before semester exams, we have CIEs.
detailed_review.Other: Mechanical department is one of the oldest and best departments of RV college of engineering. It focuses mostly on application-based learning as well as we have various technical and non-technical clubs. Mechanical engineering can be more interesting if they give us opportunity to work on some projects under teachers’ guidance.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall experience of RV College of Engineering .

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good in my college. Every year, almost 90 percent of students get placed. The highest package received by my senior is 92 LPA, and the average package is about 18 LPA. The lowest is 4 LPA. Companies like PhonePe, Google, Microsoft, Mercedes-Benz etc. Are the top recruits of my college. New companies also offer very good packages.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is good in my college. Labs and classrooms lack new technology devices and new PCs. Recently, they opened a very good new library with lots of facilities and new technologies, but the old library lacks the new and the number of computers and infrastructure and charging sockets for laptops.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are good and some are literally bad in my college, but they have egos. Coming to the academics courses in the first year and some courses in the second are useless only for marks. Semester exams are comparatively easier than the CIEs; these are the difficult ones. The curriculum is too good in my college; there are lots of clubs and lots of opportunities as well.
detailed_review.Other: Campus surroundings are among the worst, highly polluted places, and extra-curricular activities are too good. Events are regularly arranged, and fests are arranged a little bit rarely. Connectivity is a very good thing in my college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the best engineering colleges in Bangalore with good faculty, facilities and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of the students who sat for placements were placed. The highest package was around 90 lpa, the lowest was around 4 lpa, and the average was around 10 lpa. All major core and tech companies come here for internship opportunities; the college provides internships for the ones who are interested in its in-house center of excellence and competencies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: High-speed Wi-Fi is available throughout the department, ensuring connectivity for academic and research purposes. Access is granted to students and staff. The department has good labs such as the microcontroller lab, digital communications lab, digital VLSI design lab, etc. Classrooms are equipped with smart boards, whiteboards, and projectors as well. The library is decent with almost all the necessary books. Note that a new library is being opened in the month of December 2024. Hostel facilities are decent, with good food and decent accommodation.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very well experienced, and their teaching is very good. They are all very helpful; you can reach out to them regarding anything related to academics or careers, and they will guide you. The curriculum is well designed and very relevant to the industry needs; however, it is very essential for the students to also take up extra courses, such as NPTEL courses, to strengthen their knowledge. Exams are tough but can be cleared if studied; the pass percentage is roughly 85%.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course as I am interested in electronics; also, it opens up opportunities for me in both core as well as software sectors, things that I think have the potential to improve the course, such as industry visits, seminars of professionals, company projects, etc. There are a few events in a year, but it's not the best in place. RV has good connectivity, and the alumni network and sports are highly encouraged here.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best placement opportunities for circuit branches and very good brand value.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every other student who sat for placements was placed (except the people who went for higher studies). The highest package offered last year was 92 LPA by a company called UIPath for a student from the Information Science branch, and the lowest was around 3 LPA. The average package varied for every branch; for CSE and ECE, it was 15 and 12 LPA, respectively. Top recruiters were Microsoft, Goldman Sachs, Samsung, Qualcomm, Walmart, EY, KPMG, Texas Instruments, etc. Around 30 percent of the students got internships in companies like Texas, Microsoft, Samsung R&D, Walmart, Aveva, Oracle, etc. Top roles offered were field application engineer, SDE, SWE, product marketing engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi speed is pretty decent, but sometimes it doesn't get connected if a lot of devices are using it on a single router. Classrooms are pretty decent; they are renovating all the departments, and the renovated ones are good with smart boards and green board facilities with good ventilation. The library is filled with resources, internet connections, and personal computers for usage. Hostel rooms are decent, but mess food is average; very little effort is put into improving the food, and various insects have been found in the food several times.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers have doctorate degrees. They are approachable, and some of them are friendly also. Teaching-wise, they are good, but some teachers are not of any use at all; all they do is change PPT slides. The course curriculum has been through a lot of changes recently to keep ourselves updated, but it only includes surfacial knowledge, no hands-on project guidance by the professors. We have to make a project at the end of each semester, which helps us become industry ready. Semester exams are easy; whatever is in the notes, the same thing comes in the question paper, not challenging at all. The pass percentage is very high; around 90 percent of students pass on an average.
detailed_review.Other: Electronics is a good field to enter into due to a lot of upcoming market opportunities, and with the advent of AI, placement opportunities and college brand value are two things that are very helpful for me. More lab rotary sessions would be helpful for better understanding; a lot of events and tests happen in the college throughout the year, including E Summit, Kannada Habba, 8th Mile, Annual Sports Fest, etc. A lot of clubs are there in college for extracurricular activities and interests.

admission.title: RVCE Application Process 2025
admission.overview_text: RVCE admission 2026 of all UG and PG programs is an entrance-based. RV College of Engineering is a renowned co-ed an institution situated in Bangalore, Karnataka under Visvesvaraya Technological University. The college, which is known to provide an array of UG and PC programs in the field of Engineering and Technology, provides BTech, M Tech and MCA programme.

faqs.answer: To get admission into the MCA course at R.V. College of Engineering candidates are required to qualify for the PGCET/ KMAT entrance examination. faqs.question: How can I apply online to get admission in RVCE, Bangalore?

The application process for all these exams is linked below: JEE Main Application Process KCET Application Process COMEDK Application Process GATE Application Process Karnataka PGCET Application Process KMAT Application Process

faqs.question: Does RV College of Engineering accept JEE Main scores?
faqs.answer: RVCE admission for all UG and PG courses is entrance-based. At the UG level, RV College of Engineering offers a four-year BE across 10+ specialisations. For admission, candidates must meet the minimum eligibility set by the institute and must appear for one among KCET , COMEDK , JEE Main or any other national-level/ state-level entrance exam.

faqs.question: What is the COMEDK UGCET Cutoff 2025 for BTech CSE at RVCE Bangalore?
faqs.answer: The RVCE Bangalore COMEDK UGCET Cutoff 2025 for B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning) ranged from 480 in the first round to 975 in the last round for the students belonging to the General category under the All India quota. Please note that the qualifying cutoff will vary for different categories, quotas and rounds. To know more about the COMEDK UGCET Cutoff 2025, click here .

faqs.question: Is it worth pursuing BTech at RV College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Total tuition fee for BTech programme at RV College of Engineering is between INR 3.34 lakh to INR 44 lakh. Median package secured in 2022 stood at INR 10 LPA and highest package secured after completion of BTech programme in 2023 was INR 62 LPA. It is known to offer good ROI. This total fee mentioned here is taken from unofficial sources.

faqs.question: Is BTech available at RV College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Yes, RV College of Engineering offers BTech programmes at undergraduate level. College provides a four-year BE (Bachelor of Engineering) programme across 13 specialisations. To be eligible for admission, students need to meet minimum eligibility criteria set by institute, which includes appearing for entrance exams such as Karnataka CET, COMEDK, JEE Main, or other national/state-level exams. KCET qualifiers participate in KCET counseling conducted by KEA, while COMEDK qualifiers attend COMEDK counseling. During counseling process, students fill in their preferred choice of college and course, and seats are allotted based on choices filled and entrance exam scores.

faqs.question: What M.Tech specialisations are offered at RV College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: A wide variety of MTech specialisations are offered at RV College of Engineering. A few of areas of expertise include Software Engineering, Computer Integrated and Manufacturing, Machine Design, Computer Network Engineering, Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Chemical Engineering, Power Electronics, Digital Communication, Highway Technology, VLSI Design and Embedded Systems, Radio Frequency and Microwave Engineering, Product Design and Manufacturing and Communication. Systems.

faqs.question: What is the total fee of M.Tech at RV College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Total tuition fee of M.Tech programme at RV College of Engineering is INR 1.30 lakh. Fe does not include hostel fee or mess fee and only consists of total fee of tuition. Fee mentioned here is taken from official sources.

faqs.question: What are the factors that affects R.V. College of Engineering M.Tech cutoff?
faqs.answer: While preparing cutoff for the R.V. College of Engineering M.Tech course, the authorities will consider examination and admission-related factors. The listed factors will be checked and considered by the authorities while determining the cutoff of R.V. College of Engineering MTech - previous years' cutoff trends, difficulty level of exam, total number of qualified candidates, total number of candidates applying for a specific course or institute, number of seats available for admission, etc. After checking all of these factors, the authorities will prepare the RVCE PGCET/ GATE cutoff for M.Tech admission.

The listed factors will be checked and considered by the authorities while determining the cutoff of R.V. College of Engineering MTech - previous years' cutoff trends, difficulty level of exam, total number of qualified candidates, total number of candidates applying for a specific course or institute, number of seats available for admission, etc. After checking all of these factors, the authorities will prepare the RVCE PGCET/ GATE cutoff for M.Tech admission. data.title: RV College of Engineering Placement Report 2025
summary: The placement data for 2025 has been released on the official website. As per the statistics, the highest package offered to the BE students in 2025 was INR 67 LPA. For MTech and MCA courses, the highest salary stood at INR 35 LPA and INR 20 LPA, respectively. This is to note that the placement drive is still in progress. Furthermore, the average salary for BE was INR 15.24 LPA. For MTech and MCA courses, the RVCE average salary stood at INR 11.24 LPA and INR 8.94 LPA.

The department-wise placement details have also been released. For popular departments like CSE, EEE, BT and ECE, the highest salary offered during RV College of Engineering placements 2025 was INR 67 LPA, INR 30 LPA, INR 14.81 LPA and INR 37 LPA. The number of offers made to CSE, EEE, BT and ECE students was 190, 40, 8 and 148.

faqs.question: Which is the best branch at RV College of Engineering in terms of placements?
faqs.answer: In terms of the highest salary, BE emerged as the top branch with the salary of INR 67 LPA. The highest average salary was also recorded in the BE brach, it stood at INR 15.24 LPA. The number of students selected in BE ans offers made to BE students during RVCE placements 2025 was also the highest. The college also recorded a large count of companies for recruiting the BE students.

faqs.answer: The overall the highest package offered during RV College of Engineering placements 2025 was INR 67 LPA. This was offered to the BE students. sections.heading: Introduction
text: RV College of Engineering is spread over 16.85 acres of land and offers various facilities to the students like a canteen, transportation, library, auditorium, and various other facilities. RVCE Bangalore has a fully automated digital library that is stocked with e-resources like IEEE, ASCE, Springer, Science Direct Engineering, etc. The college also has a badminton court and has a girls' and boys' hostel for the students.
Check out the below videos for more information:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: R.V. College of Engineering, has a fully automated and the digital library stocked with e-resources like Springer, IEEE, Science Direct Engineering, ASCE etc. and 43290 titles and 133392 volumes and book bank facility.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description:
Separate hostel for 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th year students available on first-come first-serve basis. However, the rooms for successive years are alloted on the basis of merit (CGPA)
For final year candidates hostels are available on only single sharing basis

college_info.college_name: Rajalakshmi Engineering College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2026, Placement, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Rajalakshmi Engineering College (also known as REC) is a private college and was established in 1997. The college offers 18 UG and 9 PG level courses in affiliation with Anna University, Chennai. Accredited by NAAC with a grade of A++, Rajalakshmi is recognied by the UGC.
Rajalakshmi Educational Trust is known as the founding pioneers of the institute. REC has achieved the approval of AICTE and accreditation by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). It is recognised by DSIR, Government of India, and SIRO. This ISO-certified college has signed several MoUs with other national and international organisations. The MoUs are signed with universities such as Gedik University, Edinboro University, Altinbas University, Bahir-Dar University, University of Regina, and Infosys, among others.
REC course admissions are entrance-based. REC BTech admissions are based on TNEA scores. While for its MBA programme, the college accepts TANCET scores. The major highlights of Rajalakshmi Engineering College are tabulated below:
For more information about Rajalakshmi Engineering College Highlights check out the below video:

college_info_program.intro: The flagship programmes offered at Rajalakshmi Engineering College are BTech and MBA. The college offers these programmes to students at the UG and PG levels. Further, the college offers these programmes for a duration of 4 and 2 years, respectively with a comprehensive curriculum. REC Chennai courses strive to enhance the learning experience of students in order to prepare them for the industry. college_info.college_name: Rajalakshmi Engineering College Fees 2026
Rajalakshmi Engineering College Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Business System
reviews.review_title: College offers a perfect blend of studies and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 75-80 percent of students got placed in my course. The highest package is about 12 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA, and the average package is 5.5 LPA. Recruiting companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, and Amazon visited the campus. About 60 percent of students also got internships in companies like HCL, Capgemini, and startups. The main roles offered are Software Engineer, Data Analyst, and Consultant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has Wi-Fi in classrooms, computer labs with good systems, and a library with many books and e-resources. The labs are updated and are useful for practical learning. Hostels are neat with basic facilities like cupboards, study tables, and 24/7 water. The mess food is average but hygienic, and the canteen has better options. We also have a medical room, sports grounds, a gym, and indoor games. Overall, the facilities are good for both studies and daily life.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. Most of them explain topics clearly and give guidance for projects. The course syllabus is updated with subjects like AI and Cloud, which are useful for jobs. Exams are moderate, not too hard if you studied, and the pass rate is high (around 85 percent).

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very good college to improve your knowledge and skills.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. The placement training is excellent. The highest package at Rajalakshmi Engineering College is 25 LPA. The lowest package at Rajalakshmi Engineering College is 4 LPA. Many top companies like TCS, Zoho, and many others. Many of the students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are neat and clean. Labs are also neat and clean. At Rajalakshmi Engineering College, the library is good. The hostel facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: It's very amazing and awesome. The syllabus is very easy and good. They are very helpful and kind. They help us a lot in improving our knowledge and skills. They provide extracurricular syllabus also so it is very helpful and knowledge. At Rajalakshmi Engineering College, the faculty members are good and very friendly to the students.
detailed_review.Other: It's a very attractive and awesome college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not only focus on academics, but also on other domains like sports, skills, etc.

detailed_review.Placements: It provides many internship opportunities, and especially, the EEE department has a better scope. Symposiums conducted by our department increase our knowledge. Many companies like TVS also provide courses and internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs here have every facility, including the machines, components, electronic devices, and gadgets that are required to do the experiments. Devices are then and now checked for their efficiency and working, and changed and repaired accordingly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-experienced and good at their teaching skills. Exams are conducted according to the timetable provided in the daily calendar. Teachers here are well qualified, helpful for the practical life knowledge. Extra classes are also kept, and syllabus is completed accordingly.
detailed_review.Other: I had chosen EEE because it has scope in the present as well as in the future. Especially the EEE department is the basis for everything. It also has government job opportunities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: College review by the student in the college.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students got placed. I can't clearly say that 12 LPA is the highest package of our college. TCS is the company that visits our college, along with Accenture, Wipro, and some other top companies. There are companies that we go through online. Clubs are available in the college that would benefit the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All good about the facilities and infrastructure available for our course and department. Food is moderate and the staff are above average. There was a health center in our college. They give a big opportunity in games and sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They are qualified and knowledgeable. The quality of teaching depends on the staff. They are not all the same. This course curriculum is relevant. I don't know about that, but our syllabus is more relevant to it. It is very difficult to score marks and get an O grade, and many get arrears.
detailed_review.Other: I got this course in counseling. They should focus on one language. They are all good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: College and placements are good. Getting a seat through counseling is better.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is good. We can get placed by our skills. All opportunities are available; the thing is, how we are going to use them. Companies like Zoho and Infosys will come for placement drives. The average package offered was nearly 3 LPA, while the lowest package was 1.2 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Information Technology and Computer Science have similar curricula. The hostel is just above average; 6 sharing beds in Habitat is okay, but the food was the worst. The campus is hygienic, with greenery around. The computer labs have basic facilities. Otherwise, it has good infrastructure, and there is a teachers' lounge.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good. If you are ready to use them, they will be ready to teach you and train you. The curriculum is not bad, and exam questions are generated by ChatGPT. The course curriculum is relevant, but its effectiveness relies heavily on the teaching.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Satisfied because of good placement and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 80% of students in my department who were eligible for placement got placed. There are super dream packages as well. Only if you are dedicated and have the required skills. Here, you'll get plenty of free time to learn. If you use that perfectly. You will succeed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not top-tier, but good. Hostel facilities are also good, but the food served in the hostel is one of the worst. If you opt for the AC hostel. There won't be a non-vegetarian menu option for you, non-vegetarian food is provided in non-AC hostels for boys, but only 3 times a week.
detailed_review.Faculty: As it is an autonomous college. The exams conducted are evaluated inside the college by REC faculty members only. The questions for exams are generated by ChatGPT. Some faculty members know things well and guide you well. On the other hand, there are also ones who'll just read PPTs and get paid.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Rajalakshmi Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: Compared to other normal colleges, its placements are good. Top companies come for placements. Students get a minimum package of 4 LPA. Highest package is 32 LPA. REC provides both UG and PG courses. Most of the students get the internship from many companies. Many of the microprocessor companies are hiring.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is average, and food is also average. Classrooms are neat. Library is very neat and silent, and most of the useful books are available in the library. Canteen is also neat, and the food is average. REC promotes sports and games normally. Medical treatment is really good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers are very friendly, and they clear the doubt during the class itself. Teaching quality is good. This makes the students study. This course is curriculum-relevant. It makes the industry ready. Semester exams at the Rajalakshmi Engineering College are average. Pass percentage is 50%.
detailed_review.Other: Because BE Electronics Communication Engineering has a better scope in future.  Events and fests are better in college. Scholarship is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Basically, placements are good in our college. I prefer students join this college for sure.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 80% of students get placed in our college. The highest package offered in my course is 32 LPA. More companies offer jobs to students with a good CGPA. For students with a good CGPA, placements are so good. I recommend my college to all students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college facilities and infrastructure are very good. The hostel accommodation could be improved. They are cleaned daily. The food options in the hostel are repetitive and not enjoyable. It is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are dedicated and will complete the syllabus on time, with continuous assignments provided to students. Semester exams are straightforward, consisting mostly of direct questions. They will also provide important questions.
detailed_review.Other: Once a year, the college organises a fest named Recharge. It lasts for about three days, and we can enjoy it a lot during it. Many famous stars will come to the college to perform concerts.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied with the infrastructure and the playground.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 180 students in our department, but 30-40 members have not been placed. The highest package provided by the company is by Zoho, where a girl is placed for Rs. 2,700,000 per annum, and the lowest package is Rs. 3,00,000 per annum. The placement can only be attended by the non-arrear students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The new hostel, the food, and the infrastructure are good, but the old hostel is not up to the level of average. Our course is very good and it makes our future bright, so that we can make our career in the best way. Many other students can easily crack the interview with their help.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are skillful enough that they can repeat lessons if the students cannot understand. They are all calm and collected, so their teaching is very easy to understand and can be learned quickly. They are also skillful in teaching during our lab sessions.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college for placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: In the past year, most of the students got placements and some went for higher studies.

detailed_review.Placements: B.Tech AIML students are mostly placed in good companies. Minimum package is 4 LPA, and maximum package received by seniors is 22 LPA. Around 80-90% of students got placed. Companies like TCS, etc., come for recruitment. Most of the students got internships in the top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Two big laboratories are available in our college. Wi-Fi is available in every canteen, and network at every single lab. Many classes contain smart boards. I am a day scholar, I got partial good feedback from hostellers.
detailed_review.Faculty: Staffs are well educated and experienced about semesters. There will be strict rules on it, and pass percentage is 50 or above. We should study the exact answers for the semester exams to get pass marks in all the subjects, no marks will be boosted on the exams. Faculty members are very chill and friendly to the students.
detailed_review.Other: For every festival management is preparing events to help students calm and relax to vibe. There are many symposium for students to participate in.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Good placements, solid syllabus, and needs better industry exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 75% of students got placed. The highest salary is 7 LPA. Average salary is 3.5 LPA to 4 LPA, and the lowest is 2.5 LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Infosys, Zoho, Wipro, and CTS. 60% of students got internships at TCS iON, IBM, Zoho, and startups. Top roles offered are data analyst, ML intern, python developer, and AI/ML engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Department facilities are smart classrooms with projectors, high-speed Wi-Fi, well-equipped AI & ML labs, and access to a central library with online journals. Hostel rooms are decent with 24X7 Wi-Fi and good maintenance. Mess food is average. Canteen has better options. On-campus medical center is available for basic health needs. It has large playground, indoor games, gym, and regular sports events.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are supportive, well-qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching is mostly theory-focused but clear and helpful. The curriculum is solid and covers core AIML topics. A few outdated portions exist, but overall it gives a good base. Extra effort is needed to become industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: Best things about the course are good syllabus, decent lab exposure, supportive faculty members, and demand in job market. It could improve more industry exposure, hands-on projects, and real-time tools should be added. Placement training can start earlier. Many technical and cultural fests like Recursion and Kalakrithi are conducted. Campus crowd is vibrant and active. Our campus is well-connected to city via buses. Our campus surroundings are peaceful. Scholarships are available for eligible students. Lots of clubs and extracurricular activities are there to explore talents.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Overall good for all including extra-curricular activities.

detailed_review.Placements: Over the 2023-24 placement season, 305 companies visited the campus, and more than 1,570 job offers were made (as of September 2024). In the previous 2022 cycle, REC saw 322 recruiters and more than 2,058 offers. The highest package in 2022 reached 31.31? LPA, a significant leap from 12 LPA in 2021. The median/average packages for B.Tech students this year hovered around 4.5 LPA to 4.7 LPA, with PG students averaging 4.2 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides 24X7 internet lab, free Wi-Fi across campus and hostels, 1.155 Gbps dedicated leased line, and more than 2000 PCs/laptops with fibre-optic backbone. It has lecture-capturing system, interactive panel, LCD projectors, and smartboards in all seminar halls and classrooms. It has 244 total labs, including 113 computer labs, plus specialized research and center of excellence facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has eminent professors like Dr. G. Thanigaiyarasu (dean, mechanical) 34 years of experience, Ph.D. (France), guided 9 PhDs, expert in fatigue/fracture mechanics. Dr. L. Sujatha (ECE) 30 years of experience, established center of excellence in MEMS and Microfluidics with a cleanroom, 7.5 crores in sponsored projects, award-winning researcher. Dr. V. Murali Bhaskaran (CSE), 25 years of academic/research experience, Ph.D. guided 19 PhDs, specializes in architecture, network, and information security.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of super experience.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Supportive faculty members, good campus life, and practical AIML learning.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-85% of students from my batch got placed. The highest package is 10 LPA. The average package is 4.5 LPA. The lowest package is 2.5 LPA. Recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, Cognizant, Zoho, Wipro, and Accenture. Nearly 60% of students got internships mainly from Zoho, Virtusa, and CTS. Top roles offered are software developer, data analyst, QA tester, associate engineer, and business analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has very good infrastructure. Classrooms are equipped with projectors and have good ventilation. Wi-Fi is available across the campus with decent speed. Labs are well-maintained with modern equipment. Library is spacious and has a wide collection of books and journals. Hostel rooms are neat. The mess food is hygienic, though not very tasty. Medical facilities are available 24X7. Sports infrastructure includes both indoor and outdoor games. Overall, the campus is clean and eco-friendly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are experienced, supportive, and well-qualified. They use both traditional and modern teaching methods, including PPTs and practical sessions. The curriculum is regularly updated to match industry standards and includes value-added courses. Many topics are aligned with what companies expect, which helps during placements. Semester exams are moderately difficult but manageable with proper study. Pass percentage is quite good, with most students clearing exams on the first attempt.
detailed_review.Other: I chose AIML because it's a trending and future-proof field. The course at Rajalakshmi Engineering College offers a good mixture of theory and hands-on learning with python, ML, and AI tools. Faculty members are supportive, and classes are mostly interactive. It would be better if we had more core AI internships and lab hours. Campus life is lively with many events, clubs, and a friendly crowd. Hostel and transport facilities are decent, and Wi-Fi is reliable. Overall, its a good experience.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: The college is good and supportive.

detailed_review.Placements: REC is known for its strong placements. It has a good scope with very good support. 60% of students got internships from this course in good companies. The top roles available are in mechanical engineering, automobile, computer science, artificial intelligence, data science, and machine learning, along with comprehensive placement training. Our college provides very good placements in good companies. It also provides good service and good placement training.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Canteen and medical facilities are very good. Hostels are very clean. Sports are allowed to support students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching is good. Teachers are good and supportive. The college has many faculty members. The semester exam pass percentage is 80%. They teach us very well for the semester exams. They provide training before semester exams like CAT1 and CAT2.
detailed_review.Other: They conduct many fests and events.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement in 2023 and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: My college has a good placement drive. Many companies, Wipro, TCS, HCL Technologies, JP Morgan, etc., are likely to come for placements. Students are placed with a minimum package of 3.5 LPA and a maximum of 7-8 LPA, based on the CGPA they have secured.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have around 15 to 25 labs for our department. There are almost 35 classrooms for the CSE department. The food facility is decent, with affordable prices. Classrooms are available for every batch of students who are using them. There is a separate block for first-year students, and after their second year, they move to their respective department blocks.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers provide notes and research papers for our assessments and semester exams point of view. They also help with extracurricular activities. Qualified teachers with proper certifications are available. They conduct special and compensatory classes for students who score low marks on assessments.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Rajalakshmi Engineering College is really good with infrastructure and placement facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Rajalakshmi Engineering College''s placement record is good. Almost 95% of students get placed every year. This college has a good placement training cell. They arrange more campus interviews. More IT companies visit this college campus for interviews like TCS, Infosys, Accenture, Teach Mahindra, etc. Students' salary packages range from 2 LPA - 8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college classroom facilities are excellent. There are many departments and laboratories in this college. This college has many computer laboratories. Boys and girls hostel facilities are also available in this college. Multiple sports grounds and coaching staff are available in this college. Mess foods is very hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers and management staff here are very friendly. They are very helpful persons. They conduct many workshops and events every semester. 90% of students get first-class marks in all semesters. Our department staff give more ideas for our final year projects.
detailed_review.Other: Rajalakshmi Engineering College has excellent transportation facilities. This college management conducts many cultural events. This college has more than 15 courses. The college infrastructure and placement facilities are excellent, so I chose this college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements in our college. Satisfied with the staff's teaching.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are good. Around 90% of the students got placed in this final year. The highest package is 40 LPA. The average salary ranges between 5 LPA - 6 LPA. 80% of the students got internships in many companies. Top companies are TCS, Cognizant, Amazon, and HCL.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are equipped with smart boards. Labs are equipped with well good AC and systems. The hostel is quite good, with accommodation upto 5 students per room with attached bathroom. The food is not that good. The medical facilities are also good. Sports are taken well care in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and qualified. The quality of teaching varies for each staff. The courses are highly industry related with AI taken question papers are difficult to write. They provide industry standard questions that are also difficult but can write well.
detailed_review.Other: Recharge is our college cultural which will happen for 3 days.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechatronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: I enjoy my college life, but not the food in the mess & canteen. Teachers teach well, and I am good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students in my class are placed, with the highest package is  8 LPA and the lowest is 3.5 LPA. Top companies like Hyundai, Accenture, Ashok Leyland, Sutherland, and more. 40% of students complete internships, and my course is very valuable in currently and in the future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Jio Wi-Fi is available, and classrooms are neat. Every classroom has CCTV. The library is also awesome, and now they have added more features to the library, like ID card scanning to enter the library. The hostel rooms are not bad, they are good to stay in, but the food is average and not worth the money. Medical facilities are good, and sports are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are definitely qualified, and some faculty members have studied abroad, like in Canada and Korea. The teaching quality differs from faculty to faculty. Of course, the syllabus is good. The semester exams are really tough, and if you study well, you will score well, but the question papers are really tough.
detailed_review.Other: Basically, I like roots, but my parents forced me to join engineering. I noticed this new course and joined it to explore what the course is about, and it's good. This course is a combination of automobile, robotics, mechanical, and electrical.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Best infrastructure, better placements, and well-trained staff.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 40% of students are placed in the Information Technology course. The highest package offered in my college is 20 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 6 LPA. The average package offered is 5 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Zoho, Google, TCS, Annexure, etc. Around 80% of students get internships in companies like Zoho, Google, Meta, Amazon, and TCS. The roles offered in my course are software engineer, software developer, graphic designer, UI/UX designer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a block called Teach Lounge and Idea Factor. The whole block is full of computers, which is given with good internet access. The Teach Lounge is even filled with Macs. We can share our ideas regarding any project, and there is a team to help implement those ideas. The hostel food tastes good, and they provide different varieties of food daily. We also have a small gym in the hostels. Right now, our college is constructing a well premium hostel that is more like a five-star hotel, with AC rooms, a swimming pool, a gym, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well knowledge. They teach us good. They keep updating themselves daily. We don't hesitate to ask any of the staff regarding the subject. We engage ourselves in developing skills taught by the staff. The course is relevant to the future. The semester exams are hard, which makes us study more and get good grades.
detailed_review.Other: I am really passionate about taking IT. The course gives me knowledge for future placements. So far, everything seems perfect regarding my course. Our college is a happening campus filled with cultural and fests. They give importance to extracurricular activities. The surroundings are really neat and clean. It's a green campus.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: A great future ahead in a great college.

detailed_review.Placements: There will be more than 80% of students who get placed. The highest package is 10 LPA. The lowest package is 3 LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Cognizant, and also banks. 100% of internship opportunities are there. Top roles are marketing and sales.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There will be a special Wi-Fi spot for students, where they can utilise it. There will be centralized AC classrooms for us. We have a big library. The hostel is neat. The food is average. There will be good medical facilities. Apart from education, there will be a good career in sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very kind and helpful. They instantly clarify our doubts. Subjects are very helpful for the career. If students listen to the class, they can easily pass. The pass percentage is 50% in the main semester. It also considers the internal exam marks.
detailed_review.Other: My major interest is to do business, so I chose an MBA course. An MBA needs some more practical experience and knowledge, but my department is starting to improve the study culture by exposing outside to get a better understanding and knowledge.

college_info.college_name: Sharda University: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2026, Placements, Ranking, Cutoff, Faculty

highlights.summary:
Sharda University was established in 2009. It is a private university and has been approved by the UGC, State Government, MCI, AIU, DCI, PCI, COA, INC, Council of Architecture, BCI, and others. Sharda University Greater Noida was established under Sharda Group of Institutions and is accredited by NBA and the NAAC with an A+ grade. For Sharda University Noida Campus admissions, candidates are selected through state and national-level examinations conducted by different authorities and through the Sharda University Admission Test (SUAT).
Also, the Sharda University UP is spread over 180 acres and gives world-class facilities to students. Sharda University Noida UP rankings include 87th in the University category by the NIRF 2025. The university has ranked 101-150 in the Management category and 101-150 in Engineering category by NIRF 2025.
Students can also take a look at the USPs of Sharda University Greater Noida:
Apart from this, Sharda Noida courses are offered at UG and PG levels in the fields of Business & Management Studies, Humanities & Social Sciences, and Engineering with the flagship courses being Sharda University BTech and MBA. The major highlights of Sharda University Greater Noida UP are given here:
Sharda University Highlights 2026
Check out all details of Jindal University here:

table.details: NAAC with an A+ grade and NBA

- 87 in University

- 101-150 in Engineering

- 101-150 in Management

college_info_program.intro:
At the UG level, a diverse range of Sharda University Greater Noida courses are offered. Sharda Greater Noida has four-year BTech courses, three to five-year BSc, three-year BA, three to four-year BBA, and plenty of other programs for its students. At the PG level, Sharda University UP gives two to five-year MBA/PGDM, two to three-year MSc, two-year MA, and other courses to the students.
The Sharda University course fees depends on factors such as specialisation, course level and type with the fee structure consisting of admission fees, tuition fees, security deposit, examination fees, etc. While the total Sharda University course fees is usually around INR 30,900 and INR 76,21,947. Candidates can check the Sharda University Noida Campus popular programmes as well as a few branch-wise median packages in the information given here:
