highlights.summary:
Siddaganga Institute of Technology was established in 1963, as an educational institute based in Tumkur, Karnataka. The Institute is affiliated with Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi and approved by the Government of Karnataka. It received an autonomous status and is accredited by the NBA. Furthermore, it is accredited by NAAC with a grade of A and is approved by AICTE.
Siddaganga Institute of Technology offers entrepreneurship opportunities through awareness camps, incubation centres, an MSME business incubator, and various other facilities at a cost of INR 1.10 Crore. Around 80% students have received placement packages successfully through some of the top recruiters such as Amazon, Akamai, TCS, Wipro, Mind Tree, L&T, and many more. The Institute has a network of 33K alumni across 24 countries. For more details, check out the table below:

college_info_program.intro: Siddaganga Institute of Technology offers courses such as BTech, BArch, and MBA, as some of the popular ones as highly demanded by candidates. The Institute offers respective courses on the basis of merit and valid scores of accepted entrance exams. Candidates must secure a minimum aggregate of 45% to 50% in Class 12 and 50% in graduation, for admission to UG and PG level courses. Furthermore, the Institute offers respective courses at a total tuition fee ranging from INR 3.2 Lakh to INR 10.5 Lakh. Siddaganga Institute of Technology Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The campus also has a lab, gym, and sports facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: All departments are there. Placement tests are also held, and project works are also given by teachers. An employment program is also held. As per teachers who teach English, students should speak good English, as speaking skills are required, and we have to attract others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure and daily cleaning facilities are also available. There are many trees, but the roads inside the campus are not so good. Road should be repaired, Xerox facilities and one tea shop, and one canteen are also available on campus. Hostel facilities are also provided, which are free.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are strict and respond. Teachers help students only if students ask for help. Otherwise, there is no special importance for students from teachers. Teachers are remaining alone, as far as I know. I was told that many teachers are not likely to teach. They teach only for their salary ( only some teachers).
detailed_review.Other: Events are good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the training and placement.

detailed_review.Placements: In SIT, we have almost 100% placements. Our training and placement department will bring all the possible companies. While coming to our branch, Electronics and Communication, we have above 70% of packages. The highest package is as high as 34 LPA. Our branch ECE package is 20 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have all the infrastructure available, such as Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries. As I'm a day scholar, I know the facilities in the hostels, such as Wi-Fi facilities, hot water, clothes washing, and so on. Food is absolutely good and tasty.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and clearly explain the topics. They will clarify our doubts. The syllabus they keep is very useful for the company and industries. Semester exams are good. We have to score 40% in both internals and exams for passing.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 to 90 percent of students were placed in college. The highest package for 2025 batch was 32.88 LPA, while the average was 9 LPA. For 2024 batch, the average package was 34 LPA. The highest package was offered to the student of Computer Science and Engineering, Information Science and Engineering branch offered by VISA. The average package for CSE is above 10 LPA. Many students got paid internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The labs are very good and well-equipped with Wi-Fi and other facilities needed for students to learn. There are many labs in the CSE Department itself, and on every floor, there are 2 to 3 labs equipped with AC. Most classrooms have a projector or smartboard and have comfortable benches, and they're not congested at all. The hostel rooms are average in size, and they contain single, double, and triple sharing, depending on the hostel. The quality of food provided in the hostel mess is average. Wi-Fi is available in hostel. Sports facilities like table tennis, badminton, basketball, gym, etc., are available on campus itself.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers here are qualified enough and helpful. But some teachers lack teaching skills. Quality of teaching is above average. The curriculum is good, and they keep updating the syllabus according to the market and job requirements in the industry. The semester exams are based on the topics and syllabus taught by teachers, so it's not very difficult to score if you learn the notes given by teachers. The passing percentage is 40 percent in all the tests, quizzes, and lab tests, and everyone should have above 85 percent attendance.
detailed_review.Other: The campus life is good, as the college has a great and well-sized campus. It has a stadium, basketball court, table tennis, badminton court, and gym as well. Two fests are organized by college, 1 in winter and one in summer. A lot of extracurricular activities are organized by college, like sports tournaments and club activities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life in one of my decent COMEDK colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: Total of 1097 students were placed in the year 2025 in our college. The highest package was 32.88 LPA. The lowest was around 3 to 4 LPA, and the average package was around 9 LPA. The top recruiting companies were Cisco, Visa, JPMorgan, and many more. More than 500+ students got internships from our college in the same companies. Top roles were software developers, data analysts, QA testers, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Smart classrooms are equipped with projectors, whiteboards, and audio systems. Each department has its own specialized labs, like CSE, ECE, AIML, etc. High-speed Wi-Fi is available across the classroom, hostels, libraries, and buildings. Library has seating for around 450 students at a time, and also two AC reading halls for quiet study. There are 5 boys and 4 girls' hostels furnished with tables, chairs, cots, book racks, and many more. The quality of food is of a very decent level, with only a veg option available in mess and canteen. Ground is there for at least each sport, and medical care is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers present there are very helpful. Qualified and knowledgeable with a higher degree in their respective branch. The teachers present there provide a high level of education and knowledge regarding the course. The course curriculum is very much relevant to the IT industry as well as all the departments, which we all need for future growth. It makes students ready for the industry for the upcoming years, in which they will be able to serve at each and every stage whenever required. The semester exams are of a moderate level, which can be easily cracked, and 9 to 10 students fail.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because SIT has a good placement record for many years in branches like CSE, ECE, and AIML. The best things about this course are that it has well-equipped labs, supportive teachers, and a peaceful campus environment. I think a greater variety of food should be available at mess and make some growth in the placement of lower branches, like mechanical, civil, and many more. There is a cultural fest named Sanskriti and a tech fest named Kalashree, and department-level events are vibrant. Campus crowd is very friendly and diverse. Connectivity is well-connected to Tumkur city, buses and autos are available.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good facilities, supportive faculty, and vibrant campus.

detailed_review.Placements: 78 percent students got placed. The highest package is 28 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA. It is a good college with a good placement officer who takes care of each individual, which is why we are facing placement issues. The top roles offered are design engineer and associate engineer, and all students have secured internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has modern classrooms, Wi-Fi, labs, and a resourceful library. Hostels are clean with good amenities. The mess and canteen serve hygienic food. Medical care is available, and sports facilities encourage active participation. I am happy with the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, supportive, and knowledgeable, making learning engaging. The curriculum is well-structured, relevant, and industry-oriented, preparing students for careers. Semester exams are moderately challenging with good guidance, and the pass percentage remains consistently high.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Electrical & Electronics Engineering for its wide scope in power and technology. The course blends theory with practice making it exciting. More industry exposure can improve it. The campus offers vibrant fests, scholarships, clubs, good surroundings, connectivity and an energetic crowd.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements for core, we need core internship and vision design instead of coding.

detailed_review.Placements: 78% of students got placed. The highest package is 28 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and it's a good college with a good placement officer who takes care of why we are facing problems in placements. The top roles offered are design engineer and associate engineer, and all got the internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good and everything is according to your studies, related, and the hostel for girls is not far, and they won't provide the afternoon Tiffin box, we have to go and receive it, then we have amenities where girls can sit and study, get ready, and we can study and enjoy.
detailed_review.Faculty: All lectures help to study, and they take an extra class in the name of a study hour. They clear your doubts. The only thing is we have to be practical and strong in electrical, so that we can understand both theories and practical lectures, labs are too good and you can study better.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was interested in electrical design.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: SIT combines quality education, labs, hostels, and extracurricular opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the 2021-2025 batch, pursuing B.E in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering nearly 75-80% of students from our course secured placements through campus drives. The highest package offered was around 12 LPA, average package stood at 5.5 LPA, while the lowest was 3.2 LPA. Top recruiters included Infosys, TCS, Wipro, HCL, Cognizant, and Bosch. About 65% of students also received internships, like TCS, Infosys, and Bosch. The major roles offered were Embedded Engineer, software developer, and VLSI design Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Has good infrastructure that supports academics and student life. Classrooms are spacious, clean, and equipped with projectors for interactive learning. Labs are well-maintained and updated, giving students practical exposure along with theory. The library is a highlight, with a wide range of books, e-sources like IEEE and Springer. Wi-Fi works reliably across the campus. Hostiles are comfortable, and mess food is hygienic. Medical facilities are reliable. Sports and extracurricular facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are approachable and willing to clarify doubts both during class and after class. The teaching quality is good, combining theory with practical sessions. The course curriculum is reasonably updated and provides a solid foundation in core subjects. While the syllabus prepares students academically, gaining industry-specific skills. Semester exams are moderately challenging. The pass percentage is fairly high, around 85-90% indicating the exams are fair but demand consistent preparation.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the 2025 batch, B.E in Telecommunication Engineering. The best thing about course is structured labs, practical projects, and exposure to modern telecom tools. I wish the curriculum included more industry-oriented electives. Campus life in SIT is lively and engaging. The annual technical and cultural fests are well-organised. Extracurricular activities are actively promoted through clubs for technical projects, robotics, cultural events, and sports.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Supportive faculty, good hostel, modern labs, safe campus, and decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Completed Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering at SIT Tumkur. About 80–85% of my batch got placed, with packages ranging from 4 LPA to 12 LPA, with an average of 6 LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Infosys, Amazon, and Texas Instruments. Nearly 60% secured internships in companies like Cognizant and Wipro.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Sports facilities include cricket, football, and volleyball grounds and indoor games like badminton and table tennis. Overall, the combination of good academic infrastructure, hostel comfort, medical care, and extracurricular facilities creates a supportive environment for students. Our course had well-equipped labs, Wi-Fi, a library, and smart classrooms. The hostel offered good food, medical care, sports, and decent facilities. The infrastructure for the Electronics and Telecommunication course at SIT Tumkur is well-developed and student-friendly. The department is equipped with spacious classrooms, projectors, and reliable Wi-Fi connectivity, which makes learning more interactive and accessible.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable, the curriculum was industry-relevant, exams were moderately difficult with a high pass percentage, and overall teaching quality was good. The faculty in the Electronics and Telecommunication department at SIT Tumkur are highly qualified, approachable, and supportive. Most professors hold advanced degrees and have a good blend of teaching and research experience, which makes the classes engaging and insightful. They are always willing to clear doubts and guide students through projects, seminars, and internships. Guest lectures and industry sessions are also organized, which provide additional exposure beyond the course curriculum, which is well structured and regularly updated to align with industry.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in electronics. The best were the labs and exposure. Improvement is needed in placements. Campus is vibrant with fests.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Well satisfied with the teaching.

detailed_review.Placements: We had almost 90% placements. Our training and placement department brought all the possible companies. In our branch, Electronics and Instrumentation, we had above 50% placements. Our branch had fewer placements compared to EC and others. The highest package was as high as 60 LPA across all branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We had all the infrastructure available, such as Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries. As I was a day scholar, I knew facilities in the hostels, such as Wi-Fi, hot water, clothes washing, and so on. The food was absolutely good and tasty.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very friendly and clearly explained the topics. They clarified our doubts. The syllabus they followed was very useful for companies and industries. The semester exams were good. We had to score 40% in both internals and exams to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to join SIT irrespective of the branch. I got ECE, and the best thing about it was that we could go either for the core or the IT side. Our college conducts events regularly to improve the students' skills. Our college had the biggest fests, Halcyon and Spandana, which were celebrated grandly.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A life in my college Tumkur.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, almost 90% of students get placed easily. Many companies visit our college. The highest, lowest, and average package offered in our courses are 32.38 LPA, 3 LPA, and 9 LPA. Top companies in our college are JP Morgan, Hyperface, IBM, Indiamart, and many more. About 900 students get internships in my college and in my branch. Top roles offered are data analyst, researcher, HR, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My college has all types of facilities and infrastructure available for our course or department like Wi-Fi on each floor and classrooms, well-maintained classrooms with 4 fans as well as a big library which is useful for the students. The quality of food provided in the mess is very brilliant. There are many types of food items available in the college mess as well as their canteen. There are also medical facilities inside the main campus of SIT Tumkur and a well-maintained field for various sports like cricket, football, hockey, kabaddi, and many more sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers involved here in all the departments are very well educated as well as have higher degrees in their respective subjects and fields. They have a knowledge of about 95% of the subjects, and their quality is very well maintained over the 4 years. This course is very relevant as it gives an idea about different fields of IT sector which include coding, skills, and many more. The semester exams are good. You have to be careful before the exam if you need to score a good SGPA at the end of your exams. 90% students get pass here.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as it is also related to computer science and engineering branch as I did not get a good rank to get CSE there in SIT Tumkur. The best thing about this course is that it is same as CSE both of them have coding, theory as well as practical subjects. I think everything in this course, especially in my college is of decent level and needs no further improvement. There is a fest that happens in my college that is Halciyon, and a technical fest is also conducted between April to June every year.

The college authorities revised their curriculum as per the changing trends so as to give the practical implications of the subject which will help the students. Course curriculum was a bit loose but the gaps were filled via interaction with other department students and faculty. Course was the best rated one, be it the dean sir or other visiting faculty members.

college_info.college_name: Siddaganga Institute of Technology Admission 2025: Fees, Courses, Eligibility and Selection

admission.title: Siddaganga Institute of Technology Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: Siddaganga Institute of Technology admissions 2025 enquiry form is open for various programmes. Siddaganga Institute of Technology admits BTech students based on national-level entrance exams such as KEA / COMED-K / JEE–Mains / State level exams. The mode of application is online. The institute offers a range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses in Engineering, IT, Architechure and Management. Popular courses offered by the university are BTech, MTech and MBA and BArch.

faqs.question: What are the minimum marks required to get a seat at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Siddaganga Institute of Technology offers admission to various UG and PG level courses on the basis of merit and valid scores of accepted entrance exams. Candidates must secure a minimum aggregate of 45% to 50% in Class 12 for UG level admissions. Whereas, for PG level admissions, candidates must secure a minimum aggregate of 50% in graduation. In addition to this, candidates must secure valid scores in JEE Main, CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT, KMAT, GATE, and others.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in the BTech programme at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for BTech at Siddaganga Institute of Technology, you should qualify in CET, COMED-K, JEE Main, or any state-level entrance test of recognised status. The minimum educational qualification is class 12 with Mathematics and Physics as mandatory subjects. Properly qualified candidates can apply online through the official website. Meritorious admission is done, and branch-wise allotment is on the basis of entrance rank.

faqs.question: Is management quota available for BTech at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, Siddaganga Institute of Technology also offers management quota seats for BTech candidates. But even for management quota, the candidate must have already appeared for KEA, COMED-K, JEE Main, or any other entrance exam. Eligibility is based on class 12 with Science core subjects and a minimum percentage. It has a limited number of seats and as per institutional norms.

faqs.question: What is the minimum percentage required for BTech admission at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Minimum 45% in PCM for General candidates and 40% for SC/ST/OBC candidates is the lowest percentage for BTech entry in Siddaganga Institute of Technology. The qualifying examination must be of the same quality as Karnataka's Pre-University level. Optional subjects Computer Science or Biology can be attempted in case of poor marks in Chemistry.

faqs.question: Is NATA compulsory for admission to BArch at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, NATA is compulsory. NATA is required for all the candidates appearing for admission to the B.Arch course in the Siddaganga Institute of Technology. Regardless of category, students must secure a minimum of 40% in NATA. This apart from meeting the academic criteria of 50% in class 12 PCM or 10+3 Diploma with Mathematics.

faqs.question: What are the academic requirements for BArch admission at Siddaganga Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: The candidates should have passed class 12 with 50% aggregate marks in Chemistry, Mathematics, Physics, and English as language or 10+3 Diploma with Mathematics with 50% marks. Admission entails meeting these educational qualifications along with passing NATA.

data.title: Siddaganga Institute of Technology Placement Report 2025
summary: Siddaganga Institute of Technology has concluded the placement drive for the batch passing out in 2025. According to the latest report, 252 recruiters participated in the 2025 placements and offered 1,100 jobs to students from the 2025 batch. Additionally, 500 paid internship opportunities were offered to the batch of 2025. The highest and average packages offered during Siddaganga Institute of Technology placements in 2025 stood at INR 32.38 LPA and INR 9 LPA , respectively. The top recruiters of Siddaganga Institute of Technology in 2025 included ABB Limited, Amazon, AMD India, Applied Materials, Cisco, Commvault, Deloitte India, Emerson, JP Morgan Chase & Co., JSW, Microchip Technology, Morgan Stanley, Myntra, among others .

Earlier, 250 recruiters visited the Siddaganga Institute of Technology campus in 2024 and offered 980 jobs to the students of the 2024 batch. The highest and average packages offered during Siddaganga Institute of Technology placements in 2024 stood at INR 34 LPA and INR 8.5 LPA , respectively.

summary.college_name: School of Technology Management and Engineering

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: A pretty underrated tier-2 college for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm currently studying B.Tech in AI, and till now, no batch has passed out yet for this course. The first batch will be passing out in 2025. But for other branches of B.Tech, I would say that the placements are below average. In 2023, the median package was 6 LPA and the highest was 12 LPA. Considering fees and other expenses, this is definitely a bad ROI. This year, I got to know from my seniors that companies like TCS have tests with 4 levels, and your salary is decided based on how many levels you clear. For clearing level 1, it is 4 LPA, level 2 is 5-7 LPA, level 3 is 7-9 LPA, and level 4 is 10/10+ LPA. After the tests, there is an interview, where they will decide the final salary from the range in which you have landed after the tests. Mostly all the companies that go to B.Tech colleges come here for placements as well, like TCS, Accenture, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The first thing I would like to say is that the campus is SMALL. It is smaller than my school's campus, and there are no sports facilities. It is just one average-sized building. Given that, if you are okay with a smaller campus, then the college won't be a problem, as the building does have good infrastructure. For example, it is fully air-conditioned, and yes, the ACs do work properly. The labs are very good and equipped with the best gear. The lifts function well, and there are enough lifts. Wi-Fi is available, but it doesn't really work except in the library. The classrooms are good and comfortable. The washrooms are clean. The library has a good amount of study material and is a good place to study as well. The canteen is pretty good as well; there are a ton of things to choose from, and the rates are pretty reasonable. The taste is also good. They do provide a hostel, but it is off-campus, and I haven't heard good things about the hostel either. The rooms are decent but overpriced: 3.3 LPA if you want an AC room and around 3 LPA for a non-AC room. So, it is better to rent a flat or stay in a PG nearby.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are definitely very good and helpful. Of course, if you don't have a good relationship with them, then that's probably your fault. They are highly qualified individuals and very knowledgeable. Most of my teachers this semester were IIT graduates. The teaching quality is good, and the teachers will help you out whenever you need it. The course has changed a little from this year due to NEP, and it has definitely improved now. We get to learn a wide variety of subjects which will help us shape ourselves in the longer run (though we hate them right now because we have to study more subjects than earlier batches). If the student is following the curriculum, studying regularly, and completing all the assignments and projects, then I can say that the student will be fairly ready for the industry. We have 3 exams during a semester: 2 midterms (10/20 marks each) and a term-end exam (100 marks). The midterms were a breeze, but the term-end exams are definitely on the tougher side. YOU WILL HAVE TO STUDY HARD FOR THE TERM ENDS, or else you might not even pass. For instance, more than half of my class is failing calculus this semester. And no, you cannot cheat; the monitoring is very strict in the term-end exams. You'll be lucky if you get to cheat without getting caught.
detailed_review.Other: The events and fests are mid-level. Since the campus is small, there is very little space for events and fests. They aren't bad, but I've definitely seen better events and fests being hosted by other colleges. The crowd is good and diverse, as there are students from a lot of courses in the same building, so you can connect with people from different fields and courses easily.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech. in Computer Engineering + MBA in Technology Management
reviews.review_title: Review of NMIMS Deemed to be University - Navi Mumbai Campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 40% of the students were placed in our course. The minimum salary package offered is Rs 16,000. The average salary package offered is Rs 50,000. The highest salary package offered is 1.2 LPA. The top companies to recruit is one Tata and Hindustan Unilever. About 47% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are air-conditioners in classrooms, halls and a huge library with lots of books, encyclopedia, etc. Wi-Fi is arranged in every hall with good internet connectivity. A small canteen is available, but the quality of food is good. Sports, and medical facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good, qualified, and knowledgeable. Most of them are female teachers, with the best teaching quality. Exams are possibly difficult to make students industry-ready. Semester exams are not so difficult if you prepare well. The passing percentage is 34%.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course as I am interested in it. Events, connectivity, and crowd are good.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech. in Computer Engineering + MBA in Technology Management
reviews.review_title: NMIMS Navi Mumbai: Great campus, faculty members and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: This will be the first year of placement, with first batch leaving in 2022. Average PPO offered is 10 Lpa to marketing and 9 Lpa to finance students, most scholars of this batch opted for marketing as their majors. The placement cell is very active, and the package is only expected to increase in the coming years. All students were offered internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am a day scholar, so cannot tell anything about hostel, as I have not seen it. However, the images of campus are 100% true. The campus in genuinely a great piece of infrastructure. From gym area, music area and library to multiple computer labs, Wi-Fi and centrally air conditioned campus and a lavish canteen, the campus is a student's dream.
detailed_review.Faculty: Almost all permanent faculty members are Ph.D. holders, others are currently pursuing their Ph.D.  Even the visiting faculty members are either from the industry or have a lot of teaching experience. The course curriculum is revised almost every semester keeping in mind the industry needs.
detailed_review.Other: This course is UGC and AICTE approved, so it holds legitimate value. It also allows me to get a B.Tech and MBA from NMIMS in 5 years, which is a year less than the actual time a 4 year B.Tech and 2 Year MBA takes. I am being taught basics of accounting right from the start of 2nd year, which is a great thing and helps me build my base. The campus has a nice crowd and events and fests are a sight to behold.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech. in Computer Engineering + MBA in Technology Management
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with this college because of its placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has a strong placement record of placing its students in top companies in India and abroad. A few top recruiting companies are TCS, Deloitte, HDFC, etc. The major factor in our college is placements. It is the best college in terms of placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is spread over 40 acres. Classrooms are spacious and well-equipped. Laboratories and computer labs are well-maintained. The library is the largest factor of our college which makes it superior.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are cooperative and experienced. The exam pattern is good. Exams are conducted strictly.
detailed_review.Other: Overall, our campus is top-rated. Many extracurricular activities are held in our college. Our college is excellent.

Northcap University Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: BBA in Business Analytics
reviews.review_title: Great college life with a good placement offer.

detailed_review.Placements: I must say a full batch of business analytics got placed by university and got an average package of 5 LPA. Almost all the students got a placement if they applied for it, but some students didn't apply for the placement. Our college offers multiple placements and internships in India and abroad, with multiple scholarships and global opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Great infrastructure with a full Wi-Fi campus and a big enough library with most of the books. Our campus has 3 cafes, one inside the building and two in the garden. Our college has a big ground on which students can play, sit, and roam around, and also the whole university is very clean.
detailed_review.Faculty: I must say that our university has a very supportive staff and faculty, and they help you in each and every step if you ask them. Our college gives us mentorship every week and asks us about our problems that we are facing in any domain, like ERP, attendance, issues with faculty, etc.

reviews.course: BBA in Digital Marketing
reviews.review_title: The NorthCap University is a very good college for B.Tech. Also, it is good for management.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of students were placed in my college. Top recruiting companies are Amazon, Mitsubishi, and many more. For campus placements, college follows a mock interview if you pass the interview, you are eligible for placements and it depends on you.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The NorthCap University is not that big, and it has around 10 acres of land. The overall infrastructure is good. Classrooms are fully equipped. The library has all the books that are recommended by the teacher. Hostel is also good. One thing I can say is that the food is good and cooked with hygiene.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers have PhDs. Teaching skills are very good. Everyone has their own way of teaching students. BBA is not a degree where students are industry-ready. Semester exams are neither easy nor difficult. You can pass the exam with minimal studying.
detailed_review.Other: The annual fest at NorthCap University is known as Momentum, it is for 2 days. Many events are organised by the students. This helps in increasing the skills of students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Cyber Security and Forensics)
reviews.review_title: The NorthCap University!

detailed_review.Placements: There are a lot of companies that come to our college every year for placement drives like TCS, Infosys, HCL, Deloitte, Tata, and Byju's. The average package ranges from 2.5 LPA to 6 LPA. About 50-60% of the students get campus placement with an average salary.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college campus is well-equipped with Wi-Fi (we are given 2GB of Wi-Fi, which is kind of less). Our classes are fully air-conditioned with good seating from where the board is clearly visible. The food at the campus is also good with varieties available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-experienced, and the labs are equipped with good instruments. The curriculum is also fine. Exams are conducted two times in a semester, namely Minor and Major, excluding the labs and internals. The assessment of the examination is done by a body of teachers.
detailed_review.Other: It is good for B.Tech and Law.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Great Infrastructure and Facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: As we are first-year students, we don't know much about the placements, but from what we have heard from our seniors, they genuinely help us in getting our placements done with the right knowledge and provide guidance through each and every step. The top recruiter is Dell for now.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is amazing. It is equipped with all the things needed by a student. The library is updated with books, classrooms have smart boards, and Wi-Fi is provided to each and every student. The canteen is great, providing yummy snacks.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our BBA faculty is just out of the world. They help us in each and every work we do. They are very helpful when it comes to answering doubts and problems we face. Our semester exams occur two times, i.e., mid-sem and final-sem examinations. The course indeed makes the students industry-ready as it helps to gain knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: Every year, Northcap University has its annual cultural fest called MOMENTUM. It is a great fun festival.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied because of placements. Good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: They have a very low placement ratio. They show 70% placement, but in reality, out of 600 students, only 100 are eligible to sit for placements. They have terms and conditions like no active backlogs or no backlog till now, and the companies that come here for hiring are offering very low packages.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very decent. They don't have any hostel, but the infrastructure is good; they have Wi-Fi at every corner with decent speed. The library is also up to mark. I would say they have the best canteen, in my opinion. The area of the college is small, which is why it has low sports facilities, but it has good medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is helpful so far; whosoever I have met. They are qualified and can easily solve any issues or doubts about the course; they have great knowledge. I would say the course curriculum is not that relevant; in our course, the main focus was programming languages, but we were learning German, doing GP, and CS. The exams were easy, not that hard to pass.
detailed_review.Other: Very low-budget fest.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Good Infrastructure and Supportive Faculty. Worth a Try!

detailed_review.Placements: My college has a placement cell managed by CPAA. The companies that have recently recruited include Deloitte, TCS, Gemini Solutions, Fidelity, and many more. The highest package from the previous batch was 60 LPA, and the average package in my field is 7.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My university has air-conditioned classrooms, a library, a common room, an amphitheater, an auditorium, Wi-Fi facility, a Thought Lab, a Psychology Lab, cafes, a Maggi Point (NESCAFE outlet), and a sports room for indoor sports like chess, carrom, and table tennis. There are also basketball and badminton areas, multiple washrooms, and drinking water facilities on each floor.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are Ph.D. holders with sufficient knowledge in their respective fields. The college conducts two exams per semester, major and minor, with a moderate difficulty level. The course provided by NCU prepares students to be industry-ready. Additionally, there is an option for semester exchange programs for those interested in studying abroad.
detailed_review.Other: The Northcap University hosts an annual cultural and techno event called "MOMENTUM," which includes a DJ night, a concert, and a wide range of club activities. The college also provides scholarship facilities of up to 25 percent for students scoring 90 and above in 12th boards, which continues if a CGPA of 8.5 is maintained.

reviews.course: BCA in Web Application Development
reviews.review_title: Review: The Northcap University.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of students get placements in our university, with packages varying from 3 Lacs to 12 Lacs. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Wipro, and others. Roles in my course include web development and mobile development. Most of the students get internships from our course and college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available throughout the campus, with air-conditioned classrooms and a large library containing thousands of books. No hostels are available for boys; hostels are only available for girls, and there are limited seats in the hostels. Many games and sports are available, such as cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are well-qualified, helpful, and knowledgeable. The curriculum of BCA is very good in our university, but overall this course is considered lower compared to B.Tech. There are two levels of exams per semester in our university: the first is the minor exam, and the second is the major exam.
detailed_review.Other: This is the only possible way to join the computer field without having Maths as a primary subject in class 12. I wish that the BCA course is considered equal to B.Tech and that companies also offer jobs to us.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce ( B.Com ) – Financial Market
reviews.review_title: Choose the right college for you .

detailed_review.Placements:
Almost 98% are placed in my course. 
The highest package would be 10 lakh. 
The lowest would be 2 lakh. 
The average would be 4 lakh. 
Companies like MNCs and many more small companies are recruiting.
Roles in the fields of cooperative manager, financial minister and many more are offered.
Almost 89% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is way to good; they provide us with AC classes, perfect benches, comfortable smart boards and a perfect garden, which gets awarded for the best garden award almost most of the time. It also provides us with 2 cafes and 1 Nescafe, providing healthy food and junk food .
detailed_review.Faculty:
The faculty are very supportive. 
Teaching quality is top-notch. 
2 exams are conducted in one semester: mid- and final exams. 
Mid exam is not that difficult.
But the final exam is difficult. 
Pass percentage is the credit you earn. 
You should pass each subject with a total of 21 marks .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Full Stack Development)
reviews.review_title: Crowd is not good but the faculty is good. The campus is average but small, no hostel for boys.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 50 percent students were placed this year. The highest package offered this year was 12 lacs per annum. Top recruiting companies were UTS, AVL, Softage, etc. 5 percent students got internships this year. Web developer is the profile in which top roles are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the classrooms have projectors for better teaching and creative learning. The students use these projectors for delivering presentations too. The Library is good having adequate collection of books. But the Wi-Fi is not that good and only provides 2GB for each student daily, the downloading speed is very good but the browsing speed is slow. There is only a girls hostel which is located 1KM away from the campus and there is no boys hostel available. The food quality is good in the cafes. Medical facilities are average and sports coaches are not recruited.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers working in the university are highly qualified. Most of the teachers are doctorate holders in their respective subjects. The course curriculum is relevant with subjects like Physics, Chemistry and basics of mechanics too. The semester examinations are of moderate level and we require 30 percent to pass in theory.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: The infrastructure is really good, but it is not good for the sports students.

detailed_review.Placements: 50 students were placed in my course. The recruiters were Volkswagen, Intel, and NVIDIA. No roles were offered in the course. The highest package was 35 LPA,  4 LPA was the lowest, and the average was 5 LPA. A lot of students do the internships on their own; the college doesn't provide a lot of internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good but there are not a lot of things that should be covered in the facilities. The courses are good. They should also provide boys hostel facilities. They only have female hostel facilities. The hostel food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and humble towards the students. If you ask them any queries related to the subjects or anything related to the subject, they are very helpful and will also tell you about the internship. Also provide the internship on their own.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Excellent faculty and infrastructure with great placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: As I am pursuing B.Tech CSE in data sciences, there are almost 110 students in this specialisation. Companies like Intel, Nvidia, Volkswagen and Jp Morgan come for recruitment for the course. Many students have got internships in fields like Data Science, web development, and cyber security.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are many facilities provided by the universities. Wi-Fi is fully available throughout the campus and labs, classrooms are fully air-conditioned and well-maintained. Libraries are also very clean and fully air-conditioned. The hostel facilities are also very good and the quality of food is also very hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Here the teachers are well qualified, educated and knowledgeable. They are very kind and helpful in nature. Teachers are also available after the lectures and also take extra doubt-clearing sessions for the betterment of students. Extra sessions are also taken after the premises.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have an interest in this course. In this course, the faculty is very experienced and helpful. The fest that happens here is Momentum which is held in November.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: The Northcap University- Gurgaon.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students were placed in my course (B.Tech - CSE). The highest package is 15 LPA, the average package is 5 LPA and the lowest package is 3 LPA. 90% of students got internships from my course in companies like Cognifyz, InternPe and Codsoft. Roles offered- Data Science, Cyber Security, Full-stack etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We do not have hostel facilities. Only a girls' hostel is available. Food quality is very average. Wi-Fi and canteen facilities are also available. The taste of food in the canteen is very nice, food tastes like homemade food. Hostel rooms are cleaned every day in the morning.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful to students, they provide all the assignments. They have a great knowledge about the course they are teaching. The teaching makes us ready for the future. The exams are in moderate mode, not tough. If you study well, you won't face issues passing exams. Passing percentage is 45%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as it has a better scope for the future. Events do happen in this university, they are pretty good.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com. Hons.)
reviews.review_title: Strong Industry Connections and Supportive Faculty at The NorthCap University.

detailed_review.Placements: Not many students got internships in good companies; rather, it was just a matter of certification and not a proper placement and job securing procedure. It was not meant to be this way because so many students come to this college because of good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi was available and access was given to all. The library is large enough for a perfectly calm study environment. The classrooms are good, with centralized AC all over the campus. The ground is huge, and the cafe facilities are a bit tiring as they don't deal in cash but only with canteen cards.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at NCU is typically described as qualified and knowledgeable, with many holding advanced degrees and having industry experience. Students often find them approachable and helpful in resolving academic and career-related queries. Teaching quality is considered good, with a focus on both theoretical knowledge and practical applications. The university emphasizes interactive learning through projects, case studies, and industry exposure.
detailed_review.Other: Interest and Career Goals: Many students choose their courses at NCU based on their interests and career aspirations. For instance, engineering students might be drawn by the university's strong emphasis on technical education and industry ties. Reputation and Opportunities: NCU's reputation for quality education, good placement records, and industry connections often influence students' choices.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the university.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70–80% of the students got placed in my course. The average package offered in my course was 7-8 LPA. The top recruiting companies for the course were Amazon, Synopsys, Deloitte, Upgrade, HDFC Bank, Gemini Solutions and more. The students need to acquire extra skills for them to be able to land internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities include accommodation for both girls and boys, a health centre, a well-stocked library with both online and sprint resources, a gymnasium, a multipurpose sports ground, a cafeteria, auditorium and well-equipped laboratories. The quality of food in the mess and canteen is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: The semester exams are not very difficult to pass. You need to attend the classes regularly and keep up with assignments and projects to be able to score well. The faculty is well qualified and knowledgeable in their respective fields. They are helpful when reaching out for support.
detailed_review.Other: I recommend students join societies and clubs of their choice to get good exposure and acquire new skills.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce ( B.Com ) – Financial Market
reviews.review_title: Good college in terms of infrastructure, safety, and facilities. Faculty are helpful and supportive.

detailed_review.Placements: 15-20% placement. The highest package is 8 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, and the average package is 4-5 Lacs per annum. Most students search companies for internships on their own. The top roles held by the companies during placement are mostly sales and finance. The college has ties with many companies for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are really nice and well maintained. I am a day scholar, but according to my friends who have told me about hostels, they are not inside the college; they are outside the college, and they are only for girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are very helpful in nature, and most of them are Ph.D. holders. Semester exams are moderately difficult. The course curriculum is relevant enough for the B.Com. degree as it covers all the major and important topics that are important to know to complete the degree.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce ( B.Com ) – Financial Market
reviews.review_title: Highly satisfied in pretty much all aspects!

detailed_review.Placements: We are currently in our 2nd year and haven't undergone the placements process yet, but NCU has a dedicated placements and internship cell, CPAA, which helps the students get internships and placements. Internships one has to undergo after the completion of the 4th semester
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure-wise, we have access to everything that might be useful. On a fully air-conditioned campus with Wi-Fi coverage all over the campus, two cafeterias and a nescafe provide various food items; overall, every other thing that might be useful is present.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is pretty supportive and helpful in all aspects. We get a faculty mentor with whom we can share any problems related to college or overall career development. The course curriculum is up-to-date, and exams are conducted twice a semester: minor and major exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: The campus is good but too small, compared to other colleges, whose rules are like those of a school

detailed_review.Placements: The placement ratio is less than expected; it is about 30 out of 100 students in a batch. The highest package I have ever listened to was INR 52 LPA, and the lowest is about INR 2–3 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Wipro, Infosys, and many more for B.Tech. and law students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good, such as classrooms, labs, and the library, and Wi-Fi is available on the college campus for a limited number of students. But hostels are only available for girls, not boys. There are not so many facilities for sports, and the canteen is nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good in nature, helpful, well qualified, knowledgeable, and good in this field. I guess the course curriculum is not relevant for the students. The semester exam is not so tough, and the pass percentage is 30% overall, with a limit of marks in practical with theory.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Good college if you not getting admission anywhere in computer Science.

detailed_review.Placements: Hardly students get placed with good CTC. Average package goes to near 10 lac per annum. Students don't get intern easily. Companies that come don't give CTC above 5 Lacs which is very disappointing. Top roles paint known to me but fir cyber they hire soc analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is really good. All classes have AC, Wi-Fi good and cleaned washrooms. Cafe has decent food but are costly there are 3 places for food. Nescafe point has good maggi. Sports faci are there but has no proper trainer. They have good fields for cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are skilled and have good know of the subject. But few teachers are just for time pass. Paper set in wasy to medium. Very easy to pss if your regular in classes. They have labs with proper equipments. Students are mostly time pass except few studious one.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Full Stack Development)
reviews.review_title: Our college provides good opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Top roles offered are full stack developer, software developer, backed developer, front end developer, data science engineer, data analyst, audit and consulting cyber security expert, technical support assistant, and support and monitoring consulting management. Our college provides good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides all facilities. Wi-Fi facility is available in our college and hostel. All classrooms are smart. The library has sufficient books and examination papers from all the previous years.
detailed_review.Faculty: The student and teacher ratio is 50:1. The course curriculum is relevant and good. Exams are moderate. The pass percentage is 80%.

reviews.course: BCA in Web Application Development
reviews.review_title: Atmosphere provided here is quite commendable, staff and teachers are quite helpful.

detailed_review.Placements: The NorthCap University provides courses in disciplines like BBA, LL.B, BCA, B.A. etc. Students with percentage above 60 percent will get a good placement. Most placements are offered to B.Tech students. Top recruiting companies are Deloitte Consulting, Intel, Daikin, Yatra.com, Maruti Suzuki, Samsung engineering etc. The highest package offered is INR 7-8lpa, average is INR 3.80-4.20lpa and the lowest is INR 2-4lpa.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are quite good and variety of food is available. Food is freshly served and good in taste. Wi-Fi connection is stabilised and passwords and usernames are provided to individuals on their emails. Books are provided in library which are issued with a card. Sports room has variety of games like carrom, tennis, badminton, etc. as well as space is there for outdoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are quite helpful and faculty is nice. Study material is provided on college website in the form of presentations and links for books are also provided. Semester exams are of moderate to high difficulty depending on level of preparation. Students are exposed to various curricular activities as well.
detailed_review.Other: Momentums keep happening in college. There are various clubs and societies like NSS, Optica, Chetna, Enactus, etc. Startup conferences and entrepreneurship meets keep happening and students are provided opportunity. Cultural fests also happen regularly. I wanted to gain knowledge in field of computer and was interested in application development that is why I chose BCA.

college_info.college_name: Northcap University Admission 2025: Eligibility, Process, Date, Fee

faqs.question: Has CLAT 2025 application process begun?
faqs.answer: CLAT Application Process 2025 began on July 15, 2024. The last date to register for CLAT 2025 was October 22. Candidates could fill the CLAT 2025 application until October 22, 2024. Candidates were allowed to fill out a single CLAT 2025 application form for each participating NLU until the deadline. The official website to fill CLAT Application Form is consortiumofnlus.ac.in. Find out more about the application process for CLAT 2025 here.

faqs.question: What is the last date to apply for BCom courses at Northcap University?
faqs.answer: The admission cycle for batch 2025-2028 has already closed. The admissions for the next batch are expected to commence in July of 2026.

faqs.question: How can I take admission to NorthCap University LLM?
faqs.answer: To begin, students seeking admission must check if they are eligible for the course. For LLM, a candidate must have secured 50% or above in any Law UG degree. If eligible, students can apply for the preferred course by visiting the official website of the university. After the application stage, the university commences the shortlisting process. Shortlisting of students is done based on their marks in the qualifying examination. Those who are shortlisted are required to report at the university campus for verification and payment of fees.

faqs.question: What are the minimum marks required for MBA at Northcap University 2023?
faqs.answer: The minimum marks required for MBA at The NorthCap University in 2023 is a minimum of 60% marks at all levels (10,  12 & Graduation) or equivalent. This is part of the eligibility criteria for the MBA programme at the university. Applicants are also required to appear for GMAT/CAT/XAT/SNAP/NMAT and should have a full-time undergraduate degree completion certificate before a specified date.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for admission to MBA at The NorthCap University?
faqs.answer: The NorthCap University's MBA programme requires applicants to appear for GMAT/CAT/XAT/SNAP/NMAT, and freshers and candidates with less than 3 years of work experience as of June 30,  2024, are only eligible. Applicants may submit multiple examination scores, and NCU will consider the best score provided by an applicant while shortlisting applications. Candidates should have a full-time undergraduate degree completion certificate before October 31, and should hold a Bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a recognised institution. Graduation type: 3 years / 4 years or 5 years integrated program. Minimum 60% marks at all levels (10,  12 & Graduation) is a must.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: For more information about The NorthCap University, Infrastructure check out the below video:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Library and information resource center is stocked with rich collection of 88,747 books in print, covering all areas of engineering, law, management and social sciences etc. and provides its users the latest and modern services like online library access to online journals and e-books, Webopac facility, federated search engine ‘KNIMBUS’ which offers single window access to all subscribed resources. Dedicated Multimedia Library where 20 computers have been installed for online access to international journals from various databases like ABI/INFORM, American Society for Civil Engineers (ASCE), American Society for Mechanical Engineers (ASME), Proquest engineering collection, Manupatra and Lexis Nexis for Law students, Sage online journals and E-Brary (e-books database) having 1,18,000 e-books.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Facilities like 24-hour power backup, treated water, Wi-Fi, intercom, indoor sports, entertainment and recreational facilities, central kitchen, bus, etc. available. Accommodation in hostels is allotted on a ‘first come, first serve’ basis. Guest House facility is also available.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 410 published reviews , 343 reviews are verified.

college_info.college_name: Thiagarajar College of Engineering: Fees, Courses, Admissions 2025, Cutoff, Info

highlights.summary:
Thiagarajar College of Engineering (TCE) is as a Government Aided Autonomous Institution, established in 1957 by the philanthropist Late Karumuttu Thiagarajan Chettiar. TCE is affiliated with Anna University, Chennai, and recognised by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). Thiagarajar College of Engineering is also accredited by NAAC with Grade 'A+'. TCE offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs across various streams, including Engineering, Architecture and Science.
Thiagarajar College of Engineering admission is based on both merit and entrance exam.The campus is set within a serene and eco-friendly environment surrounded by dense vegetation and best infrastructure facilities. The highest and average package offered during Thiagarajar College of Engineering placements 2023 stood at INR 32 LPA and INR 7 LPA, respectively. Students can check the highlights of Thiagarajar College of Engineering in the table provided below:
Check out more on TCE Highlights in the below video:

For MTech admission, students must have a graduation degree with 50% aggregate. Students can check the popular programmes offered at Thiagarajar College of Engineering in the following table:
