VJTI Mumbai Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: There are top-notch placements for all branches.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90% of students get placed in the CE branch with a good package. Our college has a legacy and top-notch placement. Talking about overall placement, it is also great and one of the best in Maharashtra, after IIT Bombay, so you can consider admission with placement in mind.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is average. The PG hostel is top-notch, but not everyone gets that. The other hostels are around average, but they are affordable and budget-friendly, with fees around Rs. 22,000 for a normal hostel and Rs. 44,000 for a PG hostel. The food is below average.
detailed_review.Faculty: The exams are tougher in this college compared to other colleges, as the syllabus is deeper than in other colleges. For passing, a minimum of 35-40 marks are required. Regarding course relevancy, it is about 70-30. Some subjects are relevant, while others are not.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this college because of placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, supportive faculty, and active campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the B.Tech Electrical Engineering (2023–27 batch). In my course, around 70–75% of students got placed in the previous batch. The highest package was around 12 LPA, the average was around 4.5 LPA, and the lowest was around 2.5 LPA. Top recruiters included TCS, Infosys, Wipro, L&T, and a few core companies like Siemens. About 60% of students also got internships in companies such as Tata Power and Bosch. The top roles offered were graduate engineer trainee, software engineer, and junior design engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has well-maintained classrooms, projectors, and good Wi-Fi in labs and the library. Labs are updated with the equipment needed for electrical engineering experiments. The library is big with digital access, too. Hostel rooms are decent with proper ventilation, water supply, and 24/7 security. The mess food is average but hygienic. Sports facilities like cricket and football grounds, badminton, and indoor games are available. Medical facilities are also provided on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, many with PhDs and research backgrounds. They are helpful and encourage practical learning. The curriculum is updated and industry-oriented, especially with subjects related to EVs and renewable energy. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty; if you attend classes regularly and prepare, you can easily pass. The pass percentage is usually above 80–85%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose electrical engineering because of my interest in electric vehicles. The best part is the practical exposure and industry talks arranged by the department. I hope the college adds more core company placements and improves hostel food quality. Overall, the campus life, events, and scholarships make the journey rewarding.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Textile Technology
reviews.review_title: Strong academics, good exposure, and lively campus life at VJTI by Prabhu.

detailed_review.Placements: In the textile technology course at VJTI, around 65 to 75% of those women are generally placed through the campus and off-campus opportunities. Highest package offered in recent years has been around 8 to 10 LPA, with the average salary lying in the range of four to five, with the lowest package around 2.5 LPA. Some of the companies that visit are Reliance Textile and Century Enka.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Textile Technology Department of College is well-equipped with specialized laboratories such as pinning, weaving, dyeing, printing, and textile testing labs, which provide students with hands-on industry-level exposure. The classrooms are spacious and fitted with projectors, and Wi-Fi is available across the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty in the Textile Technology department at VJTI are highly qualified, experienced, and supportive, with many holding PhDs and having strong research as well as industry backgrounds. They are approachable and helpful in clarifying doubts, and their teaching quality is generally good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose textile technology at this college because of the institute's strong reputation, well-established department, and the wide scope of the textile industry offered in terms of both core technical and management opportunities. The best part about the course is balance between theory and practical experience, students get to work with well-equipped facts and games, hands-on screening that directly commits to industry practice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college, one of the best.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are really good. There is not a single day when the Training and Placement office is empty. Once the placement season starts in August, companies offering really good packages keep coming until the end of July. If you are good at what you like and what the companies demand, you are sure to get a job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Being a government institute, there is not much you can expect. The funds are not used where they should be. Most of the funds are used to pay the salaries of the contractual faculty. However, there are a few world-class laboratories where quality work is done. Most of these labs are industry-backed and are supported well by the institute.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are a lot of opportunities students get in various forms. The exam schedules are such that students get enough time between semesters to do some extra things. Most of the students prefer doing an internship, with a few getting them on campus as well. There is more focus on independent study.

reviews.course: Diploma in Electronics
reviews.review_title: Best for placements, one of the top colleges for a reason.

detailed_review.Placements: You need at least 80% to get in. The minimum would be 6 LPA, but it could scale up to 13-20 LPA for companies like Tata, Infosys, etc. Currently, we are all interns at companies like Central Railway, BEST, Accord Electro Technics, TIFR, etc. The top roles offered are representative, event manager, and club representative.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All classrooms and some sitting areas have Wi-Fi, and the network strength is very good. The library also has Wi-Fi, and it's vast—you can find any book you want from diploma to degree level. The sitting area is large and appears quite premium, I guess. The hostel is also very good and clean. The mess offers tasty meals, and the rooms are quite nice. For sports and games, the hostel ground is very large and well-maintained. We also have a gymkhana offering games like carrom, chess, and table tennis.
detailed_review.Faculty: The staff is very friendly and helpful, and all of them are experts in their fields. So, the lectures are easy to understand as long as you stay attentive. The curriculum is well balanced, providing good theoretical and practical experience, preparing us for the industry. Plus, we are required to do a two-month internship, which gives us even more practical and on-field knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I was genuinely interested in electronics as a field and subject. The best part is that we are taught essential computer languages. To be honest, nothing else comes to mind. Events are quite lively—they are managed by students from the cultural clubs and are very energetic. The campus crowd is super helpful and friendly, especially if you are new and need assistance. The campus itself looks quite historic because of how old the college is. You can get a bunch of scholarships based on your score, and extracurricular activities are good.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Review of Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute - VJTI Mumbai.

detailed_review.Placements: Top-class companies visit VJTI for placements. Multinational companies like Wipro, Vista, L&T, Tata, etc., visit the college every year for placements. A maximum of students get placements. To get placements, students should have a pointer above 7.5 so that students can give interviews with companies. Students get placed but only on their average score. They provide internships in good companies and help us to get the best for their future job. We don't have to attend the college in 3rd year if we manage to get an internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is the topmost college. It has a nice campus and nice teachers. There is a good positive vibe for students. It is a government college, so it has its own hostel and mess. The fee for the hostel is Rs. 12,000 for a year with mess and that is much less according to other hostels in Mumbai.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is better than any other college. It is innovative and flexible. Some of the old faculty members have real wisdom and go very deep into the subject. They don't believe in finishing the syllabus but whatever they teach is taught in full depth. Innovative assignments aligned with the teaching make us use that knowledge and practice. The exam structure is simple. We have an MS semester test for 40 marks, which is converted to 20 marks, and the end-semester test is for 100 marks which are converted to 60 marks, and the remaining 20 marks are given on assignments. The course is well-updated. The faculty members are very friendly and ready for any difficulties faced by the students to solve them. They give proper guidance to students. The course syllabus is properly balanced during the semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of my college for money.

detailed_review.Placements: 92% of students got placed. The highest package for last year's placement was 64 LPA the lowest package for last year was 12 LPA. Some of the top recruiters were Siemens, etc. Last year almost 70% of students got internships 92% of students got placed and roles were offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities are good. They have many labs and clubs which help students to find their interests. Hostel facilities are also good hostel has recently been renovated and a new hostel has also been built. There are many labs in our campus which are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have good faculty members here and a good environment for students. Teachers are very helpful and qualified. Some of them are Ph.D. holders. Teaching quality is also good, the course we learn is also relevant and it makes students industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Production Engineering (Sandwich)
reviews.review_title: VJTI Mumbai is the best college in Mumbai after IIT Bombay.

detailed_review.Placements: According to seniors, placements are quite good at our college. In fact, the average package for CS and IT branches is 22 LPA. The overall placement rate across all branches ranges from 80-90%, with an average package of 13 LPA. The VJTI TPO is doing a good job for student placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Talking about infrastructure, it is below average, but they are doing their best to improve it. They are making sure that every classroom and labs have basic amenities. The canteen is quite affordable, but do not provide much medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors are highly qualified and knowledgeable. Most of them are from top universities and institutes. The exams conducted by the college are of moderate level. The passing marks depend on the topper’s marks, as the college has opted for relative grading. Overall, the course curriculum is relevant.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: I like environment of campus. Campus is 16 acres.

detailed_review.Placements: There is a variety of companies that provide internships and the salary packages provided by ECPL, Infosys, and many other reputed companies help students develop knowledge and prepare for their future of students. 6th-semester students are eligible for campus selection and internships are given to them by many upcoming companies like ECPL, Infosys, HCL, and other companies for various students which help them financially.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Rooms are very quiet enough not saying that they are best. The food of mess is very good as compared to other college's mess. The process for registration of hostel is through your MHT CET scorecard.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good. They ensure safety. They are very encouraging and positive. They motivate students during exams and tough times. Each student is given a separate place, and all items are provided by giving study holidays. I chose this because they have placement opportunities.
detailed_review.Other: There are many communities like Technovanza for making techno projects and bots. Pratibimb and Rangwardan for organizing fests and other cultural activities. There is enthusiasm for organizing sports tournaments and events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Textile Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of B.Tech. in Textile Technology course in VJTI.

detailed_review.Placements: I am pursuing B.Tech. in the Textile Technology course. Placements here are above average. Around 85% of students get placed in top textile companies, and the remaining ones either go for further education or get placed in low-paying jobs. The highest package is 18 LPA, and the lowest package is 6 LPA. Trident is the top recruiting company for our course. Nearly all students get internships. Roles like manufacturing head, sales head, and T lab testing are offered to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available on campus, but it may not work in some areas. There are 2 hostels for boys, 1 PG hostel old and one is in very bad condition. It has toilets and a living room. PG is top-notch and has world-class facilities. Food is okay. Medical facilities are available in college at some specific time. It has 2 boys mess. It also has games and sports in the building.
detailed_review.Faculty: 80% of teachers are PhD holders. They have an average experience of more than 7 years. The course curriculum is very relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. The semester exam's difficulty level is medium. The minimum passing criteria is 35 marks. In the first year, it is very difficult for many students to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I am in my second year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement records, average infrastructure, and nice faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package was 16 LPA last year and the top recruiting companies are Vedanta, Siemens, and others. There are many companies in other branches also. In our college, companies like Google, Microsoft, and US-software-based companies provide high salaries.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our infrastructure is average but the library is best. There are all the library facilities which are required for students. Also, there is free Wi-Fi in the campus area. The campus area is sixteen acres. There are two grounds. The infrastructure is nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are best. They are always ready to help students. They are well-qualified. Pass percentage is about 80%-85%. Semester exams are above average and everyone can't pass it without studying. There is a tight schedule and very short time we get for extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Textile Technology
reviews.review_title: Good placement, good exposure, good teaching staff, and a student-friendly environment.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in my second year. All the information given below is for the Textile Technology department. Nearly 80% of students are placed. The highest package is 18 LPA and the lowest is approximately 6 LPA. Trident is the top recruiter. Nearly all students get internships, with roles such as manufacturing head, sales head, and lab testing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available across the campus, but it may not work in some areas. There are 2 hostels for boys and 1 PG hostel, which has very bad conditions for toilets and living rooms. But the PG is top-notch and has world-class facilities. The food is okay, and medical facilities are available in the college at specific times. There are 2 boys messes. There are games and sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: 80% of teachers have a Ph.D. and an average experience of 7+ years. The course is very relevant and makes students industry-ready. The difficulty is medium. There is a minimum of 35 marks passing the criteria. For first-year students, it is very difficult for many students to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I have taken admission in the spot round. I chose the course because it allows me to do side work. The best thing is that you can relate it to daily life, as clothes are used everywhere. Modified machines should be used, and equipment should be updated. There are many events such as Enthusiasm for Sports, Technovanza for Science, and Teach DLA for debate and literature. The college also has good connectivity, as the railway station is approximately 1 km away and the bus stand is approximately 20 meters away. It is surrounded by institutes and schools, such as ICT and Don Bosco High School. Scholarships are provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely satisfied with the level of teaching.

detailed_review.Placements: Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute provides great placements and research opportunities for students. Companies like Samsung visit VJTI to hire freshers. More than 95% of students got placed in the electronics branch. Overall, the average salary package is 13 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the electrical engineering department, Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute has various research laboratories for research and study. Classrooms have all the required amenities like Wi-Fi, projector, smart screens, etc. The quality of the mess food is decent, and the fee for a hostel is affordable.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members of the electrical engineering department are very helpful,  friendly, and knowledgeable. They teach very well and give all the information about the topic and cover all basics of the topic. Electronics engineering is a demand branch and studying it from VJTI will definitely make students industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has great events and placements. It only lacks infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The college has a very good placement rate. In the last year, around 75-80% of students got placed on campus. The highest salary package offered for civil engineers is 14 LPA, and the average salary package offered is 7 LPA. Almost all college students get an internship. Some students got paid internships and some got unpaid internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The civil department in the college has very good infrastructure. All the facilities are provided in classrooms. The lab instruments are precise. Wi-Fi is available throughout the campus area. The hostel conditions are not that good. The hostel has poor infrastructure, but the mess food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are PhD holders from IITs. They have vast knowledge in their respective fields. The schedule of the college is so busy, like 9 AM to 5 PM job. The college starts from 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM. Semester exams are quite tough, and the minimum percentage required for passing is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because I want to apply for a government job and civil has a vast scope for them. The college should provide lectures for competitive exams like engineering services exams. Events are so well-organised and they are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: All about no one state college of Maharashtra.

detailed_review.Placements: At VJTI Mumbai, around 90-95 percent of students from the engineering batches are placed. The highest package is 40 LPA with an average of 10-12 LPA. Top recruiters include Google, Microsoft, and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS). Around 70 percent of students secure internships in companies like Infosys, Amazon and Intel. Roles offered include Software Engineer, Data Scientist, and Systems Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: VJTI Mumbai offers modern classrooms, well-equipped labs, reliable Wi-Fi, and a well-stocked library. Hostels provide basic accommodation with average food quality, though variety is available. Medical facilities are adequate, and sports facilities include cricket, football, and basketball.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty at VJTI Mumbai is highly qualified, experienced, and approachable, providing excellent guidance. Teaching quality is strong, combining theory with practical learning. The curriculum is industry-relevant, preparing students well for careers in technology. Semester exams are moderately challenging, with a high pass percentage, typically around 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for its industry relevance and career prospects. The best aspects are the updated curriculum, hands-on learning, and strong placements. Improvements could be made in infrastructure, internships, and extracurricular activities. VJTI has a vibrant campus life, events, and strong connectivity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: A pretty good college with some fixable issues and great committee culture.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements of VJTI go neck to neck with most of the NITs and a few IITs. It is the factor that attracts most of the students. Computer Engineering provides an average package of 20 LPA. On the other hand, branches like IT, EXTC, and Electronics provide an average package of 15, 13, and 12 LPA, respectively. The top recruiting companies are: Deloitte, Morgan Stanley, Amazon, ICICI Bank, etc. The highest package in 2024 was 57 LPA. The lowest placement is generally between 6-12 LPA. The highest internship stipend was 5.9L. There were 400+ internship offers. There were 27+ selections in Google.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Since the college is over 100 years old, the infrastructure is not a strong point of the college, with CS, Textile, and IT departments being an exception. Yes, VJTI does provide hostel facilities for students, although not all students get the hostels. In other words, rooms are given on the basis of the merit list of the competitive exam during the time of admission. There are 2 hostels for B.Tech and Diploma, for both boys and girls. In addition, there is 1 hostel for M.Tech students. The M.Tech hostels are amazing, with facilities like geysers, cleaner washrooms, balconies, and lifts.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty is good enough, but you will face some problems with a few facilities. This is true for every branch in the college. Most of the teachers provide useful notes and are very experienced. The HOD is very interactive with the students. They listen to and resolve the issues accordingly.
detailed_review.Other: I chose VJTI since it is the best college you can get through MHT CET. Events, fests, and the campus crowd are the best parts of the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute, Mumbai.

detailed_review.Placements: Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute is famous for its placements. In 2023, the average package for tech branches was about 19.6 Lacs per annum and for circuital and other branches, it was around 11-12 Lacs per annum with a total average placement rate of 82 percent. The highest package offered was 57 Lacs per annum in the tech branch. The top recruiters were DE SHAW, Amazon, LinkedIn, KPMG, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: VJTI was situated in 1887 and it is a government college. You cannot expect more from the infrastructure, as the buildings are old, but the college has all the necessary labs and clubs. VJTI also has a committee called SRA (Society of Robotics and Automation) where people who are interested in robotics and related fields can join and try it. VJTI has 2 main grounds, a volleyball court, a basketball court, and a gymkhana where you can hang out with your friends and play games like carrom, TT, chess, etc. in your free time. It also has a canteen in the college where you can chill with friends.
detailed_review.Faculty: VJTI has one of the best faculties who connect with the students and try to understand them. It also has courses like IKS and CC for character development and for making students confident and industry-ready. In VJTI, there is relative grading, so students don't have to take more stress.
detailed_review.Other: If you want to join the college, you should definitely go for it. You will not regret it. The college is very fun, except for studies. There are fests like Pratibimba, Technonza, and Rangavardhan where students enjoy. Many celebrities are invited, and many more.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Production Engineering (Sandwich)
reviews.review_title: VJTI: The most underrated institute for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The students who were placed in my senior batches were around 50% till now. What I have heard and seen, I'll be passing out till 2027. We still have our internships which are due in the third year of internships in my course. Till now, nobody is doing them. Next year, what I've seen from my seniors is that the lowest package was 18,000.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities which are available in my course department are computers for CAD, CAM, laboratory, and just benches, fans, and ACs. A decent atmosphere to study is also available. The infrastructure could be a little bit better because the quality of the furniture is not good. There are enough screens and a projector set up for e-learning also.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful; they provide a lot of good insights into what the curriculum actually is. The students are made industry relevant by the course because it has been updated by the NEP 2020 policy. Semester exams are as tough as any other engineering course.
detailed_review.Other: The canteen is decent, but the infrastructure could be a little better. The feels are also pretty low, and overall, it's a good college to study in.

reviews.course: Diploma in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, facilities, and faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: 90-plus percent of students get placed, and the highest placement package is 53 lakhs, and the lowest is almost 10 lakhs. Siemens and Google UPI are the top recruiters. Students who got more than 9 points in every semester got big companies like Microsoft; every company chose good and hardworking students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries are good quality; hostels are also good, and canteen food is good. Facilities provided to hostels are also good. The medical staff and facilities are so good in our department that faculty members help students to know the new things in college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful to students; they are highly educated. Semester exams are good; sometimes tough and sometimes easier for mid-semester 30 marks test and passing 8, and for end semester is 70 marks and passing 24. We get an internship for 6 months; students learn how to work in companies.
detailed_review.Other: I chose a mechanical diploma. A good thing about that course is it will help my future career. Everything is fine, but we need AC classrooms. Events, and fests are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The 2020-2024 Review of VJTI Civil.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, some students were interested in placements, whereas some of them went for higher studies. The companies that offered us were Lodha, Axella, LnT, K. Raheja, Technimont, etc. The highest package in our course was 14 LPA and the average package was 5 LPA. Considering the students who sat for placements, the placement percentage was roughly around 80-85 percent. It’s compulsory to do an internship of at least 6 weeks in the summer break of our third year. Various internship offers are available from our faculty members in companies like CIDCO, Coastal Roads Project, KPM Engineering, etc. as a site executive. However, these internship offers are unpaid. For paid internship offers, you can try for off-campus opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As the college is one of the oldest colleges in Maharashtra, the infrastructure is not to the point. However, multiple renovation works have started in the college to improve the infrastructure. The classrooms are huge and air-conditioned with modern technological equipment like Samsung screens and projectors. The hostels are very clean and spacious. These hostels are very affordable; however, they have quite limited seats.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college is autonomous and the curriculum is up-to-date. The teachers are very friendly and helpful. They are always available when you have any doubt or issue. The semester exams are a bit easier as the faculty members set the paper themselves, so we are well-acquainted with the syllabus. There are hardly 2-3 students in a batch who fail in a subject. The cases of year drops are very low.
detailed_review.Other: VJTI is one of the most reputed colleges. The curriculum VJTI had for my course is comparatively better than other colleges. The best part about our course was we were given a chance to carry out the work practically by visiting sites, etc. One thing I would like to change about this course is the strict attendance nature, which was not much seen in other courses of our college.

college_info.college_name: VJTI Mumbai Admission 2026: Courses, Fees, Eligibility, Application and Selection

admission.title: VJTI Mumbai Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute or VJTI Mumbai is a very prestigious college in Maharashtra having an autonomous status which comes under the University of Mumbai. Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute offers various courses at the UG, PG, Diploma and doctoral levels such as- BTech, MTech, MCA, Diploma and PhD under various specialisations. Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute admissions are strictly based on merit only through an on-line centralised admission process as per the guidelines of the Government of Maharashtra. VJTI intakes admissions mainly through state-level entrance exams, such as MHT-CET, MAH-MCA CET, MAH-MBA CET, etc.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to VJTI for BTech?
faqs.answer: The path of admission to BTech in Veermata Jijabai Technological University goes through taking MHT-CET, a state-level entrance test conducted by the Government of Maharashtra under the Department of Technical Education (DTE). The candidates first have to register for MHT-CET from the official website, and the registration window for the said entrance exam usually opens between March and April. Students interested in getting admission to the BTech course of VJTI should prepare well for the said entrance exam because only those students who have scored well and whose rank lies within the range specified by the college are eligible for further process of counselling and seat confirmation.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) Mumbai?
faqs.answer: No, Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) Mumbai does not admit directly. There are all admissions on merit only and the marks of state-level entrance tests like MHT-CET, JEE-Main, or GATE, based on the course. Only candidates who are qualified and have better performance in exams are offered a seat.

faqs.question: Does Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) Mumbai accepts admission through entrance exams?
faqs.answer: Yes, Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute (VJTI) Mumbai does take admission through various entrance exams. For undergraduate courses like BTech, the students need to appear for MHT-CET or JEE-Main, while for postgraduate courses, GATE and MAH-MCA CET are necessary depending on the course.

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for B.Tech at VJTI Mumbai?
faqs.answer: 540 students from all over India can be admitted each year to VJTI Mumbai's B.Tech programs, regardless of the specializations that are offered. The following are the number of seats available: 60 for computer engineering, 60 for information technology, 30 for electronics and telecommunication, 30 for electronics engineering, 60 for mechanical engineering, 30 for production engineering, and 30 for chemical engineering ,30 seats in biomedical engineering ,60 seats are available for civil engineering,  Thirty seats for instrumentation and control. Moreover, there is additional seats available-

faqs.question: What is the minimum qualification required for BTech in VJTI?
faqs.answer: VJTI follows the guidelines laid down by MHT-CET for student enrollment in their BTech course. According to MHT-CET, the eligibility for admission to BTech at Veermata Jijajbai Technological Institute (VJTI), the candidate should have passed class 12 or SSC or a Diploma in engineering with at least 45% aggregate. Candidates interested in the BTech course of VJTI should prepare well for the MHT-CET entrance exam because only those students who have scored well and whose rank lie within the range specified by the college are eligible for further counselling and seat confirmation.

ranking_section.title: VJTI MumbaiNIRF Ranking 2025
ranking_section.description: VJTI Mumbai has received strong ranks by the NIRF under the 'Engineering' category. Provided parameters including, Teaching, Graduation Outcome, Inclusivity and Research, the institute is ranked in a good position as compared to other institutes by the NIRF 2025. In the 'Engineering' category, the institute's ranks have shown stability when compared with the previous year's ranking. text: Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute provides modern amenities with state-of-the-art infrastructure to its students. facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The digital library has the huge collection of books, 33 journals, more than 7,000 papers and E-resources such as IEEE, ASME, ASCE, ACM, IEL, Springer, Cambridge university press e-books, Mc-graw hills access engineering etc.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Institute offers accommodation for a total of 554 students. They comprise four blocks A, B, C, and D. Accommodation is given to 110 new students in all branches every year on the basis of merit-cum-need. Preference will be given to students residing outside the city of Mumbai.

data.description: VJTI Mumbai has experienced and qualified faculty members. There are student exchange programmes and conferences and various events held for the students and faculty. VJTI Mumbai faculty are PhD, diploma, and degree holders.

highlights.summary:
Amity Jaipur was established in 2008 as a private university. It is accredited by NAAC with an A+ Grade. Amity University Jaipur is an UGC approved University. Amity University Jaipur rajasthan is also approved by CoA, BCI and PCI. It is a member of the Association of Indian Universities and The Institute of Engineering and Technology. The University is also a member of Association of Commonwealth Universities, UK and Accreditation by ASIC-Accreditation Service for International Colleges.
It is known for its flagship Amity University Jaipur Design, Engineering, and Management courses. The BTech, BDes, and BSc courses offered by the University have good reputation in the Industry. Amity University, Jaipur offers UG, PG, and other courses to students. The University also offers placement assistance to students. Top recruiters such as HCL, Airtel, Amazon, Deloitte, TCS and Infosys have visited the campus in recent past.. The university has 187 faculty members and scientists. The Amity University Jaipur highlights are mentioned below:

college_info_program.intro:
Amity University Jaipur through the Amity School of Architecture & Planning, Jaipur provides flagship BDes courses to students. Other popular programmes provided by the university are BTech and BSc. Amity University Jaipur Design students are taught Design Fundamentals, the History of Art and Design, and various other relevant subjects. Amity Jaipur Design students can work as Graphic Designers, Interior Designers, or can take up any field relevant to their stream.
Amity University Jaipur BTech students can work in various non-technical fields such as marketing, customer service, sales, and others. Overall, it is one of the top-ranked universities present in India. BTech, BSc, and other course students are placed in top companies such as Amazon, HCL, Airtel, TCS, Infosys, Deloitte, Wipro, and others. Below mentioned are Amity University Jaipur courses and their respective eligibility and Amity University Jaipur fee structure:

Amity University Jaipur Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.A. in Applied Psychology (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: My Amity University campus and academic review.

detailed_review.Placements: Amity generally gets good placement drive participation. Many big recruiters like Amazon, TCS, IBM, Capgemini, etc, visit campus, and for B.Tech 2025. The highest package is 35.9 LPA, while the average is 9.6 LPA, and the median is 6 LPA. That said, placement outcomes vary widely by course branch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus generally offers modern classrooms, good labs and full campus-wide Wi-Fi, which supports academic excellence for technical professional courses. There are well-equipped laboratories and a large, well-stocked library. Hostels are separate for boys and girls, with options like single, double, and triple sharing. There is reasonably good infrastructure for core courses. Labs, library, classroom and campus facilities generally get positive marks in several reviews.
detailed_review.Faculty: Amity uses a semester system, typically two semesters per academic year, 17 to 18 weeks each, which is fairly standard globally. Evaluation is mixed, roughly 30% internal continuous assessment, class test assignments, quizzes, projects, attendance, presentations, seminars, etc.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: One of the best colleges in Rajasthan for research studies.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% placement students got placement in my course. The highest package offered was 20 LPA, the lowest being 4LPA, and the average was 5 LPA. Panacea Pharmaceuticals, Serum Institute, Biocon, etc, are some of the companies that actively recruit students from my course. 100% students got an internship from my course. The top role offered is an Associate Scientist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities at Amity University, Jaipur, are top-notch. The laboratories, classrooms, and daily amenities are all very good. The laboratories are all equipped with the latest research instruments, which are crucial for my course. The hostel facilities are very good, providing basic amenities needed for students. The food is also very good and affordable for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors at the University are all highly qualified and knowledgeable in their domain. They have exceptional teaching capabilities and are very cooperative with students. The course curriculum is very carefully curated by the University to meet the latest requirements of the industry and to prepare the students for the latest and upcoming demands. The exams are not difficult to crack if you have the base knowledge of the curriculum.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Bioinformatics
reviews.review_title: It is absolutely worth every penny we are paying.

detailed_review.Placements: Actually, every senior from our college gets a placement. That is true, and the minimum LPA is about 5, which is good. At the beginning, companies like Deloitte and other companies, such as Omics, Logice, and Wipro, come for placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is available, including Wi-Fi, labs worth 2-3 lakhs, classrooms with projectors, and a library worth visiting. I suggest everyone at least visit the campus, which provides a positive vibe and is worth every bit. There are several programs ongoing.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good. They explain every point clearly and help students achieve their goals. The semester exams are conducted strictly. The pass percentage is 50%, and attendance is mandatory at 75%, which should be strictly followed.
detailed_review.Other: I am from Kerala. I chose this course because I am eager in the field of drug development. Events, fests, and all are superb in the college. It allows students to enjoy them

reviews.course: B.A. in Film and Television Production
reviews.review_title: Amity University rocks the stage.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students from my course get placements. The package offered in our course starts from a minimum of 30-40,000 to a maximum of 3-4 LPA. Top companies include T-Series, Zee Studios, Shemaroo, Netflix, and Amazon, etc. 30% of students get internships at Zee Studios. The top roles offered are DOP, editor, director, and copywriter, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a strong Wi-Fi connection, a folly studio, a recording studio, a computer lab, and well-cleaned, air-conditioned classrooms. We also have library support. The quality of the mess food was very good, and we have 24-hour medical support. We also have several sports and games available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty was highly educated, with a well-planned curriculum. The exam process was very hectic. We have very well-settled subjects, digital classes, and extra class support. 60% of students might pass the semester exams as they are very difficult.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I love filmmaking. I think they need to improve their housekeeping staff. We have different kinds of events, fests, and sports events. We get Bollywood stars as guests and many more.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Cyber Security
reviews.review_title: This is the best university for the M.Sc. in Cyber Security Course.

detailed_review.Placements: The average placement rate for this session and the previous one was 90% in the Cyber Security Course. The highest bid was 25 LPA. The average salary was around 15-20 LPA. Top recruiting companies are DevsData LLC, Nexus IT Group, Alta Associates, etc. Top roles offered are Chief Information Security Officer, Security Architect, etc. More students are getting their internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: University areas, labs, classrooms, sports fields, and cafeterias are all equipped with Wi-Fi. The labs and classrooms are well-equipped with the latest equipment, projectors, mics, and good AC. The food there is good, if not the best, in terms of taste and hygiene. Hostel rooms are spacious and have LAN and Wi-Fi. Initially, the cooling water caused a scarcity of drinking water, but now, slowly, the problem has been solved.
detailed_review.Faculty: The university boasts exceptional faculty regarding qualifications, expertise, and experience. The educators not only assist learners with academic challenges but also offer career advice and support students with various issues they encounter. The instructors are quite amiable and easy to talk to. Final exams are challenging, and the passing rate is quite low.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma)
reviews.review_title: Some faculty are good, and some are average.

detailed_review.Placements: Our batch is the first batch for the course, so I cannot give the right information for the same, but in courses such as B.Tech, B.Sc., biotech, and pharmaceutical companies do come.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are above average for now. Last semester, there were many instruments that were not available in the lab, and the classroom chairs were broken. Wi-Fi is good, medical facilities are also good, and at the university level, there are many sports clubs that a student can join.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members are good, and some are average. Course curriculum is relevant, but in this semester, the practicals are not going well. Semester exam level is quite good, they ask a tough to medium type of question. 80% of the students have already passed all their exams. Two of the faculty are now helping us and explaining how to write academic papers.
detailed_review.Other: I could not clear the NEET exam, so I joined this programme. Programme provides me with the opportunity to I can be around medical science. I think the faculty members can give more effort towards explaining the topics, and lab practical can also be improved.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: Best infrastructure college in Jaipur.

detailed_review.Placements: I am pursuing a BBA from this college, and the college has placed up to 85% of the student strength. The recruitment companies are Zomato, Deutsche Bank, TCS, and many more. The main roles offered are in marketing, human resources, finance, and operations. The highest package is about 11 LPA, the lowest package is 2.5 LPA, and the average is 4-6 LPA. Around 98% of students got internships from the college because an internship is mandatory in our course. I got an internship at Jaipur International Airport through the college, and some students got placed in Adani, Dabur, Cognizant, Maxview, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very organized and beautifully blends with nature. The facilities are also good, like 5G Wi-Fi, lecture rooms with built-in projectors, and an excellent library that provides computers to students for study. Students just have to log in with their user ID.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching faculty is also very supportive and qualified. They don’t just give theoretical and bookish knowledge; they provide practical subjects like Data Analytics for students. They also provide mentors to students who guide us and help in other activities. The department also conducts industry visits each semester to gain real-life experience. The college exam is of moderate level; if you start studying one month before the exam, you will get good grades. The passing CGPA is 4.5.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to learn about business administration, and the best thing about the course is we gain knowledge regarding all fields like finance, marketing, and HR. In my course, I wish they would remove some unnecessary subjects. The events and fests are very good; you will be able to see at least one event every month.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Cyber Security
reviews.review_title: Have to think twice about the academic quality provided by the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 30% of students are only placed as of now. The highest package is 9 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies of our course are Micron, Ampcus, and 5Tattva. Almost 90% of students got internships in different companies. Some of the companies are Technisanct, Falconfeeds, Micron, etc. Top role offered in our course is cybersecurity analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure provided by the department are so far good. The facilities include Wi-Fi access all over the campus, one student can only connect 2 devices to the Wi-Fi, and drinking water. Washrooms are available on every floor. Hostel facility is also good. Wardens are quite strict and discipline is mandatory. The quality of the food is also impressive. Amity provides different kinds of sports such as cricket, football, volleyball, badminton, etc. There is a clinic on the campus that provides medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not that much good. Quality of teaching for my course is quite disappointing. Curriculum needs to be updated, actually it doesn't make the student's industry-ready. 50% mark is needed to pass, and the exams are not that much difficult.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in IT, that's why I chose this course. The hackathons conducted are the best things about our course. Curriculum needs to be updated. Every festival is celebrated on the campus. The day scholars have restrictions on time to participate in the events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Sciences)
reviews.review_title: Till now, the experience is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students get placed in our college. The package offered in our college is about 7 LPA. The recent placement package offered to the students is about 18 LPA. Many students also get internships on their own. Also, many of them need to qualify for the internship round based on their own skills, and it depends on the student's performance and skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good. We have proper labs, and there are separate labs for each language. To be honest, the hostel facilities are up to the mark, but the food quality is not up to the mark. So, you can avoid the mess food sometimes. We have multiple outlets, which also provide multiple food.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have the best and most supportive faculty members in our department, and they help a lot whenever we reach them. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready. There are many other activities where you can reflect on your hobbies in other fields. The semester exams are conducted, and the security is on high alert while checking. So, the exams are good and you get relief on the last day of the exam. Faculty members who are allotted are helpful and take care of the student if he/she is having any problems.
detailed_review.Other: This is a very beautiful campus in all over Rajasthan. There is a scholarship program, and you can get up to 100% scholarship on CUET results or 12 board results. If we talk about the event, there are many clubs in our college that conduct events, and there is also a cultural event named ODYSSEY, which is fabulous.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch.)
reviews.review_title: This is an average college.

detailed_review.Placements: It's a private college, your percentage doesn't matter here your money does. Placements here for B.Arch or BID purely depend on yourself. You don't get good placements through the college, you have to work hard for those salaries and money. If you really want to do this you can.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I would say the infrastructure here is average not too good but not shabby either. This college has a coupon system so don't fall for a cheap hostel fee, your money gets pretty drained here. The mess food is average too not good but not bad either except some days.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our department has decent teachers. They are qualified enough to teach us and give us the experience. This course is relevant. They have taken us on a couple of industrial visits which are not too shabby. Exams here are hectic but not too difficult that you can't do it.
detailed_review.Other: I had a kick for this so I chose this course.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA) (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: It is a good and the best college.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, there are 75% of placements for students are fixed or more. I know only the highest package 14-15 LPA, the lowest 6 LPA. Mostly I know that Accenture and Microsoft come and Jaipur it companies. 95% of students do internships. It is the best college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is going well here. Our faculty is friendly and approachable, and the departments have well-equipped labs. The hostels are clean, and the infrastructure of the buildings is very strong. The food quality in the mess and canteen is hygienic, and the medical facilities are excellent. Additionally, sports and games are prioritized and well-supported.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good except for some teachers. We can say that teachers make to industrial ready. They are really helpful. Not very difficult if you are not studying so you fail of course.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because my sister is in the IT field. They should provide coding and more explanation with practical even faster. A scholarship facility is available in our college. We have a ground. The college connectivity is good. All are very good you can connect with the people, new language, and new rituals.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Good college for B.Tech biotech.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are average. Since there are less companies in India in the biotech field so hiring and placements are a little average. But new companies are approaching our college now like Rapture Biotech and students also go to work under government facilities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good facilities are provided inside the hostel. Classrooms are also very nice. They have centralized air conditioning in the class. In hostel, they provide AC and non-AC rooms. Our hostel rooms are average in size. We have Nescafe inside the hostel and vending machines so that we can access snacks and food at night. Classrooms are big and they have projectors.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very nice. They have very good knowledge and they guide the students very nicely. They are very helpful during our research work also. Teachers give proper instructions so that we can achieve the best results in our studies and research work.
detailed_review.Other: I enrolled in B.Tech biotech course which is of 4 years. It is a very nice course. In the upcoming days, it will be a very important stream. The facilities and education provided under this are very nice in Amity Jaipur as they have well-informed teachers and proper working labs.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Microbiology (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: Amity is a beautiful and sustainable campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students got placed in my course. Top recruiting companies were Biocon, Biological e, and Mankind. 100% of students got internships from this course in companies like Mankind, Saras, Biocon, etc. Top roles offered by our course are food inspector, research analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My course provides well-rounded labs with major industrial machines like bioreactors (50L), freeze dryers, SEM, etc. The infrastructure of the building is good with Wi-Fi connectivity all over the campus. We have a government-sponsored project in my course too. Hostels are well-equipped with every necessity including Wi-Fi 24x7, water cooler, and laundry. We have different options for mess which students can choose according to their will. We have a dedicated medical emergency room for any kind of medical emergency. The campus is a green campus with options for all sports from indoor to outdoor.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers  are well-qualified. They have experience from abroad too. The content they deliver is precise and according to the current standards. The education and curriculum makes us future ready for the industry and job with dedicated focus on communication skills. Semester exams are moderate difficult with 40% being the passing threshold.
detailed_review.Other: This course was recommended by my good friend which turned out to be a great decision. My course is smooth with regular industrial visits to teach students about the industry standards with internship being mandatory for perfecting our skills and getting future-ready. As Amity is the hub of culture it has various events going on regularly with a focus on the overall advancements of students. The campus is well-built and sustainable too. The campus is one of the most beautiful and sustainable campuses in India. Amity University also offers scholarships based on your percentage scored in previous qualifications. The campus is also well secured for any kind of mischief and is monitored 24x7 with CCTV cameras.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Sciences)
reviews.review_title: Amity is humongous in terms of opportunities and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: As per the previous placement drive. Our seniors got selected into Infosys, Wipro, JP Morgan, Amazon, etc. I can definitely tell that my college provides us with handsome opportunities in placement drives. By looking at the past placement around 80-85% of students get selected.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college campus is really good. The campus is humongous and astonishing. Our college has huge fields which are full of trees and greenery. It's quite peaceful and lovely to sit on the ground in the evening. Our course is really helping me a lot in understanding the subjects and maintaining my knowledge of the trends in the market. It will obviously help me in the future, as I will be up to date with the future market trends and placements.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty and curriculum are extremely knowledgeable and help us a lot. Faculty helps us understand every subject perfectly. Exams and curriculum help us in understanding the upcoming challenges of the market trends and subject. It helps in improving my innovative knowledge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Sciences)
reviews.review_title: Good campus life and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: JP Morgan company visits the college and many more demanded companies also visit providing the opportunity to get placed for a better future. This college also provides a wide range of learning opportunities and expanding skills for an individual person.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is good and well-equipped. There is a free Wi-Fi facility available throughout the whole college. The college is very vast covering 150 acres of land and is very well maintained. The college maintains a nature-loving vibe which helps us to stay connected with nature.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers help us to understand the in-demand technologies. They are really helpful in teaching us outside the box. They all are very understanding and even we can share our personal issues with them too and they understand us really well. The semester exams are not that hard if you prepare them in the right way.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (3 Continent)
reviews.review_title: Great vibrant campus and good academics with many improvements taking place.

detailed_review.Placements: Currently, around 50% got placed in jobs and internships. Currently, the lowest package is 3 LPA-4 LPA, the average is 6 LPA-8 LPA, and the highest may be 12 LPA-15 LPA. Recruiting companies are Wipro, Capgemini, Josh Technologies, Yamaha, JP Morgan etc. Top roles offered in my course are software developer, data analyst, web developer, graphic designer, and some non-tech roles like business analyst, marketing and sales, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure available for course/department is great. We have central Wi-Fi and AC. Many labs are available and there is a central library. Coming to hostel, we have good room and timely we have staff to clean our rooms and bathrooms daily, and laundry is also available. Food is manageable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable and help us with every query we have. The teaching quality is also good. Course curriculum is relevant, and mostly makes the students ready but can have slight improvements. Exams are easy if you attend the classes as they give what they have taught in the classes. Pass percentage is either 50% or 60%.
detailed_review.Other: I am very interested in technology and the very fact that how this can make a incredible amount of changes in this world. There are many events and fests and also the vast amount of platforms and opportunities for students to explore things except their course and also participate in extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Microbiology (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the faculty and the infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 50 to 60 students get placed in our course. The highest package after B.Sc. is 1 LPA. After studying this course, one can directly opt for a job or pursue an M.Sc. in research and other programs. You can also become a quality analyst and join the pharmacy industry.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are great. There is Wi-Fi in every corner of the campus. Classrooms are large and spacious. Projectors are present in every class. There is a central library and departmental libraries. There are four food messes on the campus, and other shops are also present with daily needs. There is a gym, and the 143-acre campus with greenery provides a great place for a morning walk.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-educated and highly qualified. They make the subject very easy and understandable. The course structure is well-built and followed. The industrial microbiology course is designed in such a way that students will be industry-ready. There are mid-term exams and end-term exams. Both are easy if you study well.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing about my course is that it makes you industry-ready in such a short span of time. We even visit industries to see their work and understand what we can do there. Many events and fests in our college.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Microbiology (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: Overall, AUR offers quality education, modern infrastructure, and experienced faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: My name is Parul. I am pursuing bachelor's in microbiology. Students are getting government internships with good stipends. 100% of students are getting placed in my course. Top recruiting companies are Candila, Vadilal, Britannia, Nissin, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: AUR is renowned for its modern infrastructure and well-maintained campus. Students have excess to laboratories, libraries, and sports facilities. Hostel facilities are decent but can be expensive. Food quality is good and you will get a lot of options for food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly experienced. Some departments have strong research-oriented faculty members, especially in biotech and microbiology. Course makes the students industry-ready. Semester exams are quite decent. The internal marks are evaluated on the basis of lab work.
detailed_review.Other: Currently, I am pursuing bachelor's in microbiology. The biggest reason behind choosing this course is that I am interested in research field. The things that I wish would be better or improved are maybe the strict attendance system. You will get the scholarship each year. Campus has a very vibrant environment full of energy and it is not overcrowded at all. Universities emphasize extracurricular activities, hosting numerous events and festivals from time to time.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Applied Chemistry
reviews.review_title: We have good faculty and facilities like a library and labs.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package is 5-6 LPA. In my class, 2 students get placements. Many companies are coming. They give us roles according to our course like lab chemist, quality control, etc. 2 students of our course got a project in IIT Delhi. Our placement package range is between 2-6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a good library and Wi-Fi facility. Sports and games are good. Here, many indoor and outdoor game facilities are there. For food, there are many options and shops. In the hostel, we have a coffee shop. During exam time, they provide night food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. In our course, we have C programming and maths also. They are not relevant to chemistry but nowadays, technology part become a part of every course. This course curriculum is relevant and also makes students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: If the lab work will improve, it will help us.

reviews.course: B.A. in Economics (Honurs/ Research)
reviews.review_title: There are good placements in 2024.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good, and maximum students have received placements on campus from top companies. Every student has also secured an internship during the summer break. The highest package is 52 LPA and the lowest is 8 LPA. Most students are recruited by top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good and organized with advanced technology. Classrooms are clean and neat, every classroom is air-conditioned. The view of Amity is beautiful, and the campus is very spacious. The hostel rooms are also peaceful, clean, and neat.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty teaching was very good and understandable. They teach according to our convenience and in the language we are most comfortable with. They explain everything, including even the smallest modules, and are willing to teach things up to 100 times.
detailed_review.Other: There are many extracurricular activities like games, participation in events, organizing events, etc. Many fests are held, top celebrities visit, and many scholarships are provided to the top students.

faqs.question: Can I do BCA without Maths in Amity Jaipur?
faqs.answer: Candidates are required to Class 12 with Maths/ Computer Science/ Information Practice/ Computer Applications/ Multimedia & Web Technology/ Data Management/ Application/ Web Application (provision of a bridge course in Maths available for non-Maths background applicants) to apply for Amity University Jaipur BCA course. Aspirants who have passed Class 12 with at least 80% aggregate are eligible for direct admission to BCA course. Additionally, admission to BCA is based on merit in the last qualifying exam or CUET UG score. As soon as the selection rounds are over, candidates need to pay a course fee to confirm their seat in the university. The total tuition fee for BCA is INR 3.96 Lacs as per an unofficial source. In case, a candidate is unable to pay the fee within the specified time, his or her admission will stand cancelled.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to Amity University Jaipur for MCA?
faqs.answer: Admission to Amity Jaipur MCA course is based on merit in the last qualifying exam. Candidates must pass graduation with Maths or graduation with Maths at Class 12/ BSc IT/ BCA level to apply for MCA course. Aspirants without Mathematics in Class 12 or graduation, can still apply, by availing the option of a bridge course as per the norms of the university. As soon as the selection rounds are over, candidates need to pay a course fee to confirm their seat in the university. The total tuition fee for MCA is INR 3.64Lacsas per an unofficial source. In case, a candidate is unable to pay the fee within the specified time, his or her admission will stand cancelled. Click here to know more about MCA admission.

faqs.question: What is the qualification for MCA at Amity University Jaipur?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have passed graduation with Maths or graduation without Maths in Class 12/ BSc IT/ BCA can apply for Amity University Jaipur MCA course. Candidates without Mathematics in Class 12 or graduation, can still apply, by availing the option of a bridge course as per the norms of the university. Additionally, the university shortlists candidates for MCA course based on merit in the last qualifying exam. Once selection rounds are over, candidates need to confirm their seat. They are called for document verification and course fee payment to confirm admission.

faqs.question: What documents are required during the MCA application process at Amity University Jaipur?
faqs.answer: The mandatory documents for admission to MCA at Amity University Jaipur are graduation marksheet, scanned photograph and signature. The application process is simple. Students need to go to offcial website and apply under Admission section. There is no application fee for this program.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: Amity University Jaipur campus is spread across 152 acre of land. The state-of-the-art campus has been designed by renowned architects specialising in educational architecture. Amity University Jaipur has classrooms, laboratories, a library, hostels, and cafeterias. Some of the campus facilities include:
Check out more about Amity, Jaipur infra in the below videos:
list: Well-equipped Conference hall and Seminar hall.
ATM, hostels facility for boys & girls

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Amity University has a well-stocked library with a collection of more than 40,000 text books, 97 Journals and reference books. Divided into Circulation Section and Reference Section, the central library has a special feature - Web OPAC i.e. Online Public Access Catalogue - for members. Some of the popular online resources accessible to Amity students/ faculty are EBSCO titles, Oxford journals, Cambridge University Press publications, Taylor & Francis publications.Students at AUR can also access digital library through Amizone- Amity Intranet Zone which helps them to reach out to EBSCO Host, UGC-Infonet, INDEST-AICTE, IS1 and Delnet.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Amity University has AC/Non-AC twin sharing/Single accommodation residential apartment suites with an accommodating capacity of more than 3000 students. The hostels are well ventilated and equipped with geyser and water cooler facilities along with common room and sitting lounges in each hostel.

highlights.summary:
Established in 2010, Crescent School of Life Science is one of the constituent schools of BS Abdur Rahman Crescent Institute of Science & Technology, (BARCIST) Chennai. It is a private school that is approved by the All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE). The school has emerged as a hub for state-of-the-art research in multiple fields of Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Biotechnology, Cancer Biology, Genetics, etc., through sponsored projects from industries and government agencies.
