Crescent School of Life Sciences Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: It is an average college.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70% of students are placed in top biotechnology and other fields. This course offers research-level jobs, and it is one of the emerging courses in India and other countries. Many students are doing internships by the second semester and are doing well in the field.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department has seven labs, which are well-equipped for research. Wi-Fi and other facilities are available. The canteen food is average but acceptable. The labs are well-equipped, and the level of instruction is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The semester mark depends 50% on two continuous assessment tests for each of the two modules, and there will be a CAT exam, CAT 1, and a final CAT. The other 50% will be based on the semester exam. We must attend the CAT exam, or we will fail the semester exam. It is easy to score, but the CAT exam is stressful because it comes with no break between the exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to be a research-level biotechnologist. However, the number of events that take place is low.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Okay college. If you are okay with Kurta, you can prefer.

detailed_review.Placements: About 50% got placement in different fields. I am not sure about the company names. But help board seeking students to pursue their Ph.D. More offers from reputed companies are taken by the college. I don't know much about the placement as I am a fresher.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are 7 labs total for Life Science block. There is free Wi-Fi connection. The canteen food is average as a Malayalee student. I am okay with it. Classrooms and libraries are good. As I am far from my house, I prefer college canteen food. There are 4-5 cafes inside the campus for snacks and juice items.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are qualified and know about the subject they taught. They are helpful in pursuing higher studies. There are two internal exams before the sem exam: CAT 1 and CAT 2. 50% marks will be gained from that for the sem exam. We want to gain another 50% from the sem exam.
detailed_review.Other: I really like this field. I like the field of research.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: BSA Crescent Institute of Science and Technology review .

detailed_review.Placements: Almost more than fifty percent of the students in my batch were placed in different companies. The lowest package offered was 2 LPA, and the highest package offered was 4 LPA. The average package is 3 LPA. Some of the top recruiting companies were Biocon, Icon, Zifo, R&D, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is equipped with highly advanced laboratories with proper machinery and equipment. A big central library with physical and virtual learning materials all available for the students. All the classrooms are equipped with Wi-Fi accessibility. The quality of the food available in the hostel is very good and nutritious, with both vegetarian and non-vegetarian choices.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are skilled, well qualified and equipped with the proper skills and knowledge to handle the classes. The teaching quality is very advanced and helps with real-world problems. The learning process is highly focused on making real-world applications on a teaching basis.
detailed_review.Other: I chose biotechnology because of my affinity for biology and it's integration with modern technology. Some of the best things about this course are the spectrum of learning, its application, which is quite wide and its scope in real-world applications. I wish there was more practical learning in the course rather than more theory. A lot of events and festivals are conducted annually by the college as well as the student bodies present on campus.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Our university has amazing professors and campus but weak placement support.

detailed_review.Placements: Only 2 students out of 58 students from our class were placed through campus placements. I was one of them. A few companies visited here for B.Sc biotechnology. The highest salary package offered was 4.1 LPA for the course of B.Sc biotechnology. The lowest salary package offered was 2 LPA. Top recruiters here were Life Cell, Zifo RnD, etc. Internships were not provided by our college, except for a few summer training sessions for which they collected the fee from students. Top roles offered by companies through placements were associate analyst and COVID lab technician.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the department is amazing, with spacious classrooms, well-equipped laboratories and maintained washrooms. Wi-Fi facility is good in few classrooms and very poor in few classrooms. The laboratories have good quality equipment like chambers, HPLC, spectrophotometer, colorimeter, etc., from reputed brands like Eppendorf, Shimadzu and many more. There is one main canteen on the campus and 2 small canteens. One Amul parlour is also available here, and medical facilities are not up to the mark. Sports like cricket, football, basketball, badminton, handball, etc., are played with ample sports equipment and fields/courts available here. The hostel is huge and has good facilities. Boys and girls hostels are separated by a huge distance. There are different types of rooms such as 2 sharing, 3 sharing and single sharing rooms. Only the single rooms have air-conditioners. The food and water facilities are provided. For Muslims, suhoor and iftar are also provided in the mess during the month of Ramadan. Laundry and Wi-Fi facilities are available in the hostel, whose charges are included in the fee.
detailed_review.Faculty: The real supporters throughout 3 years of the course are professors. They are truly qualified, knowledgeable, approachable and motivated in all aspects. All professors have completed their PhD and post-doctoral from reputed institutions in India and abroad. They don't compromise in terms of teaching. The course curriculum is well-designed to clear the basic and applied level of concepts in biotechnology. But it doesn't make students industry-ready because biotechnology is a vast domain and a bachelor degree in biotechnology is not sufficient to have a good grip on the subject. Opting for M.Sc would be a wise choice to be industry-ready. Semester exams are easy to crack, and their difficulty level is low. Exams are conducted in 2 assessments and one end semester exam pattern every semester, along with weightage of internals and practicals. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: This course is very undervalued in our nation. RnD is a field that can change the entire nation and has the potential for tremendous development. This field enriches students with knowledge and growth. It does not benefit just students but also benefits the entire world through breakthrough research. I wish we were provided with more hands-on training like internships and industrial visits. Our university organises vivid cultural events and fests every semester to celebrate festivals, talents and many more. Extracurricular activities like dance, literature, music, sports, drama, Silambam, fashion, etc., are conducted through the official groups. The crowd is huge, but since the campus is huge, it doesn't cause any difficulty. The campus is surrounded by greenery everywhere and has the Vandalur zoo right next to the university. The connectivity is good through public buses and trains. Both the institute and government provide scholarships to B.Tech. For students who excel in academics, the fee is already minimal, but it is not provided to B.Sc students.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely it is a good college.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70 students from our course got placed. The highest academic CGPA got by students is 9.0, while the lowest academic CGPA got by them is 7.0. Many well-known companies like Biocon, etc., visit our college for placements. Our college provides good coaching on placements and training on other interview-related topics to help students get placed in companies and helps in higher studies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is best-in-class in our college, and modern amenities are also available here. The hostel is best-in-class, and they are separately available for both men and women and also different for different batch students. Classrooms are highly modern, clean and neat throughout the course.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are helpful and very professional. Their way of teaching depends only on English. There are different staff members for different courses and subjects. Teachers are highly talented and have many years of experience. There are teaching faculty members and also other non-teaching staff members in our college.
detailed_review.Other: Students have a good campus life here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: College is absolutely amazing in all the apects.

detailed_review.Placements: 1% of students were placed in my department with the highest package of 11L per annum and with the lowest package of 3L per annum. Zifo was the topmost company that came for recruitment with an average package. Nearly 10 percent of students got an internship. Clinical data analyst was the most common role.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our campus had high-speed Wi-Fi available in every corner, with an amazing classroom environment that has both digital and blackboards teaching facilities, it also has average lab facilities now but it is being expanded further, and our college also has a central library where you can find all the books required.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are highly qualified with Ph.D. degree and highly knowledgeable too. Teaching mode depends on the subject and the faculty too. The curriculum is designed in a way where slow Learners and toppers can cope up. The course curriculum absolutely focuses on industry demands and needs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Our college has the best faculty members and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: A quite good number of students got placed from the biotechnology. Top recruiting companies for our course are Byju's, etc. During semester breaks, we got a lot of internships in companies such as BioLim, LifeCell, Apex Biotechnology, etc., and got hands-on training in Eppendorf and Asian Analytical Laboratories.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In BSAU-SLS ( LS block), all the courses of life sciences are available such as biotechnology, microbiology, etc. Our campus has open and secured Wi-Fi facility, which makes it easy for us to web search and surf. The food available in the canteen and mess is good, and they follow hygiene standards. Our campus also has a medical centre.
detailed_review.Faculty: As we entered into biotechnology, our faculty members provided a clear idea about our course. Assessments provided by faculty members were also brainstorming. The way of teaching is also different, which makes studies simple. Our course curriculum is relevant and most advanced.
detailed_review.Other: Our college conducts symposium and workshops related to the course, which improves our knowledge and makes us experience new skills. It also provides us with more confidence and prospers our career.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: It provides excellent infrastructure, supportive faculty members, and good quality of teaching.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college assures 100% placements. I am pursuing 3rd year, so I am looking forward to top companies to take my interview. I heard from our class advisory that many medical coding related companies are coming for placements. Regarding internship, our college selects students with good CGPA for internships in universities where they have a tie-up.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the campus is excellent. The lab and classroom facilities are good. There is a central library and a separate library in each department block. The quality of the equipment was good. The food served was good. Medical services are very good. We have the main canteen and 2 other canteens where all kinds of food are available are at a low price.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are ready to clear doubts and give suggestions for our interest, regarding internships, exams available, and opportunities related to this course. They also help us to be updated about the recent trends and discoveries related to our course.
detailed_review.Other: A lot many events take place in our college and we have different clubs where students can exhibit their talent.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Our college has a top-notch infrastructure and is worth the money.

detailed_review.Placements: I am pursuing UG, and my seniors got placements in different various biotechnology labs, but I don't know more about them. Moreover, around 65%-75% of the students got placements. Almost every student has a chance to get one internship, but some students reject it. I don't know top recruiting companies for our course. Top roles offered here are optional drug design and development, disease management, herbal technology, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure available here are very good and inspiring. Classrooms are very nice and have good comfortable chairs. Wi-Fi facility is a little bit slow, and due to jammer, your phone network is also slow. However, labs are top-notch, and the library is very good and huge. The hostel has 3 blocks among which the 3rd block is not good. However, the other two blocks are very much good. The food served in the hostel, canteen and mess is good compared to other colleges canteen. The maintenance of the canteen is very good as its construction is very modern. This college has its own medical centre, along with an ambulance. It also has some huge grounds with spectator accommodation and conducts many sports activities like cricket, etc. Our college has 2X gym, mosque, swimming pool, and this campus highly prone to movie shoots.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is based on the Indian education system, and there is good communication between students and teachers. We can indulge in lab practices. There are highly educated professors and friendly staff members. Our college has a good atmosphere, friendly mates, anti-ragging group and good education.
detailed_review.Other: I planned to opt for medicine, but I chose this course. However, this course has a medical background and pharmaceuticals, and after this course, we can do M.Sc and PhD to become a scientist. Everything is good until now in our course. As it is a university, events are organised all the time. Every time, they conduct some events not only in the biotechnology department but also in engineering, architect and law courses. So this college is very active in this aspect, which makes it more impressive. I don't know about the scholarships.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Our college has a good infrastructure, green plants throughout the campus and well-trained teachers.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students in our course are interested in pursuing master studies and not in jobs. The highest salary offered is Rs. 1 lac per month, while the lowest salary offered is Rs. 25,000 per month. Top recruiting companies for our course are LifeCell, Biocon and many more. Nearly 85% of the students got placed in this academic year. Students from our department were guided to do internships throughout India and also in abroad.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are very well-equipped with senior staff members, a research scholar and assistant. Classrooms are spacious and have projectors. Our college has a central library with more than 10,000 books and also a Wi-Fi network for online courses. Wi-Fi facility is available throughout the campus with a high-speed network. The hostel has very good delicious and hygiene food. Medical facilities are available for 24 hours, along with 2 well-trained doctors and nurses.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are well trained and experienced with more than 7 years. They are knowledgeable, very kind and helpful. Their quality of teaching is a very high standard. The course curriculum makes students clear with their course. They are trained to work in the industry during their final semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Laboratories are well-equipped and provided with good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Very less percentage of students were placed as the majority of them give priority to their post-graduation, and only a few of them will get placed. The highest salary offered may be around Rs. 15,000-20,000 per month. LifeCell's, Biocon and Zifo are the top recruiting companies. We went to an internship which turned out to be a small lab. The lab assistant is the top role offered in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not good over certain regions. Labs are well-equipped with the best instruments, and classrooms are spacious and have good aeration. Libraries are provided with few books from our department. Facilities provided in hostels are good. Quality of food available in the mess and canteen is good, and various varieties of food are provided with minimal cost.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are very helpful, well-qualified and innovative in their own ways. Teaching quality is good. Some of them teach with blackboard, and some teach through PowerPoint. Each teacher is unique and best in their own way. The course curriculum is relevant, but students have to prepare on their way to enter the industry.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: The average salary package offered for biotechnology is around 15,000-20,000 per month. Top recruiting companies for this course are zifo, Biocon. As many students in this course prefer pursuing Masters than a job, the percent of students placed is less.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college has a very good infrastructure. The full campus is enabled with free Wi-Fi. The classrooms are very large and are equipped with projectors for digital learning. The library is great and has separate sections for all departments. Digital Library is also available. Labs are equipped with all advanced machinery and are spacious. The food quality is good. All kinds of sports are encouraged and separate courts are available for all.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are qualified and are helpful. We can approach whenever required and all are very kind in nature. The quality of teaching is excellent. Few facilities prefer teaching with PPT and few prefer board teaching. Both are good. This course curriculum is relevant. The subjects are quite interesting. It depends on the students how they make themselves ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied because of faculty members, infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80% of the students from our course got placed. They got a decent salary package. Top recruiting companies for our course are Bioscreen, Episource, etc. Our college offers many internship opportunities in various universities and companies, which includes the University of Missouri, etc. Many workshops and conferences are also conducted periodically on our campus. Patent analyst, etc., roles are offered here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is enabled with Wi-Fi facility, sufficient lab facilities and both main and department library facilities. Classrooms are spacious enough. Our college provides 24 hours of the medical facility, canteen facility and both indoor games and outdoor sports. There is also a ground facility, and the quality of the food served is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are very good and friendly. Beyond the course curriculum, they provide us with more knowledge to strengthen and focus on the area of our interest. They are always ready to help us to solve our doubts. The curriculum is more relevant to the course, and it provides us with more knowledge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Value for money, good infrastructure, good teaching and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of them get placed. The highest package is around 7L per annum, the lowest around 3L. Companies that come for recruitment are Biocon, Life cell and Dr. Reddy's lab. Our course requires students to do internships to gain experience. Every year,  2 students are selected for internships at University of Missouri, USA. So far 2 have completed it, got scholarship too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are Wi-Fi enabled. We have a central Library and even our life Science school has one, which has both digital and hard copy books. There is a 24hr medical facility and for sports v have a separate physical education dept and indoor facilities along with a basketball court, badminton court, football court and a huge ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and approachable. They clear all our doubts and are quite approachable. Most of them have a Ph.D. qualification. And our curriculum is relevant, goes hand in hand with those of foreign universities and is helpful to clear exams for PG.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has endless research opportunities and it was something I was always curious about and would love to learn more of. Regarding events, v have international conferences every year, along with plenty of workshops conducted every semester. We have two annual fests in our dept - intron and exon. And our college has a decent surrounding, calm and quiet. Connectivity is also good with local buses in and out of our location every 10 minds along with connectivity by local trains. Scholarships are also provided during UG admissions based on 12th standard cut off and for PG students, based on their GATE cut off.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: I am completely satisfied with our college.

detailed_review.Placements: We got top recruiting companies for placements, and few of our seniors also got placed. We have gone through many internships in companies like Biocon, and many students got placed in Byju's also. I am feeling good to study here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is eco friendly where every student could enjoy and have a good time with friends. Our college provided many clubs for us, which organises many events every month to engage students in them. Even we will have a passion for it to enjoy.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our course curriculum is very good, which has my field of interest where I could learn a lot about it. It helps get to know more about practical skills which enable us to have confidence and make us strong in a particular field, which is very useful. In our course, the top role assigned to us is to gain knowledge and skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Best professors and good college environment.

detailed_review.Placements:
All students who opted for placements were placed in our department
9L/annum was the highest,3.5L/annum was the lowest ,6L/annum was the average package offered.
Vertex pharmaceutical, United therapeutics corp. , Biomarin pharmaceutical are some of the companies.
75% of students got internship in Eppendorf, Instem etc.
B. Tech biotechnology has more lab oriented classes, a lot of experiments are performed owing to research work.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Institute has provided great lab facilities, a wonderful library, Excellent Wi-Fi connection, comfortable classrooms, green college environment
Hostel provides very good food and Wi-Fi connection is also fast enough, there is a big ground for playing, a basketball court and gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: The best asset for our institute are the professors who are extremely qualified, knowledgeable and friendly. We can trust crescent for its teaching quality. The curriculum is so good that too in a deemed to be university, it is productive.
detailed_review.Other:
Cultural activities are celebrated in a grand manner in our institute and importance is given to every festival.
If a hard copy of the study material is provided it would be more helpful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: An education friendly environment. Extracurricular activities are supported at the campus.

detailed_review.Placements: They have arranged good companies for the placement. We had placement training this year and next year we are going to face the interview. The companies visiting our campus give opportunities to the deserving students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library and laboratory are well-equipped. The food quality is good at canteen. The campus has a ground which is called as Gallery encourages students to play. There is a basketball court and Table tennis room where interested students can always visit. There are a lot of opportunities given by the college to the students .
detailed_review.Faculty: The quality of education is good at Crescent. Faculty members share their knowledge with the student. There's a good communication maintained between student and the faculty which enables the students to clear their doubts. There's an industrial visit yearly once and there we are thought how an industry function. Yes the course curriculum makes the student ready for industry.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has a better scope in the future and I am passionate about agriculture and animal welfare. Extracurricular activities are supported at the campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Review of Crescent School of Life Sciences (B.S.Abdur Rahman University).

detailed_review.Placements: As I am a 3rd-year student, I get to know from my seniors that placement opportunities were good and up to the standards. The salary package offered by reputed companies was satisfactory for fresher in this field. Many biotech companies are ready to visit our college for placements and are interested in hiring students who are capable of.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided on our campus are extraordinary, efficient and improving. Our college has a lush green environment with multiple learning facilities. Adequate and modern combat technologies are enhancing here. The food served is safe, and quality assured.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum vitae is precise and is followed as per they designed. Every year portions are revised and updated according to the vital trends in the corresponding lines. Faculty members of all departments and also non-teaching staff members are friendly, helpful and approachable.
detailed_review.Other: Life science is an emerging field and requires first-hand handling in all aspects of learning. So Crescent provides a platform for the best experience in this field.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with this institution.

detailed_review.Placements: As I'm practising my third year in B.Tech biotech and I haven't faced my interview yet. I  Will be attending campus interview during our fourth year. Hopefully, I will be placed in the best company. Our institution assured us with 100% placement facility.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is a green campus, which is very well maintained. The infrastructure of our college is exquisite, and it has seven floors with wide classrooms. The entire institution is a Wi-Fi enabled. They are enough equipment and lab materials to perform experiments. Our department has a library where we can gain extra knowledge. The quality of the food served is good, and the price is pocket friendly. Crescent Medical centre is available 24x7 for medical emergencies. Every year an annual sports event is conducted for students to showcase their talent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college are the best. No one can get better than them. They are so qualified and knowledgeable about their subjects. We have presentations to make our class more interactive and understanding. Faculty members are available in the department, and we can clear our doubts anytime. There are various courses and each semester, and each course helps us to get to know more about biotechnology. It provides vast information about scientific processes which makes us industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for the course because biotechnology helps me to know various aspects which I can use for developing scientific products. As we know, India is a developing country and science plays a very vital role. Various events are held by SLS every year. Intron, Exon, science fair, etc., are some of them.

reviews.course: Discontinued (March 2023) B.Tech. in Biotechnology (Artificial Intelligence in Health Care)
reviews.review_title: Meritorious Scholarships are available based on marks in 12th standard.

detailed_review.Placements:
90% placement record.
The highest salary offered - 7lakhs/annum, the lowest - 3lakhs/annum. , Average - 4.5 Lacs/annum.
Biocon, Dr. Reddy's Lab, Life Cell are the top recruiters.
2 Students have completed internships at the University of Missouri and USA with a scholarship from the University. Every Year two students are sent during summer through Crescent and Missouri Collaborative Research center. Biotechnologist, Technical Expert, Scientist, Quality Control are the job roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Infrastructure:
Our Entire campus is Wi-Fi enabled and we have 16 labs in our school of life sciences. All of our classrooms are Wi-Fi enabled and ICT enabled. We have a central Library and a separate library for our school of life sciences. It contains both hard copies and digital copies of books. Hostel Facilities:
We have both AC and Non AC rooms available. Both Non-Veg and Veg mess are available. Food quality is good at the hostel. We have 4 canteens. Crescent Medical Center is available 24 hours inside the campus. We have a separate physical education department and we have football, badminton, volleyball courts. Both indoor and outdoor stadiums are present.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Faculty:
Our professors are very helpful and qualified and knowledgeable. All have a Ph.D. Teaching Quality is excellent as they would conduct activity-based education. It helps us get a more clear understanding. Curriculum:
The curriculum is up to international standards. It helps us to get qualified for GRE and GATE.
detailed_review.Other:
I am passionate about Biotechnology. It has a wide range of opportunities in Research and Jobs. 
Events:
Every Year, International Conference is held in association with a university abroad and funded by Government funding agencies. Workshops are conducted in various areas of Biotechnology at least once in a month to enhance our skills. Seminars and invited talks are also organized by our school of life sciences at least 5 per semester. Fest: Intron is Conducted to showcase our talents in cultural activities. Campus Crowd: Our Campus is spacious with a green atmosphere. Campus surroundings: Our campus is easily accessible and well connected by bus, train, etc. Asia's the largest Zoo is adjacent to our campus. Meritorious Scholarships are available based on marks in 12th standard. Based on the GATE for PG students. Sports, Cultural and literary events are conducted to showcase our talents.

college_info.college_name: Crescent School of Life Sciences Admission 2025: Application Process, Eligibility, Courses & Fee

faqs.question: What is the selection process for B Tech and what is the minimum JEE Mains percentile required?
faqs.answer: Hello, The official web page of Crescent School of Life Sciences has not mentioned the scores required on the JEE Main exam by a candidate to get admission. The college only mentions the below infornation as part of the admission process. Students must fulfil the below to get admission to B.Tech course. - A pass in 12th standard exams conducted by State Board/ CBSE/ ISC board or equivalent  with a minimum aggregate of 50%  scores in PCM - Must have given the Crescent Institute Engineering Admission Test (CIEAT 2023) or should have a valid score in JEE (Main)

faqs.question: Are admissions at Crescent School of Life Sciences entrance-based or merit-based?
faqs.answer: The college only provides entrance-based admission for its BTech and M.Tech courses. Below is the infornation on the accepted exams. - BTech: Must have given the Crescent Institute Engineering Admission Test (CIEAT 2023) or should have a valid score in JEE (Main) - Mtech: Must have a valid score in college conducted CPGEE. Other than this, those with a valid score in National level Entrance examination like GATE, TANCET, etc., are exempted from appearing CPGEE. For BSc and MSc admission, however, students must have a valid score in the last qualifying exam, i.e., Class 12 for BSc and in UG degree for admission to MSc.

faqs.question: Can I join Crescent School of Life Sciences directly?
faqs.answer: Hi, The college only provides entrance-based admission for its BTech and M.Tech courses. Below is the infornation on the accepted exams. - BTech: Must have given the Crescent Institute Engineering Admission Test (CIEAT 2023) or should have a valid score in JEE (Main) - Mtech: Must have a valid score in college conducted CPGEE. Other than this, those with a valid score in National level Entrance examination like GATE, TANCET, etc., are exempted from appearing CPGEE. For BSc and MSc admission, however, students must have a valid score in the last qualifying exam, i.e., Class 12 for BSc and in UG degree for admission to MSc. Having said that, students can talk directly wth the admission office of the college for details on direct admission.

faqs.question: How many seats are there in Crescent School of Life Sciences for BBA?
faqs.answer: Crescent School of Life Sciences offers BTech seats to students who has completed the admission process. To secure BTech seats candidates must complete the entire admission process, including application, selection, admission offer, fee payment, and more. The allotment of seats will be done online based on the score in CIEAT 2025 and marks secured in class 12/qualifying exam collectively. Students with JEE Main score will be offere direct admission.

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for B Tech at Crescent School of Life Sciences?
faqs.answer: Hi, As per the details available on Shiksha.com for Crescent School of Life Sciences for Mtech programme, the total seats mentioned on Shiksha.com is 60 Since I could not find any information on the M.Tech seats intake on the official website of Crescent School of Life Sciences, I have sourced my information from shiksha. However, I would advise you to connect with the college once to cross check this information if you want. I hope this helps.

faqs.question: How secure BTech seats are at Crescent School of Life Sciences?
faqs.answer: Candidates willing to secure BTech seats at Crescent School of Life Sciences, must have completed twelve years of school education with a minimum 45% from a recognised board. Further, candidates are also resquired to secure a valid score in the Crescent Institute of Science and Technology exam and participate in the counselling rounds as well. The allotment of seats will be done online based on the score in CIEAT 2025 and marks secured in class 12/qualifying exam collectively. However, candidates with a JEE Main score will be offered direct admission in the BTech course.

faqs.question: What is the fee for M Tech at Crescent School of Life Sciences?
faqs.answer: As per the fee checked around Crescent School of Life Sciences for M.Tech programme, the total tuition fee mentioned on the official website is Rs 2 lakh. But the fee also includes hostel fees and one time fees which is Rs 2.05 lak and Rs 20,000, respectively. Moreover, if the students want to take AC bus service, they are required to pay Rs 40,000-50,000 extra per year.

Further, candidates are also resquired to secure a valid score in the Crescent Institute of Science and Technology exam and participate in the counselling rounds as well. The allotment of seats will be done online based on the score in CIEAT 2025 and marks secured in class 12/qualifying exam collectively. However, candidates with a JEE Main score will be offered direct admission in the BTech course. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the fee for M Tech at Crescent School of Life Sciences?
faqs.answer: As per the fee checked around Crescent School of Life Sciences for M.Tech programme, the total tuition fee mentioned on the official website is Rs 2 lakh. But the fee also includes hostel fees and one time fees which is Rs 2.05 lak and Rs 20,000, respectively. Moreover, if the students want to take AC bus service, they are required to pay Rs 40,000-50,000 extra per year.

faqs.answer: Yes, pursuing B.Tech at Crescent School of Life Sciences is little expensive. Fee for B.Tech (bachelor of technology) is 2 Lacs per year. college_info.college_name: BMS College of Engineering: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2026, Placements, Scholarships

highlights.summary:
Established in 1946, BMS College of Engineering is popularly known as BMSCE and is located in Basavanagudi, Bangalore. It is a reputed college is accredited by the NAAC with an 'A++' Grade and NBA. The college has been approved by AICTE and UGC. BMS College courses are offered at the UG and PG levels. BMS College of Engineering is a private institute and is affiliated with the Visvesvaraya Technological University VTU), Belgaum.
The college offers courses in streams such as Engineering, Computer Application, and more. BMSCE Bangalore offers placement opportunities to students. BMS College of Engineering admission 2026 is entrance-based. The institute offers UG, PG and doctoral level programmes. BMS College BE admission is based on KCET or COMEDK and BMSCE MTech admission is done based on GATE or Karnataka PGCET.
BMSCE Bangalore has experienced faculty members with years of experience. The college offers various types of scholarships to students as financial assistance. Some of the flagship programmes offered at this college include BTech and MBA. Students can check the key highlights of BMSCE Bangalore in the table provided below:
BMS College of Engineering Highlights 2026
NAAC with an 'A++' Grade and NBA
Ranked in the band 151-200 under the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF Ranking
Check out more BMS College of Engineering Highlights 2024:

table.details: NAAC with an 'A++' Grade and NBA
Ranked in the band 151-200 under the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF Ranking

college_info_program.intro:
The popular programmes offered at BMS College of Engineering include BTech and MBA. Students enrolled in these programmes are placed in top companies such as Accenture, Oracle, Adobe, Paytm, and others. Students opting for Engineering courses are taught a well-designed curriculum that includes the basics of Engineering, a core domain and the development of competencies through the effective usage of Modern Engineering Tools such as Multisim, MATLAB, LabVIEW, Xilinx, IAR Embedded Workbench, Code-Composer-Studio, PCB design labs, process control loops, and others.
BMS College of Engineering MBA students can make their career in fields such as Finance, Marketing, Logistics, and others. Overall, BMS College of Engineering is one of the highest-ranked colleges present in India. Below mentioned are some of the popular programmes offered by BMS College of Engineering and their respective eligibility and BMS College of Engineering fees:

BMS College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Industrial Engineering and Management
reviews.review_title: I would say the college is average and decent, it's just very hyped up because of its reputation.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements in BMS College of Engineering are different for different branches. The highest package in 2025 was offered to the CSE technical branch, which was 50 LPA. For the IEM branch, the highest was around 12 LPA, and the average package was 8 LPA. Around 31 students in IEM got placed this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities you get are honestly average. The college has a huge reputation, but the campus is too small, and the main playground is small. The hostel and mess are decent. The buildings are well developed. But due to a lack of space, it's not easy to enjoy any event. It's okay, not too good, not too bad, but manageable. Just don't expect to have an elite feeling, hoping BMS College of Engineering is a top-tier 1 college. It's infrastructure is pretty decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: The emphasis is more on studying than skills, it's a fact. I don't like the 85 percent attendance criteria. The faculty helps you get good marks if you interact with them and regularly ask questions. Don't expect that you will be taught real-world skills. It's just the VTU-affiliated curriculum. If you like to just study, then this is for you, but if you prefer skills, then this is not helpful. Also, the curriculum is highly outdated.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is good. Facilities are average, clean, and games are good.

detailed_review.Placements: If we get more than 8.5 or 9 CGPA then it will be useful for jobs otherwise it is very hard to get a job. I don't know more about placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are average. But we have to adjust while coming for food. They maintain the hostel clean. Games are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: A good faculty goes beyond mere subject matter expertise. They are passionate, adaptable, and patient educators who act as facilitators of learning. They employ diverse, research-based teaching strategies, encourage active learning, and foster an environment where students feel comfortable challenging ideas and seeking help. Crucially, good faculty communicate high expectations and provide prompt, personalized feedback that guides student development. Their commitment to continuous professional growth ensures they keep the material fresh and aligned with global trends. The curriculum defines the what and how of learning. A good curriculum is transparent, cohesive, and relevant. It features clearly defined, measurable learning.
detailed_review.Other: There is no other suggestion.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has popularity and fame only because of old college. The infrastructure is bad.

detailed_review.Placements: Nothing much, just like an average college. It does not feel like a top college, and placements are not very high. My senior says that the placement building is neglected and does not care for students. Placements are also average in random companies that most would have never heard of.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is smaller than some schools. The hostel infrastructure is old and poor. Some hostels are not even near the college, around 3-4 km away. They provide old buses for those students. Some hostels are small for the number of students, and the indoor facilities are also small.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are average. Some are dedicated, but some are not. No one has an interest to help you in any regard. It is a drag to talk with them because most teachers are arrogant and have only partial knowledge of their subject. They just talk and show slides.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college unfiltered B. MS C. E

detailed_review.Placements: In B. MS College of Engineering, the placements are very good, and the highest package is about 44 LPA. The average package is around 7-8 LPA. The college helps students with placements, and many pre-placement offers are provided to students through internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: B. MS College of Engineering is well known for its infrastructure and the area where it is situated. The campus is very good, and the hostels are also good. Mess food is top notch, classrooms are well-equipped with AC and projectors, and we have two libraries.
detailed_review.Faculty: B. MS College of Engineering has many good faculty members, with 60 percent Ph.D. holders. Because of the faculty, curriculum, and exams, it is one of the top colleges in Bangalore and Karnataka. They conduct 3 CIEs and 1 SEE. There are many activities other than exams and studies on campus.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the ECE department. My department in BMSCE is considered one of the good ECE departments in Karnataka, and we have a technical fest called Phase Shift and an event called Utsav.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good Professors, small campus, but chill college.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% to 90% of students got placed. The highest package is 51 LPA, and the lowest is 4.5 LPA. Companies like Apple and Nvidia came to our college. 40%-50% of students got internships. Many students go abroad for higher studies. Major roles are analyst and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every basic facility is available, like any other college. Hostels are less in numbers, so many students live in PG. Sports and games facilities are decent. Most of the hostels are far from the college like 4-7 km. They do provide a bus facility. Mess food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are nice and approachable. Most of them are from good colleges. The curriculum is a little bit outdated, but they are constantly working to make it relevant for us. Exams indeed get difficult after the first year. The first year is pretty chill. After the first year, they take the chill out of you.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course only because I had a poor rank in JEE. There are two major events, the first one is Utsav, which is a cultural fest, and the second one is Phaseshift, which is a tech fest.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: BMSCE, an overview of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: I am studying electrical engineering at BMSCE, and the subjects taught in this course are quite pertinent to the course and the jobs offered after the completion of the course. So I have nothing but praise for this particular or specific stream in this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite bad, and they need to loosen up their pockets because the hostels, labs and classes could use a much-needed upgrade, and they do take a lot of fees, so it wouldn't hurt them to streamline some of that cash to the benefit of the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty here is just not helpful, they will say the vilest of stuff just to put you down. I am an average student, but the number of times they have made me feel like I don't belong here is sad, especially from a teacher named ***** of the Chemistry lab. I truly hope that guy gets the worst death possible.
detailed_review.Other: Chose this course because of my interest in it.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, our college is really very good for engineering placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement is good. All we need to do is cooperate and do the needful as they guide us. If we are interested from day one, its not difficult to get a good package placement. BMS College of Engineering is one of the best colleges in Bengaluru, Karnataka. It depends on the students and their skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are very nice, but its also not that easy to get into the hostels, especially for girls. We have only 5 hostels, but if u join a hostel, we also have extra activities and events going on in the hostel, which is extra fun apart from the college fest.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are doctoral holders, but they are not that helpful. All Courses are relevant. Semester exams are really not that easy. If you look at eligibility, we wont get eligibility that easily. Attendance also much needed faculty members are really very strict.
detailed_review.Other: I believe ECE is the evergreen course, which has many opportunities, thats why I took this branch, events fest all are very good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Vibrant campus life with amazing events and energetic crowd.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently studying in 3rd year. Our seniors who just graduated from this college, most of them got internship and placement opportunities, but about their seniors who graduated in 2024. 50% of students got placed. The placements depend totally on the skills and CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is overall okay. The total area of our college is less than the engineering colleges supposed to have, the library facilities are really good, but they are not sufficient during internals and final exams, its usually crowded during that time.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are really good. They should be, its cause a top college with a huge reputation in Karnataka, there will be so many opportunities for students to grow their network and improve skills. This campus has a huge crowd, many students are applying each and every year.
detailed_review.Other: I got into this college through KCET exam, which is usually for Karnataka students. Students can join this college through JEE or COMEDK exams, but they need a ranking below 5000 to get good branches in this college.

reviews.course: B.E in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: This college is very good and has a good reputation as a college in Bengaluru.

detailed_review.Placements: There are so many members in our college. The percentage of students placed is around 92%. The highest package offered is 36 LPA. The average package offered is 8 LPA. The lowest salary offered is 6 LPA. There are so many recruiter companies, such as Amazon, Flipkart, Microsoft, Google, and many other companies. The percentage of students who got internships in my course is around 80%. The top roles offered in my course are like HR, manager, and other jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in my course, AI, ML, will include Wi-Fi available in the library. The labs are well-equipped, the equipment is also good, and the classrooms will have projectors and digital boards. The qualities of the facilities in the hostel are very good, and the food is also very good. Medical facilities are available every time there is a small ground available for sports, and there is a big ground in college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality was very good. They were highly qualified professionals and graduated from top universities. This course curriculum is relevant, and this also makes students industry-ready. The difficulty of the semester will be moderate, and the pass percentage in my course is 91%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has been trending in software. The things I wish to be better at are likely to improve the college management. There will be so many fests and events happening, and there will also be many clubs.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is a very good college in Bangalore where anyone can join.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed in my course computer science and engineering is around 94% of them has been placed. The highest package in my course is 56 LPA, the lowest package in my course is 11 LPA, and the average package is around 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies in my course are Intel, Amazon, Flipkart, Google, Microsoft, and many other companies. Around 70% of the students got internships from my course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure available for my course include well-equipped lab. The classrooms will be digital, and there will be projectors also in classrooms. There is also Wi-Fi in the library for computers. There will be well-equipped library with books. The quality of facilities of hostel is very good, and the food will be same as in other colleges. There is a ground facility near the hostel to play games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality of BMS College of Engineering is very good. They are highly qualified in many institutions. This course curriculum is relevant, and it also makes students industry-ready. The difficulty of semester will be moderate. The pass percentage is around 91%.
detailed_review.Other: This course has been in trend in this college. Students need to improve their coding skills to better understand the course. There will be many events, fests, and clubs available in college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science & Business Systems
reviews.review_title: Faculty members need improvement, but the placements are good. Infrastructure is nice.

detailed_review.Placements: Since our course is new, the senior batch is currently in their 4th semester, so placements for CSBS haven't been done yet. Our course has tied up with TCS for future opportunities. The top roles offered in our course will be business analyst and business engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is strong, up to 300 Mbps, and labs have the latest fast-running computers, which are maintained properly. Classrooms are also neat and very helpful for concentration. The library is full of books that we can borrow. Hostel food is above average, and the dorm rooms are average. Medical and sports facilities are above average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are very helpful and some are not. Teaching quality depends on the teacher. Since I am in 1st year, the curriculum kind has useless subjects which won't be useful in future. Semester exams are easy and passing percentage is high around 85%. .
detailed_review.Other: I got rank in COMEDK which chose this cource and I like to get into business professions. Two major events called phaseshift and utsav takes place every year which is the largest event among Bengaluru colleges.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science & Business Systems
reviews.review_title: Inside BMS College of Engineering – A student's perspective

detailed_review.Placements: It’s only been two years since our branch started, so I will be talking about CS core placement. The CS department at BMSCE consistently delivers impressive placement records. Top-tier companies such as Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Adobe, and Atlassian recruit from the campus, offering competitive packages. The competition is immense though.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus is well-maintained with Wi-Fi-enabled buildings, air-conditioned seminar halls, etc. Some of the college buildings are old, and there isn’t much space left on the campus. There are some beautiful places nearby, and there are always people around to socialize.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty in the department are experienced, knowledgeable, and approachable. Most professors hold PhDs and are involved in active research, including AI, cybersecurity, and data science. Students benefit from mentorship, regular seminars, and industry-liked academic exposure. Many faculty members also guide students for international coding contests, publications, and internships.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science
reviews.review_title: A very good college in  Bengaluru. Placement rate in 2023 is good, and I am satisfied with faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Good college, good placement, and good faculty, and it has a very good environment in college. Happy with it, I would suggest this college above all the colleges in Bengaluru. Join this college and enjoy your life in college with a good engineering life.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure, and it has good labs and a library to study in, and I am very happy regarding the campus. It is good to be here and I am very happy. If you want to succeed in life, come over here and enjoy the engineering life and have fun on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good courses and good faculty, and has good teaching experience. Faculty is pretty much good and has a good understanding between the faculty teachers and students. I am very happy to say that I am in BMSCE. Hope you all are going to be successful in life after joining this college.
detailed_review.Other: Crowd I would say, is pretty much decent, and you have the opportunity to grab the placements by the 3rd year itself.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: BMS College of Engineering review

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90-95% of students are placed in my college. The highest package was around 40-50 LPA, and the average is around 8-12 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Nokia, TCS, and other companies. 50% of students got internships. I am not sure about the top roles order.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good with greenery throughout the campus, and it’s very nice to be around here. There’s a building outside the campus for freshers, but the best block is PJA Block, which stands for Platinum Jubilee Block. This is where CSE and ECE classes take place. The classrooms are very nice and modern.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty depends on teacher to teacher, but most of them are helpful, although some of them might not be that good. The syllabus is very updated. I don’t know much about all this because I am still a fresher. Hopefully, I encounter better faculty in the future.
detailed_review.Other: I liked coding, that’s why I chose this course, and I hope they invest more in the artists they bring during fests, because it doesn’t feel very big with small artists.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Business Systems
reviews.review_title: BMS, located in the heart of Bangalore, provides good placements and has good peers and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75% of students got placed, and 50% of students managed to crack an internship by the 6th semester. Companies like L&T, Capgemini, Impress, Infosys, and TCS hire students. The course syllabus is designed by TCS. Roles are mainly of Business Analyst. Some can even pursue roles as software engineers in tech fields.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is average because of less area, as it is on 10 acres of land. Hostel is both close to the college and away from the college. Hostel infrastructure and mess are good, but the cost is approximately on the higher side. Medical facility is good because the college has its own hospital near the main campus. Sports culture is mid.
detailed_review.Faculty: Since the college is an autonomous university, scoring a good CGPA is a bit easy, at least in the earlier semesters. Semester exams are above average. The curriculum is relevant to industries and helps students to get a good internship. Teachers are helpful and enthusiastic.
detailed_review.Other: My course is mostly about Computer Science, aided with 15% of MBA content. The curriculum is designed by TCS.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's my honest opinion on BMSCE.

detailed_review.Placements: In Computer Science engineering, around 85% of students were placed in the year 2024-25. Highest salary package offered was for around 40 LPA  given by a cybersecurity company. Average salary package was around 10 to 12 LPA. Least salary package was for 4 LPA. Almost 40% of students secured internships with companies like Cisco, Deloitte, Dell, etc. Top roles are software development engineer, data analyst, product engineer/developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of CSE department is very good in this college. and facilities like lab are well-equipped with required devices, classrooms are cleaned regularly and are spacious enough not to make u feel cramped, libraries are filled with books and very spacious to sit. Food quality in hostel is just acceptable, it isn't that good, and facilities depend on your hostel branch. Facilities are usually good, but some rooms get cramped with 4 people, and some branches are 2 to 10 km away from campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified here at BMSCE, and a lot of them are helpful. When you ask for stuff, they provide notes before exam, but classes might feel boring. Course curriculum is relevant to our subject, but I don't think it makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are kind of hard, if u try to study everything, but manageable if u do PYQs and a good enough percentage of students pass in semester, though they never mentioned exact percentage.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of BMS College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 85% of students get placed in the CSE course. The highest package is 33.1 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA, according to our seniors. The median package is usually 8.5 LPA. My seniors have told me that the top recruiting companies are usually Amazon, Microsoft, Google, IBM, and others. About 35-44% of students offer internships in the same companies. However, I think there may be issues in the future due to the rise in the intake of CSE students from the 2024-28 batch. The top roles are usually data analyst, software development engineer, and product engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided in the libraries and laboratories are very good and well-equipped. The CSE department, being a core department, has a well-developed infrastructure at BMSCE. There is Wi-Fi, but I don’t know any student who has been able to connect to it. Classrooms are clean and nice. Hostel facilities depend on when you join. People who join late usually get hostels 2-10 km away from college, and as I have heard, it is hectic and cramped. However, people who join early have on-campus hostels with a hill environment. Sports and games can be played on the ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable, but it usually depends on the teacher you get. Some of them are strict about things, while others do not care even if you fail. The teaching quality is great. The curriculum is updated and very relevant, but you can't say it fully makes students industry-ready. Every internal exam except the semester-end examination is hard. Around 70% of students pass.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: It is a good college with a good campus.

detailed_review.Placements: About 90% of students got placed in our course/branch. The highest package offered to our branch is 90 LPA and the average package is 47 LPA. The lowest package is 22 LPA. The top recruiting companies for our course are Amazon, Flipkart, Microsoft, etc. About 98% of students got internships from our course in top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities available in our college are college buses. It provides a library with a computer lab. All the lab equipment is well-maintained. Classrooms are very neat and clean. The hostel facility in our college is very good. There is a separate building for both boys and girls. It has a good security. It is safe for women. The food given in the hostel is very good and of quality.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are well-educated and they teach excellently. They are very helpful. The teaching quality is excellent. In our course, students are well-trained in college and they are to move or run the industry. This course is not difficult, and we should read from the first day so that we can score above the distinction.

reviews.course: B.E in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: BMS College of Engineering - My honest review.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 80% is our placement rate in college. My batch is 2024-2028 AIML. Last year there was a package offered in machine learning for 38 LPA. The average package is 10 LPA - 12 LPA. Top companies are Amazon, Nokia, Bosch, TCS, and many more. About 30-40% of students who applied get internships. Top roles offered are HR manager and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are a lot of facilities in college from sports to studies, from cultural to extracurricular activities. Wi-Fi is available in library and labs everywhere except the new one APS building that is for 1st year. Hostel life is not that much good, it's fine only but the quality of food is best in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are the most supportive and helpful. They have a very good knowledge, especially teachers for 2nd and 3rd years. The course curriculum is fully ready in college as they also update course content after new discover (about after a year) like in my course AIML, they did it last year too.
detailed_review.Other: As AI is on boom and there is very much scope in machine learning in the future. I will pass out in 2028. They can improve my course by adding a few relevant things related to 2-3rd year in 1st year only in place of chemistry and physics. Two best fests in college are Utsav and Phaseshift. Too much extracurricular activities are there at the college.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: The best college from my experience.

detailed_review.Placements: There is an opportunity to avail of placemens, after the completion of the second year, with various pre-placement offers that are made in the internship programme. Multiple companies like Amazon, TCS, HDFC, ICICI, and many more visit the campus, with the highest salary average at 20 LPA and the minimum salary being 1 LPA. Top recruiters included Amazon, Brita, Bosch, Daily Hunt, Informatica, Epicore, Wipro, Westline, Volvo, TCS, Hyundai, Jabong, Elance, etc. Our Placement and Training Centre facilitated on-campus placement opportunities for us.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The MBA course is a 2-year course with 4 semesters, with 2 semesters every year. Around 70% of the faculty team have completed their Ph.D. in their interest-based research field. They also have teaching experience of 5–10 years. The total hostel fee includes the mess charge, with the food being really tasty and healthy. The hostel has all the facilities like 24x7 water and power supply, study table, and more amenities that are provided to the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of BMSCE is very well-versed and helpful. They are very approachable and patient with students. They are always ready to clear their doubts. They often gave us case studies to help us get to know our course better and in-depth. The course is divided over 4 semesters, with a number of subjects like business analytics, managerial economics, organizational behaviour, and operation research taught in the first year. The second year is for specialisation, and I had opted for marketing, with the professors giving immense focus on developing critical thinking skills and business ethics skills.

college_info.college_name: BMS College of Engineering Course Admissions 2026: Eligibility, Selection, Fees and Seats

admission.title: BMS College of Engineering Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text:
BMS College of Engineering admission 2026 is entirely entrance-based for undergraduate and postgraduate programmes. The institute offers UG, PG and doctoral level programmes. BMS College BE admission is made through KCET or COMEDK and BMSCE MTech admission is through GATE or Karnataka PGCET. Admission in the MCA programme at BMS College of Engineering is made through KMAT or Karnataka PGCET.

BMS College of Engineering MBA admission 2026 is made through KMAT/ CMAT / MAT/ Karnataka PGECET rank and scores. BMSCE PhD programme is affiliated with Visvesvaraya Technological University. Candidates wishing to take admission in any of the BMS College courses must apply for fresh admission on the BMSCE website and provide all necessary details in the BMS College application form .

faqs.question: Who is eligible for admission at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering eligibility criteria varies according to different programmes offered by the institute at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Candidates who want to take admission in the BE programme through management quota must have passed Class 12 examination with Physics, Mathematics , Chemistry/ CS/ Electronics with a minimum 60% aggregate. Candidates who have passed Diploma or equivalent examination with a minimum 45% aggregate (40% marks in case of SC, ST and backward classes candidates from Karnataka) are eligible to apply for BMS College BE admission through lateral entry.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering admissions are entrance based. Candidates who wish to take admission to any of the undergraduate or postgraduate programmes offered at BMS College of Engineering must appear for the entrance examination. The College does not offer direct admission to candidates in any of the programmes. Candidates who wish to take admission to the BE programme must appear for either KCET or COMEDK and admission to the MTech programme at BMSCE is made through GATE or Karnataka PGCET. BMS College MCA admission is made through KMAT or Karnataka PGCET while BMSCE MBA admission is based on CMAT/ MAT / Karnataka PGCET or KMAT score and percentile achieved by candidates. Check BMSCE courses .

faqs.question: What is the procedure to take admission at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Candidates must follow certain procedure to take admission in any of the undergraduate or postgraduate programme offered at BMS College of Engineering. The procedure begins with filling out the BMSCE application form followed by an appearance in the entrance exam and counselling process. BMS College of Engineering course admission for all the undergraduate and postgraduate programmes is entirely based on entrance examination. Given below is the step wise BMS College admission process : STEP 1: Candidates must fill out the detailed BMS College of Engineering application form which is available on the BMSCE website . STEP 2: Then, candidates must appear for the entrance examination according to the programme for which they wish to apply for. BMS College of Engineering accepts the scores of KCET, COMEDK, Karnataka PGCET , KMAT, CMAT and various other entrance exams for admission in specific programmes. STEP 3: After candidates receive the entrance scores, they must appear for the counselling process, confirm the seat and must pay BMS College admission fees .

faqs.question: Does BMS College of Engineering admission require entrance exam scores?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering course admissions are only made through the entrance examination scores and rank obtained by candidates. BMSCE accepts the rank and scores of various entrance examinations depending upon the programme opted by the  candidates. KCET and COMEDK scores are required for BMS College BE admission while GATE and Karnataka PGCET scores are required for MTech admission. BMS College of Engineering MBA admission is made through CMAT/ MAT/ KMAT or Karnataka PGCET scores and the institute accepts the scores of Karnataka PGCET or KMAT to offer admission in the MCA programme.

faqs.question: What is the fees for BMSCE CSE course?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering fees is different for various programmes offered by the institute at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. BMS College offers a BE programme in Computer Science and Engineering specialisation at the undergraduate level. The total tuition fees charged by BMS College of Engineering for the full time BE CSE programme is INR 1.63 lakh.

faqs.question: Is there BTech in BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering has 18 different specialisations in BE programme at the undergraduate level. Some of these specialisations, include Electrical and Communication Engineering , Aerospace Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering etc. Candidates who have obtained at least 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-I candidates from Karnataka state) in Class 12 or equivalent examination with Physics, Mathematics, English Biology/ Biotechnology / Computer Science and with English as one of the language can apply for BMS College of Engineering BE admission.

faqs.question: Is BMS College of Engineering good for CSE?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering is good for Computer Science Engineering (CSE) based on several factors. According to BMS College of Engineering NIRF report 2023, the median package offered during BMS College of Engineering BTech and MTech placements 2022 was INR 8.24 LPA and INR 7 LPA, respectively. This shows that BMS College of Engineering provides favorable opportunities and a strong placement record for CSE students.

faqs.question: What is the B.Tech cutoff for SC and ST category students at BMS College of Engineering, Bangalore?
faqs.answer: BMS College Of Engineering BTech cutoff 2024 has been announced across multiple specialisations. The cutoff was released as opening and closing ranks for General, OBC, SC, ST, EWS, and PWD categories. Based on the COMEDK 2024 cutoff in Round 3, the closing ranks ranged between 3716 and 70805 for the students belonging to the General category. Among all the BTech specialsiations, Computer Science & Technology turned out to be the most demanded courses. For SC and ST categories, the COMEDK cutoff is not available. In the meantime, candidates can refer to the table below to check out the BMS College of Engineering 2023 cutoff for both SC and ST categories to get an idea of the cutoff ranks for BTech admission:

faqs.question: Which entrance exams are accepted for M.Tech admission at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering considers both GATE and Karnataka PGCET for admission in its M.Tech course. An acceptable score in either of these tests is necessary in order to be applied. Them method of selection will be merit based and to the state reservation norms. Academic eligibility should also be attained by candidates.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for M.Tech at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Candidate who have passed BE or BTech degree examination in the relevant discipline and have secured at least 50% aggregate taken together in all the subjects of all the semesters of the degree examination are eligible to apply for admission to the MTech programme offered at BMS College of Engineering. Minimum eligibility for BMS College of Engineering M.Tech admission is a minimum of 45% marks in qualifying examination for SC, ST and Category-I candidates from Karnataka state.

faqs.question: How is the qualifying exam percentage calculated for M.Tech at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: In BMS College of Engineering, the percentage of admission to M.Tech course is computed by combining all subjects of all semesters of the BE/BTech degree. This collective assesses the eligibility of the general and the reserved category students. To sustain their scores, candidates have to be properly documented.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for admission to the MTech programme at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMSCE MTech 2025 is entrance based. Admission to the MTech programme in BMS College of engineering is characterized by two vital aspects. The first requirement is that candidates must meet the general eligibility criteria and hence be a graduate with a minimum aggregate of 50 percent in BE/BTech degree. Second, the quality is majorly dependent on the result of the entrance test among the GATE or Karnataka PGCET. These test papers are very vital in testing candidates and qualifying them into joining the MTech programme. Achieving a high percentage in the GATE or in the Karnataka PGCET exams with the general eligibility is essential to those who seek admission to the MTech course at BMS College of Engineering.

faqs.answer: BMS College of Engineering has received decent reviews from alumni and students in terms placements, infrastructure and faculty members. According to the verified Shiksha reviews , the institute provides decent placement opportunities to the students, has a good infrastructure and the faculty members are well qualified. faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for MBA at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: You must follow BMS College of Engineering eligibility criteria if you want to take admission in the MBA programme. To get admission in the MBA programme, candidate must have passed Bachelor’s degree examination from a recognised University and must have obtained minimum 50% aggregate taken together in all the subjects including language subject. SC/ ST or Category-I candidates from Karnataka state must obtain minimum 45% marks in the qualifying examination.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to MBA at BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: BMS College admission for MBA programme is entirely based upon the performance of candidates and percentile or rank obtained by them in the entrance examination. Candidates who wish to take admission in the MBA programme offered at BMS College of Engineering must appear for any one of the following entrance examination namely, Karnataka PGCET/ KMAT/ MAT or CMAT. For BMC College of Engineering MBA admission , candidates must first fill out the application form from the college where they must provide all the necessary details and submit all the necessary documents and must pay the application fees.

faqs.question: What is the fee structure for MBA in BMS College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: After getting admission in the MBA programme at BMS College of Engineering, submit the admission fees to confirm admission with the institute. BMS College of Engineering fees for the MBA programme is INR 7 lakh. The following mentioned BMS College fees for MBA programme includes tuition fees component. faqs.question: Who is eligible for admission at BMS College of Engineering?

Candidates who have passed Class 12 or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages and have obtained at least 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for SC, ST and Category-I candidates) in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology/ Biology / Electronics or Computer Science as optional subjects can apply for admission to the BE programme offered at BMS College of Engineering. Candidates who want to take admission in the BE programme through management quota must have passed Class 12 examination with Physics, Mathematics , Chemistry/ CS/ Electronics with a minimum 60% aggregate.
