Classrooms are well-maintained, and the library is also good, with a collection of books; more than 5000 books are available. Labs are well-maintained, and Wi-Fi is also available for each floor and block. I do not live at the hostel, so I don't know about it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and humble. All teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable, and the teaching quality is superb. Course curriculum relevance is more important for us. It makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are difficult because they make question papers at a moderate level, so students face them. The passing percentage is 40, so you can easily qualify if you study daily.
detailed_review.Other: This course is very popular, and I want to learn about AI and ML, so I have chosen more facilities and infrastructure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in CSE (I.O.T and Cyber Security including Blockchain)
reviews.review_title: Good enough and budget friendly private college.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 40 to 50% of students get placed in my course. The highest package in my course is about INR 10-12 LPA and the lowest is 3-4 LPA. The average package lies between INR 6-8 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS and Deloitte. They provide a training and placement program from the 2nd year with an additional fee of INR 8,000.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are decent, and the faculty is cooperative and supportive. The infrastructure is good and well-maintained with regular cleaning and proper hygiene. Departments are fully equipped with safety devices and decent classrooms with a capacity of 60-70 students. The library is also good with over 6,000 books. Medical facilities are average, with a dispensary where only a few medicines are available. Sports are managed by the Champion Club under the guidance of DSW (Student Welfare). DSW is the best thing I found in the college as they are always available and help students in all situations. Hostel food is average, and we just eat to live.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are good and cooperative, but a few are not of that type. Most of the teachers complete the syllabus on time, but those who are not able to complete it take extra classes. Teachers have good knowledge. Yes, the curriculum is relevant, and it is decided by PTU Jalandhar. However, I don't think they make students industry-ready; students themselves have to pay a lot of attention to enhance skills. Semester examinations are not very tough, but sometimes mass reappearances occur. The pass percentage is 80-90%.
detailed_review.Other: I like the course as it is innovation-based, so it can lead to good startups. The physics and chemistry in the 1st semester must be removed, and some skill-based subjects should be taught, as we have only 4 years to acquire all the necessary skills, and 1 year is wasted on physics and chemistry. Fests and events occur regularly. During admission time, the major fest "Parivartan" occurs once a year and is paid. The college pays attention to extracurricular activities, which are managed by DSW.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: The college with special skills.

detailed_review.Placements: Only 50 percent of the outgoing batch is placed on our campus. The highest package is around 25 LPA, and the lowest package is around 3 LPA. Companies like TCS, Infosys, HCL Technologies, Wipro, and Cognizant are there, visiting every year during placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is average. Classes are non-AC, unlike other colleges. Hostels that are in the college are not so good. Even the food of the mess is not good. The college never looks after the complaints of the students facing issues in the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are very helpful and qualified with the highest degrees and are knowledgeable. The chief of the college are not good in our department. They are very strict with us as students. But the teachers are very understanding and helpful, unlike in other colleges.
detailed_review.Other: As you know, everything is based on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. So, based on that skill, I opted for B.Tech in AIML as my core subjects.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Industry-relevant curriculum with supportive faculty members. Moderate exams and balanced academics.

detailed_review.Placements: An average of 75% of students are placed. The highest salary package offered to an MBA student is 18 LPA, the lowest salary package offered is 4 LPA, and the average salary package offered is 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are BNY, Deloitte, KPMG, Federal Bank, Flipkart and more. There are various opportunities for internships as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is quite good, with facilities like a bed, a wardrobe, a student table, and a chair. The food in a hostel is very good as compared to other colleges in Chandigarh. There are 4 canteens, many snack shops, and 2 food courts. The hostel is fully Wi-Fi enabled, and a gym is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: CGC Landran offers knowledgeable and helpful faculty members, though teaching quality varies. The course curriculum is industry-relevant and prepares students for careers, supplemented by practical exposure. Semester exams are moderately tough, and the pass percentage is high with consistent effort. Overall, a balanced academic environment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: This college is a better option for students choosing AIML course.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, only 50% of the students get placed. The highest package offered is about 20 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA and the average package offered is 6-7 LPA. Top requiting companies are HCL, Tech Mahindra, Deloitte, TCS, Wipro Technologies, etc. At least 30-40% students got internships in average companies like TCE and Wipro Technologies. Top roles like cloud engineer and machines learning engineer are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms are airy having at least 10-12 fans. Wi-Fi facilities are available but only for the staff and hostellers and not for day scholars. The Labs are well maintained but the library has only academics books and no novels or other good books. The quality of facilities in the hostel is average. The mess food is also average. Good medical facilities are available. Many achievements in sports and games are bagged by the college students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum and exams are in a very old pattern. The college only covers academic syllabus for the exams and does not focus on the students’ practical skills. The passing percentage of this college is approximately 70-75%. Semester exams are quite difficult. A student has to be very focused towards the studies because the college attendance at this college solely doesn't get you a good placement package.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as it has a potential growth in the coming 4-5 years. The college organizes events, fest and other extracurricular activities every month. Only Punjab SC and OBC scholarships are provided here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: CGC, Landran : Honest Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Student are being placed on a decent package here in Chandigarh group of colleges Landran. A dedicated placement cell is established in the college halls to provide or facilitate placements and internships. Top recruiting companies includes Amazon, Flipkart Walmart, etc. On average, about 60–70 percent of students are being placed here at CGC Landran.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. Labs are equipped with all the basic necessities that allow them to teach well. Facilities in the hostel are quite good; food is average—not so good, not so bad; Wi-Fi, laundry, etc. are included.
detailed_review.Faculty: Chandigarh Group of colleges are affiliated with the Govt. Punjab Technical University, so all the curriculum and exams are handled by PTU. The curriculum is not so good. Changes have not been introduced for a long time. Also, no practical-based learning is done in college.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Value for money college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% students of the batch gets placements. The highest package was 13lpa and the lowest was 3lpa. The average package was 5-8lpa. Top recruiting companies were HDFC, HCL, Reliance, Infosys etc. Companies come to the college more the post of marketing, management etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is top class. College has the big classrooms and functioning labs. There is library in the college. The course curriculum of the college is properly designed. College has the hostel facility. In the hostel the rooms are properly furnished. The hostel mess is cleaned and food is tasty.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are very highly qualified and knowledgeable. Teachers are very supportive and helpful. They help us with their experience and their knowledge. They have a very good teaching skills. Teachers used to organize various fair talks and classes. Exams are based on semester system.
detailed_review.Other: There are various tournaments and events organized in the college. The faculty of the college is top notch. It is a value of money college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: This college is totally worth the money if you have the ability or are an enthusiastic student.

detailed_review.Placements:
If you are a good student and have skills, then you will definitely get a placement.
The highest package is around INR 45 LPA, and the least is around INR 3 to 4 lacs.
The companies mainly required that you have skills in at least one language, have good communication skills, and know how to handle data.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is average because it is very small and hostel buildings are not good. I don't even refer anyone to take hostels, and the food in mess is average. It depends on the day, like when food is awesome but on some days it is average, and sometimes insects are also found there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are conducted very strictly, but this college is from PTU, and this university gives a lot of retakes. And if we are talking about teachers, average means they do not take on too much burden to teach the students and do not focus on weak students.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70-80% students got placed. The highest package is around 7laks per annum and the lowest is 2.30laks per annum. The top recruiting companies are BYJU's and most of the companies offer BDA roles. More than 30% people get internship courses from top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi, labs and library facilities are available. The classrooms are also good to go with smart classes. The hostel are good to go but the food is decent. The medical, sports and games facilities are good to go. You can enjoy food joints inside the college as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well qualified, helpful and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant as well. The semester exams are not difficult and the passing percentage is around 80-90%. The exams and the study curriculum makes the student industry ready as well.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because of my Bachelor's course. You will get good learning experience from this course about business. More practical material should be used to make this course more good. You can enjoy various events, fests, campus surroundings, extracurricular activities etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Our college is good in terms of placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college provides good placement opportunities. Almost 80% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary package offered is 45 LPA. The average salary package offered ranges between 3 LPA and 4 LPA. Many top companies visit our college to recruit students. The top recruiting company is Amazon. Many students got internships because companies visit the college at regular intervals.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is average. Our college provides average facilities. Wi-Fi connectivity is not good. The hostel is not so good. I would not recommend joining the hostel. The mess is crowded. Sports and games facilities are average. There is a medical dispensary.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. We have so much pressure because of exams and classes. You have to maintain attendance. You have to do self-study for placements. Semester exams are difficult. The exam evaluation is not good.

college_info.college_name: CBIT: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology, Hyderabad (also known as CBIT) is a private institute, established in 1979 in Hyderabad, Telangana. CBIT is approved by AICTE and offers a total of 37 courses at UG and PG levels in 14 specialisations such as Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Biotechnology Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering and Communications Engineering. Furthermore, it offer courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA in Full Time mode. CBIT fee structure includes a total tuition fee ranging from INR 1,50,600 to 5,60,000. CBIT has an annual seat intake of 1998 for all the programmes. It offers courses, in streams such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. As per the recent CBIT placement records, the average median salary at the Institute is around INR 5,48,000. The institute has a safe and well-equipped campus with all the advanced facilities.

college_info_program.intro:
Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology courses include a diverse selection in the fields of Engineering and Management. The flagship UG programmes include the Bachelor of Engineering (BE), as well as the Bachelor of Technology (BTech) courses. Both the courses are equivalent in their acceptability and are offered in various specialisations. CBIT Hyderabad courses also include the popular MBA programme, that offer a solid foundation to Management students.
Check out more on CBIT popular programmes in the details below:

CBIT Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: CBIT is the best college in Hyderabad, I think, because it has good infrastructure and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: In our branch, around 30–40 percent of students are placed in the college. The highest package in our branch is 10 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA. ITC and many other companies visited the campus. Overall placement may be around 12–20 percent. As a starting candidate, companies offer lower roles or entry-level roles in most companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are many good facilities in our college, like a gym and a proper ground. The food is very nice in both the hostel and the canteen. There are also good medical facilities. I loved the food more than the food prepared by my mom, as well as the canteen food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are very knowledgeable and provide good-quality teaching. It is not that easy, but we can write the exams. The pass percentage is around 80 percent. The exams are very difficult to write, and many of my friends failed in some subjects. They are very strict while conducting exams.
detailed_review.Other: I like the course. Sports facilities need improvement. There are no fests in our college, which is the main negative point.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: College is very good in studies, sports, balancing academics and extracurricular activities.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in this college are purely based on our academic scores. If any student has a backlog, then they are not eligible for some companies. Students who perform well in academics will definitely get placed in the campus interviews. The highest package offered last year was 51 LPA, and the average package was 10 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Each branch has separate labs and lab faculty members. There is only one library in this college, which is sufficient for students in each branch. It also contains different areas for different purposes, such as the internet, discussion room, etc. There is a canteen in this college which serves tasty and healthy food.
detailed_review.Faculty: I like one thing about the college examination is that if students score less in the examination, then they will focus on students who scored less by conducting special classes, which are called remedial classes. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. The invigilation is very strict, which is good. For each branch, there are separate faculty members. There is also a head for each department.
detailed_review.Other: There is a special event in this college which will be held in the even semester named Shruthi. It is an event of 7 days, and sports are conducted 1 and a half month before the event. Every day at the event, there is a different concept with different timings.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The college offers average packages but big name companies visit.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has fairly decent placements. However, the number of companies visiting has reduced in recent times. The highest package offered is around 60 LPA, the lowest is about 2 LPA, and the average hovers around 5 LPA. Some of the top recruiters include Asian Paints, Qualcomm, Amazon, and Flipkart. I don’t have complete clarity on the specific roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We do have good facilities and infrastructure in our college. Everywhere you go, we have separate Wi-Fi for each floor in each block, spacious classrooms with digital projectors for interaction with students, and a big library. We also have active club activities and interactive sessions with professionals and experts.
detailed_review.Faculty: We do have experienced faculty who have a minimum of 10 years of experience in teaching. They do interact with students in class, except for a few who only teach the subject in the curriculum. When it comes to our curriculum and exams, it's not too tough. The papers are prepared by our separate branch faculty and range from moderate to hard.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Review of Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology, Hyderabad.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, 80 percent of students get placements with the highest package of 49 LPA. The average package is 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Deloitte, Accenture, Amazon, Apple, and Wipro. We have the best placements. We get placed 100 percent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are perfect and extraordinary for our course. We get Wi-Fi everywhere in college, and we have India's best and biggest library. There are classrooms and projectors in every class. In hostels, we have the best food and bathrooms. Living rooms are also neat and clean. It has sports. We have the best canteen in college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers provide us with good knowledge, and they help us during classes and exams to study. The teaching quality is so perfect that it makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are not very difficult. If we learn perfectly, then we get a nice score, CGPA, and SGPA during exams.
detailed_review.Other: Our batch is the best compared to all batches. Currently, we have a lot of unity in all cases. It organises fests.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Enjoyable campus life with solid teaching and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: CBIT's BE AIDS branch offers good placements with about 75 to 80% of students getting jobs. Top packages reach almost 15 LPA and average 6 LPA. Companies like TCS and Infosys hire regularly. Around 60% gets internship in IT, and AIDS overall, the placements are good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has good facilities like Wi-Fi, well-equipped AIDS labs and comfortable classrooms. The library is easily accessible. Hostels are decent and clean. There are no ladies' hostels. The mess food is average, the campus has a nice canteen, basic medical support and decent space for sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is supportive, well-qualified, and explain concepts easily and clearly. The AIDS curriculum is updated, and it helps students become industry-ready. Semester exams are manageable if you keep up with studies, and the pass rate is quite high.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (IOT and Cyber Security Including Blockchain Technology)
reviews.review_title: Faculty is disappointing, but the events are good and the placements are average.

detailed_review.Placements: Very few of the students were placed from my course. It's not the case that the placements of the college are bad, but for our course, we are not getting enough placements, and even if we do get them, they are all of very low packages. Highest package from our course is 20 LPA. But it only came once and has not repeated again.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very old, and the college has always been under construction since I joined this college. Wi-Fi network is not on point. Classrooms are also old. Library is fine to use. Hostel has an average quality of food in the mess. Area is big in the hostel, and the room is also very big, which accommodates 10 members and is very spacious.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not very helpful and cooperative. They are qualified, but they don't try to make students understand their concept. Instead, they would just project a PPT and read it to us. Course curriculum is relevant, but doesn't actually make the students industry-ready. Students have to learn on their own from other sources to get ready for the industry.
detailed_review.Other: My course includes computer Science with IoT, cybersecurity, and Blockchain technology. I have chosen this course due to my interest in cybersecurity. Events in our college are noticeable but not often. Crowd is enormous. Main event is SHRUTHI, which is conducted once a year. There will also be sports competitions for the Shruthi fest.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good placement with worth opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90-95 percent of students got placed last year. The highest package is 54 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA-6 LPA. The recruiting companies are Google, Microsoft, Infosys, 24/7AI, etc. The roles offered in the course are back-end developer, software engineer, root designer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is very modernly developed with lots of trees. The library is very large with Wi-Fi facilities all over the campus. The quality of food available in the canteen is very tasty. There are grounds for cricket, football, badminton, etc. The labs contain every instrument required for the experiments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are the best, qualified, and knowledgeable. They explain with beautiful explanations and ticks. Semester exams are somewhat difficult to pass. Their teaching helps in using machine learning. The course is a sub-branch of Computer Science. Their teaching makes computer learning easy.
detailed_review.Other: This course has the best opportunity for the future. Improve the labs and techniques of machine learning.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good college with great opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90-95 percent of students got placed last year. The highest package is 54 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA-6 LPA. The recruiting companies are Google, Microsoft, Infosys, 24/7AI, etc. The roles offered in the course are back-end developer, software engineer, root designer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is very modernly developed with lots of trees. The library is very large with Wi-Fi facilities all over the campus. The quality of food available in the canteen is very tasty. There are grounds for cricket, football, badminton, etc. The labs contain every instrument required for the experiments.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well qualified, knowledgeable and helpful. The teaching quality is very practical and makes the student industry-ready. The course is a sub-branch of Computer Science. The course teaches about robotics, etc. The exams are difficult.
detailed_review.Other: It is the best course for future development.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The CBIT is known for the placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90 percent of students from Computer Science and allied branches got placed. The average package is 12 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Service Now, Salesforce, DE Shaw, Goldman Sachs, and JP Morgan. 4-5 students from every class get an internship in the third year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is average because it is old. But the equipment in the laboratories is good enough. I would say our college library is one of the best libraries. Coming to hostels, the washrooms are combined floor to floor. The hostel and mess food are quite good in taste.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful in delivering the subject and knowledge to the students. Even our curriculum has some industry-required skills. Toughness of exams is moderate, and very few times it feel hard. Almost every student will pass the examinations.
detailed_review.Other: I am studying in my 3rd year now. As the crowd is less in college, there is less competition, and also, I got an internship at Barclays in my third year itself.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good and well-maintained college with good faculty and infrastructure, it's worth it.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80% to 90% of students will get placed in AIDS. The highest package is 51 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and the average is 5 LPA. Accenture, Capgemini and other top companies recruit. It has one of the strongest placement records in Telangana. Many students get multiple offers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classes, laboratories and the library are well maintained. Even the hostel is well maintained with many facilities like medical, sports and games. And it is one of the best private engineering colleges in Telangana with a large and green environment. Parking and roads are well structured.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good teaching with good faculty. Exams will be conducted strictly. 35% is the pass percentage. Most teachers are supportive and available to clarify doubts. Teaching is mostly theory-based. But some teachers focus on practical teaching. Many projects will be given to students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: General review for CBIT College.

detailed_review.Placements: Maybe around 70–80 percent of students in CSE get placed in some company on campus itself. But what really matters is how skilled an individual is, so focus more on the skills and opportunities the college provides rather than the median package. The highest package is around 59 LPA, and the average is around 11 LPA for CSE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is not so good and not so bad, something similar to normal junior colleges with fewer restrictions. Food quality is okay and quite manageable. There is also a bus facility for hostelers during lunch to go and come back to the college. There is a good amount of security in the hostel, and there is no encouragement of ragging as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is okay, and the curriculum is similar to any other top colleges in EAMCET, which does not make us fully industry-ready, but we can still gain some core skills and knowledge. There will be two mids conducted per semester and a Sem End Examination. Marks are divided into internal and external for both labs and theory. Maintaining a decent CGPA is enough.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: I think choosing this college has been the best part of my life.

detailed_review.Placements: At this college, only 80 percent of students received placement assistance. The highest package available is 19.5 LPA while the average package is from 10 LPA to 12.5 LPA. The college has partnered with numerous companies that offer internships and provide competitive salaries including Wipro, SBI Axis Bank, IBM, Morgan Stanley, and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has everything you need like canteen, classrooms, bathrooms, labs, library, and more. They provide Wi-Fi in the labs and have spacious digital classrooms. There are indoor badminton facilities along with football fields, cricket grounds, volleyball courts and basketball courts. Let's not forget the food in the canteen is healthy.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are skilled and have a lot of experience. The teaching style is straightforward and made sense. The course content is relevant to the industry and kept up to date. You could get all your questions answered about the course. The curriculum is designed around current real-world scenarios.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Beautiful campus and decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In my CSE course, about 90 percent of the students are placed in various companies. The highest package is 59.9 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. The Average package is 11 LPA. Top recruiters are Salesforce, Oracle, Microsoft, Google, JP Morgan, and Goldman Sachs. The top roles offered are software engineer or data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is pretty decent with clean washrooms. Lab facilities are good but can be a little better. The library is worth studying and upskilling. Some classrooms lack the required number of fans. Hostel facilities are not bad. Mess food is better than any other hostel. Mess food is better than any other hostel's. Sports facilities are better.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They are well-qualified professionals. They are very knowledgeable. Teaching quality is pretty decent. The course curriculum is relevant to modern-day technology. It definitely makes the students industry-ready. Semester exams are not too hard. The pass percentage is around 75 percent.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I have chosen this course due to the current demands in the job market.

detailed_review.Placements: At my CSE course, more than 90 percent of students get placed in various companies. The highest package is 59.9 LPA. The lowest package is 4 LPA, with an average package of 11 LPA. The top recruiters include Salesforce, Oracle, Microsoft, Google, JP Morgan, and Goldman Sachs. detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and well-qualified professionals. They are very knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is pretty decent. The course is relevant to modern technology. reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a regular EAMCET college.

detailed_review.Placements: CBIT has placement opportunities from various companies like TCS, Lumens, Accenture, IBM, Morgan Stanley, Hexaware, HCL, etc. The packing range starts from 3.5 LPA and goes up to 9 LPA. The highest package is about 9 LPA to a student at Morgan Stanley. But still don't expect much here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is good. CBIT has well-equipped labs for each department along with Wi-Fi. CBIT also has a library with the latest and updated books as well as magazines. At present, the hostel is only available for girls, and it has 24/7 Wi-Fi support.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty at CBIT are knowledgeable persons with at least 5 years of experience in teaching. The faculty is friendly, and the quality of teaching is good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes the student ready for the industry. CBIT has a good pass percentage.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (IOT and Cyber Security Including Blockchain Technology)
reviews.review_title: It's a great college to enjoy your B.Tech and study.

detailed_review.Placements: Quite decent placements we have. But now many companies are not coming to our college. The highest package on paper is 60 LPA, and the lowest is around 2 LPA. The median is 5 LPA. Asian Paints, Qualcomm, Amazon, and Flipkart are the top recruiters for our college. I don't have much of an idea about the roles. We have many clubs, and being a part of those clubs can be advantageous.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has been under construction since my first year. We do have good facilities and infrastructure in our college, like everywhere you go, we have separate Wi-Fi for each floor in each block, spacious classrooms with digital projectors for interaction with students, and a big library. We also have active club activities and interactive sessions with professionals and experts. They are building new washrooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: We do have experienced faculty who have a minimum of 10 years of experience in teaching, and they do interact with students in class, except for a few who only teach the subject in the curriculum. When it comes to our curriculum and exams, not much is tough. The papers are prepared by our separate branch faculty, and they range from moderate to hard. Not a great curriculum.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: CBIT, is it worth the talk?

detailed_review.Placements: The companies do come, but the competition is hard. You have to try so much for the placements. If you are an average student, then you will end up with normal jobs. But if you outperform, then you might land in higher roles, with packages above 15 LPA. You should focus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure, but it seems to be old. It is a very old college, probably from around 1970. So it is old, but the infrastructure is sufficient, not so elegant, but sufficient enough. They keep on constructing something, developing floors. The college infrastructure is getting better.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is good enough, actually, they try to improve every 2 years, but end up doing less. They do take input from the industry, but the order in which they place the subject across the semester is not good. They try asking for feedback and improving, but in the end, we have to accept that it is an EAPCET college, and it has to take permission from OU for everything.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (IOT and Cyber Security Including Blockchain Technology)
reviews.review_title: Personnel review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Not very convincing, but I could say there are placements here. The last time I saw the placements, the average offer is 8 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA, and the highest goes up to 60 LPA. The top companies in the college seen are Infosys, Asian Paints, Qualcomm, Amazon, and Barclays.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure has been under construction since my 1st year, and the construction is still going on, which is the most irritating thing in the college. The facilities in the college are not above average, but I can say that they will be sufficient for the students' needs. Wi-Fi is not available in the college, like most places, the college doesn't have Wi-Fi. Some of them that do work on the internet have a very low speed. The classrooms are very old, but they are sufficient for the students in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: I say the teachers are very good, you understand the topics better than professors. Regarding the teaching quality, I rate it 4.3 out of 5. The course curriculum is relevant. I'm not sure the college makes the students industry-ready after the 4 years of graduation, but I say there is no preparation for what's coming. The difficulty of the exams depends on the exam. The difficulty of the exams is 3.5, but the same exams are tough.

faqs.question: How can I get admission at CBIT?
faqs.answer: CBIT Hyderabad admissions are undergoing, and interested candidates can follow the below provided steps to begin their applications:

faqs.question: Is CBIT admission merit-based or entrance-based?
faqs.answer: Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology is a private institute that offers various Engineering and Management courses to students. The CBIT admissions are based on the prescribed entrance exams. Interested candidates must clear their previous qualifying examination and appear for the entrance tests. The accepted examinations include TSICET, TGEAPCET, GATE, among others.

faqs.question: TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in how many rounds?
faqs.answer: The TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in three phases, namely Phase 1, Phase 2, and the Final Phase, for admission into BE/BTech/BPharma courses by the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) and will be managed by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH). Further, TS EAMCET (now TS EAPCET) Spot Round will also be conducted for Private Unaided Engineering Colleges.

faqs.question: What is TS EAMCET 2025 Counselling schedule?
faqs.answer: TS EAMCET Counselling process is ongoing. TS EAMCET Seat Allotment results for Phase 1 Counselling are out. To download the allotment order, candidates must login at the official webiste of TS EAMCET at tseamcet.nic.in. To be conducted in three phases TS EAMCET 2025 Phase 2 Counselling process began in July , whereas the Final Phase counselling process will begin August . Based on the candidate's achieved ranks, TS EAMCET seats are allocated.

faqs.question: What is the fees for MBA at Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology Hyderabad?
faqs.answer: The two-year MBA course at Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology (CBIT) Hyderabad costs approximately Rs. 1,80,000 (Rupees One Lacs Eighty Thousand). Also, fees might vary for students admitted under different categories, such as government, management, or NRI quotas. International or NRI (Non-Resident Indian) students fees may vary and are typically higher than those of Indian students. It may not include additional expenses such as hostel fees, course materials, or possible fee revisions by the institute. Eligibility Criteria: Graduation - 50%, and Exams - TSICET.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for M.Tech at Chaitanya Bharathi Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: PGECET which is the exam based on merit you will get admission to this college and through GATE exam you admission based on merit basis . Also admission process run through donation quata also in which you not get any governmental schoolership program.

college_info.college_name: CVR College of Engineering: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: CVR College of Engineering, is located in Ranga Reddy, Telangana. Established in 2001, it is a private institute approved by AICTE. CVR College of Engineering provides 21 UG and PG courses in 9 specialisations, namely Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering and Electronics & Communication Engineering. Theses programmes are offered in Full Time mode. B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech are some of the courses offered at CVR College of Engineering. Some of the stream in which these courses are offered include Engineering. The total fee at CVR College of Engineering ranges between INR 1,45,000 to 6,00,000. CVR College of Engineering has a student intake of 2202 for all the courses. The average median package at CVR College of Engineering is INR 4,37,368. CVR College of Engineering offers all the infrastructural facilities to students.

CVR College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good if you are a sincere student.

detailed_review.Placements: At CVR College of Engineering, around 78-80% of eligible students get placed each year, with recent packages ranging from the highest of 33 LPA (and even a reported 72 LPA in 2024-25) to an average of 7-8 LPA, while the lowest packages generally fall in the 3-4 LPA range. Top recruiters include Commvault, Oracle, Cadence, GAP, Amazon, Infosys, TCS Digital, Capgemini, and several product-based companies, and many students also secure paid internships with firms like Commvault, Oracle, and Cadence, offering a stipend of 40,000-50,000 per month. The most common roles offered are Software Developer, SDE, and Data/Business Analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: CVR College of Engineering offers strong infrastructure with well-equipped classrooms, 100+ modern laboratories, and campus-wide Wi-Fi, along with a large, dedicated three-storey library that provides extensive physical and digital resources, including IEEE and other premium journals. The campus also includes a four-storey student centre with a gym, canteen, indoor games, placement office, and a medical centre, while sports facilities include cricket, basketball, volleyball, and indoor games; hostel facilities are decent with Wi-Fi, regular cleaning, renovated bathrooms, and a mess that students generally rate as good with a weekly variety.
detailed_review.Faculty: At CVR College of Engineering, most faculty members are well-qualified and experienced, with many holding postgraduate degrees or PhDs, and students generally find the teachers helpful, approachable, and good at explaining concepts, leading to strong teaching quality overall. The curriculum is regularly updated under JNTU-H guidelines and includes labs, projects, coding practices, and industry-oriented subjects that help students become job-ready, especially in CSE and ECE. Semester exams are moderately difficult, with internal assessment and lab exams helping students prepare, and while JNTUH university exams can sometimes be challenging and evaluation may feel strict, the college maintains a strong academic environment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college for placements, poor at events, and good at academics.

detailed_review.Placements: Basically, everyone will get the opportunity for good placements. 85% are placed. The highest package is about 75 LPA, and the average package is in the 10-20 LPA range, the lowest package is 3 LPA. The top company hiring is Microsoft. An internship is fully based on the skills of students, it depends on them. A full-stack developer role is offered in top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are very good compared to all EAMCET colleges. Wi-Fi connections also work very well. Infrastructure is okay. The hostel infrastructure and food are very good, the infrastructure is very well manufactured. Canteen food is also good, similar to home food. There will be a sports period once a week, and we have a cricket ground almost equal to a stadium.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very well acknowledged, certified, and qualified. The faculty is too friendly if you are good at studies. Bunking of classes is not possible, it is very strict, and it helps very much to get into placements. The semester is excellent, not difficult, not easy, and the pass percentage is about 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE core because placements are good in CSE. Also it has technical theory, and proper timetable. I like being regular for classes. Events, fests are very poor, and also very rare.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science & Business System
reviews.review_title: The college is nature-friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: My course is introduced in the year 2023 in my college, so my seniors are the first batch in the college and will pass out in the year 2027. I do not have much idea about placements in this course. The recruiting company we can guess is TCS because Ratan Tata introduced our branch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good and comfortable. There are no Wi-Fi issues in the college, labs, and classrooms. The library is very spacious, and the quality of food in the hostel as well as the canteen is very good. Medical facilities are also good, but sports and games are limited.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in the college are really very knowledgeable and well qualified. The curriculum is also good. It makes students ready for the industry, and genuinely, teachers are very helpful to students in any aspect, not only in studies. The pass percentage of students is about 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to start my own business.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: There is dissatisfaction because of the poor quality of the food.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 percent of people are placed in the CSE department course. The highest package is 80 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, and the average package is 10 LPA. TCS, Deloitte, and Amazon. 30 percent of students got an internship at Amazon and TCS. They offered roles in programming and coding.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a canteen, hostel, medical room, sports, class, and Wi-Fi for the CSE department. There is a hostel facility, but there is no quantity of food available in the mess, and no access to remaining facilities like a medical room, sports, a Class, a library, and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful in understanding the concept, and they are qualified and knowledgeable professors, and the teaching quality is very good. The course curriculum is relevant and makes the students industry-ready. There is more difficulty in semester exams in college. The passing percentage is 60 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A quality education means CVR College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Seriously, this college is so good compared to many other colleges. My batch mates are really doing well enough. Generally, for the year, our college secured the highest 72 LPA, and the average package is 6 to 8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Sorry to say that I'm not a hosteler, but I can say about the infrastructure, which is quite good, like park, placements, sports, library, labs, equipment, classrooms, events, education, really it's loved by my heart. I think everyone loves it after joining.
detailed_review.Faculty: Generally, faculty are wonderful. I think many of you really like them. Faculty are good at interacting with students, teachers are well professional, and it's really blooming. Semester exams are not tough, but not easy, depending upon your preparation, so that many of them can really understand. If you just see, all the curriculum is best according to me.
detailed_review.Other: So generally I choose this course because I love to be in the technology field, my batch is really good. The best thing about this CSE course is learning from a good perspective. I think the faculty can be improved, and career guidance should be improved. Although it is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science & Business System
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with my course.

detailed_review.Placements: Our course started recently in 2023. Our seniors are the first batch. Now, placements have not yet started. Our college management is making us learn ERP software and Oracle DBMS subjects to get those roles as we are CSBS students. Very few internships, our seniors have started startups and are working on them.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good and peaceful. I noticed some lab assistants are teaching classes. Our hostel quality is best, the food rating is 4, and the canteen is best with all items always available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are big supports in the college and knowledgeable persons. They will help you to get out of problems. Our course curriculum is relevant, 70 percent reaches industry standards because they teach us management subjects. The semester exams are moderate for our branch.
detailed_review.Other: We are going to pass in the year 2028. Presently, we don't know much about the course. Mostly, so many people joined this branch according to allotment through EAPCET. Only a few people chose this branch with passion. The subjects we have are very good and helpful. But the thing is we are not 100 percent sure the industry standards we are going to meet. I wish that our management increases the level of subjects and provides the best management lectures, allowing CSBS students to visit industries and companies, so that practical knowledge we will get.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science & Business System
reviews.review_title: There are Strong placements and supportive faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: I don't know how many students were placed because my seniors are the 1st batch in Computer Science and Business Systems. And the highest may be 12 LPA, and the lowest 3 LPA. Top recruiting company is TCS, 95% of student's got internship, and entrepreneurs roles are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a good facility, with Wi-Fi labs, classrooms, and a library. There is no issue with all these facilities, and the college hostel facility is also good. They maintain healthy food in the hostel and canteen as well, and medical, sports, and games are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very genuine, strict, and knowledgeable, except for a few of them. We are not sure if this make a student industry ready because many companies doesn't need the student's from this course and exams are good not very difficult not very easy but good and pass percentage is about 80%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I'm interested in businesses as well as computer Science, and I sis this course needs to improve its syllabus, and there are no events in my college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good faculty, and the placement in 2024 is excellent, with a really good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: There are good placements in our college. The average would be around 6 LPA. Recently, Amazon selected some students and gave them placements in the college, with a salary of about 12 LPA. Well, compared to other colleges, our college is pretty good at placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in our college is above average, and the facilities are excellent, which are provided by the college. The library of our college is very good, and there are plenty of books to study and gain knowledge. The labs are pretty good in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my opinion, the college life is above average, and the faculty here is the best. Here, you will find that every faculty member is very well qualified and trained compared to other colleges. Due to the great faculty and placements, our college is one of the top 5 engineering colleges in Telangana.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: We have good facilities in our college, and the faculty and infrastructure are good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70 percent of students got placed in our course. The highest package is around 40 LPA. The lowest is 3 LPA, and the average is about 4 to 5 LPA. Microsoft, Amazon, Google, and One Text are the top recruiting companies for our course. Almost all of the students got internships in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms with projectors, a huge library, nice hostel rooms with healthy and hygienic food, a canteen, a health center, etc. Faculty will be good. They will support us. We also have various clubs in our college, both cultural and related to academics.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, highly qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready if they really focus on the subject. Semester exams are not that tough; if we have knowledge of the subject, we can easily score good marks. The pass percentage is more than 90 to 95 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Quality learning  at CVR.

detailed_review.Placements:
This college is so good compared to many other colleges. My batch mates are really doing well enough generally for the year. Our college secured the highest package of 72LPA and the average package is 6 to 8 LPA. Many internships also happened.
 .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am not staying at college hostel but I can say about the infrastructure which is quite good like park placements sports library labs equipment, classrooms events and education. Its really loved by my heart which is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are wonderful I think many of you really like that the faculty are good at interacting with students. Teachers are well professional its really blooming. Semester exams are not tough but not easy depending upon your preparation. Generally I am preparing for UPSC.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as I love to be in technology field. My batch is really good. The best thing about this CSE course is learning from a good perspective. I think faculty can improve career guidance. It is good to be in this college part.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science & Business System
reviews.review_title: Really good college when it comes to studies. But don't expect any fests or events from the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Computer Science and Business Systems is a new course in our college. A single batch hasn't passed out from this branch yet. The first batch will be passing out in the year 2027, our seniors. So, placement details can't be known until they are in their second semester.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs and classrooms are well-equipped. Library access is good for everyone, but the only thing is that books aren't allowed to be taken after college timings. If we want a book, we have to take it during college timings itself. College hostel rooms are quite spacious, all good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are more experienced and clear doubts anytime. But this course is completely different from all the other courses in the college. We have an entirely different syllabus, related to business, but we also have coding subjects as it is a branch of CS.
detailed_review.Other: No events or fests are conducted in this college. That is the only thing we all wish for in this college. There are many clubs, but they are only active during the induction and orientation programme.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: CVR College review, explained my college in detail via many aspects.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70%-75% of students got placements, so 4/5, like the placements are good, and the previous year's performance by the college is good. The placement cell brings good opportunities, but only some get to place due to some restrictions, and there are some politics.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is clean, so 5/5. The hostels are shared by 4 to 5 individuals, and mostly are clean. They also provide the facility of ACs for individuals, as you know, you have the money, and the infrastructure is quite good with many blocks, so I think the maintenance is quite good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty depends on individuals, mostly good, so 4/5, the faculty are quite experienced, and I think many teach quite well, but there are some faculty who can't explain well, and the students can't understand well, it's not about their college, it's about their explanation skills, which are not up to mark.
detailed_review.Other: Both are average, campus life is not that great if you are an extrovert they you may be a good fit here, and the campus charges a lot of money for a year, and also for the college bus charges like Rs. 50,000 per year it makes a lot going up to 2 lakhs per year and if you stay in hostel it's even more.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: The placements from our course are fantastic.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2020, from our course, my seniors almost got placed in the campus placements, about 76%. The levels of the packages were great, the highest package was around 5 LPA, the average package was 3.5 LPA, and the lowest package was 3 LPA. Accenture, TCS, Wipro, and Infotech Pvt Ltd were the top recruiting companies from our course. The students who have done their internship in various companies were about 66%. The higher roles serve development and code development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and the facilities provided by the college management were excellent and worth the feels. The facilities like separate blocks for different branches and free Wi-Fi around the entire campus, well-ventilated classrooms, seminar halls, and library were there. The medical services were available throughout the day, and sports and games were unlimited in the college. The quality of the food in the hostel and the quality of the hostel were too exceptional.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty from our course was doing an excellent job throughout the academics with a proper way of teaching and making every student clear with the concepts. The quality of the teaching had been great. They were well knowledgeable and highly effective in their course. The course curriculum of our course was liked by everyone because it made many students industry-ready. The semester exams were not as difficult as we thought, but we need to understand the concepts clearly. The pass percentage was around 65%.
detailed_review.Other: The course I chose keeps me motivated every single day for my future development. The improvements, like the well-updated computers, need to be replaced in the laboratory. The occasions in the college, like tours, fests, farewells, freshers, crowd meetings, etc., were great in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I genuinely appreciate the opportunity given by the college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements from our course are excellent in 2020, with almost 70% of the students got placed in companies. The top recruiting companies like TCS, Accenture, Wipro, Infotech Pvt Ltd, etc. Internship students are about 80% from our course in companies like IT Solutions Pvt Ltd, etc. The top roles offered from our course include web development and code development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities include great Wi-Fi around the entire campus libraries, ventilated classrooms, AC labs, seminar halls, bus transportation, project labs, etc., which are provided by the college management. The quality of the hostel facilities is excellent with a neat and hygienic environment in the rooms, the food in the both canteen and mess is very tasty. The medical facilities are available in the college with qualified doctors, and sports and games are specially played on weekends.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful for the students, they're the best guides for the students. The teaching quality of the faculty has been excellent throughout the academic year. The course curriculum is relevant, as it prepares many students to be industry-ready every year. Mostly, the semester exams are based on concepts, so we need to understand the concepts clearly to pass. The pass percentage is around 75% for our course.
detailed_review.Other: The course I chose is the best case, it will never fade away in the future. Things like good equipment in the college are great. The cultural activities like games, festivals, events, fests, farewells, freshers, crowd meetings, tours, etc., are excellent in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: I am completely satisfied with placements of our course.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 75% of students got placed in the campus placements. The highest salary offered is 5.5 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA. The average package is 4 LPA. TCS, Wipro, Accenture, Colruyt, Infosys Pvt. Ltd., and Deloitte are the top recruiting companies, especially for our course. Nearly 80% of students completed internships in different companies. Web development and server development are the top roles offered in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities available in our college are computer labs, seminar halls, a library, free Wi-Fi around the entire campus, an auditorium, project labs, etc. In the hostel, there are many facilities like neat and hygienic rooms, a variety of food with reasonable prices, water facilities, and 24x7 electricity facilities. The canteen food is amazing. There are professional doctors on the campus for students. Activities like games and sports are played regularly after college hours.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are really helpful for students in teaching the concepts clearly. They are highly recommended for students because they are highly qualified and well-experienced in their course. The course curriculum is really giving amazing results in making many students ready for the industry. Semester exams are mostly good enough to pass, so the pass percentage is 80%.
detailed_review.Other: This course excited me very much, because it is an evergreen course, so I chose this course. Things like providing the best equipment in the laboratory will be great. Many refreshment zone activities like games, festivals, events, fests, farewells, freshers, crowd meetings, tours, concerts, etc., are conducted as per the academic calendar. It also has NCC.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, supportive faculty, and consistent placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: 100% of students got placed from our course. I am from the 2023-2027 B.Tech batch in electrical and electronics engineering (EEE). Our batch has around 27 students, which allows for better individual attention from faculty and improved interaction during labs and lectures.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college campus is clean and well-maintained with smart classrooms, Wi-Fi, digital library, and updated labs. For EEE and other departments, lab equipment is in good condition and regularly updated. The canteen provides hygienic food, and there are indoor/outdoor sports, medical room, and hostel facilities with 24/7 security and basic needs. Wi-Fi is available in hostels too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. Most of them are experienced and supportive during projects, doubts, and assignments. The curriculum is well-structured and updated to suit current industry trends. Exams are moderate in difficulty, and students who attend classes regularly perform well. Pass percentage is quite high. The faculty is supportive and encourages participation in workshops, technical paper presentations, and internships. Our batch is actively involved in projects, technical clubs, and college events like Nexus. The overall environment is friendly, academically focused, and helps us build both technical and soft skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a school and not a college.

detailed_review.Placements: The overall placements in my college are pretty good. Nearly 40% of students get placed every year from each course. The highest package offered in my course is 30 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Infosys, TCS, Amazon, Genpact, etc. Internships are not offered by the college, but we have to try for offers on our own. The top roles offered in my course are VLSI design engineer and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure has been developed a lot in the past few years with new buildings, classrooms, and canteens. Wi-Fi connection is poor in non-technical departments. There are signals only near labs. The quality of food in the mess is poor, but the canteen provides hygienic and delicious food. There are even separate blocks for sports and games. Even a nurse is available for students in the college for medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers and professors on our campus are well-educated. They teach very well. The only problem with them is that they are not friendly with students. The course curriculum is not relevant to campus drives and placement exams. The syllabus only stick to academics, but does not give knowledge about skills and how to do it practically. Semester exams are not so difficult. An average student who attends all the classes can easily pass exams. The pass percentage is 85%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the Electronic and Communication Engineering course since I am interested in electronics, signals, and communication skills. My college helped me explore more about this course through its real-world projects and labs. Events and fests happen once a year, which is sad, but there are extracurricular activities like cricket tournaments and dance contests, which are held often. The campus surroundings are peaceful. There is a good environment for students to study. Once we enter the college, we cannot go out. Strict rules are followed here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Review of CVR College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80 to 120 students from my course are placed. The highest package is 32 LPA, the average is around 6 LPA, and the lowest is approximately 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Infosys, FactSet, ServiceNow, OpenText, and JPMorgan. Common roles offered are SDE and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is not as good as we expected. Some labs contain old computers which are not working properly. The water facility is also not good. The hostel is somewhat better than the college but there is no proper Wi-Fi facility in the hostel. The canteen is very good. The mess is also very good but a routine timetable is following.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is too old which means they are not using and making proper curriculum. Only some of the teachers are well knowledgeable. The quality of teachers is not as good as our expectations. The curriculum does not make the students industry-ready. The difficulty level of the semester is medium to hard. The pass percentage is above 80%.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in this course so I took it. There are a lot of things to improve in my course one is to explain the concept based on real-world scenarios. There are not a lot of fests and events conducted on campus. The campus life is boring.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Infrastructure is good. Education is also good but not much extracurricular activities are there.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package package is 40 LPA. The lowest package ranges from 3-4 LPA. The top recruiting companies for our course are Google, Wipro, etc. In each section, above 40% of students get internships in companies like Google, etc. More than 40% of students chose the computer science. In my course, 20% of students get placed in college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has a good Wi-Fi. Good labs are provided by the management. The college infrastructure is good. The college is located in the outside city, which is very good. It has a good environment. The library is okay and not bad. Good lab facilities and teaching staff members in the lab are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They teach in an understandable way to students. They ask about their subject to students if students have doubts. Semester and mid-exams are hard. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students aware of some computer and machine-readable languages like C, C+, Java, Python, data structure, etc. They train students very well.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is trending and it helps me to survive in the future compared to all other courses. It is a future relevant course. Few fests are performed in the college. About 2-3 fests are only done in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is totally not worthy because of its schedule, curriculum, and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: College has good placements. Last year also, more than 900 students got jobs. The faculty are always trying their level best to train the students for interviews. They created different batches and gave training to them according to their knowledge. Many good companies are coming.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a good infrastructure for the college. The hostel facility is really good. There are separate labs and classrooms for each department. In fact, there is a separate building for each department. The food quality is also really good, in the evening, they give us different types of snacks.
detailed_review.Faculty: The semester schedule is really tight. The syllabus is also taken from different books. This makes it hard to study for the semesters, and the question paper also gives really hard questions. The course curriculum is not relevant and does not make the students industry-ready. The faculty have good knowledge and are friendly.

faqs.question: TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in how many rounds?
faqs.answer: The TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in three phases, namely Phase 1, Phase 2, and the Final Phase, for admission into BE/BTech/BPharma courses by the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) and will be managed by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH). Further, TS EAMCET (now TS EAPCET) Spot Round will also be conducted for Private Unaided Engineering Colleges.

faqs.question: What is TS EAMCET 2025 Counselling schedule?
faqs.answer: TS EAMCET Counselling process is ongoing. TS EAMCET Seat Allotment results for Phase 1 Counselling are out. To download the allotment order, candidates must login at the official webiste of TS EAMCET at tseamcet.nic.in. To be conducted in three phases TS EAMCET 2025 Phase 2 Counselling process began in July , whereas the Final Phase counselling process will begin August . Based on the candidate's achieved ranks, TS EAMCET seats are allocated.

faqs.question: How can I get into CVR College of Engineering for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer:
CVR College of Engineering has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility M.E./M.Tech Candidate must have completed B.E./B.Tech. /AMIE in CSE/ CSIT/ Electronics & Computers Engg. /IT & Computer Science and Systems Engineering or equivalent from a UGC recognised University/ Institute.
Preference will be given to GATE qualified candidates over TS PGECET qualified candidates.
Candidate must have secured 50% marks in group subjects taken together in the qualifying examination (45% for reserved category). B.E. / B.Tech Candidates who have passed or appeared at the final year of the Diploma examination in Engineering conducted by the State Board of Technical Education and Training, Telangana / Andhra Pradesh or any other examination recognised as equivalent thereto by the State Board of Technical Education and Training, Telangana / Andhra Pradesh.
Candidates should have completed 16 years of age, as on 31st December of the year of admission. There is no upper age limit. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

college_info.college_name: DEI Agra: Courses, Fees, Admissions 2025, Placements, Cutoff, Ranking

highlights.summary:
DEI Agra is a public institute in Agra. The institute is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education and accredited by NAAC with a grade A+. DEI Agra was ranked at 101-150 by NIRF 2024 under the top University category. The institute was ranked in the rank band of 151-200 under the Engineering category by NIRF 2024 ranking. Dayalbagh Institute has various national and international collaborations and MoUs to facilitate placements and curriculum enhancement plans.
DEI Agra courses are offered at UG, PG, and Doctoral levels in the fields of Engineering, Technology, Science, Commerce, Social Sciences, Education, and Arts. Admissions to all the courses will be done on the basis of written tests, personal interviews, and analysis of previous academic performance. A few of the important highlights regarding Dayalbagh Educational Institute (DEI) are mentioned in the table below:
- 101-150 for University by NIRF 2024
- 151-200 for Engineering by NIRF 2024
Check out more on Dayalbagh Educational Institute [DEI] Highlights in the below videos:

table.details:
- 101-150 for University by NIRF 2024

- 151-200 for Engineering by NIRF 2024

college_info_program.intro:
Dayalbagh Educational Institute Agra, offers various courses to students at the UG and PG levels. The Institute also offers various Certificate and Diploma programmes to students across several specialisations. DEI Agra flagship courses include BTech and BSc programmes, which are offered to students for a duration of 4 years and 3 years, respectively.
DEI Agra admission is offered to candidates on the basis of merit and entrance, therefore, candidates must secure a minimum aggregate of 60% in Class 12. In addition to this, candidates must secure valid scores in previously attempted examinations. Dayal Bagh Agra courses are offered with a tuition fee ranging from INR 5.3K to INR 34.8 K.
