DEI Agra Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Completely satisfied with placements, good faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost all students get placed with an average package of 6 LPA, and the top recruitment companies are Honda, Tata, JSW Group, etc. The roles offered are GET, and you become an assistant manager in one year, so a decent managerial post is offered by companies, which is a white-collar job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for the course is well-maintained, and the basic necessary infrastructure is provided for the course. The canteen is not very good, having very little food variety, but the books in the library are provided for every semester at a very basic price. In addition, you can issue books from the library using your library card.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-educated, and mostly professors are from IITs. Semester exams are tough, but the pass percentage of students is 95%. The curriculum is completely relevant to GATE and other engineering competitive exams. There are some workshops going on for preparation for these exams.
detailed_review.Other: It is a good college with very few fees, and you receive a 20,000 scholarship per year from the UP government, so basically, your graduation is free.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is the best for middle-class students because it is affordable all over Uttar Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: Something 70% students got placed. Some construction companies hire students for internships at construction companies. In my course, we have a chance to get selected at SSC JE, it's an amazing government opportunity, and we have good selection jobs at companies as engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In Dayalbagh Educational Institute, classrooms are amazing with smart boards, and labs are fully equipped, the library is digital, and all kinds of books are available. Hostels are above average and have good facilities for all students, and are most affordable for all students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of engineering teachers are mostly from IITs therefore, they are too supportive and humble. They help students with every problem. The course is really good for upcoming career opportunities. The college offers open-book exams, it seems easy, but it is really too tough.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because upcoming career opportunities in civil engineering are a better option for me . Campus life is a discipline with rules and regulations.

reviews.course: Diploma in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm pursuing a diploma in electrical engineering, and there is almost 90% placement in our course. There are some top recruiting companies, such as Schlumberger, Tricolite, Cloverleaf Global, ITC, Cummins India, HMSI, etc. The highest package is 6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our campus is decent. Classrooms and labs are clean with full facilities. Wi-fi is available in lab and the library. All the necessary things related to the study are available in library. Hostel facilities are decent with discipline and sports ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our course, teachers are helpful and friendly with students, and all teachers are qualified and have the knowledge related to their course. The curriculum makes the students industry-ready on its own. There is an open book system in our college.
detailed_review.Other: There are some extracurricular activities in our college that lead to creativity, innovation, and sports competitions. I chose this college because of the faculty and placement record.

reviews.course: Diploma in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Mechanical branch is very good. Dayalbagh provides 100 placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 100% of students were placed in mechanical engineering, automobile, electrical, electronics, and civil. The highest package offered was 6 LPA, and the lowest package was 3.50 LPA. Recruiting companies were Schlumberger, Maruti Suzuki, Honda, Eicher, and Volvo. 100% of students got internships in mechanical, automobile, civil, and electrical.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities were very good. Infrastructure was very good, and the maintenance was proper. The quality and facilities were very good. Hostel food was very good like home. Hostel fee was very cheap. Canteen food was also good. Medical facilities were available, and this was a very good college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very supportive and knowledgeable. Teachers were very genius. They were very supportive, and all teachers were M.Tech and Ph.D. All teachers were good. They also provided the best education.
detailed_review.Other: There were 100 placements in top companies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Footwear Technology
reviews.review_title: This college is amazing for middle-class students because it has the lowest fee in all of India.

detailed_review.Placements: Footwear technology from Dayalbagh Educational Institute gave almost 100% placement because in Agra, there are many leather industries and good opportunities to start our own business. Students gave their best for placement and to maintain the college's reputation.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Dayalbagh Educational Institute gives best lab, library, and classroom experience for all students. On college campus, there are four hostels, junior boys' and girls' hostel, and senior boys' and girls' hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: As I know, Faculty of Engineering faculties are such amazing teacher, the best teacher has lots of knowledge. Course curriculum is too relevant to students and prepares them for good industry experience. College exams are difficult because they are conducted as open-book exams therefore, exams are tough. The department of Faculty of Engineering is too kind and moral.
detailed_review.Other: Best things about course are, it's job and business-oriented course. Campus life is average because of discipline.

reviews.course: B.Voc. in AI andRobotics
reviews.review_title: Good experience overall, but faculty support during placements and needs improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students 70% are placed in Delhi (IT sector). The minimum package is 4 LPA to 6 LPA. Deloitte, Accenture, M Filtered, and Normal Dei do not provide internships, it's only provide you guidance on how to get the opportunity of internship in IT sectors. Roles offered are data analyst and software engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure available in our college are wonderful. All course departments have Wi-Fi, and also provide labs for each department for practical purposes. Classrooms are so airy and clean. Library area is peaceful for study, thousands of books are available for study, and staff is so helpful.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The understanding level between students and teachers is so great. The teaching quality of teachers is best, even teachers teaching styles are different. It teaches different technologies. The semester exams in college are so simple if you attend the regular class and complete the assignments. The pass percentage is 5 CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because AI and robotics are best courses for future development. It is little bit tough but it provides more knowledge. For better improvement practicals should be more in the lab. Events, fests, campus crowd, connectivity, campus surroundings, scholarships, and extracurricular activities are best.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Zoology
reviews.review_title: Faculty members are great with placements.

detailed_review.Placements: We are not placed, but as we worked in CSIR and ICMR labs so we learned a lot from the labs in our internships. After internships, we are good at the experiments that we perform during our last dissertation days. We have fewer errors after the internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have Wi-Fi, labs, and library that are accessible up to 24 hours. Food quality is good. The ambiance is nice. The best medical staff must say which is available 24/7. The house mistress is so helpful with our issues. On weekends like Saturday and Sunday, we play games like badminton, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They do make us industry-ready. We have 4 semesters. Pass percentage is 40%. In our semester exams, we have proper gaps between exams as it is deemed a university, so we can manage our semester exam timetable.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have a keen interest in studying animals.

reviews.course: B.Voc. in AI andRobotics
reviews.review_title: Overall, our college is the best, as we do various types of activities in our studies.

detailed_review.Placements: This course offered a minimum package of 12 LPA to 18 LPA, and it also depended on your skills. Companies came to recruit students. The internships were given by college also, or if you want your own, you can join. We had to do internships in Python and AI.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi facility was available all over the campus. Canteens called Jugaadu Canteen, had a day-wise routine. Our college also organized extracurricular activities. The infrastructure was awesome, and there were two more canteens for boys and the other for girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were highly qualified and knowledgeable. They taught very well. This course helped us learn about AI and Roots. It was a CS course. Since the B.Tech CS program was not available at DEI, this course was for CS. The passing criteria were very easy if you attended college regularly. There was 75% internal assessment, which consisted of assignments, PPTs, daily home assignments, tests, and CTs, and 25% consisted of the end-semester grade. So, overall, it was an easy criterion for passing. Faculty members were unique in their way.
detailed_review.Other: This course was good, as it was knowledgeable and interesting. There were many competitions, like SIH and many more, and extracurricular activities were held. Scholarships were also given to the students. There was only one fest program held, which was an Open Day, often called Founder’s Day.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons) in Mathematics
reviews.review_title: DEI is a beautiful phase of life.

detailed_review.Placements: I have not been offered any package yet but I got information from our seniors that placements will occur within DEI. The average package offered is more than 2.5 LPA. Placements within the college are 100%. No student will be left without any placement, and placements are genuine within our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College provides us with many facilities like free Wi-Fi for all students within faculty members. Labs are designed for students with computer science and for others too. A dedicated library is there for students who want some pace to study. Hostels are available with a minimum fee with all facilities like medical, food, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified and are top of the country. The content they provide is quite good. The course curriculum will be given before the beginning of a new semester. The course curriculum is well-designed for seeking proper distribution of syllabus throughout the semester. Exams occur three times in a semester ( 2 CT exams and one end-semester exam). Apart from this, class assignments of 5 marks will occur regularly every week for regularly checking the track of students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am very much interested in this course. The best thing about the course is that there are a total of 30 students within the computer science branch so we can get more time and attention from our teachers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Footwear Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of Faculty of Engineering, Dayalbagh Educational Institute.

detailed_review.Placements: Students were placed in my course at a rate of over 70%. The highest package offered in my program is approximately Rs. 9,00,000, while the lowest is Rs. 2,00,000. Top companies recruiting from my branch include Baba, Adidas, and Puma, among others. Students secured internships based on their knowledge and CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are all quite good, and there is nothing we can complain about. The infrastructure available for our course includes a comprehensive library with all kinds of books, well-maintained classrooms, and labs. The quality of the hostel is also good considering the charges, and the food provided in the mess and canteen is satisfactory.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and all are qualified from reputable colleges, and their teaching methods are impressive. This course curriculum effectively prepares students for the industry. However, the semester exams can be quite challenging, as they are open books.

reviews.course: B.Voc. in Automobile
reviews.review_title: This college is outstanding with a great ROI.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is good and at least 95% of students get placements in the reputed companies. This college also provides internships to their students and has a lot of opportunities to work in various organizations. Institute mainly focused on practical and has a lot of things to learn.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is well-mannered and has a learning environment; the food is good, the staff is also excellent, the washrooms are clean, and the strict chief warden is good in behaviour and always sorts out the student's problems. Hostel has a separate playground for hostellers.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very excellent and has great knowledge towards their course and is very supportive but strict too. The pass percentage is not so bad in this college because their criteria for passing students is very simple. I will only say the college is very good.

reviews.course: B.Voc. in AI andRobotics
reviews.review_title: A good college for those who don’t have much money to spend on studies.

detailed_review.Placements: I have done B.Voc in AI and Robotics from the year 2020 to 2023. Overall, the course is awesome, and the subjects are pretty good and researched before being added to the modules. Companies like mfilterIt had come for placements. Roles like robotics engineer, and python developer are provided.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure. Wi-Fi is provided. Labs are good. Classrooms are average. The only problem with the classrooms is timing and location, as these two things are not permanent or fixed. Timing and class locations change pretty much all the time. Overall, it is fine.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and cooperative. The exams were always held on time, and students needed to attend regular classes; otherwise, they were not allowed to sit in the examination. The course curriculum is relevant, as the subjects are machine learning, web development, etc.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Really good experience with this fees.

detailed_review.Placements: 60-70% of students are placed. The lowest package offered was 3 LPA, while the highest package offered was 8 LPA. 70% of students got internships. Top roles offered are for sales profiles only, while there were other profiles as well, like Customer Success Specialists, Product Managers, and Management Trainees.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Overall, there are good hostel facilities with food, a library, a mess, and a playground. Good quality food is provided by the college authority. Sports facilities are also good. The college organizes sports functions every year for every faculty member, and winning teams and faculty also get goodies, winning prizes, medals, and much more.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. Scholars are always there to help you and answer your questions. Yes, it helps the students to learn more about corporate work and culture. The difficulty level is average. If you are good in your studies, then there is nothing to worry about. You can easily get good marks.
detailed_review.Other: I pursued MBA to get good job and hike. Placements can be better.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Strong academics and placements, but hostel and infrastructure needs improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80 to 90% of the students got placed with the highest package of 12 LPA, the lowest package of 3.6 LPA, and the average package is 5 to 6 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Cummins, Chrysler, Hero Motors, and Volvo Ericscher. About 70 to 80% of the students got internships at Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, and others, and roles offered are design engineer, sales manager, project engineer, and research and development engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This institute has all the facilities, like Wi-Fi connectivity throughout the campus, and students can also access it. Libraries are designed in such a way that they have all the essential resources, including textbooks, reference material, and other things, and classrooms are also equipped with modern technology, and labs are well maintained with the latest tools for the experimenter and project engineer. Hostel and canteen facilities are also provided with hygiene. Medical facilities are also available, and sports and games activities are also there to refresh the students minds and show them new opportunities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and have experienced and knowledgeable persons. They have great knowledge, and the curriculum is designed according to the practical and industry-relevant. Semester exams are not so difficult; all the study material is given to the students to practice for the exams, and the pass percentage is 80 to 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for its industrially relevant curriculum, supportive faculty, and excellent placement record. It also includes hands-on lab training, strong academic support, and internship opportunities in top companies. Areas for improvement include better hostel food quality and more modern infrastructure. DEI offers scholarships for meritorious students and promotes extracurricular activities like sports and clubs.

reviews.course: B.A. (Social Science)
reviews.review_title: DEI is an amazing university.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 84.36% of students are placed in our college. The highest salary package offered is 10 LPA and the average package offered is 3.60 LPA. Top recruiting companies of DEI are BHEL, Avon India, Jaypee Group, Silverskills Pvt. Ltd., etc. On average, 75%-80% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of DEI is above average. We have our lab classes on Thursdays and Fridays and speed of Wi-Fi is also good. Central library, which is famous at DEI, is open from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Almost all books are available in the library and infrastructure of the classrooms is also good. I am not staying in the hostel. Sports and game facilities are amazing and good quality food is served in the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very polite and helpful, except for some. They are qualified and knowledgeable and some of them are retired from civil services. The teaching quality is average. This course is good for students who are preparing for civil services, but not as much for industry-related careers. The open book format makes semester exam tough and hard, as we have to face tricky questions. If we score 50% on our semester exam, we will pass easily.
detailed_review.Other: Since I chose humanities in 12th grade, I am now pursuing a B.A Hons in Political Science from DEI. I am interested in Political Science, which is why I chose B.A. Hons for my graduation. Best thing about this course is that it provides a foundation for my future preparation for civil services. I wish the government would increase funding for social sciences and make the classes more technically advanced. DEI organizes its biggest fest on December 31 and the campus is spacious. DEI also allocates many scholarships to students and we are engaged in many other activities.

reviews.course: Diploma in Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average college life of Diploma students

detailed_review.Placements: Animal thirty out of forty students got placed with an average of two lacs forty thousand rupees per annum. The biggest MNC company that came was SLB, which offers 4 LPA. No one got placed there. Internship is not given by the college; students would have to find internships themselves because it's mandatory for our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are fine, and benches are also even. DEI has a big computer lab, but only a few of them are working, and some of them do not have the required software to work, like Python, MATLAB, C, etc. I did not stay in the hostel, but my friend did for a few months; he shifted later near the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and excellent at teaching; their teaching quality is good. The exam pattern is always the same every year, so exams were easy. The curriculum did not make us ready for the industry. We studied only one programming language in our whole course. They still teach us microprocessors 8051 and 8085, which have been outdated for a long time. The passing score is 66 out of 200, and the internal exam is 150 marks; 50 marks are external.
detailed_review.Other: Diploma is good if you are doing it after high school. If you are doing it after 12th, then you should prepare for JEE. The DHA system makes it easy for everyone to pass the semester without failing.

reviews.course: B.B.A (Hons.) Logistics
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college and it is value for money.

detailed_review.Placements:
1. 30% of students get placed, as it is a bachelor's degree. 
2. 2500000 is the highest package.
3. Not that many companies visited; only a few are there, like TCI and one related to manufacturing. 
4. Only 40% of students got internships in TCI in warehouse management. 
5. The top roles offered are inventory management and operations.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is nice, and the library is good. You will get everything there. The hostel is not recommended as rooms are very small, washrooms are very small, and phones are not allowed. You did not even get a chance to call your parents. Hostel timing is also not good.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Yes, teachers are helpful and qualified. Teaching quality is nice. They explain things in a practical way and also ask questions in class.
Curriculum is also perfect. You will cover all things and get a chance to learn more.
Exams are difficult but not out of topic.
detailed_review.Other:
This course is nice because of practical knowledge, and lots of projects have to be done.
Improvement is needed in the curriculum. 
I got a chance to participate in events and fests, which are great.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com) (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: Quality education is provided within a budget.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students don't opt to get placed in college and go for further studies. The average salary package after B.Com is not more than 2.4 LPA. Roles are offered in accounting. Everyone has to do a compulsory internship after the 2nd year. Can either go through the college or find one on own.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the college is good, but it is not been used to its fullest potential. Every class has LED TVs, and some also have projectors, but they are used only occasionally. Hostel quality is below average, with no air-conditioners or coolers in the rooms. Food quality is also average. College is very active in sports and games, and there is even a dedicated period for sports each week.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Course curriculum is fine, but it doesn't make students industry-ready. Will have to develop skills on own. Semester exams are moderately difficult, and recently, the "Open Book" format for exams has been introduced. Pass percentage is 33%.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Don't come here! The only positive is a substantial education in less amount!

detailed_review.Placements: The college has the worst placement record. There are no proper companies hiring, and under the name of placements, they offer jobs with salaries of 20,000 per month in expensive cities like Bangalore. The placement percentage is very low. For the past five years, there have been no proper companies for our course especially.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is okay. The Wi-Fi, labs, and library are alright. But the number of students is very high, and the classrooms cannot accommodate that many. The quality of food is very poor. The college does not support any sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very qualified and experienced. The exams conducted by the college are alright, but the course curriculum is very poor. The professors cover a fraction of the syllabus but leave out a major chunk, which is important and will be a problem for us in the future.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college due to the low fees. My family couldn't afford high fees, so I chose it.

reviews.course: B.Voc. in Apparel Design
reviews.review_title: I'm satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement for B.Voc students varies. The highest package goes from 4 to 6 Lacs per annum, the average package goes from 2 to 4 Lacs per annum, and the lowest package goes to 1.5 Lacs per annum. Top recruiting companies are Raymond, Fabindia, Arvind mills, myntra, and others. Almost 70% of the graduate students got internships at designing studios, fashion houses, and retail brands, and they also get on-site experience for different roles such as apparel designer, fashion consultant, quality control assistant, and visual merchandisers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: DEI provides good infrastructure with all the facilities, like Wi-Fi on campus and in every department. Classrooms are fully furnished with all modern teaching aids. Labs are designed according to the courses, and a wide range of books are available. Hostel, mess, and canteen are provided, and the mess is very hygienic. Medical facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality at DEI is superb. The faculty members are industry experts or have specialized training. This makes them particularly effective in guiding students through both the theoretical and practical aspects of the curriculum. The passing percentage is more than 80%, which is because the curriculum focuses more on ensuring that students learn and apply what they have been taught rather than on testing their theoretical knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have an interest in designing. DEI provides a hands-on learning experience that allows you to acquire industry-relevant skills that can lead to a job after graduation. Guest lectures, workshops, and networking events are offered for further enhancement of practical knowledge. The campus is peaceful and quiet, and various events and festivals are held to relax students' minds and learn about different cultures.

college_info.college_name: DEI Agra Admission 2025: Eligibility, Admission Process & Fees

faqs.question: How do I get admission to DEI Agra?
faqs.answer: Dayalbagh Educational Institute (DEI) accepts admission into its programmes based on academic merit, written objective tests and interviews (in some cases). Aspiring candidates must apply for the written test through DEI official website by paying the application fee of INR 270. Selected candidates can register for the counselling process, and to complete the counselling and admission process, candidates need to report to the admission cell at DEI for document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: Can I get admission in DEI without CUET?
faqs.answer: Yes, Dayalbagh Educational Institute (DEI) accepts admission into most of its programmes based on the Written Objective Test conducted by DEI. Candidates who haven’t appeared CUET exam can apply through the entrance exam conducted by Dayalbagh Educational Institute. Candidates selected based on their performance in the entrance mentioned above exam can register for the counselling process through Dayalbagh Educational Institute registered portal, followed by document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria of Dayalbagh Educational Institute?
faqs.answer: Check out details such as eligibility and selection criteria for some of the most opted courses by students at Dayalbagh Educational Institute. Popular courses Eligibility Selection Criteria MBA UG degree in any discipline with a minimum of 50% aggregate Admission test + Group Discussion (GD) + Personal Interview (PI) BTech Class 12 with Physics, Chemistry & Maths with a minimum of 60% aggregate JEE-Main + Counselling B.Ed UG degree in any discipline with a minimum of 50% aggregate Academic merit + Admission Test (online mode) + Counselling After 10 th Diploma Class 10 with Science & Maths or Class 12 with a minimum of 50% aggregate Academic merit + Counselling Click here to check out the admission process for other courses offered at DEI.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria at DEI Agra 2023 for polytechnic?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria for admission to the Polytechnic at Dayalbagh Educational Institute is as follows:

faqs.question: Is BTech available in Dayalbagh Educational Institute?
faqs.answer: Dayalbagh Educational Institute (DEI) offers a four-year full-time BTech programme across five specialisations. Dayalbagh Educational Institute accepts admission into BTech courses through JEE-Main score/ rank. Candidates with a valid JEE-Main rank above the closing rank specified in the cut-off list released by the university’s website can register for the counselling process through DEI official website, followed by document verification and fee payment for final seat allotment.

faqs.question: What is the process of direct admission at Dayalbagh Educational Institute for BTech Lateral Entry?
faqs.answer: The BTech Lateral Entry (LE) scheme is one of the lateral pathways that the Institute offers to its meritorious students of various Diploma levels and prescribed BVoc programmes. Candidates should fulfil the basic eligibility criteria to get admission to the BTech Lateral Entry programme. The criteria is that the candidate should have passed Class 12 with 50% aggregate in PCM from a recognised board along with scoring good marks in JEE Main. The candidates have to apply online from the institute’s official website. The application process usually begins in the month of April or May.

faqs.question: How can I take admission in Dayalbagh Educational Institute, Agra for B.Tech?

college_info.college_name: DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Cut offs, Placements

highlights.summary:
Dr. DY Patil Institute of Technology, also known as DYPIT, is a private institute established in 1998 in Pimpri, Pune. DYPIT is the oldest campus of Dr DY Patil Group of Institutions under the affiliation of Savitribai Phule Pune University. The institute is AICTE and DTE approved. It has been awarded the Best Institute Award by SPPU. In NIRF 2025 Ranking, DYPIT was ranked 151-200 in the 'Engineering' category. The institute is NAAC accredited with a CGPA of 3.74 on a four-point scale at 'A++' Grade. 7 UG programmes and MBA are NBA accredited.
DYPIT offers 9 UG and 5 PG programmes that cover the domains of Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, and Robotics. DY Patil Pune fee structure details for all the courses are available on the official website. DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune admission is conducted in online mode. To be admitted to DYPIT Pune, candidates must obtain a score in MHT CET or JEE Main. Moreover, DY Patil Institute of Technology Pimpri conducts placement drives, and top companies such as Philips, Veritas Technologies LLC, NielsenIQ, Emerson, JSW Group, Axis Bank, TCS Digital, HSBC, Cognizant, and many more participate in them.
DY Patil Institute of Technology Pimpri provides several scholarships to students in need of financial assistance. DYPIT is spread across a vast land area of approximately 10 acres and has a student body of over 4000, supported by more than 200 faculty members and laboratory assistants. The institute facilitates its students with a library, auditorium, seminar or conference halls, guest houses, internet & wifi, hostels, canteen, etc.
The major highlights of DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune are tabulated below:
Merit scholarship, Merit-cum-means based scholarship

college_info_program.intro: DY Patil Institute of Technology offers numerous courses at the UG, PG, and Doctoral levels in various streams such as Engineering and Management. The BTech and MBA courses offered at DY Patil Institute of Technology are very popular among the students. DY Patil Institute of Technology offers a 2-year full-time MBA course with an intake of 60 students. DYPIT provides this course to students with a wide range of career options to choose from, including roles such as Service Digital Marketing, Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics Manager, and more. The institute also provides a business communication lab, personality development lab, leadership lab, mock online stock trading, etc. Candidates can check some of the popular programmes offered at DY Patil Institute of Technology, along with the eligibility criteria and the total course fees, in the table below:

summary.college_name: DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, small campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Many people in Maharashtra know about the placements offered by this college. Placements are offered in a good number, and almost 90-95% students are placed on campus. The highest package offered yet is of 70 LPA, offered in 2023 to a mechanical student. In 2025, yet 3 students have been offered 40 LPA, which is the highest for 2025 yet.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is very small (almost no campus except a library and a canteen), there is free Wi-Fi available for laptops, but you have to send a request to the college using the ERP portals for the same. The hostel is way too expensive, and many students prefer PGs nearby rather than living in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty for some subjects is experienced and somewhat helpful, but for some subjects, you feel like you will have to do everything on your own. The curriculum is fully based on the SPPU 2024 pattern, so they don't have their own curriculum, and it is moderately relevant to modern industrial standards.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good placements, supportive faculty, and a balanced campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, there are 70-80% of students placed. The highest package is 56 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA, and average package is 7 LPA - 8 LPA. Mass recruiters like Cognizant and many more are coming for placements and take the students in quantity, like 150-200 students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has good infrastructure with Wi-Fi-enabled classrooms, well-equipped labs, and a central library with a wide range of resources. Department provides access to project labs and seminar halls for presentations. Hostel facilities are decent with clean rooms and common areas. Mess food quality is satisfactory and hygienic, though canteen options are better. Medical facilities are available on campus, and sports facilities include cricket, football, basketball courts, and indoor games. Overall, both academic and hostel infrastructure support a balanced student's life.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable, approachable, and supportive. Most of them hold advanced degrees and provide guidance beyond academics, encouraging project-based learning. Teaching quality is good with a mixture of theory and practical exposure. The curriculum is designed to be industry relevant, especially with subjects in AI, data science, and machine learning, but it could include more updated electives aligned with current trends. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty and test both conceptual clarity and application. With regular study and project work, students perform well. The pass percentage generally remains high, around 85-90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the artificial intelligence and data science course because of my strong interest in emerging technologies like AI, ML, and data analytics. The best part of the course is that it relevance to the current industry and the practical learning opportunities through projects and hackathons. I wish the curriculum included more industry-driven electives and real-world case studies.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not much satisfied with curriculum, good placements for Software branches, and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate is about 85-90% of those who applied for placements. The highest is 70 LPA, with the lowest of 2.5-3 LPA and an average of 4.5-6 LPA. The placements are quite good for the software field. Most of the companies offer packages more than 10 LPA, you might need at least more than 70% in your 10th, 12th, and more than 7.5 CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good with all the facilities like water filters, Wi-Fi, library, study room, canteen, hostels, etc. The hostel fee is currently 2.2 lacs for one year. There is a 20% increase in the hostel fees every year. The mess food is also not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are quite good at teaching and have good knowledge as well. Some of them are Ph.D. holders too. The curriculum is mostly theory-based, so if you want to be industry-ready, you need to take extra effort. The college is also strict about the 75% attendance criteria.
detailed_review.Other: I'm a 4th-year Mechanical Engineering student. The course is quite knowledgeable on a theoretical note. The college does have many clubs and events happening every year, including cultural events, tech events, Hackathons, International summits, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is decent according to placements, 85% placements, faculty and staff are average and good.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of students were placed last year. The highest package is 70 LPA. Cognizant, Accenture, Capgemini, and Infosys are main companies. About 50 students got internships. The roles offered by companies are data science and development. Placements are strong, with reputed companies visiting the campus and a good placement rate, especially in tech and core branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no Wi-Fi provided but labs, classrooms, and library are provided. No mess for college students but canteen is provided. Annual sports fest and inter-college tournaments are conducted. It also conducts professional coaching (for selected sports). It has first-aid and sports injury assistance. Sports scholarships are also there for state/national players.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is actually difficult to pass as exams are conducted by SPPU, and the passing percentage is nearly 80%.
detailed_review.Other: A vibrant sports culture with yearly sports festivals, inviting participation from various colleges across the state and country. Scholarships and special concessions are provided to students who represent the college at the state, national, or university level tournaments.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, placement, and education.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. At last all efforts are made by students only. College will try to give placement like motivation, courses, and related stuff. Cognizant and Infosys are major recruiters at our colleges. I would rather say almost 75% of students can be placed in internships or jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is so good but costly. I have no idea about food quality as I was in PGs and flats. You will be provided with plans like three sharing, two sharing, etc., also without food and with food. It has AC and rooms without AC. It also has Wi-Fi. Classrooms are way too good. Library can be improved.
detailed_review.Faculty: New pattern is absolutely good. In first year no viva according to new pattern, attendance is mandatory. Teachers are so good and familiar with students. Doubt can be clear in classroom or personally in cabins. I have no idea about whether new pattern will make students industry-ready or not.
detailed_review.Other: Campus is limited. Area is less than Akurdi campus. Hence, many programs and events are held at the medical college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is good only for civil engineers.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has a very good placement cell. We have many companies that hire students from the second and fourth years. For example, companies like Microsoft, Infosys, and Amazon hire students from campus. The highest package from our college is 85 LPA, and the lowest package is 5 LPA. We have live experiences and internship opportunities provided by our college. The new buildings are constructed by our college, and we can do internships within the campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is very good. All buildings and classrooms are properly on the campus. We have a canteen, but the price of the food is very high and outside the budget of students. Various types of food stalls are available, and the food from these stalls is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty in the civil engineering department is more compared to other branches. The exams are conducted by SPPU, and they are very strict.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not worth the money because of less practical knowledge and not being industry-ready.

detailed_review.Placements: 50%-60% of students got placed. The highest package is 45 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA. Recruiting companies are Samsung, Intel, Adani, etc. Few students have got into BARC, Tata Motors, etc. Top roles include software developer, embedded system engineer, data analyst, consultant, project manager, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library have been provided. Hostel is very costly and well-maintained like a 5 star hotel but the food isn't that good and not worth the money because cooking facilities, gym, laundry nothing is available and has strict rules.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable but don't have the proper teaching skills. Students get bored easily in class and attendance drops eventually. It doesn't make students industry-ready They need to go for other courses outside. Exams are easy to pass. Pass percentage in our course is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I thought it would be a great field of study but eventually, I regret my decision. The practical learning should be improved. College fests and events are good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Teachers are very good. Placement wise also it is a good choice.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-85% of students got placed in our course. It might be a bit more or less, but most people got some job. The highest package is around 12 LPA, that too from a product-based company. The lowest package ranges from 3-3.5 LPA. The average package ranges between 4.5-5 LPA. Many good companies like TCS, Capgemini, Cognizant, Infosys, Accenture, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, and some decent startups too visit the college to hire students. Around 60-70% of students got internships in companies like TCS iON, Persistent and Cognizant. Some students also got internships through LinkedIn or college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has decent Wi-Fi all over the campus. Classrooms have projectors and are good for lectures. Labs were well-equipped with PCs and required software. The library had a good collection of books and a digital section too. Overall, the infrastructure was good and supported learning well. I was not in the college hostel, and I was in PG.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are mostly helpful and well-qualified. Some teachers explain really well. Teaching quality is decent, a few are average but manageable. The course curriculum is okay but needs extra effort from students. To be industry-ready, we had to do internships and online courses, too. Semester exams are not very tough if we study properly. The pass percentage is high, usually around 85-90%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is not worth the money, but the infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80% of students get placed. The highest package is 70 LPA (international), while the lowest is 3 LPA. Companies like Bosch, Adani, and Samsung. Internships are available at BARC, TATA, and Philips, but the percentage is low, as the college doesn't support much. The roles include software developers, consultants, and R&D engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, with Wi-Fi labs, classrooms, a library, a canteen, and workshop rooms. The hostel is very luxurious but expensive. The mess food is not good. There are no sports or game facilities available in the hostels, and the hostel rules are very strict.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good but not very helpful. They have their favorites. No, they do not make students industry-ready, as only theoretical knowledge is provided. The exams are easy to pass, but scoring good is difficult. The pass percentage is 90%, and most students pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the boost in the future. It should have more practical experience, and projects should be sponsored by the college. The crowd is not that decent, and events and fests have a low budget.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college you can apply the for admission.

detailed_review.Placements: Best placement for mechanical engineering as well as computer engineering for 2025, there is an average placement for mechanical engineering of about 6 lacs, and computer engineering is an average of 8 to 10 lacs rupees. The very best college for placements and nice placement opportunities is there for the future.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Best hostels feature nice campuses, with the 9th hostel offering good food and all essential facilities, such as washing machines, Wi-Fi, security, night clocks, and a nighttime blocking system. We have a puri stall. The hostel has excellent security on weekends, along with various special sports activities available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exams are very challenging, and all exams depend on our HCP. SPPU is the best platform for students to take their exams, but the difficulty level is high. It's tough to clear all the points in the examination, and from this, only those in engineering can become the best engineers.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience in college was super fun, good teaching, and the atmosphere was good.

detailed_review.Placements: I think the number of companies that came into my college was more than decent, and they were big names like Accenture, L&T, Amazon, Adani Group, Dxc, Infosys Limited, etc. As I know, the highest package received by a student was 15-20 LPA and the lowest was around 2 LPA. In my batch, I think 30%-40% of students got placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure was so good, they got projectors in each classroom and also a big size seminar hall. If I talk about the library, then there were a Wi-Fi connection and AC. Labs were also good and got all the equipment. I wasn't in hostel, I stayed there in the PG.
detailed_review.Faculty: It's 50-50, some teachers were so helpful and some were not, but they all were qualified and got super knowledge in their respective subjects. If I talk about the teaching quality, it was again 50-50. Course curriculum was very relevant to make students industry-ready. Semester exams were much easier in my opinion, and transparent also, and the pass percentage was 40%.
detailed_review.Other: The events held in college were super fun, the campus was not that big, but it feels good there. I'll add only one thing that they should give you playing ground for sports activities as there was no playing ground.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has good placements and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students got placed. The highest package till now is 45 LPA and 70 LPA. International Adani, Mahindra, Ashok Leyland, and Philips are the top recruiters for the electronics core branch. Top roles offered as R&D engineers, software developers, and verification engineers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, libraries, departmental seminar halls, and workshops, which is good, but it is somewhat pricey. The food quality is poor, and there are strict timings that make it feel like it's not worth the money spent. The hostel experience is lacking, and the overall atmosphere is minimal in terms of fun, as it seems tailored for affluent students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful. Students often need to take courses outside the institution to be industry-ready. The exams are relatively easy, with a pass percentage of just 40 out of 100. Unfortunately, students do not gain sufficient industry experience, and practical activities are limited, leading to mostly boring lectures.
detailed_review.Other: I was not interested in IT so I chose a core branch. Better learning and practical lessons are required. Events are average. The crowd is also good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall the college faculty, campus, placements, events, surroundings, and infrastructure are good.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80-85% of students get placed with a package of 5 LPA. Top recruiters are Amazon, Adani, and Jaw. Internships are given to about 50% of students in its CS department. The highest package is about 70 LPA in Amazon and the minimum package is above 2 LPA. Internships are given to both boys and girls.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is amazing mainly the canteen area. Washrooms are very clean and neat. Labs are provided with good-conditioned equipment. Classrooms are very spacious and airy. The hostel is just at the back of the college, the library has 2 separate sections for boys and girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: SPP pattern so average difficult level of exam, teachers are there to solve any doubt. They make students industry-ready in 3rd year itself. The pass percentage is about 85%, teaching quality is average. They cover the syllabus and attendance is monitored very strictly.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to go for the government exams and civil engineering provides lots of opportunities in the government sector, just practical knowledge should be prioritized more instead of exams in this field. Cultural events are the best and most crowded.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Better, but not the best. Better placement, best faculty, facilities, and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of students are placed in my batch, the highest package is 15 LPA, and the minimum is 3.5 LPA. Accenture and Infosys, minimum students get internship opportunities like 25%. The top role is GET Engineer, and placements are getting better. As the T&P officer is one of the best and is among the top list of offices.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not highly equipped but decent. It has Wi-Fi, AC, etc. Facilities are average and not on the best side. The infrastructure is now getting better than previously. There was no space for parking, and we had to park on the road as well and it is getting developed.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is knowledgeable and on the good side, but they are not much ready for industry. They try hard, but it mostly depends on students. For the current mechanical branch, they are disastrous. Overall, the course is very theoretical and generally develops on theory, with practical insight developing as experience comes years.
detailed_review.Other: Due to my percentile, I selected mechanical engineering. Improvement should be made in practical exposure mostly. There are yearly events and fests, but they are not much funded by the college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the college because of the faculty members, placements, and study environment.

detailed_review.Placements: DYPIT is always better from the placement perspective. A large number of companies visit the campus including MNCs as well as popular ones. It gives very good opportunity to average and above-average students to get placed and it also provides higher chances to get placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is availability of a small area but it has beautiful architecture on the campus. On campus, there are engineering, pharmacy, and MBA colleges with a canteen. The quality of food is above average. There are hostels available for girls and boys with good quality of service and food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is declared by SPPU University and includes foundation subjects required for every engineer. The whole syllabus is informative and industry-oriented. Faculty members provide great support. Every faculty member has either completed a master's in their respective field or are PhD holder in their subjects. Many faculty members have their ongoing PhDs. Internal exams are university-oriented and help in preparation for semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: E&TC engineering is an emerging domain in today's world, so I chose it. Colleges like D Y Patil will be a great opportunity for students to make their first steps in the industry. Other than academics, events like Sanskriti, Parakram, Zion, etc., are happening each year. During the whole year, there are different hackathons, department levels, and college-level events and functions. Here, there are many chances to interact with new people and get known to the unknown.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is about studying. It concentrates on placements and the improvement of students.

detailed_review.Placements: The ENTC branch has the best placement among other branches, with almost 90% of students being placed. The lowest package is about 2 LPA and the highest is 70 LPA. Off-campus, the average package is 5-6 LPA. Companies like Amazon, Google, and Adidas are among the top recruiters. Most of the internships are provided by the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are well provided like washrooms, canteen, and library, etc. The campus is very small, and there is no ground. Also, the location is not that safe. The hostel is very good, and the food provided is also very nice. As for sports and games, there are events, and during that time, we get to play sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable, but some are not good at teaching. But most teachers are very good at teaching. The course curriculum is very relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. The semester exams are decent, as they are under SPPU, and papers are selected by SPPU.
detailed_review.Other: ENTC is the fastest-growing branch. It provides technical and non-technical knowledge. Events are decent, but the crowd is very bad, and the surrounding area is not good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Dr. D. Y. Patil Institute Of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The students who scored an 8.5 CGPA in the year and have 75 above attendance get placed. Students skills are good and the average package is 7 LPA. The highest package is 70 LPA. Many companies hire students in technical and core subjects. 80-85% of students get placed in good companies with good packages.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are best, and they give other best things to students. Library, classes, Wi-Fi, and lab are also best. The canteen and hostel of our college are the best. The infrastructure is too good and has all facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers provide their best quality which helps the students to study. The semester difficulty is medium not much hard if you study. So you can prepare for the exam and passing mark is 28 in each subject. They take unit tests and prelims before the semester for practice. Teachers are very well and all have more than 8 years of experience at teaching.
detailed_review.Other: In the mechanical department, there are more changes as compared to the technical branch to get placed because in our branch the company came to higher the women's and it's good for them and for us also. The fests and events on our campus are the best and crowd is too good. They provide scholarships as well.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is the best in Pune. Awesome infrastructure and highly qualified faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: My college gives the best placements in Pune. Almost 90% of students in my course get placed every year. Infosys, Cognizant, LTD Mindtree, TCS, Adani Infrastructure, etc., are top recruiting companies in our college. Most students get internships in big companies like Amazon and Google.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. The campus is newly developed. It is more developing. All campus areas have Wi-Fi connections. Our classrooms are very well-managed with projectors and CPUs. The hostel is good. The hostel fee is quite expensive. They give you the best medical facilities in college because they have their medical college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of the college are highly qualified. All teachers are Ph.D. holders in their subjects. The teaching quality is very good. They give you more practical knowledge. The course curriculum is set by Pune University. This curriculum is the best in the Maharashtra state. This curriculum makes students industry-ready because they focus on practical knowledge. Semester exams are moderate. Almost 80% of students pass semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: My course is civil engineering. I chose this course because my college gives placements for all branches. The placement ratio of core branches is quite good. Events in my college are the best. All events are held between February to April month. The main event of the college is Sanskriti. It is held in April. Events are managed by the student committee.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: College with 100% placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Dr. D. Y. Patil Institute of Technology provides excellent support to its students. The college has a 100% placement record for students who meet the selection criteria of the recruiting companies. The lowest salary packages start at 3.5 LPA, and the highest are in the 13-20 LPA range. Recruiters include major companies like TCS and Infosys, as well as various service-based companies. About 50% of the students get internships based on the criteria of the respective companies. In my course, the roles offered were in data analytics, among others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure at this college are good. The labs are fully furnished with PCs and the required equipment. There is a central Wi-Fi for students, with every PC having a LAN connection and a library with separate central Wi-Fi. The food is of good quality, especially compared to what is available outside the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well qualified and provide good direction for students' futures. The teaching quality is good, but the curriculum changes frequently, so the teachers need to change as well. The course is new to the industry, so students might have trouble getting a placement in this course, but they will definitely be placed in different companies that come for CS placements. The difficulty level is moderate because it's under SPPU, and from now on, the new 2024 pattern will be followed by the students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I get a scholarship under the TFWS category, which reduces my college fees.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very good Placements in 2022.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2022, from the Mechanical branch, the highest package offered to a student named Saurav Pawar was 70 LPA in Machine Learning. My college has above-average placements. In 2024, despite the recession, many students were placed in good companies like Infosys, Accenture, and many more with good packages around 5 to 30 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I would say that for the fees you are paying, the infrastructure is well-maintained. Even though our campus is very small, it is neat and clean. There is ample space for parking, and there are 4-5 lifts to use. The washrooms are clean and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers here are very knowledgeable in their respective subjects, but some of them are a bit arrogant and lack teaching skills. Still, every faculty member tries to clear all the doubts and queries of students. We also have one teacher guardian for every 20 students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was interested in the mechanical branch, especially aerospace. The management of my college is just average, and they should improve it.

college_info.college_name: DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune Course Admissions 2025: Dates, Fee, Application Process, Application, Cutoff

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by DY Patil Pimpri?
faqs.answer: Yes, DY Patil Institute of Technology accepts national or state-level entrance exam scores for admission. Candidates applying for BE, must have a valid MHT-CET or JEE Main score. Admission to M.Tech is based on GATE score. For MBA, aspirants can get admission based on MAT, CAT, XAT, CMAT, ATMA or MAH MBA CET score.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for admission at DY Patil Institute of Technology, Pune?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology eligibility varies course-wise. Candidates need to complete a minimum of Class 12 to apply for UG courses whereas, graduation is required to apply for PG programmes. Below is course-wise DY Patil Institute of Technology Pune eligibility criteria:

faqs.question: Can I take direct admission in Dy Patil Institute of Technology, Pune?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates can take direct admission in Dy Patil Institute of Technology, Pune through Management Quota. Other than this, Candidates are selected based on their entrance exam score. MHT-CET or JEE Main scores are required for BE admission. The selection for MBA is based on CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT, ATMA or MAH MBA CET score. A valid GATE score is required for admission to ME programme. Once selected, candidates must participate in CET Counselling.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: How can I get seat in BE at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology considers MHT-CET or JEE Main scores of the candidates for admission to BE programme. Aspirants need to participate in CET Counselling with their entrance exam scores. The counselling body offers seats to candidates in multiple rounds. Selected aspirants need to pay course fee to confirm their seat in the institute.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for BE at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to pass HSC or its equivalent examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the Chemistry or Biotechnology or Biology or Technical or Vocational subjects and obtained at least 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) to apply for DY Patil Institute of Technology BE programme. Aspirants who have completed Diploma in Engineering and Technology and obtained at least 45% aggregate (at least 40% aggregate in case of Backward class categories and Persons with Disability candidates belonging to Maharashtra State only) can also apply.

faqs.question: Which are the BE specialisations offered at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology offers four-year BE course divided into eight semesters. Candidates need to complete Class 12 to apply for a BE specialisations. The institute offers BE in various specialisations such as:

faqs.question: Is entrance exam accepted for MBA at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates wishing to get admission in MBA programme of DY Patil Institute of Technology need to pass MAH MBA CET or CAT/ MAT/ XAT/ CMAT/ ATMA. Candidates with their valid score will need to apply for MAH MBA CET Counselling. The counselling body will allot seats to the candidates based on their entrance exam score in the preferred college.

faqs.question: Is MBA available at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology offers two-year MBA programme divided into four semesters. Candidates who have passed graduation can apply for MBA programme. Admission to MBA is based on MAH MBA CET score followed by Common Admission Process or counselling.

faqs.question: What is the cost of MBA in DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To complete the admission process, candidates must pay the DY Patil Pimpri MBA fees to confirm their seat in the institute as mentioned below: Hostel fee (The fee is for 2020 and might include components other than hostel fees. Meal Plan is included in the fee) These are based on information available on various sources. the latest values may differ.

faqs.question: How to get admission for MBA at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Pimpri MBA admission 2024 is entrance-based. The admission process begins with registration. To seek admission to the programme, candidates are required to qualify entrance test. Given below is the DY Patil Institute of Technology MBA admission process: STEP 1: DYPIT Pune MBA Application Process 2024 Fill out the application form for the entrance exam. Aspirants with a valid entrance exam score need to fill out the CET Counselling form. STEP 2: DYPIT Pune MBA Selection Criteria Once the registration is over, candidates must appear for any of the entrance exams, namely MAT / CAT/ XAT / CMAT/ ATMA / MAH MBA CET. STEP 3: DYPIT Pune MBA Merit List and Counselling Candidates are then required to register for CET Counselling. In the counselling registration form, candidates need to provide their college and course preference. The final step of the admission process is to pay the DY Patil Pimpri MBA fees .

faqs.question: How can I apply for admission at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology application process varies course-wise. Candidates have to apply for course-specific entrance exam for admission. Below are details for DYPIT Pune application process:

faqs.question: Is the MAH MBA CET application form available offline too?
faqs.answer: The MAH MBA CET application form is not released offline. Candidates have to fill the online application form only. There is no provision of submitting the application form offline either. Aspirants, who wish to apply for the exam, need to access a computer or laptop with high-speed internet to fill the MAH MBA CET application form. The process of fee payment is also online. After filling the application form, candidates have to make the fee payment via debit card, credit card, net banking or e-wallets to complete the registration process of the MBA CET.  Candidates can fill the form from any location. All they need to keep in mind is that the internet speed is good so that there is no error in fee payment. The MBA CET fee amount is non-refundable.

faqs.question: How to check MHT CET Seat Allotment 2023 for CAP Rounds?
faqs.answer: ICT Mumbai cut off 2023 for the BTech course is based on MHT CET for the Home State Quota. As per ICT Mumbai cutoff 2023, the Bachelor of Chemical Engineering emerged as the most competitive specialisation based on the closing score.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for MHT CET for DYPIT Pimpri BE admission?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology BE application fee of MHT CET 2024 for candidates who belong to the general/ unreserved category is INR 800 and the application fee for reserved category and PwD candidates is INR 600.

faqs.question: Does DY Patil Institute of Technology offer scholarships?
faqs.answer: One of the scholarships offered at DY Patil Institute of Technology is Deutsche Bank Engineering Scholarship. Below are the details: First-year girl in Engineering programme Up to 20 years of age Annual family income should be less than INR 5 Lacs per annum Class 10 and Class 12 with at least 60% aggregate

faqs.question: How to get admission for MBA at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Pimpri MBA admission 2024 is entrance-based. The admission process begins with registration. To seek admission to the programme, candidates are required to qualify entrance test. Given below is the DY Patil Institute of Technology MBA admission process: STEP 1: DYPIT Pune MBA Application Process 2024 Fill out the application form for the entrance exam. Aspirants with a valid entrance exam score need to fill out the CET Counselling form. STEP 2: DYPIT Pune MBA Selection Criteria Once the registration is over, candidates must appear for any of the entrance exams, namely MAT / CAT/ XAT / CMAT/ ATMA / MAH MBA CET. STEP 3: DYPIT Pune MBA Merit List and Counselling Candidates are then required to register for CET Counselling. In the counselling registration form, candidates need to provide their college and course preference. The final step of the admission process is to pay the DY Patil Pimpri MBA fees . Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I apply for admission at DY Patil Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: DY Patil Institute of Technology application process varies course-wise. Candidates have to apply for course-specific entrance exam for admission. Below are details for DYPIT Pune application process: For BE, aspirants need to apply for MHT-CET or JEE Main followed by MHT-CET Counselling. The application fees of MHT CET 2024 for general/unreserved category students is INR 800. For MBA, candidates need to apply for MAH MBA CET or any other Management entrance exam. Aspirants with a valid score need to then fill out the CET Counselling form. For ME, candidates must fill out the application form for GATE. Candidates with a valid GATE score need to apply for MHT CET M.Tech Counselling. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is the MAH MBA CET application form available offline too?
faqs.answer: The MAH MBA CET application form is not released offline. Candidates have to fill the online application form only. There is no provision of submitting the application form offline either. Aspirants, who wish to apply for the exam, need to access a computer or laptop with high-speed internet to fill the MAH MBA CET application form. The process of fee payment is also online. After filling the application form, candidates have to make the fee payment via debit card, credit card, net banking or e-wallets to complete the registration process of the MBA CET.  Candidates can fill the form from any location. All they need to keep in mind is that the internet speed is good so that there is no error in fee payment. The MBA CET fee amount is non-refundable. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

highlights.summary:
Dr. MGR Educational and Research Institute is deemed to be a university with graded autonomy status, established from the amalgamation of Dr. M.G.R. Engineering College and Thai Moogambigai Dental College. In 2003, they both acquired deemed university status as Dr. MGR Educational and Research Institute. MGR University Maduravoyal is accredited with an A+ Grade by NAAC, IAO, ABET, NBA, NABH, NABL, Workplace Assessment for Safety and Hygiene (WASH), and approved by UGC, AIU, and the Sri Lanka Medical Council. Some of the courses provided by the university are approved by AICTE, CoA, DCI, MCI, NCTE, and INC.
Located in Maduravoyal, Chennai, this reputed university has signed an MoU with leading industrial, academic, and research institutes.
The university offers various courses via its affiliated colleges. These courses are provided across the Dental, Architecture, and various other streams. MGR Educational and Research Institute offers placement assistance to students. Dr MGR Educational and Research Institute offers various facilities to students, such as a library, hostel, and others. The university is visited by top companies such as Google, IBM, Cognizant, and others. The major highlights of MGR University Maduravoyal are tabulated below:
